Reviews.Title: “Not impressed....”
Reviews.Author: ToesintheWaterAITS
Reviews.Content: This resort does not deserve a 5 star rating. False advertising "ALL SUITES RESORT" The rooms were horrible.. small with a "lovely view" of a construction wall and service road after the first room had no air conditioning. Very poor lighting in the rooms and no place to hang anything, but yet they want you to use your towels more than once!! Room service is offered but the poor fellas have no place to set up your meal! The drive into the resort from the main road was such a disappointment. Usually the resorts have georgeous grounds as you approach and are most welcoming..this did not. Paid extra for private transportation to the resort from the airport and I understand why...This resort would not want a buss full of people viewing their unwelcoming entrance. Front desk lobby would compare to a Super 8... small and not very inviting. We are accustomed to beautiful open lobbies with staff greeting you on your arrival. Very dissapointed in the entire check in process..also the first place that copied our passports...What's up with that???? Food in the main restaurants was very good..slow service but we enjoyed that since we were with friends. Difficult for families with small children as many were crying or fell asleep with the slow service. Pools were great though not much of a beach.. water too rocky in front of the hotel but a short walk and you can swim and snorkle. All in all we made it a great vacation lots of sun and relaxation. Would never go back to the Azul Fives as we have been to so many All Inclusive properties (this being our 12th) with 4 or 4.5 star rating that far exceeded what was offered at this 5 star rated facility. This was our most expensive vacation property and we rate it near the bottom. I guess I will never understand how these properties earn their ratings but I will say the "Dreams" , " Now " and "Iberostar" properties by far exceed the Azul with better value and superior service. I am positive we will return to Mexico but this experience at the Azul Fives have given us serious doubts as to where we want to spend our hard earned vacation dollars...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation can't wait to return next year!”
Reviews.Author: jgrimold
Reviews.Content: Azul Fives was an excellent resort, especially for families with smaller children. We stayed from March 14-20th, and wished we booked for longer. We absolutely loved it! We have 2 boys 7 and 9, and they loved it. We met a lot of really nice people, and the service was just excellent probably the most attentive, hard working and friendly staff of any resort we've stayed at and we have been to many many nice 5* resorts. I can't understand negative reviews, honestly people need to relax a bit and take a chill pill. I want to put your mind at ease this is a really nice place especially for families with young children to stay. Would I stay here if it was a couple only trip? Maybe not as there are a lot of kids but that is what Azul is all about and they focus on. If looking for adult only consider Karisma's El Dorado resorts perhaps. Room Our room was excellent. It was a 1 Bedroom Suite in Villa 14, ground floor. A Swim up pool varnish right across from the outdoor patio. Room is awesome, tons of room, definitely go for a suite and request to face the pool. Food Food was definitely overall above average with other comparable resorts. We loved Tsuki - Japanese and Sea Olive. Excellent waiters and food was very good. They both have a kids menu which parents with picky eaters like us really appreciate! We went 2 times to each. Arezzo was pretty good also, but they didn't have a kids menu there. It may have been what we ordered, it was good but we actually preferred the others. Many others we spoke to loved it though. Flavors the buffet was good, we mainly went there for breakfast which was very good! The Beach Grill had the best view of the beach and water, had burgers, fries, pizza, was good. Went to the Lizard Outdoor cafe for lunch or afternoon snacks. It was good too, tacos and nachos, gourmet burgers were tasty. Always could find something good to eat, no one got sick at all and my wife is a pretty picky eater. We got room service once for breakfast, it was OK, make sure to order lots as the portions are pretty small so I wish I had ordered more. Pools Really nice pools running throughout, with a few swim up bars open around noon to 5 or 6pm. We had one right behind our room it was great! The temperature is a little cool but not too much. It is Mexico and it is very hot so we didn't find this a problem at all, as I read in some reviews. Infinity Pool close to beach is nice, again a little cool but not too much, it was welcome with the heat. A little busy, music, animation crew around but was a lot of fun if you like this. If you want quieter go back to the winding pools around the rooms. Service, Staff We found the staff and service to be excellent! Everyone truly works very hard and tries their best to exceed hour expectations. There were so many individuals I could mention but Manuel at The Rainbow Bar is an excellent bartender and really took care of us all week! Thanks Manuel, you're awesome! Also Erika at Azulitos the Kids Club, thanks so much. You were so friendly and our boys had a great time with you and your great staff! Really, we were very impressed with the high service level at Azul Fives. The landscaping and grounds staff were always working hard grooming and making things look so beautiful. Grounds The landscaping and grounds were impeccable. Beautiful! Beach The sand is nice and soft. The resort was full when we were there and we didn't find it hard finding chairs. It is pretty rocky in front of the resort, but if you walk around 5 minutes to the north (or to left) there is a nice swimming area there in front of the Princess resort. It would be nice if it was a little easier if less rocks and easier to swim right in front, but wasn't a major issue for us. Lots of beach to walk. Still enjoyed sitting on the beach relaxing, was a beautiful view. Some did go in with water shoes to enter through initial more rocky area into the water, we may look at purchasing for a future visit. Animation Staff Were really friendly, and not as pushy and in your face as much as many resorts we've been too. They have lots of activities if you are interested, but if not they don't bother you which is nice. Kids Club It was the best most organized kids club we've seen, which is important and made our trip so much more enjoyable. They have several staff, and had several kids attending when we were there. They had a baby, toddler room. Most kids we saw were around similar age to ours, between maybe 5 and 9. I was really impressed with the number of hours they were open everyday, opening at 9 to 5pm; then again between 7 and 9pm for movie and disco nights for the kids which was really surprising and excellent. We went to dinner one night while the kids were at disco night for an hour. The kids loved it and it was a nice little break also for us! Nice facility, nice small pool outside it. Overall Again, we loved Azul Fives. We would like to get a big family trip going for next year here. It is great for families, and don't be turned off by some of the negative reviews, seriously. You have to put things into perspective, it may not be the Ritz Carlton but it is a very nice what I would rate a 5* resort for Mexico and other comparable locales for beach getaways in places like Dominican Republic, Jamaica, Cuba. We've been to many 5* resorts and it is one of the better ones we've stayed at. Very good value also and unique with the suites which are so nice versus standard hotel rooms for families. We definitely want to return to Azul Fives next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: SusanM15
Reviews.Content: Azul Fives is a nice place for families and OK for couples. The staff is very courteous, friendly and helpful. Be prepared to tip $1 US for every service, more in the dining rooms. The food is excellent. the main buffet has lots to chose from, changes the menu daily and it's all fresh and well prepared. The other restaurants by the beach have fixed menus and are very good. The beach is not very sandy in the water but is fine for walking on. The massages in the spa and the candlelit wine dinner on the beach were wonderful. The suites and grounds were gorgeous and well cared for. The pools were fine and the swim-up bar a plus. However, there was no heated hot tub. The main issue that we had was the circuit breaker kept popping in our suite. We and our neighbors next door quickly learned the location of the breaker box and how to flip the breakers. We were upgraded to a penthouse suite at no additional charge. Also, there was no ATM on site. The nearest one was about 1/4 mile down the road and there was no shuttle. A cab ride into Playa del Carmen was $30 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Shady, horrible service. Over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Jalbano2002
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel, front receptionist Manuela asks how many people from reservation have arrived. When we told her the first time that all guest on reservation had arrived she asked the ages of everyone. She then asked who was staying in what room, we as guest where not sure yet who would room with who. Manuela then says that if we did not know and we put certain people in a room we would be charged extra ( makes no sense as to why).  She then asked for the ages once more (even though we had already told her clearly that all five guest where present) and who was presently in the hotel a second time. We told her again that everyone in the reservation was here, all 5. The next step after signing the hotel contract was taking I.d. Photos. She did not call Nancy, one of the guest in the reservation. When we asked Manuela why she wasn't taking Nancy's photo, she replied because she was not in the hotel yet. We again then told her that all guest where present. She then gave a arrogant look as to tell us she knew what she was doing. Then she said,"poreso, Dile que venga, Tengo que tomar su foto". Too add, she was not welcoming, she did not offer us any champagne as the other guest where asked, I myself had to ask for three glasses. Later during our stay we also find out we needed the I. D. Cards to consume; Manuela also forgot to give us our I. D. Passes, making our family waste time having to go and pick them up.  What was supposed to be a relaxing experience has been ruined.  On a side note we also cannot believe How rude the employees are here. Instead of getting  The the I. D. card I needed they make you feel stupid for not having one. When it wasn't even our mistake to begin with. It is also unacceptable to be given cheap plastic cups for beer consumption, for all this hotel promises, they lack attention to detail and well cooked food.  Also, staff kept asking to go into to room to "check if phone is working", another day one asked if he could come in to use the phone. For all this hotel makes itself out to be, it's completely inaccurate. Food is also overpriced and over cooked in most cases.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for families”
Reviews.Author: MaracuyaCa
Reviews.Content: If you have kids and are looking for a nice 5 star resort, this is the place. Food excelent, service excelente. Very clean and modern. The kids club was open until 9pm, they had it all in there for the kids.. Very nice place to eat, relax and spend time with your family..

Reviews.Title: “Rodrigo the Super Smoothie Maker”
Reviews.Author: Suziev_12
Reviews.Content: Azul Fives was AWESOME! Staff are friendly and go out of their way to make you happy. My children miss them already. The rooms are exceptional and the pools were very clean. Begin your stay with a trip to see Rodrigo at the smoothie bar and do yourself a favor and order the Hercules or the Manila, heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: Our children are 7 and 9, this was the first time we took them on a trip with us. We have always done the adults only at Sandals (4 times) but now the time had come to bring them along. Azul Fives is a very good mix of luxury and family time. We got what we paid for, an affordable 5 star family vacation. No complaints about the food, presentation, service or cleanliness. Our oldest one was a bit bored with the kids club but fit in very well doing the other activities. The youngest one loved the kids club, that was very well organized. The resort is for family, don't go there as a couple; you will not like it or if you've left your kids at home you will miss them terribly. It is a bit small but nonetheless we were always able to find a spot by the quiet pools or the beach and not feel too close to our neighbor. We would go back with kids and recommend it for families with kids between 4-8.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book here! All they want is your $$$”
Reviews.Author: Katie D
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with 3 other people in a two bedroom suite to attend a friend's wedding with the understanding that my $75 deposit was nonrefundable should I choose not to go. 2 months prior to the trip, 1 of the other 3 and I discovered that we were both unable to go. The other 2 were still planning to take the trip. We made multiple attempts to switch our other 2 friends to a smaller suite but the resort was not willing to help us make these changes, leaving us with the option of paying the remaining portion of our "all-inclusive" booking or leaving the expense to our friends, which we were not willing to do. The resort claimed that they were holding rooms for another wedding and that they would not allow us to switch to a smaller room. Ultimately, with the final payment due, the resort bullied us into paying our full "all-inclusive" rate or else canceling our friends room. They were unwilling to even lower our rate to just cover the room. If they are unwilling to let you out of your booking with the loss of just a $75 dollar deposit 2 months in advance, what is the purpose of a deposit? I have traveled to many places around the world and never experienced such horrible treatment. Though I have wasted a significant amount of money, I am glad I am not wasting time at a place with such little integrity and concern for travelers. In life, things come up and we are not always able to follow-through on all plans; I recommend booking at a place that understands this. We stayed at Maroma resort and spa in close vicinity and experienced the highest quality vacation... I recommend looking into this resort instead of Azul fives or any of their sister hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Families...Some Inconsistencies”
Reviews.Author: cac2582
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at Azul Fives March 5 to March 10. It's a great family all-inclusive with some inconsitencies that keep it from a 5-star rating. At the outset, I would tell you that this is not the place for you if you are a young couple without kids, looking for a party or are looking for a quiet resort. On the other hand, this is the perfect place if you're with a group of people who have kids (like my wife and I were) or of course, if you have kids yourself. Rooms: The rooms are very nice. We had a 1-bedroom suite and it was enormous for two people. As the pictures show, the 1-bedroom suite has a huge spa bathroom in the same room as the bedroom. The other part of the suite is the living room/kitchen/dining room. The bed was a bit hard and we needed to ask for an additional blanket as the standard is two sheets. The pocket doors separating the bedroom from the living area are relatively flimsy, so I'm not sure that they would keep any noise from the living room out of the bedroom if someone wanted to sleep and others wanted to stay up. The one-bedroom suites also have a bath and a half, with the half bath in the living room. Air conditioning worked great. The whirlpool tub in the bathroom is definitely big enough for two people as is the shower. One issue we had with the tub was that when we turned on the whirlpool jets for the first time, brown particles came out and settled on the bathtub bottom. I assume this is because it isn't used all the time. The fixtures in the shower are very nice, with a rain shower head and a separate shower massage attachment. No problems with hot water. The lighting in the room is a bit dim, especially at the bathroom mirror. His and her sinks were a nice convenience, though. The couch is also a pull-out. We had friends who were given a crib for their baby as well. No complaints from anyone. The kitchen is a bit of a waste for most vacationers, but nice to have the space. If you request you can get plates, flatware and cooking pots and pans. Also, if you really want to cook on your own there are ways to get to a reasonable grocery store or to have groceries delivered. Just ask the concierge. Only real complaints about the rooms are: (1) the lighting in the bathroom is too dim; and (2) the fans in the bathrooms are loud and annoying and sound like they're half broken. All of the rooms have a walk out patio with chairs. I'll talk more about this when I talk about the pools, but our patio was relatively useless based on where our room was. We were on the first floor facing a path that lots of people walk down to get to the main building or the beach. So, it wasn't very private. Also, across the walking path was a main road that is fenced off. You can still hear workers going up and down it and smell the exhaust off of cars traveling down it. Other patios would be awesome, especially ones that are on the second floor or higher, or that face internally toward the internal pools. Food and Drink: Let's face a fact: if you're going to an all-inclusive and you're not shocked by the price, you're not getting gourmet food. They can try, they can come close, they can make the presentation look nice, they can put french words on the menu, but it ain't gourmet. That goes for any nice all-inclusive. That said, the food at this resort is very good for all-inclusive. By the main building where you check in is Flavours, the buffet (they call it a "food display"). The buffet itself is a touch on the smallish side, especially given how big the dining area is. But, it was rare to have a line and when there was a line it moved relatively quickly. Flavours is open for breakfast and dinner. We had breakfast every morning and it was pretty good. Fresh eggs and omelettes were cooked quickly with a nice selection of additional ingredients. Lots of your otherwise standard hot and cold breakfast fare was also included. Plenty of choices for everyone. One very nice touch was the bloody mary and mimosa bar setup off to the side every morning. The building next to the beach and activity pool has Arezzo (Italian), Tsuki (Japanese), Sea Olive (Mediterranean) and the beach grill (bar/grill food). I think Arezzo and Tsuki are only open for dinner. We had lunch at both the beach grill and Sea Olive. Both were good. Sea Olive for lunch had fish, mexican dishes and both standard and "dressed up" lunch type dishes. The fajitas were awesome, as was the caesar chicken salad and the shrimp burrito. The beach grill had your standard burgers, dogs, nachos, etc. The only downside to the beach grill is that it's outside, so if you're looking to come in from the heat you need to go to Sea Olive. Tsuki for dinner was good. Plenty of good (not great but not bad) quality sushi and other asian dishes. Arrezzo for dinner was amazing. This is coming from someone who lives in a very large city with many excellent italian restaurants, nearly all of which I have eaten at. I would put Arrezzo up with most big city italian restaurants. The food was tremendous. Try the flatbreads, the rissotto and the osso bucco. Tremendous. I was really shocked at how good it was. Arrezzo is the only restaurant you have to get reservations for. What they will tell you officially is that you have to get your reservation at least the day before you want to eat from 2-5 from a guy sitting near the pool with the reservation book. Maybe you need to do that for the first night, but we found that we could reserve a table for the next day by going up to the hostess stand at Arrezzo and asking for a reservation. Nice little shortcut. Room service is available, pretty timely, was always accurate for us and the menu is wide and varied. The only downside is like most room service at all-inclusives, the quality is not as good as in the restaurants. But, if you order something more basic like nachos or cheese plate you'll get something you'll like. The drinks are good. If you like a strong drink, then I recommend you have them make your drink and then you ask them to top it off with your choice of booze. I found the drinks mostly good, but there are a few bartenders who don't know what they're doing. Also, the selection of liquor brands is kind of hit or miss depending on what bar you're at. At some bars they'll have grey goose, at others only absolut. At some they'll have a nice reposado tequila, at others on only Cuervo. Pools/Beach: This resort has your standard activity pool and beach. Nothing really unique. Plenty of chairs on the beach up to about 10:30 or so. Chairs by the infinity pool went away by 8:30ish. No limit on towels which is nice. Drink service was very good. Obviously, the activity pool is very loud and boisterous. The pool itself is a bit small for being the main pool. The beach area is, as everyone has noted, pretty rocky. Some experienced ocean swimmers found a way to get into the water and swim past the rocks. But for everyone else, I suggest you walk north (take a left as you face the gulf) and walk up until you get to the area that is opposite a vacant area which is fenced off. It's probably a two minute walk. The beach there is not rocky and it's easy to get into and out of the water. The other unique part of this resort are the internal pools. There are two large pools that wind internally between the villa buildings. At some points, they are narrow like a lazy river. At others, they are quite large, almost the size of the main pool near the beach. These were pretty cool. Many rooms actually lead out directly to these pools. So, you could setup shop on your own patio and be steps from the pool. Also, these pools have three separate pool bars, two of which have seating outside the pool and you could have an open-air lunch there (off a more limited menu, basically like the beach grill near the activity pool). If you want to be close to your room, or you just want a more quiet area, these internal pools are for you. Many people don't even think to look at them because they kind of resemble the more private, swim-up rooms that other resorts have. This is not the case. None of the rooms are "swim up room" with direct pool access, though some are just steps away. I would encourage you to meander through these internal pools and find a little nook for yourself if that's your thing. These pools have areas with wade-in spots for smaller kids, or just steps leading in. There are also "hidden" nooks and crannies with three, four or five chairs setup that weren't taken all day. Definitely worth exploring, and still easy to get a drink. Spa My wife and I each got a massage. It was great. Go a bit early and do the "water treatment' which is basically a rotation of a sauna, steam room, hot whirpool, cold whirlpool and rain shower. Very nice. The massages were wonderful. Kids Club Obviously I didn't use the kids club but our villa was next door so we walked past every day multiple times. What an awesome place for a kid. They have a small kiddie pool outside, and inside they were always doing something with the kids from using the indoor gym to showing movies to pinata parties. Very cool looking. Nightlife: None to really speak of. Not too many people go to the shows. The Zky Bar doesn't get too crowded, either. Fun to have a drink on the veranda overlooking the activity pool adjacent to the Zky Bar. Overall It was interesting to see all the little things they have setup in the restaurants and other areas for kids. Toys in every restaurant. Kid friendly foods everywhere. Very accommodating for strollers, easy for others in our group to get clean boosters and high chairs. Overall, just seemed like it was really set up well to make it easy to have your children and enjoy yourself. The service was a bit inconsistent. Very good at times, very mediocre at times. All of the restaurants are slow, so if you want to eat fast then I suggest the beach grill for lunch and the buffet for breakfast and dinner. One thing we noticed was that as it got busier, the service really suffered. So, if you see a large crowd in a restaurant maybe delay your meal by a half hour and let the crowd thin out a bit. Also, the administrative policies were a little bit confusing and not consistent. One morning we showed up at the towel stand and were told that we could only have one towel per person. We come back a half hour later and now we can get as many towels as we want. I mentioned the issue about getting a reservation at Arrezzo. So, if you hear an answer you don't like then maybe you should just ask a different person at a different time...you might get the answer you want. I would definitely go back if I had kids, or was again with a group of friends that had kids. Probably wouldn't go back if it was just a couples retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Angel795
Reviews.Content: Just looking at the photos posted, makes me want to go back! Please keep in mind, this is a family resort. Lots of kids, but you can manage to find a quiet spot as we did and did not regret our choice. Food : 5/5* I am extremely fussy and fully enjoyed everything I had, but one meal. Stay away from the molle (chocolat sauce). Takes more like black beans sauce with no salt. Everything else was amazing! I wish I stayed 10 days instead of 7, in order to taste everything on their menus. Isalian and Japanese were outstanding. You may eat at a-la-carte restaurants as often as you wish. Rooms : 5/5* Amazing rooms. Extremely secur, seeing that you need to pass your ID card in two doors before entering you room. (They have an entrance that leads to a suite and a regular "deluxe" room. Could improve lighting above sinks, but really enjoyed everything else. Pools : 5/5* Infinity pool near the beach - Awesome! Not to mention the pool in between the villas, that are so long, they start at reception almost and lead directly to the last villas near the beach. GOs : Animation is really good and professional. They have professionals come to the hotel for the night shows. Really enjoyed each one. The day time animation was great and they are extremely friendly. Beach : If you're looking for an impeccable beach, you will be disappointed with Riviera Maya, no matter where you stay. I have to admit though, that at the Azul Fives, there was plenty of space to lay out in the sun without feeling like lined up sardines. I went to the Grand Sunset Princess two years ago and when I went back to take a look at it during this stay, I couldn't believe how cramped everyone was. All in all, you will not be disappointed. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Why would we go anywhere else?!”
Reviews.Author: tiffanylmiller
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! We got this trip last minute on. Travelzoo deal and it was one of the best experience we have had in Mexico! We go to Mexico at least once a Year and have had a hard time booking any other resort because we want to go back to Azul Fives so badly! Not perfect, but pretty darn close. Pros- Food was AMAZING. Best food I have had in Mexico at an all inclusive. There is a buffet option but there are also a variety of a la carte restaurants on the property. We ordered 3 courses at almost every meal. Infinity pool and beach were beautiful. And I love the swing beds on the beach for nap time. Staff was always super friendly and accommodating. Drinks were good. The rooms are unbelievable! We had a one bedroom suite and it was just beautiful. Cons- The beach is a walk from the rooms, but not bad. There are no ocean view rooms at this resort. I am fine with that but some guests found that to be a negative. The drive getting to the resort is a little worrisome. The drive to playa is fine but then you turn onto this undeveloped road and it looks as if you might be dropped off in the middle of nowhere! Once you are in the gates of the resort it is lovely. It might be a litlle crowded during the high season season but we went in october and we had the place pretty much to ourselves. We lived the Azul Fives and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives - Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives from February 23 – March 1. We had a great time so I had to assure all of those with trips booked. As others have stated, I would recommend this resort for families with younger children. I would not want to go here with just my husband. For those travelling with a child or children – I wouldn’t go with the deluxe room as it is quite small. We upgraded to a 1 bedroom which was beautiful and clean and we were on the ground level we could enjoy the pool while our 18 month old daughter was napping. Here are my comments on a few key areas: The food – gourmet is probably not the word I would use to describe it. It is much better than other resorts I have been at, and there was always something for our daughter to eat. We tried Tsuki the last night there, and it was delicious, we wished we had tried it sooner. Ezekial was one of the best servers we’d had in our entire stay! There was one night when there was a wait to go to this restaurant so we did the seaside grill, every other night we were seated and eating within 15-30 minutes at the restaurant of our choice. Check In - Upon arrival we had a nice cool glass of champagne, our daughter had a chocolate milk. In our room was already waiting for us a crib, baby monitors, bottle warmer, and bottle sterilizer. At every restaurant there are a few toys by the entrance for your child to play with during dinner – this was all very much appreciated. I would suggest bringing some of your own toys and books to keep in the room and for at the pool. We tried to use the baby monitors they provided and just a note they were a bit fuzzy…we had brought our own so you may want to do the same. The pools – they were a bit cooler, but our last few days there were so hot that it was very welcomed! It never bothered us or our daughter at all. They water was so clear and clean, all day there was someone keeping the pools clean. The infinity pool was the coldest with the breeze coming off of the ocean. The beach –the water is very choppy with rocks at the bottom…it just wasn’t usable for us with a child at this age but again, we loved all the pools Kid’s club – very clean and inviting, we only went in for ½ hr on our last day, but next time we will use the facilities a bit more. All the kids seemed to really enjoy it. The layout – you do have to walk max 5 minutes a bit to get from each end of the resort etc… I needed to burn off all of the calories I ate there each day so I welcomed the bit of exercise The rooms – I agree with others comments that the bathrooms were a bit dark but they were clean and the beds were very comfy. We were on the ground level and you could hear people above you sometimes but I still loved being on the main level. We did experience a few glitches throughout our stay, it was a bit tough to upgrade rooms as the front desk was kind of brushing us off. But we went every morning to inquire and by the 3rd day our diligence paid off. An employee at the resort “shop” severely overcharged me on a few items, which I discovered when a different employee was working and charged me less. So make sure you get a receipt for all of your purchases there. We had a few issues with room service, but overall it was fine, it was anywhere from a 20-45 minute wait. The location of this resort is fantastic...close to the airport, and Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: JRIowa_8
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this resort. The staff was very good, always friendly and attentive. The beach is wide and deep and had plenty of lounge chairs available. Sand volleyball, bocce, beach soccer available every day. Never got into the ocean because of windy weather and high surf. Nice pools with a bar at each. There is a free show most every night. Don't miss the fire show. It is amazing! There is no ocean view but why are you in your room all day? An easy walk to any part of the resort. Well kept and spacious grounds. The specialty restaurants were good and we did not have any excessive waiting times. The rooms are not luxurious but are quite adequate. However, the lighting is poor. Take a lighted makeup mirror. I stayed at the Royal at Cancun 2 years ago. My experience was so bad I didn't want to go back to Mexico. Azul Fives changed my mind. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: idgirl
Reviews.Content: The road to Azul Fives is "colorful". It is a long, narrow road that looks like you are heading into the "hood". Ironically, this road was charming by the end of our vacation. The entrance and lobby were very simple. The "deluxe room" is large but only comes with double beds and no tub. We upgraded to a one bedroom penthouse suite on our second day. It was well worth the money! We didn't use the upstairs balcony much so if I were to go again, I would book the one bedroom suite. The room is HUGE with a large couch, table, kitchen, jetted tub, and two bathrooms. Hot water does seem to be hit or miss. We had fewer problems once we were in the one bedroom suite. Bring a hand held mirror! The lighting in both bathrooms was poor and it was difficult to put on makeup. I took my mirror and got ready on the balcony. The food was excellent. We especially loved the Italian restaurant. It did require reservations but we never had a problem getting in. The sit down food service is slow (average 2 hours for a meal) compared to US restaurants, but it didn't bother us. We traveled without children so we enjoyed the time visiting with our friends. This may have been a problem for us if we had hungry children waiting. The restaurant staff were attentive and very kind. We loved the pools (yes, they are not heated but they felt great with the February heat) and espcially the beach beds. We spent many hours reading and relaxing on the beach in comfort. The drink service on the beach was consistant and there were various activities going on (horseshoes, volleyball, water aerobics, etc.) if you wanted something to do. We found the staff throughout the resort to be very accomidating and attentive to our needs. Their responce was always, "it's my pleasure"! The grounds are beautiful!!! and constantly being groomed. We loved the monkeys, iguanas, and other wildlife from the neighboring preserve. We had a wonderful week of pure relaxation. Azul Fives is not the resort for you if you are looking for a party every night. There are lots of families with children and the resort is very quiet after 10. However, it is the perfect spot to get away from it all and relax.

Reviews.Title: “"Average Resort"”
Reviews.Author: ptm39
Reviews.Content: The Azul Fives grounds are beautiful and well kept. The lazy rivers wonderful and the pool bars good. Get out early in the am and grab a lounge chair or you will be wandering around looking for a seat and you might be out of luck. The staff at the bars and the gourmet corners are great. We had a two bedroom condo on the second floor, wish we had a booked or asked for a ground level condo facing the lazy river. No view of the ocean at all. No such thing! Our 2 bed condo was okay, we found the king size bed was damp. The ID cards were not a problem for us. The spa is excellent. Didn't spend any time at the beach.The beach was nice not very big. We found the music from the infinity pool loud and we weren't into the games etc. The restaurants were okay. The food was okay, certainly was not the gourmet food we experienced the previous year at the El Dorado Casita Royale. Apparently this is a fairly new resort, I think they are trying....just not there yet! If you are looking for a room with a view of the ocean this is not the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Arn B
Reviews.Content: First, the positives...Azul Fives with its canals meandering among its three story buildings is very nice for a family vacation, especially with toddlers. The grounds are well kept, the beach is fine and so is the infinity pool, The staff was always helpful, if not always competent. If, however, you want a room that features even a glimpse of the ocean, book elsewhere! ALL the rooms are at least a quarter mile from the beach. There is no such thing as "oceanfront" though they advertise otherwise. Forget "ocean view", "ocean glimpse" or "virtual ocean". Not possible! Finally, the food ranged from completely inedible to barely acceptable and lighting in rooms was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Donna258
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "dont do it", save your money and go somewhere else. Upon arrival, after requesting a King bed, non to be had unless I had an extra $89. per night, happy 26th anniversary dear in that bed way over there. To the maybe 5 gallon hot water tank (its in the trick cupboard under the fridge, that I must say was restocked maybe twice) couldnt even finish washing my hair with luke warm water. The workers were awesome with great tips on where to go (away from the resort for fun). Yawn, yawn. Too bad some of the whinny kids werent doing a little more yawning, cause they were a little annoying. Parents today, when kids are tired, order room service, in general people arent interested in listening to your whinning demanding kids at dinner. Maybe send them to grandmas so you too can relax. Or take a lesson from the locals, never heard any of their kids whining. This is my 4th trip to this area and maybe the other resorts did a better job at keeping the young ones in their own little area, but I dont recall being annoyed at almost every meal with crying kids. Which in turn effected the night life, everyone was in their rooms with their children. Hence no night life, I may be 50 but this place was a real drag. Other than the pool by the beach by day, there really wasnt anything to do but lay around. I too like to relax but I also like to have some fun. The available toys, oh right there were non. Sticking to the larger resorts from now on, at least they have things to do. One advantage to nothing to do, meant we left often, that was when I enjoyed myself . The beach was okay, just dont go in the water without water shoes, all the sand has washed away and its rocky first step in. Go to Playa if you want a real beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Azul away 3 weeks.The staff is wonderful;very polite and helpful.The food is wonderful.The staff at the pool are so kind ,i went to water workout everyday and they know how to do it.Plan on going back for a month next year.Not a negitive thing to say. .WONDERFUL

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with a few issues - great for families”
Reviews.Author: flyersfan16
Reviews.Content: We were at Azul Fives in January with our two children ages 7 and 10. Food The food was very good. The resturants were better than the RUI palace however the buffet (they called it a 'food display'- hilarious) was good but not spectacular. The room service menu was excellent. The smoothie bar was also great. The drinks from the bar would good all around. The asian resturant was the best! Grounds Well kept and lots for kids to do. The gym was excellent. The pools were very nice and the winding river was also good. Lots of walking, but that was fine. The beach was rocky and rough but if you walked for two minutes, you had a nice beach but the surf was rough when windy. Service The bar service was great. The resturant service was also very good. The front desk was useless, and was no help whatsoever with our room issue. Karen at the conceirge office by the front pool did her best to help us out. Room We had a standard room which was fine as we were on the go constantly. The beds were very good. There was an iPod docking station and a DVD player which was good when traveling with kids. We had no hot water for most of the week which was a major issue that could not get resolved. Entertainment. The shows were good but they wasn't one every night. We have stayed at RUIs before and there was always something every night. The staff by the pool were great and were able to include by kids and adults during the daily activities. The sky bar was very nice but underused as this was a quiet hotel. The kids club was great for short periods of time. Other Information There were a lot of kids so if you are looking for a party hotel, this is not the one. I felt bad for some of the singles and groups of those looking to party because this was a quiet hotel. Would we stay there again? Probably not due to the hot water issue and also that we may try somewhere else. Questions? Don't hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort”
Reviews.Author: jdp028
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week at the Azul Fives with our five month old. This is an ideal holiday spot for families and highly recommend it. Travelling with an infant can be stressful, but the resort accomodated us by providing a crib, bathtub and baby monitor. We had a pool walk-out room so when our baby slept inside, we could lounge by the pool. It is clear that the staff (from grounds keepers to service staff) take great pride in their work. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The resort is small, so we never felt crowded or had to wait for anything. The spa is first-class and I would dare compare it to some very high end spas anywhere in the world. The atmosphere was serene and the service excellent. I'd like to address some of the negative reviews that almost turned us off this resort -the beach is lovely and perfectly sized for this size of resort. We always got beach chairs and were always well-served by the beach butler. The only negative is that once you get into the water, there is a rock shelf that might be intimidating to unexperienced ocean swimmers. However, the beach itself is clean and sandy. -the restaurants were great. We never had to wait to get a table at the buffet or the restaurants. There was lots of variety and the food was good. The only reason that I did not give this hotel an "excellent" rating is because I am comparing it to some very high end resorts in the middle east and europe where facilities and staff truly are excellent. Although we booked a room with a king sized bed, we received two doubles (which staff pushed together when we requested). The mini-bar was only restocked when asked (which we did daily). And turn-down service (which I don't even care about) happened occassionally. Finally, although the resort preached environmental sustainability, and requested that guests re-use towels, our room had no hooks or towel bars where you could hang them.

Reviews.Title: “our vacation: priceless”
Reviews.Author: hawkMuskokaOntario
Reviews.Content: Recently (Feb 8-22) we enjoyed a very relaxing vacation at Azul Fives. The condo was wonderful - spacious & very clean. The all-inclusive option which is available by the day or more if you like, is an excellent value. The restaurants offer many selections with excellent quality. There are plenty of activities and entertainment offered during the day & evenings. We especially enjoyed the fire dance show - watched it from the Sky Bar - what a treat - and there was a casino night which was great fun. The spa, aahhhh the spa - what a pleasure - 4 visits there - each a delight....Olivia added to the calming atmosphere you feel as soon as you go through the door. The layout of the property with the pools, patios, restaurants and lush gardens is excellent. The many walking paths to the beach and along side each of the winding pools are very picturesque. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. To name a few: Alberto, at Flavours, Miguel at Sea Olive, Jorge at Flavours, Jacobo at Sea Olive, Ana - hostess at Flavours, Vanessa at Front Reception and our Housekeeping staff member who was incredibly thorough. All of the staff seemed to 'go the extra mile' and certainly helped make our vacation very enjoyable. A favourite part of being at the resort is the many choices offered; you can choose a short or long walk along the beach, you can lounge at the infinity pool in full view of the ocean, join in water activities, enjoy the swim-up bar OR retreat to the extensive winding pools for quiet/shady relaxing time and/or have fun at the 3 swim-up bars complete with food/snacks. There is something for everyone. All in all, as spacious and large as the resort is, it holds a quaintness about it. We will definitely return to "The Fives"..... ole

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time at Azul Fives”
Reviews.Author: rcsje
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from our 1 week (Feb18-25) holiday at Azul Fives and I felt compelled to write a review to hopefully reassure others who have booked there not to worry about the negative reviews. After a much delayed, extremely annoying flight we arrived at 4 am at the hotel to be greeted by Angel and several other staff members. The welcome and the smooth, pampered check in set the tone for our entire holiday. The room we booked, a 2 bedroom penthouse suite was exactly as pictured on their website. The air conditioning was perfect temperature, everything was spotless and smelled wonderful. Our family travels alot and this was definitely one of the best set ups for a family with older teenaged children - lots of room and everyone had their own space. The resort itself was small enough and safe enough that we felt very comfortable letting them do things on their own. The layout of the resort was fantastic with the pools meandering around the villas and the swim up bars (with access at the sides for those not in the water) conveniently interspersed. The path to the beach is through a park like setting (not a long distance) with a tennis court, outdoor chess and checkers, ping pong, shuffleboard and swinging hammocks. The grounds are immaculate. When you turn the corner at the restaurants the view of the infinity pool overlooking the beach and water is breath taking. In the morning we would go for a walk on the beach and pick our chairs (around 8 am everything is available- it started to get busy after 9). The staff were very helpful and cheerful. There was always plenty of towels and you could also pick up cold water, sun tan lotion or books at the towel booth.Due to high winds we did not try the snorkeling or kayaks which are available for your use. There was also yoga, beach volleyball, water polo, water aerobics, horseshoes, and bocce to keep you active. We played tennis 4 times while we were there. Pedro, the pro offers lessons (for a fee) but you can also just play on your own. To book a court you just talk to him at the court. He'll provide the racquets, balls and cold water! On Sunday you need to go to Azulito's - the kids club to pick up the racquets. Too bad they didn't have lights because it would have been preferable to play in the cooler evenings. Although I didn't use it, my daughter said the gym was good for those of you wanting to keep up with your daily routine. My husband and I love to cook so we usually only dine out at very good restaurants. We found the food at all the restaurants very good ( I wouldn't call it gourmet) but much better than the average restaurant and outstanding for an all inclusive. The service we received at Arezzo and Tsuki however was comparable to the best restaurants at which we've eaten. A word of caution, we found the service got slower (not terrible) when we went around 7:30 - 8, no problems at 7. Arezzo, the Italian restaurant has a sommelier to help you if you wish to purchase a nice bottle of wine. The house wines are okay - they offer a couple of differnet reds or whites which depending on your taste you can find one you like. Their house champagne is good too. We used room service almost once a day and didn't have a problem. They always repeated your order back to you and even followed up with a phone call to determine if everything was alright. Although ther were alot of families with small children, there was a good mix of all age groups. This resort would suit anyone except those looking for a very loud Spring Break atmosphere. I liked the variety available at the resort - the livelier dining/beach area, the quieter pool sides and finally the absolute privacy of the roof top terrace. Depending on your mood you could go to the place that suits you best. Perhaps the thing that impressed me the most about the resort was their commitment to continually improve. Managers were often asking for your opinion on services, they were extremely apologetic if something went wrong. Given my experience and talking to others, I truly believe that those negative reviews are isolated incidents. Finally, although all the staff were friendly and very good - there were a few exceptional ones Caesar - our maid, Ezekial our waiter in Tsuki, Gregorio a waiter at the Beach Grill and Emilio, the bartender at Palmas. We will definitely recommend this hotel to others and hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Mejiks
Reviews.Content: Feb.3 - Feb. 10, 2012 - all inclusive package for 4. The resort is very nice, the waiters are very pleasant and hardworking, the food and drink are very good. BUT It took 4 (!) days from the time of arrival at Cancun at 9:30 am on Friday until 3 pm on Monday to get a decent one-bedroom suite for which we paid for. We spent most of these valuable days at the front desk as we checked-in to 3 different rooms with no hot water, terrible smell, no bedding for our sons and locked washroom. We received wrong guest cards, had problems with reservations for Italian restaurant and were constantly given wrong inconsistent answers from the unprofessional front desk clerks (except of Vanessa the manager). It was obviously not 5 star resort service level. Just beware...

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Overall”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive trip taken, 2 adults 2 children ages 4 and 7. We have travelled extensively, cruises, rental homes, hotels etc..I was somewhat skeptial prior to depature based on the negative reviews. Let me just say, if you expect 5 star service, then you should most likely be staying at the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton, but also, expect to pay a premium. I honestly cannot understand the negative reviews given and questioned each one while I was there. This is a 4 star based on the standards of this country. Food was very good at all restaurants. No, it is not "high" end as one may led to believe, but for Mexico standards, was probably as good as it is going to get. Flavours for breakfast, anything you may want and more, the fruit was exceptional. Service by Roberto was excellent in the morning, he would have our drinks ready upon arrival without asking. Yes it is buffet style, but did not feel that way at all. We ate lunch at the Beach Grill each day as it was easy, convenient and very tasty. Again, its lunch and following a big breakfast, you probably should not be eating a big lunch anyways. Dinner at Azzaro was very good, service was right on. The Matre'D, Jumanico, I think that is how you spell his name, took pride in taking care of his guests, including my family. Never waited for a table. Tsuki, well, Sushi in Mexico? Really, they should shut it down and replace it with a nice Mexican Restaurant, we are in Mexico. Room service was very good, prompt and order was always correct and meals warm. The property is extremely clean, rooms are well furnished, spacious and accomodates families of 4 with no problems. We stayed in Villa 14, you cannot have a bad view from this Villa as it is in the middle of the resort and next to Lizards. If you like civiche, you will have a very good one here, a must for lunch. Ground floor rooms are also very convenient if you have children. Extremely safe resort, there were NO issues with personal safety at this place or in the area. We walked the beach everyday, not once were we hassled. If you walk left facing the water, past the pier about 10 minutes, there is a sand bar in front of the Princess Resort, great for swimming. Take a look at that resort and then be happy you are at Azul Fives. I must end with the pool and temparture of the water. I have read a lot of complaints about the water in the pools being cold. People, it is Mexico and it was hot every day. Dipping into a refreshing pool was amazing! Heating the pools would be a total waste of money and resources, especially when they are not cold! So for those who find it cold, where a wet suit or again, stay at the Four Seasons, they may warm it up for you. I must add that I read a lot of complaints about slow service at the bars. I never waited more than 2-4 minutes for a drink, but got served almost immediately when ever we went to the bar. We are good tippers that may have had something to do with it but for the most part, we were served quickly as were other guests. Unfortunately, I did not see many other tippers, which is sad. Ceasr is a bar keep at the main pool and Zky Bar, seek him out, he is a super nice guy and will tend to any of your needs. The staff here are what make it all come together. Pedro at Beach Grill, Roberto at Flavors, the front end staff at Azzaru, including Gabriella and her manager, house keeping, and all the other bar tenders working the swim up bars. If you don't want to get wet, just go to the side, they will serve you. Not for couples if you don't like children, but a great family resort overall. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “"Excellente" at Azul Fives”
Reviews.Author: Jessica W
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 1 week at Azul Fives. Feb. 16-23. We don't have kids. We are early 30s and were looking for a contemporary, modern 5 star experience, with personal service which was met and exceeded by the staff and amenities at Azul Fives. This is a small but deluxe resort with just over 300 rooms. Rooms: - check in was easy & quick. We checked in at 5:00pm and our room was ready. We were offered welcome glasses of champagne. - we stayed in a one bedroom suite. Upon check in we asked if there were any that offered a roof top patio and there was one available. - The rooms are spacious, beautiful, clean. Look exactly how they appear on the website. The roof top patio was outstanding. Two lounge chairs, 1 day bed, BBQ, a washroom up there, bar area, table for 6, jacuzzi tub (cool water, but that was ok for us in the 30 degree weather). We used the roof top every single day as the resort beach area is east facing. So, shade sets in around 4:00 and the roof top patio is where we would catch the last cpl hrs of sun. I recommend using room service to your full advantage. It's included, accurate for the most part and quick. We would order wine and champagne, cheese platter and fruit platter and hang out on the patio everyday for happy hour. Grounds & Beach: - immaculate grounds. Zero garbage. Staff are everywhere - checking PH levels in the pools, mowing the lawn, cleaning everythings. Hardly a leaf could fall from a tree without someone there to sweep it up. - River pool was very nice, however we spent most time either by the infiniti pool or beach. We preferred the beach - it was beautiful. For the infiniti pool, we would reserve chairs around 7:30 am without problems. For the beach, just drag your chairs wherever you want to sit at anytime of the day. the pool/beach was full but never seemed too "busy" which was nice. - No food allowed by the pools or beach which was nice as it probably would wind up in the pools or causing a mess. There are 2 nearby restos for lunch. It was not an inconvenience. - We enjoyed walking on the beach and checking out the other resorts (but ours was better!) Restaurants: - Overall, food was great. We would do a morning workout, and then grab a shake at the Shake Bar, Shakes were tasty and I particularly liked the use of fresh fruit. We would have breakfast at Flavours which was delicious and had everything you could want. Yes, it's the same offerings everyday, but you just need to ask the kitchen for what you want and it's done. As well, there is an A La Carte menu at Flavours for breakfast if you prefer. Some of the best omlettes we have had! - Lunch: Sea Olive had a nice salmon fillet and good chicken breast dishes. Killer chicken ceasar salad. If you prefer junk food (hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza... head to the beach Grill) Get the icecream!!! - Dinner: Tsuki was our favourite with outstanding sushi rolls, the chicken/beef skewers and asian noodle dishes were great. Busiest restaurant. So, my advice is to put your name on the list and head up to Sky bar for drinks. They actually come up there to get you when your table is ready. - All restaurants were good. Yes, mistakes happened and orders were wrong sometimes. This was due to the language barrier. Good manners and treating your servers with a lot of respect and politeness goes a long way. Every single server we met on our trip would do anything and everything we asked - even custom orders of food that we often requested. Their mission is to make you happy and we noticed it. We were very impressed. - We didn't get sick once and ate everything you could imagine. Drinks/bars: - Sky bar was great. Nightly entertainment we watched every night from 9:30-10:30 ish. We were impressed by the Michael Jackson and Circus shows. The fire show on Fri night was great. It was very busy up there. Very well done. - Drinks are good. Be creative and ask for something different. I recommend the Medina Dacquiri, Mango Dacquiri, Cesars. (they have Clamato!) Spa: - Better than many top end spas here in Vancouver. Best Relaxation massage I have had) People/ Other guests: - We met a lot of great people. Many Canadians go here which is great, because we are from Vancouver. I would guess around 70% canadians here. - not a lot of smokers and smoking isn't heavily advertised. (no ash trays in your room or patio or by the pool.) We are non smokers and appreciated this. - This is a kid friendly resort which we were initially worried about there being so many kids because we don't have any. The kids were so well behaved and did not bug us at all. People / staff: - By far the highlight of Azul Fives was the endless wonderful people that work there. It has left a lasting impression on us. Smiles by everyone and you could find any staff there and they would try to help you with whatever you needed. Special thanks to a few. - We met Jose upon check in. Jose is at the Bell desk. Superior service as he gave us a "VIP tour of the resort as he drove us to our room" He is a special guy. - Nelly at the Omlette station. She would personally deliver our omlettes to our table. - Ana at Flavours in the morning and Sea Olive for lunch. I thought she was the manager there and realized it was only her third day! Very talented and exceptional service. - Oscar and Agustus ( aka: Danny DeVito!). Great servers. - Cesar at Sky bar and the main pool bar - Luis and Hilario - these guys are the activities makers and run all the programs (volleyball, water arobics) - We were approached by Walter the food manager for feedback on the food quality and everytime we ordered room service, we received a phone call asking if it was accurate. *** Like any interaction with people, it goes a long way when you try to get to know the people who are serving you. It's important to know their names and greet them by it. Asking questions about them and showing you care and enjoy hearing about their life too, results in better service than any tip you can give. However, we did tip everyday....a dollar or two at all each meal to show our appreciation for their hard work. It was probably the best money we spent there. We would recommend Azul Fives a hundred times over to anyone. A comment about Mexico in general: Overall I can say that Playa Del Carmen is a great, culturally diverse city, with many good bars and restos. We went into town to explore, had lunch, went out at night to Coco Bongo. We always felt safe and would return without hesitation to the city any time of day.

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: Y H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 1 week stay at the Azul Fives (Feb 16-23). I must preface this review by indicating that I have never felt inclined to write a review for tripadvisor in the past. Moreover, I have always had a health sceptism about negative reviews on this site. Surely, the people writing the reviews must be too picky. I have never viewed myself as such. I also know that the management will likely respond to this post with the standard response that seems typical when there are negative reviews of the hotel - i.e. that it is apologetic for our experience and that it is apologetic with respect to our concenrs. In anticipation of that response, I would like to point out that our concerns were brought to the attention of management while we were on our trip and our concerns were not addressed. In my view, that speaks for itself and an apology or explanation now is too little, too late. In the interests of fairness I would like to point out that there were issues that we encountered that are not attributable to management and I have done my best to point this out when that is the case. The first issue is the food. The food is mediocre, at best. it is not gourmet experience, as stipulated in the marketing materials. On many occasions our food was inedible. For example, the steak we ordered was so full of fat that we could barely take two bites out of it. It was often cold, bland and tasteless. Azzero was okay but not the five star experience it is made out to be. Breakfast at Flavours was fine, but just fine. Sea Olive too, was also just okay. This is unacceptable for a hotel that makes the gourmet inclusive a centre piece of its marketing. With these types of expectations, one will surely be disappointed. The next issue was the service. We were treated very badly by at least two staff members. We were lied to in an effort to get more money for the resort. I will not delineate particulars here but suffice it to say, this left a very bad taste in our mouth. I must add, that this was the case, notwithstanding the fact that Azul Fives has many hard working, lovely people who do their best. It was confirmed to us by management that the hotel is understaffed and this is reflected by the slow service in the restaurants and the spotty/inconsistent quality of the service. The rooms are one of the positive aspects of the resort. We had a large suite and it was very nice. That being said, I could not use the jacuzzi as every time I turned it on brown water would come out. This was reported to the management but nothing was done about it. So too were our concerns about the staff members set out above. NOTHING was done to rectify or discuss this situation with us. As we were checking out, we were asked if we received a basket from the management to apologize for the inconvenience. We were told we had not. All we head in response is "that's too bad". This is not quality service. Finally, I want to add that it was confirmed for us by a high ranking member of the Azul team that Azul Fives is at the very bottom of the Karisma chain and we were questioned as to why we did not go to El Dorado. This was very disheartening to hear having spent a good amount of money on the trip. In conclusion, this is a 3 star hotel at the moment. If you have a choice, go elsewhere. As I say, were it not for my concern that others would experience the same treatment we received, I would not be writing this.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: Fripou1
Reviews.Content: Went from feb 16 to 23rd. Had the best vacation ever. The resort is beautiful, clean, the food was excellent and all of the staff was the very best. Enjoyed the pools that go through the resort with all of it's bars, yummy drinks and food. The beach is rocky but great for snorkeling, there is a beach that is all sandy to the left of the resort where you can swim as much as you like. We were there with another couple and everything was great. It's not too big of a resort you can go everywhere and imagine many of the staff would actually remember your name! Go and have a great Holiday!

Reviews.Title: “!!!Nice and cozyhotel but be careful!!!”
Reviews.Author: vuqq
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel and a great vacation spot for a couple whom enjoys the quite of a beach and good food. one major problem we experience was that our Amex CC info was compromised during check in processing by the staff members or someone they know and was used to purchased Apples products online. So be careful not to let them used your CC to used as deposit for hotel, and make sure your card is checked for illegal purchases. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Mummurph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azuls Feb 7th-14th with our two boys 5 and 6. We had a one bedroom suite in villa 9 on the ground floor. We were close to lizards terrace and the swim up bar that our favorite bartender Sergio worked. He was great and was always very attentive. Rooms were awesome, very modern and very clean. We bathed our guys every night and my wife and I both showered never once having any issues with hot water. Our kids did not find the pullout bed comfy so we just put sheets on the sectional sofa and they were happy. Two tv's in the room was nice so we could watch a show if the kids wanted to watch something else during down time. Cleaning ladies were great, it is true they come at different times during the day but we just adjusted to this. They always gave us what we asked (extra water, beer, pop, etc). Restaurants were great, flavors buffet we had breakfast every day and they have everything you could possibly want. If you don't enjoy this breakfast I would hate to read any review you may write about any resort. We also went to a few of the theme dinners at flavors, the mexican and Mayan nights were both very good while the Italian night to us was not good at all. Italian restaurant was good, we had a reso for 6pm and had no wait. Good food but not our favorite. Japanese Reston was our favorite, we didn't bring the kids to this one. They stayed with my wife's parents and had room service. The tempura, soups, sushi all awesome along with service. We liked the beach grill for lunch, buffet with salads and pizza's some enchillada's and other tasty stuff. At night it turns into a beach side steakhouse with fresh red snapper and other great dishes. Sea olive was Mediterranean and quite tasty as well. The kids liked it as it had onion rings. Lizards restaurant near our room was probably our only bad experience for food as we had lunch one day and they messed up our order, forgot things and took forever. We just went back to the room and ordered room service. Room service was great, food was good, friendly service, and came in a timely fashion. We always ordered so fruit trays for the kids and put some in Tupperware we brought and put in fridge for the kids. Pools were great, infinity pool was pretty nice and definitely the busy area of resort. We preferred the pool near lizards near our room. Little quieter for the kids etc. lots of chairs and convenient to be close to our room. We wanted an ice relaxing week and that is exactly what we got. My mother in law and ger husband are already planning a return trip here. I think we will definitely consider this resort again but also like to try different places. Would I recommend Azuls Fives? Absolutely! Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Terrific trip with the family”
Reviews.Author: Westchesterfamilyfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 29- Feb 4. Used two combined Groupons, but also purchased the Gourmet all-inclusive option. Worked out to be an incredible deal. Arranged transportation to and from Cancun through Lomas travel. They were great with very professional and clean service. We needed a van with 3 car seats and they met our need perfectly. We have twin 3 year old boys and a 2 year old girl, so our experience was based on just wanting to go someplace warm and spend time at the beach all together. Upon arrival one of our sons hurt his face pretty badly and the resort was very responsive to provide us with medical care and arrange for transportation to a local hospital. The rest of the trip was event free. We had an attached 1 bedroom suite and a deluxe room, on the first floor of building 6. Perfect location for our kids. Steps away from the Kids club and kiddie pool while closest to the main restaurants and beach. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. You need to ask on check in for pots, pans, and utensils, which were quickly brought to our room. The 1 bedroom suite has a good sized kitchen and dining area with a large dining table. There is a half bathroom along with a main room next to this, followed by the bedroom and good sized bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. We had no hot water issues at all, even after bathing all the kids and ourselves. The fridge was stocked with beverages daily, and you could order room service 24/7. Most of the time room service was timely, but at busier dinner times it sometimes took a bit longer. When ordering, you are given a wait time which was very accurate. The restaurants were very nice, with great menu options and hard working staff. We felt that the main buffet restaurant could have been a bit more kid friendly, utilizing less glassware and having cups with lids available. Overall the other restaurants were a bit more kid friendly. The Japanese and Italian restaurants were outstanding. The Italian restaurant was as good if not better than most fine Italian establishments in NYC. The grounds and pools were very well maintained. Never had a problem getting chairs or beach beds. The beach was nice, but getting into the water was hazardous because of large coral rock formations literally just off shore. Even getting in the water just to cool off was a challenge. In this sense it was perfect for smaller kids because they could just play at the water edge all day. There are several pools that work well for adults as well as kids. Two of the pools have zero entry. The kids club has lots of activities, some supervised, but most geared towards parents just spending time with their kids. It has a room for movies and video games, a lego play area, an activity area, and a gym area. The kids gym cost extra for an hour long class that was well worth it. Our kids loved it. There is a nice adult gym with fairly new equipment and weights. Next to this is a Smoothie/juice bar with lots of really healthy options. The kids loved this, too. Wifi cost $50 for a week, or $10 per day. Easily accessible in room or throughout the resort. All things considered an excellent resort with hard working, friendly service and great restaurants. The all-inclusive option is a must to really get the most out of it. Special thanks to front desk man Nathaniel. He was very helpful to us from start to finish. I would definitely recommend this resort, especially if getting a deal as sweet as ours.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfec”
Reviews.Author: Gatorgirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the azul fives February 10-19 in a one bedroom suite. The rooms were perfect big and always cleaned to perfection. The food was good at every restaurant, I especially enjoyed the lizard pool side restaurant. The service was excellent in all areas but Diana & Domingo at the beach and Sergio at the lizard pool bar were the best. This is a family resort and they really treat the kids well and they also have a great kids club. I would recommend this resort as it has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Site!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyParrish
Reviews.Content: After months and months of planning a wedding in Michigan, I looked at my fiancé and said "I am done dealing with all this stress." A girl that I worked with had just come back from having a destination wedding and brought in all her photos. After looking through her photos, I knew I wanted to do a destination wedding. The girl I worked with recommended DestinationWeddings.com, specifically Kathy Murray. After calling and talking with Kathy, she was able to recommend a few wedding venues for us in Mexico that would be within our budget. When I first got engaged I had put together a list of people and an estimated cost for our wedding. The list was around 350 people and our wedding was going to cost $60,000. This was way outside our budget. After talking with Kathy I was able to learn that a destination wedding typically costs anywhere from $3,000-$10,000. That struck my interest. Three weeks before our wedding in Riviera Maya, I was watching the news and saw that the resort that we were going to have our wedding at had a natural gas explosion. I immediately panicked, since it showed that the resort was going to be shut down. I called Kathy and she was able to transfer all of our guests over to a FIVE STAR hotel called Azul Fives. This is a family friendly resort that has an amazing kids venue right at the resort as well. I was upset and nervous at first since I had never been to that resort, but put my trust in Kathy's expertise. I am so glad we did because of the fact that the resort was an amazing experience. It was a much nicer resort than we had originally planned to get married at and the resort was able to transfer over the same rates as the first resort. We were treated like royalty, which made the entire experience a memorable one. The food, the people, the atmosphere are perfect for an intimate wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity now!”
Reviews.Author: Mary Anne C
Reviews.Content: I went to the Fives with a friend, and had an amazing time!!! I needed a rest and this serene resort gave me just that. It's a small resort and was never over crowded. The landscape and decor is classy and elegant. It was basically the most beautiful resort I have ever been to, clean and well kept. The staff was professional and courteous. The entertainment staff were friendly and not pushy, which was great as I was looking to unwind. I did yoga in the mornings and long walks on the beach everyday. Playa del Carmen was a very short taxi ride away, and was fun to go to in the evenings. The food for breakfast, lunch and dinner was delicious. I tried all the restaurants and have not one complaint. The Italian restaurant was my favourite. Just to finish, the spa is the most amazing retreat you will find in the world. I have never had such wonderful treatment. Relaxing to the max. I whole heartedly recommend this resort to one and all. You won't find anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: Keithster
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of a destination wedding. A great time. Food was quite good, staff was excellent. Would return. check out Cocos Cabanas, 100 meters north off beach and through a small parking lot. Great lunch spot.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...would probably stay at different Karisma if we came back.”
Reviews.Author: tennisplayerinlr
Reviews.Content: I visited Azul Fives because of a great deal on a Groupon. So we did not do the all inclusive, as that was not part of the deal. Just want to preface the review with that information. There were some goods and some bads. The goods were very nice staff. They were always very helpful and did what they could to make our stay better. Very nice grounds. They keep the whole place very neat and clean. And it is very pretty. We had the candlelight dinner on the beach (it was part of the groupon), and it was very good. The breakfast buffet was top notch. I ate all the fresh fruit I wanted and had some wonderful omeletes prepared for me on the spot. The bads include that the pools were very cold. I got in them and tolerated them, but my partner would not get in them. The infinity pool was the really cold one (but it is beautiful, that is for sure...). The pools and pool bars seemed to close pretty early (I know..this is a family resort, but I wanted to point that out..). Distance to town. We got a taxi a few days, but would be nice to actually be able to walk to a few things. But you are basically so far from the main road, that walking is out of the question. And if you are not on the AI plan, the food is pretty expensive and only okay. We were so excited to get off the resort and eat (the little place right before you get to the resort is wonderful!!). So if you are going with a family, this might be your place. You can do lots of activities and stay just on the resort and not have to leave to enjoy the trip. But if you want to do some things in town and want more of a couples / adults atmosphere, try a different Karisma resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: Lauri K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Azul Fives from February 10 until the 17 and enjoyed our vacation a great deal. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The food was very good in the restaurants that we ate at. We ate at Flavors for breakfast every day and a few nights, the Sea Olive 3 nights and at the Italian for Valentine's day. The beach, although small and a little crowded was still enjoyable. The service on the beach was very good and the wait between drinks was not as long as some reviews that we read had suggested. The staff throughout the entire resort was very professional and very friendly. We had excellent service from all but have to mention the exceptional service of Aricelli in the Palmas bar, Jose in the Sea Olive and Domingo on the beach. The entertainment staff was great as well. We have been to resorts where the entertainment staff was a little too pushy, but Baxter and Luis were very friendly and respected your quiet time. We saw them socializing with guests of all ages. They played volleyball everday, played jenga with the kids and soccer and bocce with whoever wished to play. The last few days of our visit, a new beach butler named Eric started his new job and was great. He introduced himself and was around a few times during the day to offer bottled water and fruit. Our room, a one bedroom suite in Villa 12 overlooking the pool, was lovely. Although we travelled without our children, this resort is very family friendly. I would guess that at least 75% of the guests were families with small children. We have 4 children between the ages of 20 and 24, and they would have loved the resort during the day, but the place was very quiet come 8 pm. We did hear a fair bit of complaining from some guests, but we honestly never encountered any issues during our stay. The longest wait for a table at either lunch, dinner and breakfast was no more than four minutes.
