We did eat breakfast after 9 am most mornings when most of the younger children had left, and dinner was always after 8 pm. The funniest complaint was from a very vocal woman who complained about not getting a taxi instantly at 6 pm on a Friday night to go into Playa Del Carmen for 6 people. Not New York City standards of taxi service. To summarize our review, I would say that if you are not bothered by young children or a smaller beach area and not a great spot to swim in the ocean, then this would be a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an all inclusive and for kids!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoNicole79
Reviews.Content: Azul fives was excellent, very clean great service and good food and drink. The suites are amazing and are definitely what makes this resort stand out. Don't be afraid from the other reviews on the wait for the restaurants, you have to be realistic when going to any all inclusive ,there will be waits, but thats just the way it is and if you're prepared its not a big deal at all. The service was excellent, the food was great for an all inclusive and the pools were perfect. We chose to sit by our room at the lazy river instead of by the beach pool and the quieter setting did us perfectly. We went with a 4 month old and it was great, all the staff played with him and were welcoming, i would not go to this resort if you don't have kids because there are kids everywhere, just a warning. I would highly recommend this resort if you have kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip for our family”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: We were at the Fives for a week from February 7-14, 2012. We returned earlier today. We had read all the negative reviews (along with the positive ones) about the food, the bars, etc. We went with an open mind. We are a family of three, a couple with a 19 month-old son. We had never been to an all-inclusive as a family before. We were looking for a place that could accommodate us with a one-bedroom suite set-up for our room and enough to do for our son to keep him excited and interested all day. The resort exceeded all of our expectations. The Fives is a small, relatively quiet, beautiful resort ideally suited for those with families. We have no idea what it is like for singles or for a night life, because our night ended each day after we put our son to sleep at 7:30 with a few (or more) drinks on our terrace enjoying the quiet and recapping our day. If that sounds appealing to you as a traveller, give the Fives a try. Our family enjoyed all the different pools, the beach (which is beautiful, and a bit rocky - but swimmable even for a family with a toddler son), the many location and menu options for meals, the kids club, the monkeys (seen three times) and iguanas (seen many many times), the other families with young children, the nightly performances for children at the Flavours restaurant and the easygoing atmosphere that we felt throughout the resort. On day 7 of our 8 days at the Fives, our son Jack fell off a couch and injured himself below his eye. He needed medical attention (3 stitches), and we were near the beach at the time (about a 5 minute walk from the front desk). The staff moved quickly and efficiently to get us to the front desk quickly (by golf cart), where an ambulance arrived shortly thereafter. We were at hospital within 35 minutes of the injury, and one of the front desk staff came with us to translate what needed translating, and to guide us back from Playa del Carmen. Our son was fine in the end (after the stitches), and we rate the hospital in Playa Del Carmen highly. But the attentiveness of the staff at the Fives in the immediate aftermath of the injury and in the 24 hours that followed was impressive. The staff (and all of the other guests at the Fives) without exception were concerned about Jack and how he was doing, and all of them offered any assistance we might require to make the rest of our stay more comfortable. Our experience at the Fives was excellent before the accident, and our experience afterward solidified for us that this resort and its staff were exceptional. The pools are not too cold as some reviewers mentioned (they were warm enough with the sun for our whole family, including our son). The food was varied and well-prepared. The staff were friendly and attentive (special thanks to Ariceli and Victor). The bars are not all swim-up bars as some on here have said. In fact, every one of the swim-up bars welcomes walk-ups to the corner of the bar or at a separate access point, so you can always get a drink. We discussed why some reviewers on here have been somewhat negative (or very negative) about their experience, and we tried to come up with an explanation after comparing what some have said to our own experience. We have not been able to explain it. All we can think of is that some of the negative reviewers did not do enough homework or were sold something else, and so they had expectations that did not match with what they got at the Fives. Our advice to you is to read the long and detailed reviews by those that seem to have similar families and interests to you. Once you have, if you are still thinking it might be the place for you, give it a try. We are glad we did, and we will be telling all of our friends. We would recommend the Fives to any family (we saw lots of extended families at the Fives enjoying their time); any group looking for a smaller, quieter resort; any smallish wedding; and anyone else to whom the above description appeals. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at AZUL Fives from February 9 - 13 and had a fantastic time! We enjoyed everything about our stay -- the grounds are absolutely beautiful, the food was delicious (best Italian we've ever had!), our room was extremely clean/comfortable and every employee we encountered was professional, friendly and focused on customer service. Although our vacation was relatively short, we experienced almost everything the resort had to offer and were never disappointed. In our opinion, the only thing lacking was a grand lobby that many other resorts offer. However, once we got past the entrance and stepped onto the grounds, we soon forgot about this shortcoming. We've had an opportunity to travel quite a bit over the years and our time at AZUL Fives was the best experience we've had so far. Thank you to the staff for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “We will go again!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives from January 27-February 3rd and had a fantastic time. Upon reading many different reviews, we were quite worried about going there. I found it to be a very beautiful resort and very clean. It's very family oriented with lots to do for the kids. We were 2 couples travelling without kids, but I liked watching them play and have fun. My BF and I remarked how well behaved they were. Some people have said that they had long lineups when going to the restaurants but we didn't find that to be the case. I think it depends what time you go. We usually went to Flavours or the less crowded Beach Grill for breakfast and never had to wait. Lunch for us was usually around 1:30 or 2:00 and dinner at 7:00. All the food was very good, but my personal observation was they they had the tendancy to undercook the meat. I'm not someone who has to have it overdone, but pork and chicken do need to be cooked properly. A couple of times I had to send food back to be cooked more. The service was unbelievably good. If I could rate it a "six", I would. A person travelling with us had food allergies and the staff were very kind and accomodating. Yes, the beach is rocky, but a short walk to the left will bring you to a sandy area for swimming. The week we were there it was quite windy at times to be on the beach so we hung out at the pool by our room. It was nice to have a grill there for lunch and we had some very good burgers and salsa. The entertainment was fun and we all enjoyed it. It's too bad more people don't go up to the lounge...it's very beautiful, but on most nights quite empty. We all enjoyed it very much and I would rate it as a 41/2 star if I had the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ian Goodland”
Reviews.Author: Goodland I
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Azul 5 is the best and most happy of any resort we have stayed at previoudly. Special mention for Ariceli and Santiago at the pool and Elizabeth (both Elizabeth) at the sky bar. Also the staff at reception were excellent. Thank you so much everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Pazuzu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives February 1 to 8 in a one bedroom suite. We had great service, our room was always clean and our fridge stocked. We tried all of the restaurants and had good meals at each one. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, always willing to help out whenever they could. As other reviews mentioned the entrance to the ocean was very rocky but the beach itself was lovely. My only complaint was that the lighting in the bathroom is quite dim making it difficult to put on make up or use contact lenses. I would recommend this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wassssss Great”
Reviews.Author: Jasper D
Reviews.Content: Ours vacations was great!!! My kids loved this vacations in this resort, the meals was delicius, and the staff all time was friendly, I'm leaving but we won't!! Thanks for everything. See you soooooooonnnnn..

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ilanalib
Reviews.Content: It could be better. The food quality and selection was great, but not always available, for example: 1 hour waiting time in the restaurant if you not going to buffet. (But the service was excellent) And as others reviewers mentioned some rooms really smell bad, i had to change room 2 times and it was annoying and time consuming (not something you want to do on your vacation) so my first and second day where not enjoyable. I think they use to much cleaning solutions and it's too consternated for the floor and bathroom and the smell just linger in the room. So in my 3rd room i kept the doors open for 2 days and I asked them to clean without chemicals, just with water and the smell was gone. My room service was horrible, late by 2 1/2 hours and the order was completely wrong. And room amenities as far as shampoo and conditioner, just bring your own. I was told they don't have it and later discovered that some other rooms had all and even a cotton swabs, but not for us for the whole 10 days. Another discovery that all the families from Canada got much bigger rooms for the same rate that I paid. Obviously its disappointing if considering the not so pleasant beginning and the fact that nobody even offer to us to "upgrade" or some how make us happy. The beach is really rocky, not for children. the pools are cold, but we didn't care we came to be by the sea and not in the pool. The whole place was really clean. The people who work there were really nice and some just made my day! I did enjoy, but i believe it's only because my personality so positive. Easily I can see somebody else make a big deal of what happened to me and i don't feel it right now to go in to the details. It's just could be better. And I hope will be better for who ever reading this and already booked the place.

Reviews.Title: “All Good!”
Reviews.Author: Tiarajulie
Reviews.Content: We returned from 11 days at Azul Fives. It was our first time there and we went with our 2 1/2 year old daughter. I am writing my review because I felt the complaints that were given prior were unwarranted and unfair. We received excellent service, from friendly and helpful staff every day, all day long. The food was great, with only a few exceptions, but I don't know of any restaurant anywhere that gets it right all the time. The portions are smaller, which we liked. It gave us an opportunity to try different flavours. There seems to be more staff there than guests, and so the grounds and rooms are impeccable. Everywhere people are gardening, cleaning, painting. This is a family resort, so expect children to be there. If you want something without children, Karisma as adult-oriented hotels as well. For those with children, it is so welcoming to your kids. Lots of booster chairs, there is a children's program that has planned events each day. The toys that you can bring to the room are limited, so do bring your own toys still, books and beach toys. The pools are cool when you first get into them, but are the perfect temperature once you're in and you can happily float about as long as you want. We had no problem waiting for the restaurants or our food, but we also came right at 5:30 when they open up. Best Day picked us up at the airport and shuttled us to the hotel. Everything was smooth, professional and timely. We will definitely return to a Karisma owned hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what all the complaining was about !”
Reviews.Author: Travelercp102010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a beautiful week long stay at this wonderful hotel. The service was great, the staff is very friendly,the food was great (one exception the Asian restaurant), the pool side entertainment was great. Some people just have nothing else to do but complain. Stay home!! Our room was cleaned every day pefectly. The main buffet always had lot of great food. We are good HEALTHY eaters and found wonderful healthy food all the time. We spent lots of time at the gym. It's not bad, lots of cardio machines, some dumbells, nothing to do a good leg workout, but we walked a lot. Went all the way to Playa del Carmen one day. 4.5 hrs there and back with 1/2 hour there. Great time just looking at the other hotels, and swimming in the water. We like to tip, did not look like many people were tiping. We tried to get 1$ bills at the front dest, very difficult. If you plan on tipping, which you should, bring your own 1$. We had a regular room which only has two double beds. If you require larger, go for the suite. Apparently the larger beds are in the suites. Very children friendly. Lots of familis and very well set up for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly Gourmet but great for Babies”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at Azul Fives. I was very concerned about staying at this hotel after the run of horrible reviews from the week before our stay. First, we used USA Tours to get to the hotel from the airport. Definitely the most economical and very reliable and safe. I traveled with my husband and 10 month baby. It was very easy to book online and paid through paypal. Their directions were easy to follow and they had a carseat for my infant. After arriving at the hotel, we were greeted nicely. After having requested Villa 4 or 5 because they were closest to the main restaurants we were disappointed to be booked in Villa 11. Basically, this is a small resort. The good is that frankly nothing is further than a ten minute walk, but there is not much room for switching rooms or special requests. Having said that we were booked in Villa 11 in the one bedroom penthouse. No room will ever be ready before three pm... period. We went to lunch at Sea Olive and our room was ready by four. The staff is friendly nice and very helpful. The penthouse was a large (larger then my first apartment) suite with a full kitchen, dining room and bedroom. There is a separate shower and toilet with a whirlpool in the room. I have travelled quite bit and the space was amazing. We have a rooftop that was also stunning, with a large hot tub, eating space and lounge chairs. I was extremely happy and now get why housekeeping takes so long. The rooms were cleaned in the early afternoon. It didn't matter to us. Sea Olive is so so. I felt this restaurant had the worst service. My recommendation is to give your full order up front so that you don't have to wait for the waiters to check on you. The staff is very very new. I would guess most of the staff have been there less than 6 months, thus the service issues. We also ate at the BBQ which I enjoyed even being vegetarian. The bar restaurants are very basic. The food here is certainly not gourmet. In general the food is ok, not amazing. If they didn't constantly say the word gourmet then they would be ok. I wouldn't bother with room service for dinner. We had dinner in the room because of some rain our first night and the food was not really great. edible but that's about it. The Japanese restaurant again is so so. I had realistic expectations by this point about the food. Again we didn't have service issues, but the main reason people must is that this whole hotel is woefully understaffed and the staff that is there inexperienced but they really really want to please so it was ok for us. As for the Italian restaurant... the food here was def the best but again they are not equipped for the amount of people at the hotel. Initally they didn't take reservations, we always eat early because of the baby so we never had to wait. The on display kitchen is super small and again they don't have enough staff. Surprisingly, the last night we were told we couldnt be seated because we didn't have a reservation. Apparently no one thought to tell the guests. I was very irritated and asked for the manager. They sat us after ten minutes and I was super annoyed to see most of the tables were empty. The asparagus and saffron risotto is great. I also enjoyed the portobello soup. The only other thing with the Italian rest is that there is no elevator so be prepared to climb two sets of stairs. Normally not an issue, but with a carseat and diaper bag etc etc annoying. The pools are not heated. But none of the hotels I looked at had heated pools so this was no shocker. We didn't have a issue with the temperature of the water. The baby loved the pool. There are two pools.. an infiniti pool in the main area and a "lazy river" which is just a regular pool that winds in between the villas. We loved this pool area. It was quiet and relaxing. There are three pool bars and two eating places. The service was fine, I had no complaints. I would suggest picking up some extra beach towels before you pack up if you want to either reserve your pool chairs or use the pool early They don't put the towels out before nine or ten. We were again up early because of the baby and were happy to have saved some from the day before. We did see most people reserved their pool chairs as did we. It is what it is. If you don't care, there are plently of chairs. We are just fussy where we want to be. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. I had no issues with the room and cleanliness. A couple of things came up the first day. The sinks weren't draining. They fixed it right away. There was a leak from the roof top the brought water into the hallway. Also fixed. There was even a super loud truck on the main road which was keep us up and the management took care of it. They provided everything we needed for the baby including a stroller, a bottle warmer and sterilizer as well as a monitor. The kitchen was completely empty but I am sure you could request whatever you need. The only annoying this was that they didnot have high chairs in the rooms so feeding our baby was annoying but hopefully they could remedy this. Every restaurant had a million high chairs and they were very clean. We never had a problem. Overall, we had a great time. The food was so so but they really accomodated the baby and satisfied all of my requests. The room was amazing and the staff was ready to please even with their inexperience. I think if this resort hired a lot more staff and get a few years under their belt it will be a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Once you leave the property they treat you terribly”
Reviews.Author: 111patricia
Reviews.Content: I left me jacket behind. I called from the airport. I spoke to Vanessa. She said she had my jacket at her desk and could arrange to have it sent to me. That was on December 12th. Since they I have tried to get my jacket back from Vanessa, who is concierge, from Kion in reservations in miami (he is suppposedly a supervisor) and from Johanna who is the sales manager of the Azul Fives. On January 28th Johanna told me that she would ship my jacket and send me a tracking number and I have not heard from her since. I would not stay at this hotel again, nor can I recommend it to anyone else. While the staff on the ground at the hotel is lovely, they are poorly managed, and the conceiege service was terrible the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: Six of us spent a week at the Azul Fives in Playa Del Carmen through Sunquest Roulette and overall we thought it was extremely good, and incredible value for what we paid. Azul Fives is a very modern high end resort, and quite sterile, with no real Mexican feel, none of the usual thatched buildings etc. Not much atmosphere, little nightlife, but very good food and great service. We were asked by the staff quite a few times to fill out customer comment cards, and we had the distinct impression that the management and staff were doing everything they could to make our stay as good as possible. We had no complaints, only a couple of minor issues, so this review is to help decide if this is the right place for you based on our experience. The resort is partly all inclusive, partly timeshare, partly full ownership. Maybe this explains the lack of nightlife, and the lack of bars open in the evening as in other all inclusive places we’ve been to. There are more staff here per guest than we've ever seen at any other resort, and they are all excellent! We had great service everywhere, and all the staff are very friendly and very attentive. Some reviews said the service was slow, but we found the pace just fine, we were happy to sit and drink and chat with each other, and take our time over each meal. I guess if fast food is what you’re used to, you might find it slow. The resort seems to cater to families with young children, and there were lots around. We were fine with it, but if it's not your thing...... And this is definitely not a party resort for young people! The pool bars all close at 6 pm, and after that the only place to get a drink apart from the restaurants is the Zky Bar, and a small bar temporarily set up outside the Convention Centre where the evening entertainment is held. The Zky bar has no atmosphere at all, and was pretty empty any time we were there. There was some entertainment there each night, but basically one guy with a guitar playing some songs. Room service was included in our package, we didn't use it, but judging by how few people were around in the evenings, maybe lots of people did. If you want exciting nightlife, discos etc, this is not the place for you. There was a show held each evening in the Convention Centre, but that’s not our thing, so no comment. We found the restaurants excellent, and definitely on the gourmet side. The Italian restaurant overall was very good, the lamb exceptional. People we met said the lasagna was cold, we didn't have it, so no comment. The Sea Olive restaurant was excellent, with very good steak. The Beach Club Grill had the best red snapper I have ever tasted. Pedro our waiter was great, so were Marco and Diana the maitre d’s. The Tsuki Asian restaurant was very good with great sushi, great Thai curry, we had a few drinks and had a great evening. Flavours restaurant close to the front desk was good for breakfast, with a great selection. The Beach Club Grill was good for breakfast too, with less selection, but a great view of the ocean while you ate. This resort uses photo ID cards, not sure of the reason, but it’s less convenient than the normal wristbands. When you want a drink, or go to a restaurant, they ask for your card, write down your details, and return your card. Not sure why they don't use wrist bands like everywhere else. The grounds are immaculate and beautifully kept. On the beach the staff come round with jugs of beer, platters of fruit skewers, and in general they can't do enough for you. Aracelli was the best! We had the typical resort activities during the day, yoga, aquacise, beach volleyball, water polo in the pool etc. The beach was sandy, but areas of the shallows were rock and coral, with only one small clear area to get in and out of the sea. The snorkelling was quite good right off the beach, with many varieties of fish, moray eels etc. Our room was excellent, very modern, spacious, clean, lots of hot water (previous reviews said they ran out, we never had that problem). The toilet tank ran continuously, we reported it, but it was never fixed. A very small point. One couple in our party didn't like being on the ground floor, but since the resort was full it took a couple of days to be moved to another room. The other couple had a flood in their ground floor room, but it was very quickly dealt with, and they were moved to another room. Wifi was available in your room, and cost $10 per day, and could only be accessed once you had created an account. For some reason you could access it for free with no account at the infinity pool and Beach Club Grill, not sure why, so why pay for it? The weather wasn't the best while we were there, cloudy some of the time, with rain most days, sometimes heavy at night. Quite windy most of the time which made the sea rough, so we couldn't go into the water some days. Beach volleyball suffered too! The "canal" type pools which wind through the villas are quite beautiful, although quite cool, and the layout of the resort made it easy to get lost, and difficult to find your own villa, especially if you were on the wrong side of the canal. Maybe the tequila had something to do with it! Was it perfect? No. Was it incredible value for money? Absolutely! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled716
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Azul Fives after a five day stay, an annual getaway for myself and four of my girlfriends. It was a perfect set up for us. We had a penthouse suite with three bedrooms and living area complete with a rooftop deck. Being on the plus side of 50, we found the resort offerred the perfect mix. We played some great golf at two of the nicest golf courses I have played in a long time (not part of the resort but in close proximity). Tennis clinics, yoga, swimming, spa etc. provided enough activity for the non-golfers. What surprised us the most was the standard of service and the dining experience. Over the years and in trying many different destinations, we didn't have high expecations of either but I can honestly say that all the staff were gracious, accommodating, pleasant and competent. "No" is just not in their vocabulary. It was a refreshing change from other places we have travelled. We also found that eating in the restaurants was more of a true dining experience and didn't feel like an "all inclusive". We did bring our own wine so I can't comment that aspect but the food in general is really very good. Ditto on the service. No line ups to make reservations,no hassles waiting for tables and the variety was ample to satisfy our five nights. I agree with a few of the other comments that the hotel is not as beautiful or as luxurious feeling as some of the other resorts I have visited and it is really not that well layed out. But the other aspects mentioned above make up for it. I never got the impression that better service came with better tips. In fact, you want to tip the staff as they go the extra mile to earn it. The only one flaw I found which is easy to correct is the lighting in the bathroom. Really inadequate. Not major but an fyi to management. All in all, a great stay and great value for money. I guess the proof is in the pudding. We have vowed to make this the destination of choice for our annual getaway from here on in.

Reviews.Title: “We would have stayed longer !!”
Reviews.Author: Serge B
Reviews.Content: My wife, my son, my mother-in-law and myself went to the Azul Fives resort from January 25 to February 1. We were slightly worried before going as the number of negative reviews is fairly high for a five stars hotel. The 4/5 average rating on Trip Advisor and the fact that very large one-bedroom suites were available at a very reasonable price made us choosing this Hotel. The roughly 1000 ft2 suite was $1415 per person on a double occupancy including the flight ticket from Montreal-Cancun with Sunwing. The suites are very spacious and modern. Look at the pictures at the Azul Fives web site, they are very representative. We discussed our observations about this hotel with three other families and we were sharing pretty much the same comments. The main ones are: The Pros: - Large and modern suites at reasonable prices - Very well maintained property. There is a large number of staff maintaining the property - Good quality and variety of food. Unlimited usage of “A la carte restaurants”. No reservation needed. A reservation is needed only for the new Arezzo Italian restaurant (it was not needed at the beginning of our stay but they introduced the reservation system to reduce the waiting time). We never really had to wait for restaurants as we were going to restaurants at 18h00. - Well adapted for families with young children. The hotel provided a stroller and a crib at no charge. They can also provide organic baby food if needed - Most clients were really nice and it was easy to talk with other parents around the pools while the children were playing - Nice and clean kid zone - The staff is generally very nice and truly interested in providing us with a nice stay. They smile a lot and say hello whenever possible - There is an adequate compromise between activities around the beach and calm near the pools - The Senses restaurant no more exists. This restaurant was available a few months ago for an extra cost and created some frustrations. Be careful with reviews made before December 2011. It was replaced with an all-included steakhouse open to the sea. The tuna steak is particularly good. - The new Arezzo Italian restaurant is very good. Definitively the best restaurant on site. Great service, good food The Cons: - The beach is not very large but it is nice and very clean. The issue with the beach is the entrance to the water. It is difficult to enter in the water as the ocean floor is unequal with some rock. If you use sandals, you can walk about 12-15 feet in the ocean and the ocean floor becomes very nice. Alternatively, you can walk on the beach about 5 min towards Cancun and you will find a much nicer beach that can be more easily used by kids. This is what we were doing. - The only aspect that really irritated us was the door lock. The doors are noisy. This could be solved relatively easily by installing some rubber/foam to absorb the impacts of the door lock. - Housekeeping inside the room could be improved. The rooms are clean but we think that a more in-depth cleaning is required at the change of customer every week or so. - The free wines are not very good. If you are not picky with wines, this will be okay for you. If you like wines, you will likely find the wines deceptive. The “A La Carte” wines are quite expansive if you don’t want to drink the included wines. My wife and mother-in-law liked the wine but I didn’t - The main lobby is not large and prestigious like it is in some other 5-star Hotel. This didn’t bother us at all, but I heard people saying that they would expect more from a 5-star hotel - The free internet Wi-Fi that is available near the beach is very slow. I don’t think the issue came from my HTC Amaze smartphone as it is very quick on my home Wi-Fi. I didn’t try the room internet access as it was 15$ per day or 70$ per week. - Pavilion 5 (more specifically the rooms with the view on the tennis court) can be noisier than the others as all clients must pass in front of these rooms to go to the restaurants and the beach. It was not that bad as most of the Azul Fives clients are very respectful. - The suites should be equipped with two phones, one in the room and one in the living room (there is only one in the bedroom). If someone sleeps in the bedroom, it is difficult to make a call (to room service for example) without awaking the person that is sleeping. This was not a big issue for us, but at one point I went out to get something to eat instead of using the room service for this reason. Overall, we were quite happy with our stay at the Azul Fives and most of the “Cons” comments above were relatively minors and did not affect our stay. The staff is nice, the property is extremely well maintained and the food is good and diversified. We honestly don’t understand how people can give 1/5 or 2/5 for this hotel. We recognize that everyone has different expectations about a resort and that the Azul Fives has its weaknesses. But unless something really bad happened to the people who gave very bad reviews, we simply don’t understand these reviews. A final note, as in all Hotels, if you give some tips for housekeeping and waiters (plan for a total of 10-15$US a day), you will get a better service. Keep in mind that the staff salary is probably 5 or 10 times lower than yours. Treat the staff well and you will be rewarded. If the Azul Fives management solves a few of the “Cons” points above, this hotel will become one of the five best hotel in the Playa Del Carmen area. This hotel is best suited for people looking for a relatively calm hotel. It is definitively not a hotel for single persons or couples looking for a lot of activities and parties. If you have a family looking for activities and calm at the same time, this is a great hotel for you. Overall, we would rate this hotel as a 4.5 stars and our overall satisfaction level would have been 4.5 if this was allowed by the Travel Advisor Web site. As it is not, we had to choose between 4 and 5 and we decided to put 5 as we had a great experience overall. Hope this help

Reviews.Title: “A perfect destination wedding and family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Heidi A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives Jan 24-Feb 1, 2012, and got married there Jan 27. We had a group of about 15 people that came for the wedding and all of them left saying they wished they could stay longer and wanting to come back again. First let me say that the staff is the best I have EVER seen...Everyone was so friendly and accommodating. Our wedding coordinator was Arturo and he was amazing. He and his team went out of their way to make sure our time here was perfect. (And it was!) The food here was great. Several members of our group were nervous about the food before they got here and they were all raving about it when they left. We had a couple private dinners with our group and the food was exceptional. The a la cart dinner restaurants had lots to choose from and I didn't have anything I didn't like. Tsuki was my favorite. We did not eat dinner at Flavours while we were here so I can't rate that, but the breakfast buffet there was great, with something for everyone. The food at the swim up bar restaurants was ok. Nothing fancy, but a good mid day snack. We ordered room service a couple times (at all different times of day) and never had an issue there. There is a health bar by the spa and gym with smoothies and they were all very good. I just wish they could also have a smoothie bar by the beach. We booked a 1 bedroom suite and upon arrival found out they put us in a 1 bedroom suite with the rooftop terrace which was AMAZING. We were in building 6, and I think we must have had the best view there is. We visited the spa for a couples massage and had a great time. It was so relaxing and I felt completely comfortable the entire time. Make sure to pack everything you need because if you need to buy a necessity at the gift shop it will most likely cost you an arm and a leg. The ocean directly in front of the resort does have lots of corral and it is not necessarily good for swimming, but we just walked down a bit (1-2 minute walk) and the water was clear, and not crowded. The pools here are all very clean and the way they are spaced out makes it easy to find a place to lounge. The biggest thing I can say is whatever issues people have run into here, you can tell they are working VERY hard to correct them. There are constantly people working, and maintaining the property. And every staff member, from the front desk, to housekeeping, to maintenance workers outside is just SO NICE. Everyone you pass says hello and is smiling. I just don't know how anyone wouldn't enjoy their time here.

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome for our first Va-K”
Reviews.Author: Bradley155019
Reviews.Content: We loved it here, I dont eat crazy foods but they had food for me :) It was very nice and small rooms and grounds r always clean, wi-fi for 50 usd works awesome on iphone I found the bed to be hard on my neck but I have a nice bed at home so it was a down grade but maybe an upgrade for most. The sheets and bedding is 2012 not 1950s lol just watch out for the floors in the rooms slippy as hell lol when wet.

Reviews.Title: “A great family resort”
Reviews.Author: JakiMaria
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay at this resort as part of the Sunquest Roulette 5. We were not disappointed. All the good things people speak of are true. The food, staff and accommodations are excellent. We had issues with room placement and the staff went above and beyond and upgraded all 5 of our rooms. Our room flooded one day and maintainence were there in minutes. The "food displays" (buffets) aren't as appealling and plentiful as other resorts I've been to but the restaurants make up for that. The Italian and Japanese were our favourite however wait times can be long so go and put your name in and go relax and have a drink. The day we left they finally listened to their guests and were allowing reservations to the Italian restaurant. Some things they should look at improving are; the ID card vs. bracelets, such a tedious system. You need to show this picture card entering a restaurant and then you have to show again to the wait staff. Around the pool this system is terrible. Much improvement is needed for the entertainment location. It is a small conference room without a stage, difficult for all to enjoy. Also, there is no outdoor seating area to enjoy a drink and conversation. It would be nice to have a plaza area where they could bring in vendors like other resorts. The bar at the show area packs up right after the show forcing you to go inside to Skybar or to your room. One thing they need to address immediately is putting a rail around the waterways beside the walkways in that area. Everynight we saw guests fall in the water. One guy took the whole bar out. Some excellent staff to mention, Pedro in the beach grill, Jonathan, Hilario, Enrique and Elizabeth at the pool and of course Mr. Buffalo, didnt remember your real name but your management and attention to guests was remarkable. I don't know how you can be in so many places at once. We had a wonderfl vacation and all agree we would return.

Reviews.Title: “The Good The Bad and The Daily Visit from the Maintenance Crew”
Reviews.Author: marriedinmexico
Reviews.Content: I'll start off saying that i have been travelling to the Mayan Coast for over 20 years now and have stayed at many 5 star resorts in the area and all over Mexico. Check in: The check in was smooth.. lobby is small and underwhelming.. but i don't spend time there so i didn't care. Grounds: Gorgeous and clean Rooms: Villa 14 Room 1414-1 - I bedroom suite ... Nicest room i have ever had.. gorgeous modern decore, 2 bathrooms, great layout for couple or family. Kitchen had no cuterly or dishware but was nice to have large fridge and dining table for room service. Great view of pool ... central location.. 4-5 stroll to lobby... 4-5 minute stroll to beach Huge Balcony with lovely lounge chairs and sitting chairs. Beach: very nice beach for relaxing.. nice views.. not swimable.. if your a big beach swimmer don't come here... but very nice to look at.. we loved it. swing beds on beach that you can reserve with Hugo... Hugo was by far the best person at this resort.. he worked his but off and did everything possible to make everyone's stay enjoyable. I actually saw him spot a gentleman struggling with some baby stuff and ran from the far end of the beach up to the pool area to help him. Such a great guy. Food/Restaurants: HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT. I love my food.. and one of the main reasons i came to this resort...Because the resort markets this as "gormet" i was expecting good food. Not the case in most instances. We tried to get into Japanase restaurant 2 times .. waiting time was an hour. We tried to get into the Italian 2 times.. waiting time over an hour. (comments on Italian later on) The grill and the American restaurant were pretty good. Do not expect to grab ANYTHING IN regards to food and bring to your lounger or room .. they will not ABSOLUTLY NOT let you. Room Service: 5 items for Lunch and Dinner in TOTAL. Very limited selection. Ordered room service 3 times.. 2 of the 3 times was not edible, and was not correct... and was an hour wait.. 3rd time on last day was delicious, correct and only took 15 min. Management here is non existant... at least for us.. and several other couples/families we spoke to. Staff: All very friendly. Managment.. non existant!!! Kid Friendly: Very... great for families with young children.. I don't have children.. but the babies and young kids were so cute to watch. The odd loud kid .. but that's to be expected. Bars: This was very strange.. only bars are swim up bars.. there is absoltuly no where to go to just sit and and have a drink.. or grab a drink and bring to your room or lounger... very strange.. only swim up bars.. and the pools were quite cold... sometimes i just want a drink and sit and relax ... odd! Problems: For the first 3 days we did not have air conditioning. Everyday we called .. they came .. said was fixed after an hour or so of waiting.. and not fixed. Next day we would call.. wait .. they would come .. they would fix .. not fixed.. this went on for 3 days... sleeping at 25 degrees is not easy when you are a women... 45.. if you know what i mean. After our air finally got fixed we had a very bad leak in our ceiling.. I noticed when i almost wiped right out from the flood in our kitchen... once again the maintenance crew was back. this time for a few hours ... said was fixed. Day 5 - another leak in the ceiling.. this time so bad the dry wall came apart and thought the ceiling was going to cave in over cupboards.. yet another maintenance call.. LOL and another visit from our new friends.. the maintenance crew.... and yet again .. not fixed.. LOL Throughout this chaos i had left 4 messages with the Managment.. NO CALL. 2 times i was asked to wait while they located someone in my room and i would get a call back .. no call.. Finally a gentleman by the name of Milton who worked at front desk..took my information.. and actually had the leak fixed.. got us reservations into the Italian for all our troubles.. (many of which i didn't even get into) and said we would be pampered. WELL.. far from that.. my food at the Italian was not edible.. my mothers was delicious.. we waited 15 minutes so i could get something else.. he never came back.. so i just shared my moms.. after 25 minutes.. we just left as we were tired of waiting.. unedible entre still on table.. not my idea of pampering.. LOL But at least Milton tried.. and he was the only one really. We did see all the bad reviews a few days before our departure date and tried to change resorts.. but could not. I do feel because of these previous bad reviews they were trying to make changes in the right direction... not during our stay. The day we were leaving i did see a change in the room service menue.. they added a lot of items. I did see food being served by the pool which was an absolute NO NO the first 6 days. so they are trying.. overall BY FAR THE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD AT ANY RESORT.. out of 15 visits to AI in mexico. We spoke to about 10 or so other couples / families and they all had there problems too and some were very very upset. No comparision to their sister resort .. El Dorado... NOT EVEN IN THE BALL PARK I WILL NEVER GO BACK.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: Robb G
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Azul Fives and we loved it. We had a group of 10 (5 adults and 5 children, ranging in age from 5 months old to 10 years old). There were some minor things that we didn't like but that is expected (at least to us) when you book at one of these resorts. The Good: The food was great and our service (with the exception of one miserable guy at the Seaside grill) at every restaurant was good. There have been complaints about the resort being understaffed. I didn't see that. In fact, I felt that they could have left us alone more at the buffet restaurant as a few times, they tried to clear our plates before we were finished eating off of them! The grounds are beautiful and while you do have to walk everywhere, you can do so in 10 minutes, max. People complain about the beach being rocky. We were on it a bunch of times in bare feet and had no problems. Apparently, "rocky" means little stones and shells in the sand. It was not a problem. I do agree with the comments about the swimming at the beach though, you would need to walk a few minutes away. On top of that, the water is too rough for little kids but that isn't Azul's fault. The rooms were awesome in my opinion, especially for privacy with the kids. We had a 2 bedroom suite and they upgraded us to the penthouse which gave us the rooftop terrace and hot tub on the roof. We enjoyed this feature especially since we were given it for free. It is true that you don't have hot water up there but I filled up a pail from the sink in the kitchen with hot water a few times and added it and it warmed the hot tub right up. It was a little bit of work but the kids loved it. . We never had the problem with hot water in our rooms or towels not being available but we did have go get the towels ourselves while at the pool. The kids club was great and they are good with the kids. We had 2, 3, 5 and 10 year olds go and they all had a lot of fun. The resort was busy but whenever had a hard time finding chairs or getting drinks at the swim up (or any other) bars. On one of the days, my wife's card wouldn't open the door to our room. They figured out that there was a problem when the cleaning woman couldn't get in either. They quickly came and removed the door and replaced it, knowing that we needed access to the room because of the small kids. There is some excellent shallow areas of the pool for small kids to play in. It is true that the pools weren't warm, but I didn't find them cold really. For people who grew up, with unheated pools in Canada, you won't have an issue with the temperature. The Infinity pool is the coldest though, due to the breeze off the water and beach. The Not so Good: We had to wait on our shuttle for 45 minutes for 2 idiots at the airport in Cancun because they thought the bus could wait while they talked to timeshare people in the airport. That isn't Azul Fives problem though, it was TripCentral.ca's. Yes, I am talking about the guy that looked like Larry David. Our room kept getting cleaned at times when our baby was asleep so we kept declining. It was not anybody's fault, just where our room fell in the order. We asked beforehand to be placed in a building with our family members as we were hoping to be able to put all of the kids to sleep and hang out together. They put us in different buildings. I think we ended up being placed in the worst two buildings for a group travelling together. This, I feel, could have been fixed before and our option was to try to move one of the families mid-week. People don't want to do that. The fans in the bathrooms are super loud and turn on whenever you turn on the light. Hopefully, your kids can sleep through it if you need to turn that light on in the middle of the night. All said, we loved the resort and would recommend it to others if they were going with children. We would return with our family but would likely try going elsewhere if we were just going with the adults.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous 2 weeks...would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: cannuck1
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous time we just had at Azul Fives. My family with 2 boys- 6 and 9- just wrapped up 2 weeks at Azul Fives. Lots of lenghty postive reviews that covers lots about the resort so I will try to add something new. I did a lot of research before I booked the trip and suggest everyone does the same. I found that "complainers" were lured to the resort by the price and forgot to research as all their complaints were items tjat tje reosrt tells you about or other reviewers tell you about. The resort is very upfront that they cater to family so don't be surprised to hear crying, noisy kids....kids of young ages = noise. Don't complain about kid noise. That was your lack of awareness nothing to the resorts fault. The beach does have very limited access for direct swimming but we had lots of fun playing in the surf as my boys were more interested in the pools. We ordered room service numerous times and it arrived as we ordered and if not sooner than they had told us. We were in villa 4 that was central to everything. Only once we needed to call for restock of the fridge and after that we had regular service. A postive laidback attitude goes a long way to enjoy the vacation and the staff are more than willing to help the "happy" travellers. We needed ice for our drinks and as we were beside the rainbow bar, it was quite simple to bring over our bucket and it was filled no questions asked. We never had to wait for a table at the restaurants as we arrived right when they opened for the popular Italian and Japenense to get a table or went elsewhere as we missed the "first sitting". The food is fabulous and perfection does take time. I had the impression by the time for food and the quality of the food, that they do not have an assembly line in the kitchens but prepare as much as they can fresh for you. Just reflect on how long takes for you at home to put a meal on the table. I would rather have fabulous tasting food that is hot and fresh vs food that was banged out in 15 mins to get the people in and out. Flavours does get busy with the young families right around 8 to 8:30 in the morning. I witnessed lots of staff working hard to make changes to make the experience better. It is a "young" resort and will continue to grow and get smoother as it continues to improve from realistic feedback. My only complaint for the whole trip is the other guests were witnessed picking up my camera that I dropped on the sand by the chairs and kept the camera for themselves. All that was on the memory card was photos of my 2 boys playing in the surf. Shame on you for keeping the camera! I guess you figured that you let it sit on the lounge for awhile and since it was not claimed, you kept it.

Reviews.Title: “property Azul 5s”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Just returned...30 jan 2012 The property is great;....although I would not rate it A1...the room we had #713-2 was pretty good....need s little work....was clean ...but a few tiles boken and could use a new paint job...not sure if each unit is individualy owned and responsible for upkeep....we went on a Sunwing package....food is great ..as well as staff. Room service for us was non existent....tried 3 times to get ice (for bucket in room) but never materiaized..after first 2 days..mini bar was not restocked....mostly wanted coke for mix as we brought a bottle of rye from Canada to have in our room.....again asked to have bar restocked ...but never happened. Was always told to call room service supposedly available 24 hours (bars closed early......). but could never get anything. This resort is great for families...up to 3 bedroom units....but do keep in mind this pretty much shut down by 9 - 9:30....so not good for any nite owls. Also...just a note....supposedy money exchange available at front desk....but my self and other guests could never get anything less than 50.oous exchanged (for 20s) nothing smaller. Waiters would help exchange whenever possible...again....staff great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with young children...not for a romantic holiday.”
Reviews.Author: FoodieGal
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our Omni Cancun through Interval International for our one week stay. Our first room was a complete dissappointment. It was Building One and it faced a mechanical equipment room and a block wall. We moved the next day to a basic room in Bldg. Five. It faced the trees, which was much better as we saw a monkey at 8 am twice. This resort has some issues, but they may not apply to you so I really hope this helps you understand this resort. We have stayed in Cancun since 1998. This resort caters to families with small children. You will be very happy here if you have a stroller and a baby and you like to drink, swim, have nightly entertainment and great selection of activites for children. They have a play yard, wonderful shallow, beautiiful pools, wading pool, etc. The staff really are great with children. There are some issues here. Internet is impossible....but the staff will tell you it is fine. The information is inconsistent. Your map will say the beach grill is closed on Friday, but, alas, it is open. So some times the surprise is pleasant. The staff is very optomistic and their effort is great; but execution lacks. The rooms have the worst lighting I have ever had in a hotel room. You cannot put on make-up or contact lenses here! Bring a lighted mirror of your own.The basic rooms have two double beds, another problem for couples. So the good news: the pools are lovely. You'll get great pictures. The food was really good. Don't miss the "Health Bar" for fresh smoothies - it is hard to see. It is right next to Flavours Restaurant and The Spa. The Entertainment Staff is excellent. Just wondering why the children were dressed for dinner, but so many of the adults did not observe the dress code. Please guys, your T-shirt is for you to put on at the Pool Grill (don't eat so I can see your back hair) and put on a collared shirt or a nice button down for dinner. Weddings - I saw two. The staff was super attentive and they were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dramz3
Reviews.Content: I always rely on tripadvisor reviews to pick vacation spots so I have thoughtfully written this long review to help you in making your vacation choice. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to message me. We just returned from our 2nd visit to Azul Fives and I didn't think it was possible, but our trip exceeded our expectations AGAIN! We traveled with our 3 1/2 year old daughter and splurged for the one bedroom suite (highly recommend). The suites are so great for families because it allows privacy, yet closeness as a family often needs, and they are huge with a full kitchen, dining room and 1-2 balconies (depending on the layout of your room). Everything about the room is wonderful- I especially love the shower, it is heavenly! Never once did we have a problem with hot water. We also had a penthouse terrace, which was amazing and we would have put it to better use if we had been traveling in a group, but it was so lovely - the views were amazing! I already knew that the tubs on the terrace only have pool temperature water, so it is a private pool as opposed to a private hot tub :-). The housekeeping service was spotless. If we ever needed anything we just wrote a little note and it was taken care of. We also had our fridge restocked every day. The only maintenance issue we encountered was the fact that our elevator was not working for 4 of the 7 days during our vacation- not a huge deal as the exercise was necessary, but occasionally an inconvenience since we were on the third floor. Food- The best AI food I have ever had! We loved b-fast every morning at Flavours. A few mornings there was a line to be seated, but at most it took 15 minutes. The food section is great- they basically have anything you could ever want and the fruit selection was superb! I also loved having the option of authentic mexican b-fast items (plantains, beans, tamales, etc). Sol is a hostess at both b-fast and lunch and she is such a sweet woman that made the vacation extra special for our family, as she was so very sweet with our toddler. She really is a shining star at Azul Fives. Lunch is quite casual- the addition of the beach grill was a really great idea. The ribs there are to die for- seriously I could have eaten them everyday we were there! Nice salad bar and pizza bar. For a slightly more formal lunch, you could opt for Sea Olive. The Ceviche is amazing at Sea Olive! I ordered 2 of them one day! The dinner options have really improved since our trip last year to accommodate the resort being fuller. The Italian restaurant (Arrezo) is the BEST food I have ever had on any vacation. We ate there 3 nights because we were so impressed with the food and service, not to mention the view!!!! As you can imagine, this is a popular restaurant, so if you want an "in and out" experience, I would arrive as soon as the restaurant opens (5:30pm) to be seated first. One night we were in a hurry because we wanted to make it back to the room to watch the 49er game and we just told our server and he was very accommodating! We also enjoyed our dinner at the Beach Grill- I really liked my salmon and my husband had the filet, which was good. We went to flavors only one night for the buffet and it was good, but I felt the al carte restaurants were so good, we tried to make it to one of them each night. Oh, and we loved Tzuki! The sushi was great and the main dishes were also very tasty. The drinks at this resort are fantastic! They will really make you anything that you want and as strong as you want it. And they have top-shelf alcohol (kettle one vodka, Don Julio Tequila, etc). We used room service several times- it was very good. We did have to wait 30-40 minutes from order to delivery, but we just planned for that, so it wasn’t a problem. The grounds are just stunning! Over the past year, the landscape has really matured and the grounds staff are doing such a great job. The beach is great! There were always lounge chairs to use, but the beach beds are in high demand, so if you want one you have to get up early to reserve, as it is first come first serve. We got one 2 days during our trip and really enjoyed it. We saw a few travelers fighting over beach beds and acting really ridiculous…it was actually embarrassing to watch how some people were behaving. The water right out in front of the resort is not swimmable, but all you have to do is walk 3 minutes down the beach to the left and there is a coral free swimming area. The pools are wonderful and very refreshing! The pools are not heated, but completely comfortable with the Mexico climate. Our daughter really liked the zero-entry pool and the kiddie pool by the kids club- there were so many nice families there, so it was fun for the kids to play together and nice to make friends with other parents while on vacation. The Azulitos kids club is really one of the highlights of this resort. They really have it figured out! The My Gym room is so fantastic and used a lot more now than when we were here last year. All ages enjoyed the kids club area and the ladies that work there are super sweet with the kids. All day they have scheduled activities, such as: sand castle building, beach soccer, water balloon fight, tea time, cookie decorating, etc. At night they also had very fun activities: Face painting, piñata, talent show, etc. The only bummer is that they don’t have the jog strollers any longer- we were able to borrow an umbrella stroller from housekeeping, but the jog strollers were greatly missed by our family. The spa is really very beautiful! One of the most amazing spa experiences I have ever had. I decided to splurge and enjoy a spa treatment with my daughter- it was truly a beautiful experience that I will forever remember. A couple of the other days I had a 30 minute massage on the beach by one of the venders down to the left of the resort. I paid $20 for 30 minutes and it was really great- you could hear the waves crashing and the massage therapists were very sweet and professional. The way I looked at it- the spa was an overall amazing experience and the massage on the beach was just a stress reliever. I highly recommend both options. Every morning of our vacation I went to tennis lessons with Pedro. He is a wonderful teacher with a true passion for tennis. We are so grateful that Azul Fives is a resort our family can return to year after year and experience a luxury experience that is completely family friendly. The staff at Azul Fives is really what make the resort extra special. The following staff made our trip extra special and we look forward to seeing them when we return! Sol- hostess Vanessa- hostess Sergio- bartender at Rainbow bar Alberto- beach bartender Hugo- infinity pool concierge Karen- Spa concierge Edith- spa manager

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 7 days”
Reviews.Author: Suzie M
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews on trip advisor before leaving, so thought that I would take a minute and tell you about our experience. We just arrived home last night, and I have to say, my husband and I had an incredible time! We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, and it was gorgeous. Can't say enough about the accommodations. Clean, lots of space, a comfortable bed and hot, hot showers. The resort is beautiful, the staff second to none, and the many, many Canadians that we met were amazing. There ARE lots of kids. My husband and I travelled without our kids this time, so if you are looking for a quiet adults only place, this is not for you. We didn't mind the kids at all, we actually met amazing families, and heard about their positive experiences as well. We did meet a lot of couples that found the kids annoying, but for us, it didn't change our opinion on the resort at all. I think the most impressive part of Azul Fives is the food. WOW!!! It was absolutely incredible. From presentation to taste, we were blown away. Our two favourites were the Asian Fusion, and Italian. I also had two spa treatments, which were great. I hope this has helped. I can't figure out some of the negative reviews, because Azul Fives is paradise!!! Thank you Azul Fives!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly D
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all! The villa we stayed in was breath taking. It had all top of the line amenities and was very clean. The staff was top notch and spoke English very well. Emilio at the swim up bar can mix some delicious drinks. He anticipated our needs and kept us entertained! Jonathan got everyone involved in fun activities on the beach. The food was really good. We ate at all of the restaurants they had. The Italian restaurant was very tasty and had excellent staff. Perfect trip! I would highly recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Was that a dream? Nope Azul Fives by Karisma”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: My wife and son (4 years old) and I were lucky enough to spend a week at Azul Fives Hotel in the Mayan Riviera in January 2012. From the moment we arrived at reception the experience was premium. We were met with friendly staff that were tuned in to our needs and gave us a very good and quick orientation which allowed us to whisk off to our room and begin to de-stress after a four hour flight and 40 min bus ride. That was a nice touch. We then found all the staff around the property remarkably courteous and engaged with their task of making us feel comfortable. Working in the service industry myself, I was struck at how every employee we met during the week took the opportunity to make eye contact with my family and offer a nice “Hola” and a smile which sent the message – “Happy to have you here and I am available to help if you need” – very nice touch. The amenities were second to none in my experience with each detail aimed towards pampering and enhancing the experience. Our suite was amazing, the linens and atmosphere were chic and a delight to the senses. We found the beach staff amazing as well. Very accommodating and attentive the whole day – they never seemed to tire! Whether in finding us lounges or taking our drink order by the Sea, the beach staff were dialed in the whole time. The Restaurants were all so good. I kept looking for a dip in either Service or Quality but every restaurant was fabulous. We tried them all except the Seafood restaurant only because my wife and son do not like Seafood. The ability to truly recreate international flavours was very good. I expected all the food to have a similar taste seeing as we were in one region of the world but the chefs truly got each cuisine right in my mind. From Italian, American, French, Spanish and Mexican it was all so good. The food being so good really enhanced our week. My brother has been to other resorts in other countries and the food has been all very similar which makes the overall experience go down as the week goes on. Not so at Azul Fives – the food was always top level. The Service was very good too at the Restaurants. I found management’s ability to adjust staff levels to peak times at different restaurants very well done and seamless. Over all we found the week to be a supreme experience worthy of the 5 star designation they have. Go to Azul Fives - it does not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “6 Stars for AZUL FIVES”
Reviews.Author: ChaChaPablo
Reviews.Content: “6 STARS for AZUL FIVES” Pending review We are frequent sun resort travellers who just spent a fantastic week at AZUL FIVES Hotel Resort. AZUL FIVES offers the best of both the features of an " All Inclusive Resort " along with the ambience of a personal holiday experience. The AZUL FIVES amenities, its attentive staff from management down to the servers, stylish accomodations with manicured grounds , right on the beach , are all First Class . The meals are " cuisine " as opposed to food. We found AZUL FIVES to be a unique, high-end resort with its own identity and ch(K)arisma. ChaChaPablo

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families”
Reviews.Author: Love2tan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort on January 21st. Our experience is fantastic. We have our little one with us (he is 11 months). This resort is wonderful for families. There are plenty of high chairs in the restaurants. Upon our arrival, a playpen, a baby monitor and a baby bath/ change table were provided to us. Also, baby food is available in all of the restaurants (gerber jars). The pools are amazing, and the ones next to the hotel rooms are very calm and relaxing. Theone next to the beach has plenty of activities and music. The food is outstanding. This really is a gourmet inclusive resort. The sushi at the suki restaurant was delicious. All of the restaurants are very good and the service is always delivered with a smile. The staff is always there to help. Our room ( one bedroom suite) is soooooo big and beautiful. It was great to have the kitchen to wash baby bottles, etc. The seperate bedroom is very spacious and great for our little one to sleep while we are on the patio or watching tv in the living room. The rooms are cleaned very well every day. We have travelled To many different 5 star resorts in the caribbean, this one is definetly at the top of our list, and we certainly recommend it to all families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! Don't listen to the bad reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnyJo29
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days at the Azul Fives January 13 to the 21st. We stayed in building 2 near the main building. I read that it took someone 15 minutes to walk from building 1 to the restaurants which seemed ridiculous so I timed it. It took us 4 minutes! Seriously? This is a 360 room resort, everything is max 5 minutes away! We had a one bedroom suite which was huge and gorgeous. Tons of room for the 2 of us. Our room was cleaned very well everyday. Cristel our maid was wonderful! No issues at all at any time with hot water. We had enough water always for both of us to shower. We didn't spend much time at the beach as there is a lot of coral there. It is rocky but not the resorts fault. Blame mother nature. Walk a few minutes to the left and swimming is just fine. The pools are just fine. Not sure what people are whining about. It is hot out and the pools feel GREAT during the day. We didnt have any issues. And actually if you feel the jets going into the pool, they blow warm water. Pools were all great and pool bars were a blast! The infinity pool was our favorite! No issus ever with pool chairs, the odd time we had to move a chair to have 2 together but no big deal My only pool complaint was kids in the adults only pool. I needed a break from bratty kids and we couldn't get that. Was dissapointing. But we solved that and went to the spa. Their hydrotherapy system is fantastic and we took advantage of that almost every day! Restaurants: Flavors was not my thing but I have always hated buffets. Omelettes were good there though. The grill was also open for breakfast everyday we were there but was similar to the buffets. We usually ordered room service for breakfast or headed to the best kept secret, the smoothie bar. So good and they don;t tell you about it. Newar the main building next to the gym, there are two tables outside and the smoothie bar is in these doors! The Green Power and the Manilla were my go to breakfasts! Opene 8 till 4 and you must go! If you like Booster Juice, you will love it here! The Grill for dinner was average, not my style. They grill your meat and the rest is buffet. Sea Olive was decent for lunch and dinner. Nothing blew me away but was good. Better than most resorts and I have been to many 4.5 and 5 star resorts. Tsuki was pretty good for Japanese. Gret rolls, good dishes from what we had. The fried ice cream for dessert however was disgusting. I only tried it due to the rave review we heard but it was seriously a blob of fried dough around ice cream. Ick. my guy hated it and I only had a bite as I am not supposed to eat gluten. It wasnt worth being sick all night. We had dinner here only once. Arrezo.... where do I start? We ate here for 4 dinners during our stay! FANTASTIC! There are no reservations at this resrot so my advice is, decide when you want to eat and head out 45 minutes before that, put your name on the list and go to Zky and have a glass or 2 of wine upstairs. They had entertainment up there most nights. Not a big deal. 45 minutes is nothing and this place is worth the wait. Wine is like most resorts and goes from awful to not bad. Didn't mind the Pinot Noir or the Tempranillo. The whites were terrible. Service in the Italian was fabulous. We got handshakes and hugs every night. A $20 tip goes a LONG way there. And they earned that and more from us. the mushroom rissotto and asparagus and saffron rissottos were FAB! The beef carpacio was very good. As was the Caprese salad. The boy loved the lamb and the ossobucco. He also loved the chocolate mousse and it was tasty. The creme brule I was only able to resist 2 nights out of 4. Very good! They have a couple gluten free items on the menu and they were very accomodating to use that pasta with different sauces on the menu. Was very sweet of them. Food was from ok to awesome! Room service was decent. We ordered salads, breakfast and the boy loveed the crispy tacos. Anytime we asked for something we got it regardless of whether it was on the room service menu. Great service. We only had one room service issue one morning we ordered at 6am to eat before we left at 7:20 for a tour. It never came and we had to leave. No big deal, we grabbed some fruit from the buffet and went on our way. We saw some of the most embarassing and rude people at this resort. Treating the staff like garbage is not the way to get treated well. Saw a group of 3 Quebecers freaking out on a server because they couldnt take the dishes from the restaurant. He told them they could order room service when he said he wasnt allowed to transfer the food from that restaurant and they were disgusting to him. I apologized on behalf of Canadians. Another couple checking in was making such a fuss about room service dishes outside the room and how horrified they were. Um, do you expect the dish clearing fairy to take them away? Give these people a break. Dishes were alwasy gone by the morning from our door. Simmer people. This woman pulled the whole, I am trip advisor reviewer to the front desk and stormed out to "take pictures" You are an embarrasment lady and I hope you read my review, Don't be a cow and maybe things will get a little better! :-) The spa was great, we had moonlight massages on the beach! HEAVEN! Shows were small but its a small resort. The circus show was good, the fire show on the beach was great! Go see that one. We headed t Zky most nights and always had a blast with the same group. Usually around 50 people up there at night. Fun place and we always had great service up there. She remembered what we drank everytime. We never had to ask for a drink. They also made my guys birthday a really fun night! Thanks for that ! All in all this is a wonderful resort. People need to relax, chill the heck out and realize you are on resort. This is a small resort with not a lot of walking at all. 5 minutes max from end to end. So there really isnt a bad room anywhere. Some are close to the beach and the a la cartes the others are close to the front, the spa, the buffet and gym. But really not an issue, nothing is far. The staff are for the most part wonderful and welcoming. It is a boutique hotel so dont expect a grand waterfall entrance. It is a chic and cozt feeling place. If you hate the 1600 room resorts, give this one a try. This is a family friendly resort, so if you are getting away as a couple =, be prepared for this. Next time we may try the ElDorado properties because bratty kids made me nuts more times than I can handle. But when we travel as a family, I would retunr to the Azul Fives in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have to agree with the bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: LoniNewYork
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Azul Fives in early January 2012 with our 2 small children. We chose the Azul Fives because it advertised itself as so child and baby friendly. We did not find this to be the case. I'll start wih the good-- 1. The resort grounds are beautiful. The grounds are very well maintained, and the pools are beautiful. 2. The suites are beautiful. We had a one bedrom condo and it was very very nice. Huge soaking tub, nice modern kitchen, large couch to lounge on. Sadly, that's it for the good. And now the bad-- 1. The service was awful. The waits in the restaurants were ridiculous, I was so glad I did not do all-inclusive and spend my vacation waiting in lines and for service. After two meals in the hotel, we abandoned it and drove into Playa or cooked in our suite for our meals. 2. The food was awful. We tried almost all of the restaurants and I'm sorry to say the food was very subpar--bland and poor quality. Absolutely not worth the all-inclusive prices. Sorry, but using Cheez-whiz on nachos is just not acceptable at a 5 star resort in Mexico! I ordered tiramisu in the Mediterranean restaurant and it was absolutely not tiramisu. It was a tasteless gelatinous mess. Even though we paid for our meals at the restaurants (extortionate prices at that), we were not offered chips and salsa or bread with our meals. We saw waiters bringing these out for the all-inclusive people, but somehow we were second class citizens even though we were PAYING for our food. 3. The hotel overpromised and underdelivered. We chose it because we had read it was baby friendly. They advertise on their website that you don't need to travel with baby equipment -- they have everything. Well, they had nothing! We asked for a high chair for our room b/c we had a kitchen and planned to at least have breakfasts there. We were told no. We were never offered any other baby equipment for our room as advertised. The website said there have a welcome gift bag for kids on arrival. Our son was offered a bottle of water and no more. Everything was just slightly less than how they advertised it. 4. We had a full kitchen that was advertised as "fully equipped" yet had no silverware or utensils. We had cups, bowls, cutting board, pots and pans, but not a single spoon, fork, or knife. We asked if they could be provided, we were told no, though they did finally bring us spoons and forks, but no knives. We had to swipe one from the restaurant. 5. Finally, we were on the ground floor and had a pipe on our "lawn" that leaked sewage. We complained about this repeatedly yet never had anyone come and check it out. The first day we were there our 1 year old promptly stuck his finger in it and put it in his mouth. Despite repeatedly going to the front desk about this, no one ever did anything and we were unable to use the outside at all. 6. Oh and as others have said, the pools were cold. Pretty much not usable at all. The beach is rocky, and not nearly as nice as the beach in Playa. I would definitely not stay here again, and would not recommend others to go here. They just miss the mark.

Reviews.Title: “The complaining is insane....”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our wonderful week @ Azul. This is a gorgeous property with awesome staff ( especially Oscar @ Palmas)! For those who only have complaints, it's too bad that such small issues can cause such bad reviews. We never once had a cold shower..and my husband and I didn't have to shower together. Our concierge Marco was a great help with all information that we requested. The pool is gorgeous and did not need to be heated. If your in the sun and your body temperature is hot...of course the water feels cold, that's the reason to jump in is to cool off!! The only thing that my husband found a bit different is that the Flavors ( buffet) was very small compared what we're used to, but all the food was good. I would return in a heartbeat, the rooms are fantastic, good food, good drinks and great staff. We stayed in Villa 11 on the 1st floor, walkout room which I enjoyed being able to leave the patio door open and be at the pool. If we needed to get to our room, it was right there. Yes, the beach is rocky, but if you studied your environment a bit before booking, this information is easy to obtain. Can't wait to return....Hola!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Wilma W
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Jan 22, 2012 from the Azul fives, reported as being a 4.5 - it is barely a 3 star. Our experience was bad from arrival, the lobby area and front of the hotel are not welcoming at all. We arrived at noon and were told that our rooms were not ready and to come back at 3pm - we had no one greet us or give us orientation so we did not know where to go or what to do.
