Finally the room was ready we were told it was deluxe - far from it. The toilet did not work for 3 days, the mirror was off the wall, the safe did not work and the TV did not work. When they came to fix the toilet they left black sole marks on the floor which stayed there for two days. We did not have any contact from the hotel regarding the hotel or the services offered, there was nothing in our room about the restaurants, room service or anything about the hotel. Now comes the bad food....this was our first trip to Mexico but other guest told us the food was of Cuba standard. For a 4.5 star hotel that states "Gourmet" it was terrible - the buffet at Flavours was the worst buffet we have ever been too. There was no steak or seafood available. Our last night dinner we went to the Italian restaurant waited over one hour and then were told we were not on the waiting list - they had written our number on a sheet at the top of the stairs but the one they were working off was down stairs, we saw other guest going in that had come after us so we brought this to their attention and they added us to the bottom of the list, when we went to leave they said they had a table for us.When seated we saw that the restaurant had more empty tables than the number of waiting down stairs. We left before my husbands main course came, the delivered mine when they delivered his pasta course - even this service took a very long time. The only good thing we have to say about this resort is that the breakfast omellets were excellent and Oscar at the Palma pool bar was very nice. If it was not for Marco the concierge (who just happened to come by and ask us how our stay was) our washroom floor would not have been washed nor would the racoon tracks on the terrace have been cleaned up. We will never return to the Azul Fives and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Azul 2 is more like it”
Reviews.Author: troyd83
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at this hotel. Worst resort experience i have ever stayed at. I dont usually complain and take things in stride but after a few days it started to ware on me.. The showers only have hot water for maximum of id say 8 minutes so if you go as a couple best make it quick. Our toilet was at times running non stop and when told maintenance they said it was suppose to be like that. The first night getting their we sat out on our balcony and relaxed and when we went to bed we left the balcony door open to get the breeze in. Apparently you cant have the balcony door open and expect the front door to be closed... we woke up and our door was completely wide open after we had closed it. the breeze through the balcony door opens it, plus the front door didnt always close. we notified the staff but nothing was done. Our neighbours were extremely loud coming home every night at 4am and waking us up. i know this is not the hotel fault but we asked to be moved because after 4 nights of this happening we were very frustrated. they said they would look into and we never heard anything back. The pools are absolutely freezing and the beach in front of the hotel is un-swimable due to the rocks. only place other then restaurants, to get a drink were the pool bars which you had to be in to get a drink or reach around and ask for one. the restaurants had decent food but problem is it takes way to long to get it. typically you put your name on list for table and wait 45 minutes. once you sit down to time you leave it can take anywhere from 1 hour to 2 hours if not more. i saw a family sitting at a table beside me in the asian restaurant where the 2 little kids where falling asleep cause they had been their so long. at night time their is nothing to do you are almost forced to hang out in your room. the entertainment is lacking and the Sky bar is pathetic. your lucky if their is more then 15 people in their and even still takes 15 minutes to get a drink. Out of the 7 days we were their, 3 days our room did not get clean. so no toilet paper, fresh clean towels, no stocking of fridge. the days we got frustrated with the restaurants we called for room service which is just as bad. took just as long and when it got their it was wrong. we asked for water we got beer, asked for cesar salad no chicken and got chicken. we had asked for a king bed and were told we are getting one but when we got to our room it was 2 individual double beds that we had to push together. the final straw was on the morning of check out when we were cleaning out our safe we realized our ipod had been STOLEN!! i know they will try and justify that they cant get into the locks but it bunch of B.S . What if we had locked it upon us leaving the place, how would they get into it then. the funny thing is tho they invite you to a meeting here they want you to buy into this place(timeshare, though they wont tell you thats what it is), not likely going to happen. the resort sucked and it not just my opinion, we talked to about 8 other couples from canada who were their at same time as us and they said all the same. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, people who didn't are insane.”
Reviews.Author: mahonesm
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the most perfect vacation at AzulFives. No complaint worth writing about, until I read ridiculous reviews below. I can't believe someone would want a heated pool in Mexico. It was over 30degrees everyday. Pool is only 4.2ft deep, the sun can heat the pool just fine. The food was fine dining at all the restaurants, the food at pool bars is lite snacking comparable to what you get at most resorts. staff friendly;These people like their jobs,proud of resort. Take negative review w/ grain of salt. Can't wait to go back, would recommend to anyone who likes a cool splash in pool when it's +30 out. First time at gourmet incl resort and feel the excellent food suits the "gourmet" title; huge difference. I've been to GrandPalladium, Barcelos, etc, most of my life. Every meal I had there was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except two things”
Reviews.Author: mikefishman
Reviews.Content: Just came back from this hotel, stayed there from January 13 till January 20 2012. It is a very nice place. Two major things prevent me from rating this as execellent: 1. The beach is very rocky and it is almost impossible to enter the sea unless it is completely calm. 2. You would think that with this beach problem people stay more at the pools (and pools are beautiful) but the water in the pools is too cold. If not these 2 things I would rate this resort as a complete paradise. Yes, and one more thing - the service is sometimes painfully slow. Rooms, food, cleanliness and the whole appearance of the resort is just execellent. It is especially good for kids, you got a lot of activities and the food for kids is just great, up to the point that you can ask special baby food (as well as yours, by the way) to be delivered to your room 24 hours a day. I would definitely recommend this place. Michael, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NorthStarBeachGuy
Reviews.Content: I decided to join Trip Advisor because we found it useful when making our reservations and planning our trip and thought we should try and give something back. We returned from our 6 nights at the Azul Fives yesterday, January 19th. The purpose of our trip was for my wife and I to share a relaxing week before I started a new position that would require a lot of travel. Overall Resort - The grounds were outstanding. Beautifully manicured and we saw grounds crews working on it every day. The rooms are divided amongst 13 3-story villas, none having a view of the beach/ocean. Pools and beach areas are kept very clean and attractive as were the restaurants. Room - We had a 1 BR suite which was excellent. The pictures others have posted here do it justice. It was very roomy and the bed, while very firm, actually helped my back rather than hurt it (I was surprised, too). A couple of points about the room: the light by the sinks is limited so to put on make-up or to shave is more difficult than it needs to be. The kitchen is useless-ish due to the lack of any utensils or plates. I wasn't about to cook on vacation but there were a few times that I would have liked to have had a fork or knife around. A roll of paper towels would have been fabulous. It is great to have a full size refrigerator, though. We never experienced what we thought was a dirty room. One thing, though, I think they do a really complete disinfecting between guests and the first day there the smell of the cleaning solution was overpowering and irritating. We opened the windows and sliders then went to dinner and walked the property. By the time we got back the smell was all but gone. The next day it was and it never reappeared. Restaurants - We lunched the first day after we checked in at Lizzards Bar since it was near our room and we wanted to pick up something light. I had a pizza and my wife the nachos. I have to admit, this set off red flags for us: the pizza was like a Totinos frozen pizza and the nachos were ball park nachos, complete with velveta sauce. We thought if this is gourmet, then we're in BIG trouble this week. It did not get better that night when we ordered room service. I had the chicken cordon bleu and my wife had the filet with mustard sauce. What I ACTUALLY got was the kids chicken and fries. My wife's filet was tasteless and the "mustard sauce" was just brown gravy. Oh oh... We ate at Flavours each morning (mostly because it was the only place open for breakfast!) where there is a breakfast buffet. Yes, the buffet is indeed the same every morning, but it consisted of: omelet station, eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, waffles, french toast, mini-pancakes, pasteries, cereals, fruit, yogurt - you get the picture. For those that complain about lack of variety at breakfast each day - I'm not sure what else you need! Lunch at Sea Olives was, surprising. My tacos consisted of three tortilla wedges with chopped seasoned chicken laid across. The taste was tasteless and the portion size anemic. I don't mind smaller portions at all, especially when you walk away saying, "wow, that was fabulous" but Sea Olive underwhelmed. My wife had the chicken quesedilla which was fine but not fabulous. That night we tried room service again and, while they got the order correct this time, my Cordon Blue was laid over a bed of egg noodles with the obsequious velveta sauce. I don't care where in the world you are, liquid cheese never qualifies as gourmet. My wife had the spaghetti with butter sauce which was really egg noodles in butter. So much for room service. We were really a bit scared heading into the meat of the week but we discovered that Flavours had a theme buffet each night for dinner; the Seaside Grill had burgers and fries for a quick beachside lunch (not fabulous, but it worked) and Arezzo (Italian) was fabulous. The courses at Arezzo were really good - especially the variety of breads at the beginning of the meal. My lasagna was delicious and my wife enjoyed her cheese cannelloni. If you're even a bit hungry, though, make sure you get the grande portion. My lasagna piece was smaller than you would get at a Macaroni Grill or an Olive Garden and it was the "grande". This time, however, the taste certainly made up for lack of size (though it was certainly reasonable) and this is more of an observation rather than a complaint. The buffet nights were definitely above average with a lot of variety and the food quality was pretty good. Service at all the outlets was excellent as was the staff overall at the Azul Fives. Beach - Gorgeous. Soft, beautiful sand and a lot of lounge chairs that could be full at the peak of the day but usually not. This could have been because the week were were there (1/13 - 1/19) was slow but we never had a problem getting a couple of chairs together. There were a few signs of seats being saved but I didn't see many. We usually got to the beach from 8 - 9 AM. I can imagine that if the week was super busy it may be tough, but we never experienced an issue. We could not, however, go swimming. The red flag was up for our entire stay. Not a huge deal to us since we're mostly readers and not swimmers, but I do like to go in the water from time to time and was unable. To be fair, the surf was pretty rough the first few days but the last day it was pretty calm and the flag stayed flying. Down the beach toward Playa del Carmen folks were frolicking in the surf so that was a bit disappointing. To reiterate here, the lead into the water is filled with rocks - it is what it is and given the protected nature of the reef it probably can't be changed. Once past the rocks it looked nice, however. Spa: Tremendous. I'm an occasional spa goer while my wife is an avid spa goer. We've been to spas around the world and Vassa was perhaps the best spa experience we ever had. We got the Romantic Journey which was a hot stone message for 2 and relaxing facials. The design once you get behind the doors is like a Japanese garden. The locker rooms were spotless and we changed and went upstairs. We were first brought to a relaxation room where we laid down on very comfortable lounge chairs and treated to a warm compress on our shoulders and eyes. After 10 minutes were led by our therapists, Betty and Alejandro, to our treatment room. After some aroma therapy and a foot bath/message we laid on the tables and the hot stone message began. Excellente! After the facials we were led back to the relaxation room where we were again soothed by a warm shoulder compress, enjoyed a very flavorful hot tea and soft music before we headed back to the locker rooms to shower and change. The entire experience was nearly 2.5 hours and was worth every penny. A couple of minor issues that we learned to deal with: - housekeeping is erratic. A couple of days our room wasn't made up until after 5:30. This was tough because we kept waiting so we could take showers and head to dinner.Once we accepted it as the way they did things, no issue. We simply worked around it. Though there was a day that it was done by the time we got back from the beach around 3:30. Also, we found that different housekeeping personnel stocked our towels differently: once we had no hand towels at all! - mini-bar service is erratic. We we there 6-days and while the sign says that the minibar will be restocked every day, it was only restocked twice. We did keep getting extra waters from our maids which was fine, but once the two Sprites were gone, we would have liked some more! Not a deal breaker and we just drank water, but it you're going to really go through beer or soda, you'll need to stay on them to stock up. - bell service. We received a paper under our door the last evening that if we need bell service for checkout, please return this paper with the time and date and they would be there to get you with the oversized golf cart. We turned it in at the front desk and the front desk clerk looked at us like she never had seen it before. She said that she would get it to the bell folks asap. Needless to say we didn't get the warm fuzzies nor did we get a ride the next morning as requested - though another staffer driving by picked us up and brought us to the front desk. Overall we had a wonderful time. Once we figured out where to eat and deal with the maid service we managed. The staff was exceedingly friendly and pleasant. The one day we had a bit of a go 'round with folks (first day our room wasn't getting cleaned and we wanted to go to dinner), I think the issue stemmed more from a language barrier than an inability to please. My bad Spanish with the staffer's bad English mixed poorly! That said, problem was solved! We certainly were able to relax and enjoy ourselves. There is some walking but where we were situated, Villa 7, it was 5 minutes to the beach and 5 minutes to the front desk/Flavours/Spa which we didn't think was all that bad. Not everything was perfect but the imperfections were not enough to ruin our trip and were things we could live with. This was our experience. Obviously other folks have had other experiences. I'm not belittling the bad experiences, just trying to give you a taste of ours. I was a bit offended by the person who feels that anyone that gives this place a good review "obviously" doesn't know a five star resort. We have stayed in palaces in Italy (literally) and shacks in Micronesia so I think we can reasonably rate a place. Just because this was our experience doesn't mean it will be yours, though I do hope our review was useful to you. Please feel free to contact me and I'd be happy to add or clarify what I can.

Reviews.Title: “1 star? What hole did you crawl out of?”
Reviews.Author: Smokaah
Reviews.Content: I am currently at the resort and should say that the resort is very nice. I was told they only opened in November 2011. It is a little more "boutiquey" than other resorts I have visited with a very modern feel. The grounds are very well maintained and clean. The pictures on their web site are very accurate. This is my 5th time to the Riviera Maya and this place is as good as all the others. My wife likes the fives the best where as it is my 2nd favorite of the 5. They seem to cater heavily to young families so if you cannot deal with small children go somewhere else. With that said my two little girls really like it here and are having a blast with children's activities. The food is excellent, truly gourmet, the pools and rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. The service is friendly and for the most part fast. Some of the waitstaff faster than others. Hugo at the Sea Olive was a very good server. We had some minor issues with a TV and coffee maker not working but they were replaced quickly. My only issue to speak of is the beach itself. It is very rocky and covered with a lot of seaweed at the water's edge. I would return, however I prefer trying new resorts each time we visit. They have a 4/5 stars plaque from tripadvisor on the lobby wall which tells me a lot considering so many people online can be so ruthless in their reviews.

Reviews.Title: “My wedding was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Azul Fives on November 2011 and everything was perfect. The hotel staff is so friendly, everyone knew who we were and they made their best effort to help us with anything we needed. The Wedding event coordinators were on top of every detail and had answers to all of my questions. On the day of the wedding the entire hotel knew we were the highest priority so we got everything we needed and the event was amazing. As for the resort, the food is amazing. It's not your typical all-inclusive, here they make gourmet food and the restaurants have a lot of variety. I do have to say that the service can be a little slow, but we had no rush, after all we were in vacations. On the first day we arrived we got upgraded to a penthouse suite for free, I don't know if they do this for all wedding couples but it was AWESOME, we had our own rooftop patio with a jacuzzi and a dinning table to host guests, it was a great surprise! They also have 24 hour room service as part of the all-inclusive deal which is wonderful!!... specially for those people who arrive to the hotel late at night and the restaurants are closed. We had 32 guests to our wedding and they all stayed in the hotel with us, every single one of them said they were very satisfied with the hotel and thanked us for choosing such a great place. Some of them are considering going back for their vacations! As far as wedding options, there are plenty, we chose the balcony setting and the view towards the ocean was incredible! Our wedding pictures are amazing! One little issue is the beach, it is pretty rocky and hard to walk on, but if you walk along the beach towards the left side (facing towards the ocean from the hotel) there is an empty beach like a block away were there are no rocks and its pretty isolated. Great place to enjoy the sunset. I also enjoyed the volleyball on the beach, the entertainment staff is super nice and they make sure you are having fun!

Reviews.Title: “better be a deal”
Reviews.Author: shamic1
Reviews.Content: It needs to be cheap to go. The room is dirty, dirty, dirty. We took our kids and after supper they bathed and we had put clean new white socks on within two hours they were black from the dirty floors. Nothing is ever scrubbed clean including the dishes that are just dipped in water(they will do this infront of you at any of the bars) The room is set up nice but many things didn't work (ceiling fan, lights) The water is a rusty color and leaves a film on you and you will run out of hot water. You will have to beg for hand towels, faceclothes and towels. The room never got cleaned twice and is usually done late in the day. The pools are ice cold but did warm up as the weather got warmer. The food is excellent and is the highlight of this esort. The problem is the service is super slow and can take over two and a half hours to eat a meal. The servers are not lazy but they can't keep up and they tend to only fill just over half the seats because of it, so you at times will wait over an hour just to get a table. If it's slow the service is very good. You will have to pay for internet service and it doesn't work most of the time. It will cut in and out wherever you are. The room service is horrible and takes forever. We also had some make up stolen from our room. The beach is just ok and you can't really go in the ocean because of all the rock but if you cross the rock there is sand further out. All in all i wouldn't go bak to this resort even if it is cheap i would gamble on something else.

Reviews.Title: “A very HONEST Review. Negative, but honest.”
Reviews.Author: Joan L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives from Jan 1-11th. My husband and I have traveled to Mexico a number of times and I have never written a bad review on any Resort…except this one! We would NEVER NEVER return to this resort. We booked Azul Fives last minute and I also should have listened to the bad reviews. Any good reviews on this hotel are from travelers who have never stayed at an actual 5 star resort, or a 4 or maybe even a 3. Azul Fives can not be rated as a 5. So here we Go…. Upon arrival we were immediately disappointed with the drive up to the resort. Nothing spectacular at all. No security into or out of resort and immediately beside the Lobby are trailers and barking dogs. The lobby itself is small and nothing grand at all. Looks like a travel lodge lobby of a hotel. Check in went smoothly. Instead of an arm bracelet they give you an i.d card with your pictures on it. We were traveling with our 3 year old and she thought that was pretty cool. Well it was not cool at all. EVERYTIME you order a drink or go to a restaurant you have to show them this stupid card. So ladies when you’re in the pool ordering a drink, you better tuck that card somewhere in your bikini. Or, get out of the pool, get the card, get back in and show your stupid i.d. After check in they took us to our 1 bedroom suite. The room was nice and large, but the kitchen was useless because there are no cutlery, plates, and dishes of any kind. Also our kitchen looked like it had never been cleaned with greasy fingerprints all over the stainless steel door. We also had moldy food under the sink near the garbage can. Our room location was in Villa 1 right behind the check in desk. So we could hear dogs barking and the view outside our room was of the main road and parking lot. Also across from the gym and the main buffet Flavors. We were always woken early to workers bringing there carts through and also from other kids screaming on their way to the buffet. We found the food was good and the service was always great when we ate at all restaurants. We could always find something for our 3 year old to eat. We did not like the layout of the resort though. The buffet was on one end of the resort, and the other 3 restaurants were on the far far other side of the resort. And when I say far, I mean a good 10 min walk from our Villa. This resort is not an ocean front resort at all. None of the rooms can you even see the ocean. There are 3 pools in-between all the villas with 3 swim up bars. Plenty of chairs around those pools, but good luck getting any in the sun. Also, if you would like a drink on your long walk to the beach you will have to get into the pools and order your drink. ALL the bars in this resort are swim up bars. So if you stand on the very edge of the bar and yell across, you may get a drink, but don’t forget your card! When you finally get to the “main” pool, good luck trying to find a chair to sit on. This was the smallest pool in the resort. It is an infinity pool and the view from the pool is very nice, looking out to the ocean. We learned you had to get up super early to get a spot by the main pool. And even then good luck. One of the members that hands out the towels reserves all the chairs for guests that have tipped him. There are probably 60 chairs around that small pool. Oh and all the pools are NOT heated. Coldest pools I have ever experienced. Not fun with a 3 year old. They also have NO hot tubs at all on resort. Our daughter would have 2 hot baths a day. The beach was nice, but we could never find a chair. The ocean is not really swimmable. Lots of large rocks and Coral. That never bothered us because we never care to swim in the ocean. If you do like that though, good luck. The only place we found that you can stand and order a drink was off the beach behind the pool. However getting a drink took up to 10-15 min. All the pool and beach servers would line up to get all their orders and then the bartenders would take your order. Half way through our holiday we asked the front desk to move us to another AZUL resort but they would not accommodate us at all. They said to stick it out. Thanks. We contacted our travel agent and tried to switch to The Grand Palladium, (which is AMAZING) for the remainder of our holiday but we could not get a room for the full time. We then asked the Azul Fives to move us to another room location, they did. To Villa 12. This new room was a great location. We never once got our mini bar stocked our whole 9 days. I would stock up on water bottles from around the pool to reserve for the evening time. So my daughter would have water. When we did call to have our water and pop replenished, it took 2 hours for them to come. And they brought us beer… No thanks I asked for water. Another half hour and they brought our water. Now the one thing that we were so disappointed about. And that was that there was NO nightly entertainment. Nothing for the kids and NOTHING for the adults. All other resorts we have been to have these Grand outdoor theaters with great entertainment EACH night. Azul Fives had nothing. The sky bar is where we were told they would have entertainment was so small you could never hold the capacity of the resort, and it was DEAD every night. The other thing that drove us crazy was there was no bar to even sit around and have a drink. The only bar you could have a drink was sky bar. This was dark and empty. So we would sit by the beach, then my husband would go all the way up the stairs ( so stupid, terrible layout) get us a drink, bring them down by the beach and we would watch our daughter play on the beach. We did that for a couple of nights, but the stairs and carrying our drinks down just got too much. The resort was dead because people were forced to there rooms with nothing to do, not even an outside bar to gather around and mingle. So lame. The kids club was terrible. Our daughter never wanted to go in there. And the times we did bring her in she wanted to play in the gym area, but you have to pay $5.00 every time for an hour. She would only ever play for 15 min, so it was a waste. So we would have to just tell her no. How fun is denying your child an activity. Also, parents beware that when they say a toy lending library they only have 4 toys to choose from. A walkie-talkie set (that never worked) a book, phone and and a vacuum cleaner. When we did ask to lend these toys, they were never available. So bring your own toys. Also buckets and shovels from the play place were always gone as well. We did meet around 10 other couples on our 9 day trip and we had a blast hanging out with them. ALL the people we talked to did not care for this resort and would never return. They were all disappointed. One couple had a roof top terrace but the Jacuzzi up there is cold water. They don’t even have a hot water valve in the plumbing. Another couple’s room flooded. And we met this wonderful large family celebrating birthdays and anniversaries and they were so disappointed with the lack of buffet choices and how un accommodating the restaurants is with large groups. With just the 3 of us we had no problem getting tables at restaurants, but the wait could be up to 15 min. And the buffet would be empty. This review is mostly negative, I know. I have never been disappointed with a resort. Nor giving a bad review but I always appreciate and honest review so I can plan my holiday. I only hope this helps people, and that the resort changes things. They have lots of work to do to make this a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened more to the "terrible" reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Leahsmurf
Reviews.Content: We were there Jan 6/12 - Jan 13/12 Don't GO!! We just returned home from what we planned on being a 5 star holiday and it was the farthest thing from it!! We read many of the online reviews both negative and positive and thought they could all be justified. We definately should have realized that from the negative ones they are things to make your holiday not so enjoyable. On a positive note before I get into it, the grounds were in great shape to some extent and the staff was friendly and willing to listen and help where they could. Upon arriving at the resort we dropped another family off at the Valentin which has a beautiful long entry way that is all maintained and professional, arriving at the Fives, mayhave been a trailor park! There was no security checking vehicles and the front door was 50 feet from the main road in, you could see people walking by, random dogs and locals ... you also had to walk by this to get to the main buffett restaurant "worlds cusine" ... to start off we got to breakfast at 9:30 and there we waited in line for over 25 min complaining with the other outside who were no impressed. Upon finally being seated, the inside of the restaurant was not even half full, the buffett itself was mostly empty and the food we did get as often cold, stale or mushy (ie waffles, dont think we ever got a fresh one) breads that I did try were cold as if they had been frozen!! Lunch was a little better as you had some selection. Dinner, restaurants were okay but I don't believe that any of the quality was gormet, 5 star service nor quality. get there early as arriving at 8 may get you a table closer to 9!! Ocean: not really swimable, little to no walk in access (have to stumple over rocks). No rooms are really ocean front and have to walk quite a ways to get to the water!! Kind of a bad thing when you are there for the ocean etc. May as well stay somewhere cheaper not on the water! Bars: only swim up bars near the upper pools, had to stand at edge and yell over the side and pass drinks over the water. They should have foot access!! all swim up bars are on east side of pool too, no afternoon sun and therefore in unheated pools, sitting in the shade and drinking a cold drink in the cold water is often not the greatest. Had the occassional poolside service and often took tipping to get them to come back for repeat service. Rooms: we had a one bedroom suite with penthouse patio and enjoyed it. It was a lot of wasted space that could be better utilized. Kitchen had nothing in it, no plates, cups, anything so may as well not have been there. a/c made the room very damp to the point where bedding and clothes all felt wet. bathing suites would not dry in the room! we read a comment about the dining room light fixture being loud and blowing, thus sounding like someone was breaking in all the time ..... thought they were crazy but once there, that was exactly what it sounded like!!!! It interupted our sleep so much that we had to either turn a/c off or else shut bedroom doors which was just a nusance. There was no nightly entertainment so plan on being early to bed. Sky bar could of had so much potential with stuff going on but was dead from what we saw between 6-10 even 11!! No nightlife for adults and nothing in the common area for the kids... KIDS: so many of them, don't go if you prefer a adults only resort, screaming in restaurantings and whinning, splashing in pools and strollers everywhere!!! We liked kids but I think because they didn't have anything to do with the kids unless send them to the kids camp they were all bored!!! food would also be hard for them imagining feeding my kids from what I saw! Overall message is I would avoid this hotel and not recommend it. If you are not picky and want to pay a premium price without the amenities and conveniences, then this is for you!!! We stayed at the Azul Sensatori last year and I would go abck there in a second, we actually tried to switch to there!! Now that was a 5 star resort and I would recommend it anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip, couldn't ask for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: AngeleBelanger
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had gone to Cuba in July 2011, this was my first trip. After the HORRIBLE time we had there we decided to look into something that would make up for it and this was THE place. I was a little worried travelling to Mexico but I can honestly say I will be back after this. The staff were amazing, we had no problems with communication. Everything was "my pleasure" lots of thank yous and hellos.. You could tell everyone worked hard to make sure everyone had a fabulous time and if you were not enjoying your stay they would make sure to fix it. I am a very picky eater, I ate more at this resort then I do at home.. the food was amazing! They had a little of everything, and I really like the idea of all the restaurants because a buffet can get old fast during a 7 day stay.. Those travelling with children should keep in mind that mexicans spend a lot of time at the dinner table, therefore you will too. The food isn't in front of you right away but the wait is worth it.. I recommend ordering a meal as an appetizer because it will come out quickly and that should hold you over. There is a wait to go to some of the popular restaurants at peak hours.. just like at home.. I got a little upset one night and was given a table within 15 mins.. the next day the manager found my boyfriend and I at the beach restaurant and apologized for the wait. He took the time to explain to us why there was a wait and that he was sorry. We went back the next night and he was so happy to see us again. We also went for sushi late one night and they manager said there was too long of a wait and she wouldn't be able to get us in.. she did the same the next day.. found us and made sure we got a great table that night. THE SERVICE AT THIS RESORT IS AMAZING. You cannot stay mad very long. In the morning, I believe her name was Elizabeth would always great you with a warm smile at flavours.. she was there everyday and we loved being seated by her.. it started our morning off amazing. The beach is not the greatest but if you walk down about 10 mins it gets better.. you have to keep in mind once you leave the resort the hotel is not longer responsible for your security. The pool was great, very clean and well kept. Everyday I seen about 5 workers cleaning it and taking care things nightly. Our room was great, modern and clean.. something that could be worked on is after guests are done with room service items it would be nice if someone came to collect a lot of the dishes.. I guess some familys didn't want to keep them in the rooms and so the often ended up in the hallway.. which wasn't nice to see.. The staff did however work hard to keep the resort clean and I often saw the sidewalks even being cleaned which is nice because I like to be barefoot. Something that should be kept in mind for couples, this is a family resort and there are a lot of kids. I don't mind kids but it would be nice if the hotel had some more pool activities for them.. a lot of the kids founds friends but the staff is so great I am sure they could motivate the kids to do some sort of water sport or aerobics.. get them out of there parents hair for a little while. Other then that I really don't have anything bad to say about this resort I had a beautiful time and can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller449
Reviews.Content: Our family was at Azul Fives for the Christmas -New Years holiday. It was perfect in every way. The property is beautiful very relaxing the pools wind thru the place. Our meals were great at every restaurant. They had many restaurants to choose from - more then we have ever seen offered at an All Inclusive resort, and there was no restrictions as to how often you could eat at any of them, and we did not have to get up in the middle of the night to book a reservation!!! The food was truly Gourmet Italian, Sushi, International even Mac n Cheese for the kids!! The Pizza was fantastic and they brought it to us at pool side!! Our room was very modern and had a full kitchen!! Our suite had three balconies one off of the Living room and one off of each bedroom. Would definetly go back, next year we will bring more of our family.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the sun”
Reviews.Author: salvaga
Reviews.Content: Azul is a fabulous 5 star resort on a beautiful white sandy beach. The staff are wonderful. The meals are fine dining in all the restaurants. The buffet breakfast is the best I have ever had. It is not a place for children which is great for someone like me. It is a very romantic resort great for couples.

Reviews.Title: “It keeps getting better!!”
Reviews.Author: cdnsenorita
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort a few times now and found that it keeps getting better and better all the time! Everything about this place continues to improve and impress! Karisma is working very hard to create a "gourmet" resort, and the results are evident! Despite relatively small menus, the food is very good. We never had a bad meal while we were there.The addition of the beach grill and the Italian restaurant are huge plusses for this resort, giving its clientele even more of a choice when it comes to dining. Perfect portion sizes and fresh food means no waste, and you don't get the left over beef fried up in your rice the next day!! Despite the high level of occupancy while we were there, we had no problems finding a quiet spot away from the holiday revelry when needed. We did experience a shortage of towels on a couple of occasions, but in this regard, I don't blame the resort. ( Do people REALLY need to use 3 towels each when sunbathing?! ) We found that the resort staff bent over backwards for us in all departments, and really cared about our needs. Friendly and personable, they knew us by name and treated us accordingly. This is a relatively small and intimate resort, which we love after being to some of the "mega" resorts in Mexico. After travelling to the country every year for the last 17 years, we can honestly say this resort is our favourite and will be our "go to" destination in future. Special mention to a few of the key staff members who give that little "extra" to make the holiday more special: Hilario, Juan, Pedro, Alejandro (pick one - they are all great!), Marisol, Jacobo, Chiara, Carlos, Saul, Ali....I could name them all!! We love this place and look forward to the day when we can return! Oh, and by the way, the tennis lessons are AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - but that's where it ends”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to go to Mexico for 7 days for my honeymoon. We decided to take my husband's children along with us with is why we decided to go to Azul Fives. The children are 11 and 13 and were bored except when they actually found other kids to play with. The activities listed on the calendar didn't alway happen either. We had one hot shower a day - then it was cold water. Our room had a hot tub which obviously we couldn't use either. And even the hot tob in the spa was cold so we should've just purchased a massage on the beach for about a 1/4 the price. The restaurants had such terrible service we walked out a few times...and there were times we would wait up to 20 minutes to get a drink at the pool bar as well as the restaurants. I could go on about the issues but the list was too long after 7 days. I would not suggest this resort for anyone unless they fixed the service issues which would have to start with the management because they didn't seem to care we were unhappy at all. It was a disappointing way to spend my honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Travelsude1111
Reviews.Content: Food is so bad...looks good on plate but tastes like garbage. Rooms and resort are fine but service and food are very sub-par. The only thing azul fives does well is marketing and misrepresentation. Stay away believe the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress”
Reviews.Author: marlene s
Reviews.Content: We spent 13 days at Azul Fives in December from the 9th to the 24th. Without a doubt the property is immaculate and the rooms are beautiful; plus the staffs at the wonderful kids club and at the lunch bars around the pool(s) area are great. That being said, there is a lot of work to be done especially when it comes to customer service at the front desk and at the restaurants. 1. The service in the a la carte restaurants during lunch and dinner is extremely slow, wait time are ridiculous. 2. Food quality is fair to poor on many instances, chicken is always undercooked (pink in the inside even if you ask for well done) and vegetables are always overcooked. 3. Room was poorly cleaned especially when our cleaning lady was off. 4. The fridge was never replenished during our 13 day stay even though I phoned the front desk twice to ask them to make sure they did replenish the fridge. 5. They run out of towels at Lizards and the main pool by 11am and sometimes they never replenished the towels until late afternoon. 6. The food quality and taste at Flavors was poor regardless of the theme. In fact there were a couple of nights during the Spanish and American theme night (both weeks) that food was so bad, we went to bed hungry. The theme does not reflect in any way, shape or form the food selection especially during the American and Spanish theme night. Dinner at Flavors for the most part during our stay was extremely disappointing. 7. Seafood selection was very limited and at times for most of our stay nonexistent. 8. 4. The food at the buffet restaurant is tiring specially breakfast if you are on holidays for more than a week, it is the same thing (same items) day in and day out. 9. The front desk is not much of a help, no matter what the issue. 10. The WI-Fi was down most of the time we were there. Even the wired internet connection at the lobby was down about 5x during our stay. 11. The shower in the deluxe rooms needs to be better designed. The seal between the shower door and the common area around the sinks and the toilet next door gets completely wet and extremely slippery and dangerous when somebody is taking a shower, my 1 year old and my husband both slipped and fell when my son was taking a shower. 12. Complaints are never addressed by management. They either don’t get it or they don’t care. I believe this is a work in progress. However, there is a lot work to be done by management in order for this resort to be at the same service level as resorts such as the RIU, Moon Palace, etc. especially when it comes to food selection and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Beware of Mexican star rating though.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferAnne1987
Reviews.Content: We Arrived at Azul fives Christmas Eve... First off, dont be put off by the road leading too Azul Fives. It is reflective of the typical Mexican town Play Del Carmen is. We stayed in the three bedroom penthouse with the roof top living space. Azul fives was a suprise, it has to be the cleanest resort I have ever stayed at - they regularily washed and swept all the walkways, bleached the handrailings and the resturants and rooms were spot less. Our maid was honest and very thorough, he found that our safe had not fully closed one day and left us a little note - nothing was ever stolen at this resort. The pool bars and resturant choices were plenty for 7 days, I think that two weeks may be too long at this resort. Playa Del Carmen lacks in culture in comparison to wandering the streets of Peurto Vallarta, it was very beat up and poor. There is really no unique goods to be purchased, just your typical tourist items from China. I found Playa Del Carmen a humbling experience as we walked about an hour in the town. Everyone was very friendly and we were not given any trouble from the locals. Downsides: Our roof top cold tub leaked through the roof and my parents wook up to an inch of water, luckily nothing was ruined of their possessions. One whole day was spent getting repacked and moving to another building, there was no offering from the resort for our troubles - this was disapointing. **We were a little concerned to notice they had filled the flooded room with the water damaged roof with guests a few days later (221 for your reference)** Resturants close by 10, this really didnt fare well with us as we have been known to enjoy dining well past 10. Note: The Italian restuarant still served us and were very welcoming- we stayed until at least 10:30 and they did not mind at all. Dress code was a moving target: It seems that the shirt pants and shoes dress code varied widley. I'm not sure how a resort in Mexio can expect to get away with a "no sandal" rule and after a little protest of sorts the resort seemed to make an exception for clean/expensive sandals. The sushi restuarant staff is a little overwhelmed: This didnt suprise me too much but we asked for a table for 6 and were told that they couldnt rearrange but if we waited there would be a large table leaving shortly. We said we would wait out front, then a group of six entered the restuarant and was seated immediately. Young boys in scrubby footy tees and all. The hostess proved to be slightly incompetent but did make an honest effort to make it up. We had a special meal made by the chef that was not on the menu. Bonus points for him! The main pool was very noisy and there were a lot of children around that area though it said Adults only, we hung out in the winding pools amougnst the buildings --- very peaceful! In all, this resort was very pleasant for being child-friendly...it seems they had alot of activities to keep them entertained and there is a daycare building. I was a little disappointed that there was limited adult entertainment nightly. One night there was a fire show with Reggae, we had an amazing night - it would have been nice to have more of that! The "night club" was very big and very empty with great lounge seating, the bartender was excellent and made us whatever she felt like for fun, it was great...she would just show up with a new creation once our others were done. Really impressed with Domingo and Carlos at the pool bars, they were alot of fun and "fixed" my husbands sore foot with the best tequila they had. The watched our things while we went swimming and nothing went missing. The beach server took a little monetary persuasion to get better service from, so be prepared for that. When I had read other travelers reviews, I have to admit I thought many of them were alittle whiney now I understand what the problem is. Overall, dont expect a 5 star experience, if you want that stick to a country other than Mexico. In all, our vacation was great and we got some much needed "nothing time". Wander down the beach to the right, at the second massage "hut" (its a little hidden) Carlos will give you the best massage you have ever had- for 35 American dollars! Also give "Xplor" a go it was an active Disney Land for adults, we really had fun. Please dont be afraid of all the Media about Mexico, I am a young caucasion woman and I have not yet had a problem in Mexico. Just make sure your safe stays closed and dont wander around Playa Del Carmen at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Paradise0123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, amazing spa, and great restaurants! The stuff is incredibly kind and helpful. The suits are beautifully designed and very spacious.... Cannot wait to return here!

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: 2nothome
Reviews.Content: As you would expect, the hotel is clean and comfortable. Service in the restaurants was outstanding. Our standard room was spacious, although the room set up--shower and toilet are off the entry hall--was odd. Food in all the restaurants was good. Access to Playa del Carmen is not particularly convenient, so if you plan to spend much time in town, this may not be the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip”
Reviews.Author: dselmal
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Azul Fives and there were enough small issues this time around that we wont be returning. On their own they are not a big deal, but added up we realize that this resort has too many issued to overlook for another booking. We were happy to see that 2 new restaurants have opened as well as a juice/smoothy bar. However, we were told that none of the restaurants take reservations so when we went to the italian one, the first thing we were asked was whether we had a reservations and if not it would be an hour wait. Then, the beach grill was not open for dinner service most of the nights we were there. We did ask the concierge about the schedule, and were told they would be open, but when we went on a certain evening they were closed. They did not have scuba lessons at the pool or any sort of water craft that we could use as it states in the info. Towels ran out frequently at the pools. Although there was an activity calendar posted, most never happened. Also, there were no longer programs each night. Rather, only a few of the nights. We knew that service would be slow, but at times it was ridiculously slow. They need more wait staff or a quicker kitchen. Room service was a nice treat for late afternoon snacks and on one morning. But the order always had a few errors. The mini bar/fridge was not restocked daily, but a few times. When we called nothing happened. Also, we were told that there would be items for the kids that would be stocked in the fridge, but that did not happen. Only once did they come by for turn down service, but that was at 5pm and we were getting dressed and asked that they return in 2 hours. They never came back. Any time we had a question, or make a call, we were told that they would look into it/talk to a manager, etc and get back to us. They never did follow up and after a few days we decided to let it go rather then spend our vacation on the phone/talking to the front. The dinner variety was nice, but breakfast got old fast. Also, only having one tennis court available made it difficult to play. HOt water was no longer an issue in the rooms. and it was nice to have s uch a large base when traveling as a family. There is a ton of staff, but even so there were many gaps in service and delivery. The grounds were kept up great and the resort is quiet so you don't need to worry about loud parties at night when you are traveling with kids. We felt very safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: lemonpie13
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the facility at Azul Fives. I have never seen such a beautiful spa. The staff was so kind and informative and the food was wonderful. I would recommend this resort to anyone who loves great food, a quiet and sophisticated atmosphere and especially if they have young children.

Reviews.Title: “a work in progress”
Reviews.Author: cmsknyny
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, with huge suites with excellent layouts for large families. The challenge here is the details - the execution is fair to poor on many dimensions. We much prefer Azul Beach to this property - perhaps in time they will get their act together - but for now I cannot recommend. 1.room was poorly cleaned upon check-in - dirty mirror and tub, etc. sheets smell moldy 2. they run out of towles @ 11am 3. The food is mixed, some good, some poor - they have the exact same buffet for breakfast every day, and the service, as noted by others can be very slow. 4. the keys to the room fail numerous times per day, and you need to wait for security - no explanantion 5. the front desk is totally non responsive, no matter what the issue 6. the wifi is down most of the time. 7. the beach is rocky and unswimmable When you complain about these issues, you receive a blank stare from management - they just dont get it! The staff is nice - there seems to be noone in charge. the pool is nice, rooms are great, and lazy river pool very pretty. It is a shame...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ABethC
Reviews.Content: Totally serene and beautiful. Great service and grounds. I will definitely return this year!

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend Stay after a Week at Azul Beach”
Reviews.Author: mydogislovely
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our two daughters, 6 & 9, stayed at Azul Fives for a weekend after our week long stay at Azul Beach in November. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a penthouse suite and were very happy with the extra large, luxurious accommodations. Our suite included a bedroom, living area, full kitchen, dining area, full bath, powder room, two balconies and a rooftop terrace that was HUGE!! The bedroom had a king bed w/ comfortable mattress and linens, a large flat screen and privacy doors separating it from the living area. The bedroom was connected to the main bath which featured two vessel sinks, a rain forest shower and a two person Jaccuzzi. There was another TV in the living room with lots of room to spread out and be comfortable. We had the all inclusive plan, but if you chose the European plan, the kitchen and dining area were quite ample, easily providing the equipment needed to prepare meals for your family. The rooftop terrace had enough room and seating to host quite a party. From there we were able to see the ocean and much of the surrounding area including Cozumel (I think) at night. The rooftop Jaccuzzi would be great in the warmer months. It didn't seem to have hot water, so we didn't use it. We borrowed a stroller which was convenient as our youngest usually fell asleep during the shows. The elevator was quite handy as we were on the third floor and it made getting her back to the room a breeze. The resort is a nice size - not too big. We were in Building 4 and it was probably a three to five minute walk to either the beach/ pool/ restaurant areas or the lobby. The Azulitos Club was bigger than at Azul Beach and had a gym ( extra cost?) and its own pool. Our girls liked it, but preferred AB because of the fun they had with Zoe, Pillar and Mariam during the week we were there. The beach looked fine, but the water looked too rough for my taste. It is very much like the beach at the Valentin. I prefer the very calm, shallow waters of AB. The pools were fabulous. Since some even meander through the complex, there was always one close by. The entertainment in the Zky bar was great. All of the restaurants were very good with professional service and delicious food. We always had excellent service at Azul Fives. There is a small on-site cenote just outside the windows of the main restaurant near the lobby. Monkeys come and hang out in the trees by that cenote. Since we were only there two days, we didn't get a chance to see them though. Although my first choice for a great family trip would be Azul Beach because of its smaller size and better beach, I would definitely consider a second trip to Azul Fives. Whichever you choose, you cannot go wrong! P.S. I really can't see how anyone could give this resort a "terrible".

Reviews.Title: “Read the Fine Print for Travelocity.ca”
Reviews.Author: Vacation2011154990
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware, read the fine print when booking online with Travelocity.ca. We thought we were getting an All Inclusive when we booked with Travelocity. We booked a two bedroom at Azul Five. When we got there, we were told it was on the European Plan and not the All Inclusive. When we tried calling Travelocity , we kept getting transferred from rep to rep and being disconnected. We also incurred higher long distance calls as calls placed from outside the USA or Canada are not toll free. The kitchen dishes are also not available to guests as they are reserved for the Time share owner. The Hotel staff are not accomadating in this nor is Travelocity. The hotel is nice that is why we rated it a four star but the service from Travelocity is poor.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: Last day at the Azul Fives Hotel I really felt to share this and have to say it was the best hotel experience that we have ever had. a total luxury experience.. The Villas, grounds, facilities, restaurants the food are all top notch from easy going succulent beach grill BBQ to world class Italian restaurant. but what truly makes this place special are the people that work there. Everyone we came into contact with could not help us enough us and they worked really hard to make us feel special. They all seemed to enjoy working at the Azul Fives and seemed very genuine. I was impressed with how the managers always seemed to be around and spent time talking to the guests and helping out their employees when they needed help. I wish I could remember all of the names of the people that we enjoyed talking to and provided great service to us but there are too many names to remember. A few names that I can remember that made our stay great include; Sol the hostess Ali bartender Michael in Food and Beverage Johanna customer service Azul Fives is a real gem and I can’t wait to return again

Reviews.Title: “Expectations & Realities”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: Keeping with tradition, this review will be written in sections in order to keep everything neat and organized. As I began this trip from Canada it will also focus on the tour operator: Transat Holidays, which the holiday was organized and executed through. Thank you for your interest in my review! I hope that you find the information I provide helpful and informative in your decision making process. Table of Contents Looking for a particular section? To use the table of contents use the "Find" functionality of your browser. Press "CTRL and the letter 'F'" on your keyboard and type in the numeral which you would like to go to. For example, CTRL+F and "ii." will take you to "Air Transat Flight". i. Pre-Booking ii. Air Transat Flight iii. Arrivial at Cancun Airport iv. Arrival at Azul Fives v. 1 Bedroom Suite vi. Restaurants vii. Pools ix. Beach x. Ocean xi. Conclusion & Notes (i.) Pre-Booking --- As with all vacations which we go on, it always begins with a long process of research and determination on which property to book. All of the major players in Canada (Air Canada Vacations, Transat Holidays, Signature Vacations, Sunwing Vacations etc.) had this hotel in their portfolio but there was an interesting observation; they all rated the property differently! This immediately made me skeptical. ACV (****1/2) TH (****1/2) SGV (*****) SWV (*****) While the ratings were relatively close together (only off by .5 of a star) it still makes me wonder "why". Of all the providers I always go with Air Canada Vacations rating on a property; in my experience it is always bang on. In this case it was no different. When we went to book our vacation, our travel agent spoke very highly of the property and stated that it was highly regarded in the agent community. That was all we needed to hear and with that we booked with Transat Holidays a one week stay at the Azul Fives. (ii.) Air Transat Flight --- For those who are not concerned with the flight or tour operator, please skip to the next section by typing (CTRL + F) and searching for "iii." This is the first time that I have flown on Air Transat and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised! I expected the flight to be packed full, everyone jammed in together to maximize revenue but that didn't seem to be the case. On the way down we upgraded to "Club" class (Business Class) for $99/person. The upgrade to the Club class seats were well worth the money! The services that are offered in the Club class section of the aircraft rival any other North American full service business class service. The large leather seats are arranged in a 2-3-2 formation compared to 2-4-2 in economy. There are no PTV's, it is still a shared TV system which is no big deal (you should have your own entertainment anyways). Services offered in Club include complimentary newspaper, amenity kit, and full meal with china plates. The service was excellent, once again, I have to highly recommend it to anyone who has the means to take it. (iii.) Arrival at Cancun Airport Note: This still pertains somewhat to the Transat Holidays package. Feel free to skip to section iv if you so choose. I've travelled to Mexico over half a dozen times and know the drill. Get off the plane, go through immigration (where the officer didn't even speak to us...), get your baggage, wait in line to have your luggage scanned on the way out, and wait for your transfer to your hotel. It's pretty simple, but after a long day of traveling this process can set you up for disaster in your first impressions of the country and hotel when you finally arrive. Upon deplaning, make sure you go DIRECTLY to Immigration/Migracion. I've witnessed the ground staff opening the door to the departures hall and asking people to make their way by themselves. Most of the time people are very confused/don't care and just walk around to see the shops and buy stuff they don't need. Don't be the persons who holds up the bus because you wanted to buy some trinket. Follow the signs on the ceiling that take you to Immigration and get the process started. Once Immigration is cleared and you have your bags you will walk the long hallway to make your way outside. Once outside, this is where you will meet your tour operator's representative, car rental companies, ground transportation, or family. This is where Transat made their first mistakes. Being one of the first from our flight to leave the arrivals hall we found the woman holding the "Transat Holidays" sign and clipboard. We verified that we were on her list, she motioned towards our bags and said "let my friend help you with your bags". Being a seasoned traveler, I can't believe we fell for it but we did. A man wearing a white shirt and black pants (along with his co-workers) were working with our representative to get tips from travellers by taking their bags and moving them a few meters down the concrete. I'm not saying a few meters to be dramatic. Literally, he wheeled our bags about 10 meters to a "holding point" nearby. This made me VERY upset. We watched other people as they fell for the same trap, if they didn't tip the person who carried their bags they would just stand there until they got the picture. Unbelievable that the agent would do this. She is representing Transat Holidays and probably made a little cash from her referral services. Bottom line, do not let go of your bags. The second problem was the ride itself. Where was our transportation? Nobody really knew. The Transat representative told us to talk to someone wearing a red shirt who would just keep saying "yes, ok on the way" and "Azul Fives is only 5 minutes away!". 1, no it was not on the way. 2, the Azul Fives was more like 45 minutes away. People were starting to get 'upset', which is a PC way of putting it. After waiting for 45 minutes for our van to show up at the airport, they brought 12 people over to a 9 passenger van. Well, this wasn't going to work; which it didn't. The driver shooed 3 people away back to the curb to wait for another mode of transport. Luckily, it wasn't me or anyone else in my party. It's almost 10PM and all that people want to do is get to the hotel and get some sleep but before this happens the driver and man in the red coat needed to have a leisurely chat for 10 minutes. This entire ordeal took just over an hour to finish up. Unbelievable. iv. Arrival at Azul Fives The 45 minute ride to the Azul Fives was uneventful and safe enough. After driving down a secondary road to the hotel, we pulled in the drive and were there. One of the most notable differences that was noticed was that the hotel didn't have a guard shack or security before you were admitted to the property. A little bit strange as the other 2 hotels that we let people off at previously both had large shacks (as did all of the other hotels which we had visited in the past in numerous countries). But who cares, we're on vacation and it looks great! Right away you could see that the hotel is designed with modernity in mind. Large 2 story windows were present all around the front lobby as the van came to a stop at the front doors. As other reviewers have commented, the lobby is small by comparison to other resorts in Mexico. The only real reason you would be in the lobby during your entire vacation would be to check-in and out, talk to the tour operators, or arrange a ride to the City. So really, it serves it's purpose and looks good doing so. Greeted by the receptionist, we were invited to sit down while we checked in. A warm welcome was extended and welcome Champagne was offered along with a cool Aloe towel. Very nice touches! While nobody in our party opted for the Champagne everyone went for the cool towel. Very refreshing! Following the paperwork we were handed a booklet and given a brief overview of the hotel, key locations, and services provided. With that said and done it was time to get to the room! The property is very large and set away from the beach (more on the beach later) with accommodations spread out into 13 different villas numbered 1-14 (no unlucky 13). The hotel has large golf carts prepared to assist people traveling to their rooms with a quick and easy ride. Our accommodation was in villa 11 located right beside the lobby within a very quick walking distance. The bellman grabbed out bags and began walking us to our 1 bedroom suite. v. 1 Bedroom Suite It is now past 11PM and we're finally unlocking the door to our room. I'm so excited to get into bed after a long day. After climbing the dark staircase to the second floor we were at the doorway to our room. Like other hotels, the Fives set up it's rooms so that there was a first set of doors that had the room number 11XX and once inside that door there were two different doors that went into either suite 1 or 2 (both separate). The door opened to our room and we were greeted to the 1 bedroom suite... ...and a lizard on the wall. I looked at the other people in my party and pointed at the lizard that was now moving along the wall and made some pretty shocked exclamations. The bellman just goes "no, no!" and continues to wheel our bags in and show us the room. He never ended up looking for it, someone else had to while he watched from a safe distance. Turns out that "IF" there was one, it went into a hole at the "L" section between the cupboards. Huh. Back to the room. The room itself was very nicely appointed and was again, very modern. When you walk into the suite you are greeted by the large kitchen which featured what looked to be granite countertops, dark coloured cabinets, and stainless steel appliances. The kitchen also provided an island with the same counters and cabinetry. Very nice! To the left of the main doorway into the room was a bathroom. Inside the bathroom there was a modern looking sink, mirror and toilet. There was a problem with the plumbing in the toilet which forced it to continuously fill the bowl with water. It was very loud and annoying. It forced us to have the door closed to the bathroom anytime that we were in the room in order to muffle the sound. Moving into the room there was a dining room table with a very unique looking light fixture above it. On the table was a welcome bottle of Champagne in an ice bucket and some fruit. I say fruit because "fresh fruit" would be untrue. It had clearly been sitting there for a while and had some pretty serious bruises the Pear and Apple that were on the plate. No big deal, if I want fruit I'll get it at the restaurant. Past the dining room table was a large creme coloured L-shaped couch. In our tour of the room the bellman showed us that the second bed was a pull out couch within the sofa. Not surprisingly, when it was set up it showed that the mattress was max 5cm thick and very uncomfortable. The pull out couch remained out for the remainder of the stay as we needed both beds set up for sleeping. There was also a large-ish TV that the couch faced. To the right of the living room area were two sliding doors that revealed the master bedroom and bathroom. Directly facing the sliding doors was the king sized bed. I really, really, really hoped that the bed wasn't hard as a rock as all of the other beds in Mexico seemed to be. Unfortunately, it lived up to it's expectations of being hard as a rock even with an added layer of padding. Too bad. Inside the bedroom there was another TV facing the bed that initially didn't work but finally figuring out that there were heavily damaged cable wires on the back that had to be jostled in order for the TV to even turn on solved the problem. Another issue with the bedroom was the curtains. The windows that look out onto the balcony are wall-to-wall while the curtains stop short of the wall. You could see where other tenants used their own tape or fasters to fix the curtains to the wall so that people couldn't see in. The uncovered area is very small (around 1cm) which didn't bother me but to privacy conscious people it could be a problem. It did become an issue when using the shower as it is open to the bedroom. If someone were to have the means to, they could look in. This is something that they should really consider taking a look at. To the right of the bed (from the doorway perspective) was the bathroom which was completely open to the bedroom. The bathroom featured a large jacuzzi tub, separate standing shower, double sink vanity, and separate toilet. There were dozens of bathing related amenities set out for use by the guests which looked to be high end by the looks of the packaging but turned out to be lower quality product in the end. When you look at reports on TripAdvisor about the hotel there is a focus by many people that "there is no hot water". I take long showers which will drain from any resources that the facility provides most of the time lasting more then 20 minutes. From what I experienced, they realize that it is an issue and are working to fix the situation. Only once during the 14+ showers I took at the hotel was there a dip in the hot water to where it was warm. It wasn't an issue at all. The reason that I say that they are on top of the problem is that on one of the days they had a golf cart full of new water heaters that were being installed throughout the resort. If you experience an issue, I believe that they are working to correct it. vi. Restaurants We knew going in that the resort only had 3 restaurants at the time of arrival. The choices were Buffet (Flavours), Pan-Asian (Tsuki), and Mediterranean (Sea Olive). During out stay the staff were preparing the 4th restaurant, an Italian Restaurant, for opening during their first busy season. Breakfast is only available at Flavours buffet restaurant. Compared to other massive resorts such as Riu, Iberostar, and Dreams the experience was lacklustre. The buffet itself is smaller than the fruit display at a Riu buffet and had little choice that did not change throughout our entire stay. The food was good, but repetitive and lacked any change. Flavours One night we decided to try Flavours dinner buffet and see what it was like. We have never had such a bad meal at a resort since we were in Cuba over 10 years ago. The food was cold, there was no selection, and for an "American Night" there was no "American" food in sight. Very disappointing. We never returned to Flavours for any meal other than breakfast every morning. That experience leads me to the next restaurant. After not even finishing one plate of food we went down to the Sea Olive restaurant to look at the menu. At first we were very skeptical seeing dishes like "Squid Ink Pasta". The restaurant manager noticed our looks of dismay and heard about our experience at Flavours a little bit earlier. He pulled us aside and extended an offer to us to go upstairs to the currently closed Italian restaurant to take part in a private tasting. We accepted and headed up to the restaurant. Arezzo (Italian Restaurant) Nobody had ever been to a chef's tasting before and didn't know what to expect. The Maitre D (I don't know how to do the special spelling or symbols for the name, sorry) took our room card for verification and sat us at a table by the window. It was a very cool experience! We were the only people in the restaurant except for the staff who were in training and a table of 6 resort managers. The Corporate Chef came to our table to thank us for coming and told us how the process would work. Essentially, they make plates that are on the menu and kept bringing it to our table. Before the events started the local chef came by the table and introduced herself and re-iterated what was going to happen. It was AWESOME! At first we would eat the entire plate and wait for the next one but after 6 half-sized portions passed by our table we realized that that tactic wouldn't work. We switched to eating a little of everything. All of the food was amazing! It definitely made up for the awful experience at Flavours earlier. The Corporate Chef was all over the resort making sure that the food was up to his standards and would come over and personally great us whenever he had the chance. Very good customer-staff rapport. Sea Olive (Mediterranean) While on the first time we looked at the dinner menu and were worried that there would be nothing that anyone would like to eat it was time to give it a try. Once we sat down and took a closer look at the menu there were tons of different options to chose from that weren't swimming in squid ink. In the 3 times that we ate at Sea Olive for dinner I tried the steak, and variations of pasta. All of the food that came to the table was delicious, fresh, and just right. Sea Olive is one of the 2 restaurants that are open for lunch. The food that is served at lunch is also fantastic. Everyone in our party commented that the food in the sit down restaurants were by far some of the best that we ever had, no questions asked. Tsuki (Pan-Asian) The food at Tsuki looked way too crazy for us, we did not eat at this restaurant. Please consult another review for information. Burger Boutique For lunch the other option was something called the Burger Boutique. It was situated on the patio outside the Sea Olive and Tsuki restaurants. In the first few days we were at the resort it was only a gourmet burger and light snack bar which was really fantastic. The burgers were big, fresh, and cooked right. There were about 8 different burger variations on the menu that were cooked to order. Everything was phenomenal! However, halfway through our vacation we started noticing some professional corporate staff start to show up at the restaurants. It turned out that the Food & Beverage manager for the Karisma chain and another high-up from Corporate supervising the restaurants. he came by and introduced himself, very nice guy who would always check up to make sure all of the food we were eating was just right (which it always was). The high-ups were at the resort to supervise the opening of the new Italian restaurant and the change-over of the Burger Boutique to a buffet style BBQ styled restaurant. The change seemed to remove burgers from the menu and it moved towards a bbq meat and fish buffet restaurant. On the first day of the changeover the staff were kind of confused and didn't understand the new menu. This is where the F&B manager came by and told us what was going on and that they were working to make everything work. We didn't care that it took a little more time than usual, we're on vacation! It all turned out well in the end and they were good to go from there on out. Once again, the food at the BBQ and Burger Boutique were fantastic! The only complaint that we had was the dinner buffet which we only stayed at for less then 5 minutes. Everyone should enjoy the sit-down restaurants without a doubt. vii. Pools The resort has 3 pools. Two of the pools are massive and snake through the villas. Unfortunately, both of them were bitterly cold. While it isn't surprising that the pools weren't heated it made it difficult for myself to justify going in past my ankles. Lap swimmers were in heaven when they could swim for probably 250m from end to end of the snaking pools. For kids though, it didn't seem to stop them. Down by the beach there is an infinity pool that was also quite cold that I didn't go into. Numerous different activities took place in the infinity pool throughout the day. Both pools are very nice and cleaned on a daily basis. The infinity pool unfortunately had a pounding speaker that would be on from 10 in the morning until after we left the beach for the day at 3. Kind of annoying. If you are a pool person you should enjoy any of the 3 options which you have at the Fives. The snaking pools had lots of chairs available and nobody who was using them while at the infinity pool there were not too many chairs that were mostly filled by families viii. Bars Our party does not consist of any drinkers which meant that we didn't try out many of the bars on the resort. The only one which we went to regularly was the beach/infinity pool bar to get Pina Colodas. All of the drinks that they made were fantastic. No complaints whatsoever! For the beach bar there was a waitress that would regularly come around and take drink orders and pick up used cups. Great service, always got the order right and in made sure they came in a timely manner. ix. Beach We spent all of the time outside of the room on the beach. The beach was somewhat small compared to other mega resorts but had an appropriate amount of space for all of the guests to enjoy. One of the coolest things that the resort had were "Beach Beds". They were mattresses that were so much more comfortable than the mattresses in the rooms that would swing back and forth in the wind. On the first day we went over and sat on one of them but were greeted by the beach butler who said that that particular one was reserved.
