I had to move to a different one which he said was unreserved. It was so comfortable and relaxing! The only problem was that there seemed to be a reservation system that revolved around tips. As the resort got busier it was less and less likely you would be able to "reserve" a bed. With the politics of the beach beds behind us, the rest of the week was spent on the lounge chairs on the beach. There are tons of different options at the beach: under the palm trees, under a shader, or in the direct sun. Anywhere you choose to sit will have fine beach sand with just a few rocks buried under the top layer. x. Ocean As with other reviews, I can confirm that the ocean is very rocky and nearly impossible to go into right in front of the resort. For the 7 days that we were at the resort there was a red flag stating that you were not to go into the ocean. If you travel down the beach to the hotel next door you will be able to find some less rocky conditions and easier access conditions. xi. Conclusion & Notes One thing that was very interesting was the load factor of the hotel. When we checked in, we curiously asked the receptionist how full the hotel was, to which she answered 50%. Everyone at the resort told us on numerous occasions that the resort was at 50% capacity. it was simply untrue. The first few days the resort was a ghost town with no more then 50 people out on the property at any given time. We ran into the same few groups of people numerous times during the day. In reality when we spoke to the corporate staff later that week they corrected the staff's earlier statements by saying that the first 2 days that we were at the resort it was only at 20% capacity. Service at 20% was amazing! The corporate staff also told us that this was the first holiday/high season that the resort has seen as it is under 1 year old and that they were ensuring that everything was going to run well. They were going to be at 93% capacity on the day that we departed. Service throughout the week remained consistent with a few slowdowns but otherwise had no issues. With Transat Holidays, I was very happy with their air product but not pleased with their ground transportation arrangements. I would however recommend a holiday with Transat as for the most part everything went well. In conclusion, everyone enjoyed their time at the Azul Fives. At the end of the trip we were keen on returning to the Fives or any of the other hotels in the Azul portfolio. I hope the information that I have provided in this review is helpful. If you have any further questions please send me a direct message and I will try to get back to you with an answer on what I experienced. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: alex m
Reviews.Content: How do we feel? We would go back in an instant!!!! This place is one of the best. Anyway, The buildings are separated and in beautiful gardens foliage/trees that really help give an relaxed appeal to the resort, there runs a huge pool right to the center of the property in between the buildings, you can really have a exercise swim going from one swim up to the other. The wide range of menus from the various restaurants was awesome, I can bet you that you will find your favorite and one not so much. the bars have all the top brands that can come to your mind.The attention and interest of the staff is amazing. The grounds are clean and very well maintained. From the beach you look straight at the island of Cozumel. This is one of the few resorts that have staff on the beach taking care of you. I don't want to say the same thing that others have... but as far as I am concerned... out of 10+ cruises and almost as many AI resorts around the Caribbean... this is head and shoulders above all others.

Reviews.Title: “There is the best and the is the rest!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy w
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST! This place is magic. The beach and main pool area were pristine, the service and attention to detail were spot-on. A wide variety restaurants are very well apointed with beautifull decors, being a restaurant owner in NY I can say that the food was absolutely delicious, the service is attend and extreemly friendly. During the day they have a terrificopen air grill with outstanding food easy acces in swimwear. The rooms are comfortable big and spacious. Our first all inclusive vacation but I can tell you this the fives errased the paradigm we had about all inclusive. We rarely visit the same place twice, but we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives by Karisma sucks”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy1123
Reviews.Content: This place sucks. A/C doesn't work in room. Sweating like a pig right now. The food at one restaurant was pathetic. Mahi Mahi on pasta... the fish was dry and way WAY overcooked, rotini noodles with crappy sauce and pretty much tasteless. The service is okay - the staff tries to be attentive and help you with what they can, which ain't much as it turns out. AVOID. John

Reviews.Title: “Trip with 15 month old”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience at the Azul Fives was very good. We stayed in a 2bedroom penthouse suite. While we didn't use the rooftop deck much at all, the extra space within the room was great. The room was spacious and clean for the most part. The fridge was stocked most days. They do have 2 size cribs so make sure you ask REPEATEDLY for the larger one. The food was better than normal for Mexico. Not a ton of choices but overall good quality and very good service. They cater well to young families with babies. Don't underestimate the "food display" otherwise known as a buffet, at Flavours. It's much better than we expected. The other restaurants are also nice. They have plenty of toys and highchairs. Azulitos is great for the little ones. Plenty of toys for babies and toddlers. Staff in general are super friendly! The hotel is spaced out so definitely bring your stroller as its a ten minute walk to get from a room to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Food and service five stars”
Reviews.Author: Jforsyth85
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazing, the drinks were great and the food was so far above any of the resorts we have been too. Five stars! Ps. The Italian restaurant above the sky bar is a gem. The food is fresh thoughtful, and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of fresh air!!”
Reviews.Author: raptorsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Azul Fives from Dec 15-18th, after spending a not-so-great week at the Azul Beach. It was such a great and wonderful surprise to enter this resort after the experience at their resort up the road. We booked this resort through Hotwire, so we didn't know where we would end up...I'm glad we did it that way. If we knew ahead of time we were going to another Azul, we probably would have cancelled, due to the experience at "beach". From the time we entered the lobby and given sparkling wine and a cold cloth, we knew we were in for a treat. To our surprise they upgraded us to the penthouse suite, which was absolutely breathtaking. The staff were so friendly & eager to please. What can I say about the food...AMAZING!!!! It was so fantastic...the new Italian restaurant Azzuro opened the first night we arrived, so we had to try it....it was unbelievable. The head chef made sure to visit our table, including ours, and we made sure to let her know how happy we were to be at such a wonderful place...we did tell her we had a bad experience at the "beach" and she was sure to pass on the info to the executive chef who was on the premises that evening.... All the food we had during our stay was fantastic, no complaints. The sky bar, which became adults only after 10 was a nice treat after dinner. The resort does cater to families, but I never felt it was overrun with children. The pool by the Iguana bar seemed to be a nice escape for adults. We really loved our stay at the Fives, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghPhil70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at here on a site inspection for future groups and meetings. I don't like condos, but this one had the feel of a hotel, which means more conveniences like restauranrs and bars. Everyone was very courteous and thoughtful. The one bedroom condo was 1200 sq.ft. with a full kitchen (Coffee & maker inc.), living room, and double sink bedroom. We had a patio that was 10 feet from the immemse meandering pool in which one guest was swimming the length of every morning. The pool also had a pool bar and eatery with hot and cold snack (hamburgers,etc.) food with waiter service. The beach area was well kept (except to the left of the property line-other hotel) and the infinity pool leading to the beach was well designed, with waiter service and a nice restaurant right next to it...more convenience. I recommend Azul five for business meetings (excellent food and food displys in the meeting rooms), and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Baby Friendly Resort, small annoyances”
Reviews.Author: tdd1111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 14 month old just returned from the Azul Fives. This resort is smaller in size (300ish) rooms, which was nice as was not a sprawling mega resort where all you did was walk everywhere. Ive detailed some items below. Baby Friendly: Resort provided crib, stroller, baby monitor, and toy lending program. All restaurants have booster/high chairs. The kids club is fantastic, as is the babysitting. The sitters are excellent with children, and we had no issue leaving our little for for a few hours. The kids club did have a nice nice gym area, but it is a pay for use area. You can also get baby food in the restaurant, plus an extensive kids menu. Rooms: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which included a full kitchen, dining and living room area. The room was modern, and provided ample space for everyone. The kitchen proved to be very useful with our little one, as there was a fridge we could put milk etc in, an a sink where we could wash bottles etc. The bedroom was nice to have separated as we could put our daughter down, in one area, and we could watch TV etc in the bedroom. The bed is very FIRM, I found it to be extremely uncomfortable, but I do enjoy a more plush bed. We did have a problem with tiny ants coming in through a window near the soaker tub, I did complain about this as this is where we wanted to give our daughter a bath, but was told due to it being a tropical environment, and people having food in the room it is difficult to keep them out. I was not entirely impressed with this answer. They offered to fumigate, but I declined due to our daughter. A full size crib was provided for our daughter, although I heard others comment they received a half size crib. Either way its nice to have a real crib. Restaurants/Food/Drink - Overall the food quality was quite good. The buffet restaurant had a changing theme each night. During lunch only Sea Olive and Boutique Burger were open, which was a bit of a limited selection. You do not need to make reservations at all, which is nice. Each restaurant also provided high chairs and booster chairs for the children. We had some of our best meals at Sea Olive. Others have commented the room service menu is sparse, which is true, but anything we asked for was delivered, so you may just need to ask. Drinks were always very good, with no shortage of booze..I must comment that service in the a la cartes is painfully slow at times, especially with a baby. Not quite sure why, they seemed to be staffed well. I should mention there is a great smoothie/juice bar in the same building as the Vassa Spa. We were there each day for a delicious smoothie, but it did not seem to be very busy, and I do not think many people know about it. Do yourself a favor and find it. Pool/Beach/Ocean: 3 pools, 2 winding which snake around all the buildings (Try and get a poolside room) and 1 infinity pool at the Beach Club. All are beautiful, none are heated so in December its a bit chilly, even for this Canadian. The beach is very nice with lots of chairs, and beach beds. The ocean is not swim able, due to extensive rock/coral. For us it was not an issue as we were not going into the ocean anyway, but if your an ocean lover, it will be difficult for you, or a 10 min walk to a point where you can get in. They have beach drink service as well. Entertainment:During the day an extensive array of programs exists around the resort, and there seemed to be no shortage of things to do. During the evening,there are shows at 9:30pm each night which we never took advantage of due to our daughter needing to sleep early. The main lounge is called the Zky bar, which overlooks the Ocean, it looked very cool, although we also did not partake. Overall, to me the resort seemed quiet at night, which was absolutely perfect for us, but in fairness there could have been more action around the beach club/Zky Bar which we never saw. In any case, no yelling drunks at 3am was a very big plus with a baby. Service: Overall service was great. Room was cleaned each day without issue. In fact one day even with a privacy please sign out, someone tried to come in. This was a bit of an annoyance as the baby was sleeping. The restaurant servers and hostesses were great, you can tell they take pride in what they do. They only negative is the slower service at the a la cartes, I did lose my camera on our last day there, and left my email, to date I have not heard anything, but hope they contact me. Spa: We did an 80min massage at Vassa, which was beautiful. My wife and I have been to spas around the world, and this one of the better ones. If you book a 50min or greater treatment, a free hydrotherapy session is given, which is a 6 step process. Cool shower, Steam Room, Dry Sauna, Cold water plunge, and hottub. It was great and definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, almost, but not quite yet.....”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaStamp
Reviews.Content: It's new, it's modern and contemporary and has the most beautiful pools and suites. It's a small, all inclusive resort, close to Playa del Carmen (15 mins & $15 in a cab) but we stayed as owners within the timeshare there - so that meant we got a few extras that DON'T COME AS STANDARD FOR USUAL GUESTS. We got the private butler, the free wi fi, the fully stocked bar with premium litre alchohol, the extra attentive staff - all remembering your name and rushing to help, the service - and that was lovely. Compared to some of the other resorts we've been to, it is a little small with only one bar open and it currently had only three restaurants open in the evening too although a new Italian restaurant was opening on 5 December. There are plenty of pool bars (4 I think) also open during the day, and serving food in some too. Overall, I think the restaurant and food choices could improve - the Oriental restaurant was excellent and breakfast was very good, but dinner options were limited. However, this will change with the new Italian choice and as the resort gets more established. There's a spa and a gym although I didn't use either, my friends and husband did and said they were great. Overall, I would go back as an owner.

Reviews.Title: “Bar tenders, Restaurant, & Front desk STOLE from us - KEEP YOUR RECEIPTS & CALL YOUR CREDIT CARD COMPANY ASAP.”
Reviews.Author: Tom02020
Reviews.Content: The pool and beach are great, there are a few honest and genuinely friendly staff, and some nice rooms, but I would never stay here again. If you do go get the all-inclusive. I went here because my brother had his wedding here -- I just got back yesterday. My girlfriend and I did not sign up for all-inclusive and paid for everything ourselves. We did not receive one bill that did not have extras on it. One bartender took my girlfriends room key and wouldn't give it back insisting that she had an earlier drink that was not paid for and then that he wanted to leave it open. They actually charged me extra for drinks at one dinner using a vodka they don't even stock at the resort at all. We kept all our reciepts after the first time we stopped at the bar and they added two bogus drinks to our bill. This occurred in every bar and restaurant we attended at this place. We got to the front desk and even though we let them know we have all of our receipts they still presented us with a phoney bill. The front desk acutally went through their copy of the signed receipts and pretended to check them off of their list of bills to charge us. I almost fell for it .. they simply checked a couple that they themselves didn't have a bill for at all (niether did we in our copies co-incidentally). Then when we left they accidentaly printed us a copy of the bill with inflated prices on every item on the original bill bringing the total to $150 more than we spent. This was not a mistake -- the staff here has a quota and they are required to steal from you. I have not ever dealt with so many slimeballs in one place in my life. This above is my primary complaint - but we also had to change rooms a few times, because the first one had a leak - water was coming through the light fixtures in the ceiling from the unit above. And every room on the ground level smelled like mold and sulphur. This place has serious plumbing issues. Overall my memory is good of the pool and the beach - pretty much those parts of the trip that were not ruined by the staff at this pathetic place.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card with the front desk!!!”
Reviews.Author: dakiki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our two children (2&8) and my mother. We arrived on Nov11 and Departed on the the 14-long weekend stay. This is our 7th time to Mexico and have travelled to Costa Rica, Dominican, Chile, Europe etc...... In all our travels, not once have we ever been worried about giving our credit card to the front reception to pay for our stay at a five star resort. What I have to say, out weighs any good experience we had for the long weekend. My husband's credit card number was taken and several purchases were made long after we arrived back home and until the month of December. Beware with the front desk and how they handle your credit card. I do not enjoy writing this post but I feel obligated to warn fellow travellers. Hopefully the owner of Karisma will see to it that their employees at the front desk are checked on and the bad ones are removed. It is pretty sad that in today's time when jobs are difficult to come by, that one would jeopardize this opportunity to be employed. When I called the hotel to inform them about the incident, I was told, " that can't be possible". This is not an appropriate way to handle a customer's concern. I for one will never return to Azul fives and nor will I recommend this hotel. I will say this for the remainder of the employees, the staff in the restaurant, pool area etc.. were very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “You can't please everyone all the time”
Reviews.Author: 20darh20
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Azul Fives this week. Some times things are better than you expected, other times not so much. At first arrival we were a little disappointed, of course comparing the resort to the one we usually go to. BUT, we spent 10 days at Azul Fives, and for the most part it was great. One must remember to not be narrow minded, and be positive. We found the food for the most part 5 star. The portions are smaller, thus giving us a chance to try more courses, there is a great menu choice. The service in one of the resturants was only fair, however it wasn't like we had anyplace we had to be, so time shouldn't be a factor. The only two complains we had, one being our safe need to be decoded, and lack of water one day, these were dealt with immediately. The bartender DOMINGO- at the Lizard lounge made our vaction, he was fun, and he totally enjoys his job, we just can't say enough good things about him. Also the butler at the main pool- HUGO was gracious, always a smile with warm greeting. Telling us he is getting married in May to a Canadian girl, how great is that? We were a little diappointed with the two double beds in the room, but having our own beds turned out fine. The fact there were a lot of families with very young children concerned us in the beginning, however we ended up finding a area by the Lizard Lounge where there was just couples,this ended up in a little party evey afternoon. Yes, there were some parents that seemed to think it was OK to make there little 3 yr olds wait until 8PM to eat dinner, and yes they were crying, but that can go on in Calgary also. Like one guest reminded me, you may have crying children during the day, but they don't stay up all night and party until 3AM. Once again you can't have it both ways. Over all we had a great vacation, met some great people, and are a little sad that our vaction is over. One last note: Playa del Carmen is ONLY a hour 15 minute walk down the beach, try the walk it's great. Cab back at only $15. We found the beach a great walk in both directions. We walked at least 2 1/2 hours everyday.

Reviews.Title: “NOT PERFECT BUT ALMOST”
Reviews.Author: Julielesyeuxbleus
Reviews.Content: We went to the Azul fives from Nov 26th to Dec 3rd 2011 and it was a very pleasant trip. It was our first time with our 16 months old baby and I have to admit that the Azul have everything for family with young children. We moved from a Deluxe room to a one bedroom suite because there were not enough space for a family of 3. A big difference and worth the $$. If you are travelling with baby, believe me, you really need the one bed room suite. The only thing that we found annoying was the communication with the resort. We requested a crib but we received it 3 days after we arrived. Also, the resort have missed the baby food and we were really upset with the situation. But we have to thank all the staff for their patience, everyone was so nice. We went to the timeshare presentation because we had a interest but without pressure. The kid's club is super and the food was also a big + for us. Yes, we recommand the Azul and we definitively go back to the Azul!

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina S
Reviews.Content: It was our very first trip with our baby boy and I was really nervous about taking him out of the country. This hotel was made for people like us,they have thought of everything that you can imagine to make a family’s stay really comfortable. Our room even had a kitchen and they gave us a crib, babymonitor and stroller for us to use. Everything was new, clean and way up to my personal standards as a first time mom. The staff was so cute with him, always wanting to make him smile. We took advantage of the babysitting service offered(only $15 an hour) and even got to have a dinner on our own which was so amazing. The hotel wasn’t very full and the staff knew we were out on a“romantic’’ night and they made it very special. I was so relaxed that I even splurged for a massage which was so worth it. The spa was like nothing I’ve ever seen before with high ceilings and dark wood accents, very calming. I have to say that this is perfect for families and couples looking for a romantic escape, we can’t wait to come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time @ azul 5”
Reviews.Author: Calero919
Reviews.Content: Have been to many all inclusive up and down the coast of Riviera Maya and this one is a winner all the way. Restaurants are top notch food, they have different options for dining and they aren’t all buffets which is the usual. You can even get a nice bottle of wine from a wine list (hadn’t seen that many times before). We really enjoyed the room service as we had a lazy day and stayed in watching TV all day. The staff is eager to please, the location is perfect and the rooms are huge, definitely splurge and get a 1 bedroom suite, have never seen anything like it and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gonegrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives from Nov 26 to Dec 3 in a 2 bedroom penthouse suite. The room was fantastic except for the firmness of the beds. We were travelling with our 24 yr old and 4.5 yr old. It was great for the kids to have their own room yet be with us. The penthouse was nice but we truly did not use it as much as I thought we might. Armando and Dario at Flavors were our favourite staff. Armando took great care of us and dinner and Dario at breakfast. Hugo by the pool is great as well, all the staff seem to work very hard and be happy to be there. The pool by the beach was very nice and we loved the beach beds as well. We booked this hotel mainly for the room and the kids club and we didn't end up using the kids club at all, we had too much fun with our 4 yr old at the pool and beach. We were in Villa 11 which was a little too far from the beach for our liking and when we asked at check in if we could be closer to the beach, we were told the only villas with penthouse suites were in 1 or 11, once we were up on the penthouse this is not true so I'm not sure what the story is there. I liked that the music at the pool seemed to stay fairly mellow and that I was only approached in person once about the "travel club". We were left some notes in our room about it but there was no pressure. The resort is pretty laid back, if you are looking for wild night life and pool life this is not the place. If you want a nice relaxing beach vacation with a super firm bed and good food, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, even for kid-free couples!”
Reviews.Author: Lizardo23
Reviews.Content: PROS: A La Carte food menu, generous amount of alcohol in drinks, Michael Jackson show, service with a smile, canopied beach beds, morning yoga, cleanliness, gym, green juice at breakfast, Grouper and Risotto at Green Olive, abundance of beach chairs/beds. CONS: Cab-ride to airport is either $50 USD or 500 pesos (equal to $38 USD... so keep some pesos 'til your last day, or change the equivalent at the front desk), Staffing deficiency at Green Olive restaurant makes service slow, minibar and shampoo/soap was not replenished, rocky beach, ID cards given back to another couple, lack of room service menu and resort amenities binder in-room. I stayed at Azul Fives with my fiance; we booked it on hotwire, and after realizing it was a kid-friendly resort, approached it with trepidation, but quickly realized that the kids are all well taken care of, and having children around kept things lively. ROOM: Very clean, in-room safe, comfortable beds, tastefully furnished open-concept design. Nearing the end of our trip, we made friends with another couple, and it came out that they had a binder detailing the resort's classes, amenities, and room service menu. Since this was our first all-inclusive visit, we did not know to ask for this, and realized that we missed out on the smoothie bar, bingo, cooking lessons... Also, the housekeeper did not restock the mini-bar, nor soap/shampoo for the entire duration of our stay (5 days). FOOD: Food is GREAT, albeit SLOW at Green Olive. One evening, after sitting at our table for 20 minutes, we had to ask the hostess if we had been allocated a waiter. During the same meal, it took 1 hr and 20 minutes to receive our entrees. I have to lament that the STAFF IS AMAZING, but there is clearly a serious staffing deficiency. That same night, an entire table of guests left after not being served for 20 minutes; the same table made a heated complaint to the hostess in the presence of other guests, which was deserved, although uncomfortable and awkward for everybody else. I noticed 3 other parties inquiring when they would receive service. It is important that I state that the staff is working its but off, but it's easy to see that they are stressed, which when perceived by the guest, makes things unpleasant. I have concerns regarding Azul Fives staffing issues. The bartenders are generous with the booze - in fact, I had to ask for half alcohol hat times!! Buy, hey - can't complain! The morning buffet is wonderful, with anything you can imagine. Ask for the green juice - super healthy! I experienced the room service menu on one occasion - it was ok... however, I noticed some deficiencies during my trip in food presentation, ex: I ordered beef fajitas, but they did not give any tortillas. At Tzuki, I ordered bacon-covered scallops, but only received scallops. Upon ordering green-tea tiramisu, received regular chocolate tiramisu. All-in-all, the food was great, and I was pleased with my experience. I absolutely love the ceviche at Lizard's. KEY-CARDS: Although they are a great concept, the picture taken by the front desk is very dark. Basically, it is easy to mix one couple up for another. This happened to us - unbeknownst to us, we were given back another couples card. We didn't know this, and when we presented our card at a restaurant, the other couple happened to be in front of us, and asked, 'why do you have our card?' This was embarrassing, but quickly remedied by the front desk, although it was never discovered where that original card went. BEACH/POOL: We got a beach bed facing the ocean each day. We got there around 1100, and it was no issue. Hugo is fantastic and welcoming. The beach in front of Azul Fives is very rocky. Despite having water shoes on, my fiance received some cuts. This is easily avoided by walking down the beach, and swimming further down. The beach is very clean, and the view is SPECTACULAR! GYM/ACTIVITIES: I attended yoga/stretch each morning at 9 AM. It was basic yoga, and when overlooking the beach, was unforgettable. Lorena provides a class with a great workout. The gym is well-stocked with Lifestyle machines: 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 stepper, and 4 strengthening machines. Free weights increase by increments of 5 lbs. I made a vase at the ceramics stand next to the bar, and they detailed it and put it in the kiln, and it looks amazing. At first, I was skeptical, but it was money well spent! I am a little upset that I did not realize that there are so many activities throughout the day!! There is a sign near the pool - although it says Fisher Price on it, do not be fooled! It has adult activities on it like Spanish Lessons, Salsa dancing etc.. SHOWS: I really enjoyed the shows; they are for guys and girls alike. The Michael Jackson show was packed, so get there early, if you are inclined. The Karisma dancers were fantastic. SERVICE: Everybody here works very hard, and are always quick to greet guests with an 'Ola.' I cannot commend the workers enough. They made my experience unforgettable. I sure hope that the management shapes up, so the poor waiters aren't always run off their feet. TAXI: I left with a bad taste in my mouth, when the hotel taxi charged $50 USD or 500 pesos. Unless, you're a chump, you would know that 500 pesos is equivalent to $38. So, save yourself $12 and change your cash at the desk before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: barthols2
Reviews.Content: Pretty good, except the bed was no kidding, like a ROCK!!! Restaurants had good food, we didnt have to make reservations. There were just a few restaurants so it did get a little old in 2 weeks, maybe we should break up the vacation in 2 resorts instead of one.... Staff was good. It was smaller, we did like that, it wasnt over-run with tons of people. The kids club area our daughter loved. (note: dont play in the balls ... pee) Room service was nice but wished the menu was a little bigger. Nice pool, but the gift shop.... wow $90 for 3 smaller pool toys... now we carry them with us. If it wasnt for the rock beds we possibly stay here again. Oh yeah, dont count on privacy if you are traveling with children, the door to the bedroom is see-thru and so quiet you can hear them breathing....

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: GlenandTina
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a family destination wedding at the Azul Fives and I should preface this with our Mexican travel experience (10 trips) and preference not being all inclusives other than our daughters wedding at the Riu in Cancun. They seem good for weddings but not for those looking for Mexico. These are lovely places beautiful grounds, friendly service but oh so North American they could be anywhere. At any rate the Azul Fives was very nice. We had a pool side suite, very spacious great access and full service including 24 hr room service and with a one year old in tow this was helpful at 5 am to order breakfast. Very kid and family friendly and the wedding was handled impeccably by a lovely British woman who was on top of everything. All went without a hitch. Our only observation was the food was OK but a notch or two below the Riu in Cancun and oddly they charged $10/day for wireless Internet later to find out that using VIP for user name and password got you hooked up for free!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great for families with children, limited bars and restaurant choices”
Reviews.Author: xmaskutee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Azul Fives from 11/13 to 11/17 for our baby-moon. It's a small but modern hotel. During our stay, only 2 out of the 5 bars were open. 3 out of the 4 restaurants were open (one under renovation) and there is only 1 restaurant open for breakfast and 1 restaurant open for lunch so the selections were very limited. The staffs were very friendly and nice. The hotel is great for families with small children. They have a lot of toys around most public areas for kids to play and the toys were all sponsored by Fisher Price (include the high chairs and booster seats in the restaurants). The room are very spacious. Beach is a bit rocky so not ideal for swim or kids. I would recommend the hotel to families who wants a small vacation at a all inclusive. (side note: pillows were dirty. It was report and one of them were replaced the next day)

Reviews.Title: “Great all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: docboy711
Reviews.Content: Incredible all inclusive about a 10 min drive from the heart of playa del carmen, premiun rooms, food and liquor!! Very friendly staff!! Quiet a little off season, but we enjoyed the chill factor, and went downtown playa at night for more nightlife!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation, Cannot Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Rauncie
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Mexico and 3rd to the Mayan Riviera. We are a family of 5 with children ages 2, 7, and 10. A room to accomodate our family is important. The rooms at The Fives are spacious and very family friendly. There are TVs and DVD players in every room. When we arrived the toy rental program allowed toys in our room for our youngest. She was thrilled. Every restarant has an abundance of high chairs, and kids toys for entertainment while you wait for your meal. There were kids meals at every restaurant. Staff were very friendly. At times there were service delays. We recommend the buffet as we were able to get in and out faster with this kids. I am Celiac and follow a gluten free diet. They offered cooking on a separate grill often. What was amazing was the gluten free muffin / cake for breakfast. They had 3 kinds! Banana, Carrot and Orange. The orange was fabulous. This was above and beyond all my expectations. The spa was the highlight of our trip. I have never taken my boys but they were so excited to come I relented. They are high energy kids and I was sceptical. They set all 3 of us up in one room. There were small robes for the kids upon check in. They served tea and chocolate milk in a relaxation room before the service. The kids never said a word through the entire treatment. My 7 year old raved about it. I loved it. The kids club is very well set up. It has a gymnastics area from 9-10, hopefully they will extend the hours. It has a lego area, a small childrens area, a video game area with 3 different game systems. The staff were amazing. My 2 year old never leaves my side and was comfortable playing on her own for short times. The beach had a very small sand area where my 2 year old played. There is a beach restoration in the plans I understand. My 10 year old loved the coral and caught small fish with a net (bring one!), snails, hermit crabs, and other treasures! Everyone loved the pools. There are winding pools everywhere. Our favorite spot was in front of building 5 and 6 which had a pool where our 2 year old can walk in. It has a very gradual incline. The old kids could play further back and swim. She loved the shallow area. I loved that she cold play alone. I understand the infinity pool will be heated shortly. My kids would swim into the evening but I find it cool. This will be a great feature. There was an abundance of beach chairs at the beach and pools. We never had to "save" one which is often a problem. There are many canopy beach beds which was great for a tired 2 year old when the boys wanted to keep swimming. The hotel hardly mentions the cenote. It was very cool. We saw iguanas, geckos, turtles, and MONKEYS! They were so beautiful. The buffet restaurant surrounds a cenote and you can watch the beautifully lit trees in the evening, wildlife in the morning. There is a cenote in front of building 5. We saw a mom and baby monkey in the early afternoon while hanging out at the pool here. Our whole family would love to go back to The Fives.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing week at Azul Fives”
Reviews.Author: Clear898
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay at the Azul Fives and thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. The resort is beatifully maintained with modern, clean, and expansive suites. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which had plenty of room (more than we needed), an amazing rain shower, and a romantic jacuzzi tub. Bonus: Bring your iPod or DVDs, as they have iPod docks and a DVD player. The infinity pool overlooking the ocean was a wonderful place to spend to day. There are also a series of other large, well maintained pools that the suites overlook a little back from the beach if you want to enjoy a more secluded pool. The beach was white and sandy, and it was enjoy the late afternoon on one of the swinging beds. Although it is rocky in the water immediately fronting the resort, if you walk 100-200 metres to the north you can swim in a perfect sandy beach to fulfilll your ocean swim cravings. The a la carte restaurants were great, it made you feel like you weren't at a standard all-inclusive but a much higher end resort. Favorite foods included beef tenderloin at dinner, Yucatan seared shrimp for lunch, and chocolate fondant for dinner. The staff were always attentive and welcoming, making you feel at home and secure at the resort. I highly recommend this resort to any one looking for a relaxing, carefree, and upscale week in the sunny Mayan Riveria.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: feedthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Rooms: We had a 2 bedroom suite. The room was extremely clean with a full kitchen, 2 and a half bathrooms, living/dining area, and 3 balconies. Location: 45 mins from the Cancun Airport. Value: We were upgraded from another Azul property so I can't evaluate the price, only the experience. Reason for stars: Overall staff: everyone says "hola". It got tiring to respond after a while. The customer service in the restaurants: great. Food: Meats are not their forte. The presentation was very good but the actual execution in terms of taste was lacking a bit. Room cleaning staff: quick and thorough room service: food wasn't very good Beach: Rather small. Great for adults to sun bathe, but not as good for children to play on. Pools: They all had small wading areas for the kids. Kid's Services: They are great. They have a children's play room and games which was perfect for the infant/toddlers as well as teens. Overall: Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Kid Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: kim h
Reviews.Content: top choice resort for parents with young children (0-9). High end and mondern ammenities yet 100% kid friendly. Children are very welcome, all high chairs, booster seats, toys, etc are immaculate - the Azulitos kids club is very cool. the staff is the icing on the cake, courteous, friendly, and very welcoming, especially to the little ones. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip (Nov 2011) and will return soon - safety was never an issue nor a concern. Nice beach, awesome infinity pool and swim up bars. 1BR 1-1/2BA suites are very nice - modern and new and over 1,100sq ft. (SS appliances in a full kitchen - including dishwasher, granite counter tops, vessel sinks, tile shower, jacuzzi tub, and much more). GREAT food, 2 more restaurants opening by end of the year. this is a diamond in the rough, the staff makes it a step above it's competitors. i can't recommend it enough, especially if you have young child/children.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!!!!! Beautiful inside and Out.”
Reviews.Author: Octobersky1414
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives in November, 2011, we were there for a wedding that was at another resort. Azul Fives had a friendly staff, beautiful decor, pools throughout the resort, and a beautiful beach. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, it had a state-of-the-art kitchen, bathroom, livingroom, diningroom, and bedrooms. The rooms were spacious and decorated beautifully, with flat screen TV's, and ipod docs. The bathrooms had a large full glass shower, separate toilet stall, and double sinks in both rooms. The restaurants had great decor, good food, and friendly staff. The resort staff was very helpful, they helped with activities and transportation within Playa del Carmen. I will definately stay there again, I give it 5 STARS*****!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: GATTSMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Azul Fives with our children and friends for a long weekend. The hotel is about a 45 minute drive from the airport and you go down a long dirt road before you get there (a little scary - but OK when we got there). This is the low season for the resort, so some of the swim up pool bars and a restaurant were closed. Check in was fast – we were all provided with room keys with our picture on it rather than bracelets which proved to be a problem for us. We had lots of issues with our room keys not working and we had to call hotel maintenance several times. We stayed in a 3-bedroom penthouse suite in villa 3. The resort is laid out with the villa's overlooking pools - none on the ocean, but we were able to see the ocean from our penthouse. The penthouse had a hot tub (no hot water), lounge chairs, bed, grill, bar and bathroom, but we didn't spend much time there as we wanted to be down by the main pool and ocean most of the time. The food was good in all of the restaurants, but the service was slow in Flavours for dinner. Tsuki (the Japanese restaurant) is a must! There were daily activities by the main pool which also included a swim up bar. Our weather was great - but we just missed two weeks of rain preceding our trip and hurricane Rina the day after we left (make sure to buy trip insurance if you go during hurricane season!). There was a wedding on the beach next to our resort on Friday and lots of the guests ended up coming over to our resort and drinking at the all-inclusive pool bar. This caused issues for the guests at our resort the next day as we had to show our room key every time we went to the swim up bar for a drink (even though the bar tenders had been serving us for the past few days). The staff (Marisol and Hilaro) tried hard to entertain the few people in the Zky lounge in the evenings, but it was usually just us with all of our teenagers. We prefer more activity, but it could have just been the time of the year. The resort is beautiful, but we will probably try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort for families with great food and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Gemma L
Reviews.Content: We returned from a trip to Azul Fives in October 2011 and it was an amazing experience. I work for a travel company in England, which only sells the top 5* hotels within Europe (I also have visited over 200 5* hotels for my job, so I have a good idea what should be expected!) and I would say the Azul Fives was as good, if not better, than any of them. We have a penthouse room, which was spectacular, I have never seen such an amazing roof terrace, with a day bed, jacuzzi, dining table for 6, BBQ, sunbeds and enough seating for about 15 people, great come chill out in complete peace and quiet and perfect if you have small children who need a nap etc, as you can still enjoy the sun while they sleep. The rooms themselves were huge and very well equipped, with full kitchen, dining area and 2 large bedrooms each with their own facilities. We used all of the restaurants and found the food to be genuinely gourmet (unlike some other resorts which claim to be) but the great thing was they also catered very well for children with a childrens menu and if you wanted, they would cook anything, even if not on the menu, for children, which was fantastic. The pool areas were always quiet and the staff very friendly, the childrens club were great as even if they didn't attend there, they would join in games with the children around the pool to give the parents a break, without putting them in the kids club. We were also invited to a party for another child at the kids club, which was lovely and really well organised, a great touch. The beach is beautiful and the perfect for splashing in the sea, the only downside is that it is rocky after a couple of metres, so you cant go straight in and swim from outside of the hotel, but a short walk down the beach brings you to a place where you can walk straight in. The staff are what makes this hotel, they looked after us so well and nothing is too much trouble. Everyone from the waiters, to the kids club, to the pool butler, reception and the cleaners were genuinely friendly and really helpful, they could not be faulted! Even when faced with a hurricane approaching, the service did not slip once, despite the fact the staff were running around trying to also secure the hotel and worrying about their own homes/families. A fantastic hotel, highly reccommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives, is a piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Taco_Connosieur
Reviews.Content: Azul Fives, is most definitely one of the small hotels that are a very well kept secret. Luxury, attention to every detail, excellent service, amazing food, peace and quiet, and a lovely beach! Stayed there during low season, and only a handful of tourists were enjoying this hotel. The variety of restaurants that the hotel has, offers something for everyone, from Mexican to sushi, to italian. Concierge and all the staff are ultra-attentive to your needs. A romantic dinner by the beach is an up-sell, but its definitely worth it, it will add a touch of romance to your vacation. If you are travelling with children, fret not! they have a world class 'daycare' with trained personnel that will keep the little ones entertained, while you relax with your partner. Overall, this is one of the most amazing small hotels that I have stayed in down in Cancun. A must for the well traveled, and for the connoisseurs. You will not be dissappointed, as this is quite a luxurious hotel, that doesn't cater to the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: ““very relaxing and pleasurable””
Reviews.Author: WEDRAW A
Reviews.Content: Returned recently from another great trip to Mexico…this time to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary, spent 4 nights in the Riviera Maya at Azul Fives near Playa del Carmen and had a great time. Upon arrival you could feel the warmth of the staff and the quality of service, when greeted with the cool hand towel & a glass of champagne. After the smooth check in we were off to our 1 Bedroom Suite with King size bed, Jacuzzi, separeate rain shower, living room, full kitchen, balcony with table & chairs, AND a knock on the door - delivery of a chilled bottle of bubbly. The décor is modern and very nice, lots of wood and nice lamps, chandeliers, art etc. Because we were there October 17-21(Off peak) the resort was not at capacity, so the pools loungers were ours for the taking. Service at the pool bar and at the outdoor grill was outstanding, as was service everywhere at the resort. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept, it takes your mind off the short walk to the beach. Once there - its kinda small which was not a downer for us because you can also continue walking in either direction for endless beach. Oh yeah - even toured the penthouse suites - of which the rooftop setup appeared to be prime for partying! Snuggling too. And the monkies came out while we were in there so that was a nice treat as we gazed out the windows at mom and baby. The food at all restaurants on the resort is excellent, along with the 24 hour room service meals. Being as though it was a milestone anniversary for us Johanna & the Executive Chef Danton set up a food tasting as our anniversary dinner because the weather the next day was more appropriate for our candlelight dinner on the beach - so we geared up for both. Our chef for both the tasting & the dinner was Chef Guillermo, he was nothing less then stellar in his explanation of ingredients, the presentation of each dish, & more importantly the tastes. He prepared a variety of dishes that were well liked (no, loved!) & appreciated by us both. We couldn't have asked for anything more at the anniversary dinner, the Chef was great, the food creations were AMAZING, & the service was top notch! They say this is GI (Gourmet Inclusive) and it truly was for us. A la carte meals & drinks whether at the pool, restaurants, or in the room. The food & people make this place heavenly. The only thing that could have made this trip better was more sun to heat the pools, but why let that stop you either. Just come, enjoy it all rain or shine good times. And if you are not having a good time - order a Sakerita. lol That drink will make anyone smile. Overall we had a great stay at Azul Fives with a superb room, top notch service, great pools, bars, and restaurants. Nothing but good experiences at 3 Karisma Resorts so far, a return is very likely. Special Shout out to Lilly & Marisol in Activities. I beat them in Blackjack AND pool basketball, but a nice tradeoff was them teaching ME the sexy moves of Salsa baby! Shout out to Walter the Service Manager, Joel the Captain & Jacobo @ Sea Olives & Dario @ Flavors To Azul Fives & Karisma Resorts - SALUTE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bhaskar P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in Azul Fives in April. We were joined by my sister-in-law, her husband and their two 3-year old kids. We had a great time in the resort. The resort itself is extremely new and very well-maintained. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and the room was extremely well-furnished and spacious. They have a great infinity pool (which is beautiful) and in addition they have a winding swimming pool running through the entire property. This makes it extremely convenient to go for a dip right next to your room at any time. The food options (even as part of an all-inclusive plan) are amazing. The breakfast buffet (at flavours) had a very wide spread in terms of variety and the quality was very good too. There was a lot to choose from at the a la carte menus for lunch and dinner at sea olives (which had a great view). The resort had a smoothie bar which served fresh smoothies most times of the day. Do go for the all-inclusive plan as its worth every dollar. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful yet unintrusive. They also had a kids club in which my niece and nephew had a great time. Overall it was a fantastic experience and one I'd recommend (both with and without kids).

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Azul Fives with family and friends, including two children. I have to say, it was my first expereince at a resort, where they cater to both; young and old! I found the resort to be extremely accomadating, ensuring we had everything we needed and wanted to make the most of our vacation. The staff were outstanding, of course my fav's were the pool bar/side crew! (Santiago, Fabian, Reyna, Marisol, Libby and Hirlago). They go from playing basketball in the pool with the kiddies, to an all out volleyball game with the adutls on the beach!!! The food was fabulous, gourmet meals at every sitting! The drinks kept flowing and the the views were gorgeous! The infinity pool, beachside, was probably the biggest seller for me. There is nothing like laying poolside, with a gorgeous view just steps away to the beautiful beach and ocean. Perfect resort for both young and old, can't go wrong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives Trip to Playa del Carmen, Mexico”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip with my fiance to Mexico and stayed at Azul Fives. We stayed in a one bedroom condo with a solarium and it was absolutely stunning. We had a few minor issues with our room (toilet problems) but they were quickly solved by the staff and followed up by a phone call to ensure we were satisfied. The beach area is kept clean and the staff is there ready to wait on you (all over the resort from the front desk to maintenance) to make certain your stay is the best stay possible. The selection of food at the restaurants was good. They are building two more restaurants right now to offer more of a food selection. I love the option to have a meal right on the beach at night....soooo romantic. If my fiance and I had stayed longer we definitely would've done this. I look forward to going back again next year,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: troptrav419
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Azul Fives last night. Just a gorgeous resort. I chose this hotel for it's family atmosphere, large suites and abundance of pools. I traveled with several friends and 2 five year olds. So we needed to make sure there were plenty of things to do for the kids. They have a wonderful kids club with Xbox, Wii and plenty of activities going on. Beautiful pools throughout the resort, including the infinity pool near the beach, kept everyone happy. We thoroughly enjoyed our accommodations in the 3 bedroom penthouse suite. Very clean, chic and spacious. The food was delicious and they offered a nice variety. The one thing I look for most in a resort is service. You can have the most wonderful accommodations, restaurants and pools, but if you don't have great service, forget it. Well, the staff here are exceptional. They truly enjoy their jobs and have a passion for making the guests feel welcome. Of course we had our favorites including Fabian, Reyna, Domingo, Santiago, Nashielli, Marisol, Lily and Hildago. They truly made our vacation wonderful. Anything you might need, just ask. My son's 5th birthday was while we were there and the staff threw him a fantastic party in the kids club. We had a full lunch with cake and drinks, the kids had a pinata and face painting. And everything was decorated in my son's favorite spiderman theme. It was a wonderful day to say the least. I'm a huge fan of the Azul concept and feel that if you are looking for a laid back vacation to enjoy with your family and friends, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with families with young kids”
Reviews.Author: DayWatch
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip looking for somewhere to go with our 16 month old baby. After lots of research we decided on this one and stayed Sept. 1-5th. I almost canceled after reading some negative reviews but I decided to stick with our choice and that is the main reason why I am writing this review – DO NOT WORRY – this place it a piece of paradise. When we got to the hotel after a long flight the staff was amazing, our room was ready right away and they already had little Ema smiling and giggling with the toys they showed her at check in. Once we were settled we asked for more things and they brought everything you could ever hope for – a stroller, crib, baby bath and great toys from Fisher Price. I loved that we could order room service 24 hours a day since I am nursing so we didn’t have to worry about restaurant schedules. The pools and grounds are immaculate and it’s perfect for playing in the pool or a late afternoon stroll. The kids club had activities that we could do together with Ema which was amazing, still today these are some of her favorite things to do and it brings us such great memories of our wonderful time at Azul Fives.

Reviews.Title: “Big Improvement in Last Six Months”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the Azul Fives. We were last there in April 2011. The hotel has a great layout, beautiful grounds, comfortable/spacious suites. The last visit we felt the food didn't match the quality of other Azul and El Dorado hotels. We believe now the quality is up to the usual high standards of Karissma. In addition, they are about to open an Italian restaurant and possibly a beach grill-type restaurant. The staff works hard to meet every need. It seems they have gained experience in the last year and are now up and running. The beach is rocky and better swimming is about 400 yards to the North or further to the south. However, the pools wind throughout the beautiful grounds. The beach pool is available for swimming and is near the restaurants. Great spa at the high end of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in heaven”
Reviews.Author: maliico
Reviews.Content: This resort really has everything you need for a first class honeymoon. We had booked a room called Deluxe which had 2 double beds (we didn’t know) and on arrival they helped us with a great price to upgrade to a one bedroom suite. WOW is all I can say, this room had its own kitchen, dining room and living room all decorated in the most luxurious and modern style. Every night when we came back to our room they had placed some sort of romantic decoration which was such a nice touch. The bedroom has a bathroom with the most beautiful Jacuzzi I have ever seen. We didn’t use the kitchen much but I can see how great that would be for an extended stay or if you come with family. The hotel has an immense pool that winds through the middle of the property with the rooms surrounding it. There’s also another one beach front with a breathtaking view of the Caribbean. It seemed to be that there was always a place to grab something nice to eat or drink. It wasn’t the typical snack bar / buffet style food either. We enjoyed 5 star dining every time. Loved the nightly entertainment and lounge bar, definitely coming back for our anniversary – thanks Azul Fives!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: bodesponja
Reviews.Content: The staff are ecellent, very friendly and extremely helpful, the food es very good. the rooms are very good. The hotel is close to Playa del Carmen. Thanks to all staff who made our stay very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids. Fun and relaxing experience even with bad weather.”
Reviews.Author: Noel J
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids came here to relax and unwind. We are very happy we chose Azul Fives. It has been raining the whole time... a little bit dissapointed we could not enjoy the beach, but the food and service is excellent. The kids club is fun, my 4 year old and 11 month old loves it. The staff here are all happy and friendly and they speak english well. This is not an issue with the hotel, but beware when booking with funjet. We paid for an all inclusive experience expecting exactly that, but they booked us on Spirit Airlines (exactly the opposite of all inclusive). Azul Fives is excellent. We want to experience another Azul resort again.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing and pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: DOROTHY S
Reviews.Content: The lazy river, the infinity pool is wonderful. All the meals were excellent. Had a very happy experience vacationing here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bithedust
Reviews.Content: We were there in September and had a great time!! I think like most reviewers have mentioned the staff and service here are probably the best by far we have had anywhere else in the caribean or mexico. The kids club and rooms were the 2 biggest reasons we stayed here and were not disappointed with either. The food was really really good, the gourment inclusive is a nice touch. We didnt feel like we were at some huge resort where the drinks were watered down and the food was overly abbundant and tasteless. Everything here was classy and very good. We found the ala cart meals to be the best. They do take longer, especially with a child, but we were on vacation and relaxed and enjoyed them all. Be prepared to eat 3 courses or more as portions are small, but you get filled at the end. Highly recommend for families. We will definetly try another Azul resort because of our expierience here. Pros Service Staff Rooms Food. The ala cart meals were really nice. Nice selection, but more could be needed if you stay a long time. Pools Cons Layout. Could have been better designed, especially for someone with a stroller. Some places were not safe for a toddler running around. Beach Construction Need more restaurants. They could use another snack bar/restaurant by the beach area, so you dont have to go back to your room to change for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great......know what you are looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: I will say that this resort has one of the best rooms that I have stayed in and a staff that was very nice, polite, and friendly. That being said here is the down side, one restaurand was under construction, the other ones had a limited menu. So I won't say this is 5 star food it was average in options and average in taste. I had nothing that was bad but I also don't miss one meal that I had there. I will say if you want a good price for a great room and you are a lay by the beach/pool type of vacation person. This is for you, if you want to mix it up, meet people, have a little social scene........probably not the place for you. The beach is a beautiful photo, but the rocks don't make it a great beach. It is ok, you can swim and play but it is not the great one that you dream of.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, excelent serviceClose to Playa”
Reviews.Author: Alexnico72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in september. With 2 kids 5 & 13. Great place for families, lots of activities for kids. All restauranta a la carte, gourmet food. Rooms a massive. Hotel is bran new, openend nov, 2011 Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Mr X
Reviews.Content: I needed a quick break form everything and I booked this hotel quickly without deep investigation. I was presently surprised with everything. We spent 4 nights at Azul. The hotel is gorgeous with modern decor and the food was fabulous. You can feel the warmth of the staff and the quality of service as soon as you arrive. They even greet you with champagne. This hotel is a must see – my favorite would be the Asian restaurant; they have a coconut curry that is out of this world. Definitively check you spa!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST VACATION OF YOUR LIFE”
Reviews.Author: valery d
Reviews.Content: We are staying at azul fives at this moment and i have to tell you this has turned out to be one of the best holidays of our lives !! The service is 100% the staff are incredible and we are over the moon with every thing about fives !! I must certainly will recomend this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: ope557
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives for a few nights between reservations we had already made. The whole family really loved the resort, no one wanted to leave. The resort is very new and nicely maintained. With regard to rooms the suite was large, very clean and comfortable. We were three steps from the pool which the kids loved. The hidden bed in the couch was a typical hide-a-bed and a bit uncomfortable for the kids. We stayed on the so called european plan which means that we were not staying all inclusive. We did eat breakfasts and one dinner at the resort. The food quality was good - better than the average all-inclusive resort. The prices were average compared to other restaurants in Playa del Carmen. They have themed restaurants which span the world for foods. My only complaint would be that Mexican food was not well represented. While Mexican food is generally known as tacos and burritos curious eaters know that there are many gourmet quality Mexican dishes such as Mole sauces that I think should be part of any high end Mexican resort. The pools and grounds were spotless, the staff very friendly. The only caution with regard to the grounds is, as mentioned in other reviews, the ocean is rocky here. For us that was not an issue at all but it is something to consider if you are planning to swim in the ocean a lot. Another point is that the resort is away from town. Whether that is good, bad or neutral depends on your plans. I definitely recommend Azul Fives and plan to stay there again the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Azul 5s...almost Perfect with a few tweaks needed”
Reviews.Author: Summerfunboy
Reviews.Content: Returned recently from another great trip to Mexico…this time to celebrate my son’s 16th birthday along with his friend and my ever lovely Summerfungirl. We stayed at Azul 5s near Playa del Carmen and had a great time. Our trip started with us being whisked away from the airport in a stretch limo courtesy of our friends at Lomas Travel. A quick 30 minute ride and a smooth check-in with a glass of bubbly and we were off to our 2 Bedroom Penthouse Suite 1222. None of the rooms are beachfront at Azul 5s…they’re a short walk to the ocean and have various pools and connecting ”rivers” undulating in the middle of the units. The Penthouse is on the 3rd floor and you walk in a doorway that separates into two other doors…one leading to a bedroom with 2 double beds and a bathroom with shower plus a TV and a mini fridge and the other leading to the main rooms with a complete kitchen featuring a stove/microwave and full-size fridge…plus a dining area…a living room with couch and TV with DVD player and sliding glass doors that lead to one of three balconies. Because of the vegetation…the view on the balconies isn’t much but the rooftop area makes up for this. Continuing through the room there is a small bathroom with a full wooden door (Yay!!!) and then on through sliding wooden doors that lead into the main bedroom and washroom area. A Queen size bed…a closet with safe and iron…and a Jacuzzi tub for two greet you as you enter. The bathroom is open to the bedroom and also has a shower. Yes…the toilet has the annoying frosted glass “no-privacy-for-you” feature but seeing as the Penthouse has four bathrooms total (there’s one on the rooftop patio too) at least you can find privacy somewhere when you need it. There is another TV and DVD player in the room…an iPod Clock radio plus another glass door entrance to another balcony. (the other bedroom has a balcony too) The style of décor is modern and very nice…lots of wood and neat lamps…chandeliers, art etc. Internet WiFi is $15 a day or $70 for a week and worked fine…once you got through the cumbersome online sign-up. Climbing the indoor staircase near the entranceway leads to the rooftop…a huge, wonderful area to overlook the complex…relax on one of the loungers or on the padded bed or take a dip in the Jacuzzi. (cold water only but fill it in the morning and it’ll warm up for you from the sun) I used the rooftop every day to lay in the sun…listen to music…and just enjoy the beautiful weather we had. There is also a table and chairs under a slatted roof ..a storage room with a propane BBQ (more on that later) and another bathroom. All in all, having stayed in many Presidential Suites and top rooms all over the world, this was one of my favorite rooms. Because we were there Sept. 8 to 11th the resort was quite empty so the pools…loungers etc. were ours for the taking. Service at the pool bar and at the outdoor grill beside it was outstanding, as was service everywhere at the resort. From a consistency point of view, Azul 5s had the best service across the board of any place I’ve been to. The grounds are beautiful and well kept and it’s a short walk to the beach…passing a giant chess board…giant checkers board…a tennis court...a shuffleboard area and a ping pong table along the way, for those so inclined. At the beach there is a bar and a swimming pool with some loungers around the pool and on the sand. Many complain about the beach but to me…the beach is the SAND area of which there was lots of. The sand is white and fine on the feet. The WATER part is pretty bad right in front of the resort. Not bad as in unclean but rocky for the first few feet trying to get out into the ocean. If you walk down the beach a little bit there is a patch of clear sand that leads into the water and once past the rough patch the sand is smooth and rock/coral free. There seemed to be beach service…I spotted one waiter once…but it didn’t look like it was all that reliable. We ate at the Japanese restaurant and the Mediterranean one and the food and service was excellent at both. Room service was good and always delivered quickly but Azul 5s has the most limited Room Service menu I’ve ever seen. This is unfortunate because everywhere we ate (the pool by our room had an outdoor grill and the food was excellent there too) the food was wonderful so it would have been nice to have a better selection to order to the room...especially late at night. One other complaint...hot water. For some reason our room didn’t have hot water and although they came up to check things…it never did reach the levels of warmth needed. The strange thing is, the connecting bedroom the boys were in had plenty of hot water…go figure. After a fun day of deep-sea fishing and snorkelling booked through Lomas Travel, we arranged a rooftop BBQ for our last night. They offer 4 menus to choose from…ranging in price from $40 to $90 per person…and we chose the Texas BBQ along with a bottle of bubbly. Juan was our amazing chef and Orlando our wonderful waiter for the evening. Both get the highest marks for their efficiency…humor…cooking/serving skills and being just overall great guys. They set up a marble top table that holds all the scrumptious ingredients in front of the BBQ and set up the rooftop table for us to dine at. With music playing on our iPod…a glass of champagne in hand…we were ready for the magic to begin. There was potato salad…green salad…wings…sausages…turkey…brisket…veggies…the food kept coming and coming and all of it was delicious. The wings were to die for…the best I‘ve ever had…and Juan was gracious enough to give me a bowl of the sauce to put in the fridge in case I wanted to add it to something later. If my Spanish had’ve been better I would’ve asked him for the recipe. If you get the Penthouse with 4 people or more, I highly recommend the rooftop BBQ. Overall we had a great stay at Azul 5s with a superb room…top notch service…great pools, bars and restaurants with only half a star being deducted for the small Room Service menu, rocky beach water and the hot water problems in our room. Stay tuned for my “better late than never” review of the Presidential Suite at El Dorado Seasides Suites. Until then…have fun!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home if i had a penthouse rooftop at home!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna T
Reviews.Content: visited with 3 kids, 5, 9 and 11, and have to say, everyone had a fabulous time. the rooms are just spectacular. and the fact that they're separate was just perfect to keep the kids (noise) at bay. food was great, we had the gourmet all inclusive package, so ate as much as we wanted (3 pounds gained!0. my kids loved the monkeys you can see playing at the main restaurant windows, very cute, they have food displays (don't call it "buffet", that's not upscale enough) with a good variety for adults and kids. ordered room service a bunch of times, also good. except when the kids were exhausted we opted to walk, didn't use the golf carts much. staff was nice, not in your face but always there to help, and mostly with a smile. there's a neat kids club with games and toys, but really what was fun was to hang out at the beach and the main pool and visit the area. the Tulum pyramids are lovely. we went to playa del carmen twice, once during the day and once for dinner. it was nice but would have enjoyed more genuine mexico, not all sleek stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort”
Reviews.Author: Travelfunfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. We were here to attend a family wedding. For the most part the resort was very nice. The rooms are huge. We had the one bedroom suite. It had a full kitchen, dining area and living rm. We didn't use any of the other space except for the dining rm to eat rm service breakfast every morning. Overall the rm was clean and nice. There was a slight musty smell, but that is very common in tropical areas, but nothing overwhelming. The pools were really nice and the water was always the perfect temperature. I didn't love the layout of the resort as it was set back away from the beach front. It was a short walk from our rm to get to the main pool, and main restaurant area. If you can't easily walk then I would not recommend this. Overall I would actually come back. This resort is very family friendly and I have a toddler son that would have enjoyed it. Having access to the large suites is a perfect option for families. Also, I want to make a specific comment about the staff. I think that this was the most professional, courteous staff that I've ever come across in Mexico. Also, I've never seen so much management at a resort. There were constantly managers walking around and checking in on things.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, INCOMPETENT and OFFENSIVE service”
Reviews.Author: jayci
Reviews.Content: I visited Azul Fives over Labor Day weekend. I visited over labor day weekend as guests of some friends who were renting a penthouse for a wedding party. The problems started as soon as we walked in the door. Despite being notified by our friends who were staying there, the desk staff seemed slow to understand that we were visiting and initially would not let us in on the property. They made us stand around for 20 mins while we were explaining that our friends were at a reception and were not reachable at their room. Finally after considerable amounts of pleading, someone tracked down a manager who knew we were coming and we were cleared. If only it were that easy. We basically had to sign three pages of waivers and turn over our driver's license before they let us in the property. What. The. Heck.The worst part was that there were three people in the front. Two girls who were mostly inoffensive, but deferential to the male who worked at the desk. His name was Angel. More about him later. Once we entered, it took us 20 mins before they managed to flag down a golf cart to drive us to the reception site. This wouldn't be so terrible if the golf cart station wasn't right next to the lobby with plenty of empty carts and staff hanging around the front. Once in the property it was great. Beautifully laid out, brand new, great rooms, great views. We returned to my friend's penthouse to chat and grab some food. Our friends were on the all inclusive plan and we were all hungry so I called the operator to connect us to room service. Angel picked up. I politely asked for room service and he gruffly responded "When are you leaving?" I was stunned. I have visited hotels and resorts all over the world. I have NEVER been addressed in such a rude and inhospitable manner. I responded, "Excuse me?" and he went on to rant that he knew I wasn't a guest there and how I couldn't order food, yadda...yadda..yadda. I hung up the phone and told my friends what had happened. They were FURIOUS. Our friends are professional travel agents and booked over 150 people for the wedding on the property. They could not believe I was treated so rudely, especially considering that we were all Americans without distinctive accents so he had no idea that he was talking to me instead of the actual guest of his hotel. Eventually we were able to order food, after calling the front desk several times and talking to the night manager about the horrific treatment we received. It didn't even end there. When we were trying to leave the property we STILL had problems getting a cart to take us to the lobby. We called no fewer than four times and it took us almost 45 minutes before one lazily drove by and picked us up. What's worse, multiple staff members walked by and asked us how we were doing (after all, we're two women standing in the middle of the road). However, when we inquired about the status of our cart they just mumbled an apology and wandered off without attempting to help us resolve our issue. Once we FINALLY got a cart to take us to the lobby, we got our licenses back and asked to speak to the manager. We complained about the service to the manager but she gave us a blank look, not even a halfhearted apology. I got so mad that I simply walked out and waited for a cab. I could not stand to deal with these people any more. Such a shame. It is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “run from this place fast!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rk123456155019
Reviews.Content: do not waste you money and your time one this half star resort period i do not usually write reviews.but for this place i have,nothing good about it period.spend your hard earned money other places that know what a guest is

Reviews.Title: “Super Time!”
Reviews.Author: sess46
Reviews.Content: Just recently came home from Azul Fives (August 21-25). It was a multi-generational family vacation - My husband, myself, my 15 year old son and grandparents. We had a fabulous time and the weather was great. The food was excellent, although there was only3 choices of restaurants (one being a buffet- which we didn't go to) the food options were sufficient for the 4 nights we stayed. If we stayed longer I think we would be bored with the food. The service/staff was 5 stars and they treated us like royalty. The hotel is beautiful except for the beach area. Unfortunately there is a beach, but you cannot go in the water because it is filled with rocks. You have to walk about a 5-7 minute walk if you want to go swimming. Other than that it was superb. The shows at night were entertaining but it is not a place to go for a wild time. It is very quiet and terrific for families. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for a large family! Great service as well.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, 4 children (age 10,8,6 and 3) and my father. We had a 3 bedroom suite (villa 6) which was beautiful. The rooms were spacious, clean, well decorated and all connected by a common living area and kitchen. It felt like a very large condo with daily maid service; not a hotel. The grounds and facilities are very nice and well kept. I have to agree that the construction was a little annoying but not terribly so; they did a good job trying to mask the construction noises with music and kept the workers and projects hidden behind temporary walls and boards so they it wasn't all "in your face."
