The waiters and staff everywhere were very kind, friendly and helpful. Domingo at the infinity pool bar works his tail off and deserves lots of tips. Aldair at the pool was always trying to help us with towels and getting enough seating together. The maids were very friendly and kept making creatures out of towels for us which delighted my kids. The barbecue for lunch was always good and the staff there are so helpful. There are a few monkeys on the site which would pay us a visit near our villa. They were comfortable enough to let us see them and photograph them, but were not aggessive and another source of delight for my kids. My kids did not participate in any kids club activities, (their choice) but I can say the staff was very friendly and would try to include them in sandcastle building and pool games whenever we were around. I was disappointed in the lack of water sports as other reviewers have said. I wanted my older kids to try a few things, and walking 10 minutes down the beach was not really an option for us. They should change their clamis to have such activity on their website. The food is good; but interesting. Everything was very tasty; small portions so order a lot if you are hungry! The sushi is NOT your standard sushi; it is all maki and was tasty and seemed fresh but don't be deceived into thinking that you have options for toro, unagi, and salmon sashimi ; this is "sushi lite." There is good fish and other dishes at the Sea Olive ; very tasty; but small portions. That is fine as long as you are prepared to order an appetizer, and a salad and count on dessert too! There is a duo of brothers who are on site with various ceramics the visitors can paint. At first, they seemed a little pricey (don't be fooled into thinking that it is a kids club activity; it is not!) but essentially, your kids can paint everything in the colors they wish, and then the brothers "touch them up" and decorate them to look like authentic Mexican art pieces before they kiln them and bring them back for you to pick up the next day. They turn out beautiful. They really did make great souvieniers that my kids are proudly displaying in their rooms at home! Okay, the last word of warning. I did have a bit of gastrointestinal distress after eating at the Flavours breakfast buffet (as did someone else judging from the noises in the restroom.....sorry). This happened to me twice during the week and did not linger, but be aware of the possiblity. I did note the staff changing the food at the buffet frequently, but there are no "thermometers" or monitoring of the temperature of anything, so I can imagine that the potential for staph and e-coli are real. The rest of my family was fine so it may be my sensitive stomach! The beach is indeed a disappointment; they should consider dredging a small section; I don't think it was active coral as much as rocks, but it is maneuverable if you bring some ocean shoes to protect your feet from the urchins and slippery rocks. Again, too far to walk with small children to get to the soft, sandy beach that others had mentioned. You should not expect a grand lobby. Driving down the hotel strip in Riviera Maya, there are so many huge resorts with outrageous entrances and I imagine fabulous lobbies. This resort is located down a somewhat dreary road off of the main drag, is not well labelled and although clean and bright, is really a tiny little no frills lobby. Even our tour driver (we took a trip to Xel ha) asked me "This is the lobby? I've never been here. This is it???" They save their impressiveness for the suites; which are really great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kdisy
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I was a little worried about staying at Azul Fives from reading the reviews. BUT, I cannot say enough positive things about this resort. It was by far the most beautiful place we've stayed in. I've been to Mexico several times, and at high-end resorts, but we just had a wonderful experience here. Travelled with my husband and three children - ages 24, 20 and 12, and my 20 yrs. old's friend, who is 25. While my 12 year old wanted nothing to do with the Kids area, she was happy to spend the entire time with us. From the moment we arrived, we had a friendly greeting and offered "azul/blue" colored champagne as a welcome. My 12 year old daughter was given a nice cool bottle of water, which was very refreshing for her! While they did have the cool refresher towels there also, we were not offered them - not sure why, and we didn't ask. After we took a family photo for our room keys, we arrived before our 2 bedroom suite was ready. I took the advice of several travellers who left reviews, and asked for a suite in Villa 14 - and they accomodated us. Yes, Villa 14 is the place to be! It is in the center of everything - from the restaurants to the infinity pool and the beach. We left our luggage with them, as they said it would be taken to our suite when ready, and because we arrived almost 2 hours prior to check-in, we were able to get some lunch. As we were all driven by golf cart to the walkway to the beach, (which we really could have walked), we had lunch at the bbq area, which was delicious. The guys that prepare lunch here are so friendly, and everyone just about knows very good English. However, it was fun for my kids to brush up on their Spanish with many of the staff! After lunch, we walked around the resort and to the beautiful turquoise ocean. They had afternoon volleyball everyday as well as soccer and bocce ball. We really enjoyed the Salsa lessons too right by the pool. After we were driven to our room, and walked into our suite, we were in absolute awe. The suites are beautiful! With our two bedroom suite, there were separate entrances for both bedrooms, but connected through the main entrance. The kitchen, dining and living rooms were connected to the master room, with french doors for privacy. Each bedroom had its own patio with sliding doors, and right outside your bedroom was the sparkling pool - like a lazy river that went all throughout the resort. Several pool swim-up bars were all around as well. The restaurants were very good, and Sea Olive was our absolute favorite. Roberto, our favorite waiter really took good care of us! We actually ate there for lunch and dinner on the same day! While tipping is not necessary, we tipped everyone, as they all gave us such wonderful service. Domingo always took care of us at the pool bars, and if you want top shelf liquor, it's your's for the asking. The capacity the week we were there was about half full, which was nice to not have to wait for seating in any of the restaurants. Breakfast at Flavours was your typical breakfast buffet, but enough of a variety where you can something different every day. The sushi that everyone raved about on other reviews was just OK, it was your typical sushi -- but again, the wonderful service made it very enjoyable. The beach, as told by others, is not one to swim in, however, is wonderful for beach volleyball, and soccer. We did not mind at all walking down to the other resorts to their beach. One day we ventured to the right of our beach, which was about a five minute walk, and that was pleasant. The next day we went to our left, about a ten minute walk, and that's where they had wave-runners and parasailing if you wanted, and the beach there was magnificent. The sand is so soft under your feet, and the beautiful, crystal clear ocean was remarkable. At this beach, you can walk about a mile into the ocean and still only be up to your waist in the water! Our family really enjoyed ourselves at this resort, and would definitely come back again. We didn't want to leave! We had beautiful weather, with just a slight sprinkle for about ten minutes in the early morning just enough to give the landscaping a drink. I would definitely recommend this resort for anyone who is looking for something a little different, expecting great service and memories that will last a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: 2011worldtraveller20
Reviews.Content: I am a world traveler, been going to Cancun/ Playa area every 3-4 weeks within 12 month. 1 bd suit is very nice!!! Food was great! Service was good, do not have to wear wrist band for all inclusive , very clean, soooooo quiet inside the room, can not hear who is next door or outside. Love it! Beach not the best , but could walk to the next resort... Would go back

Reviews.Title: “read before booking”
Reviews.Author: pjensor
Reviews.Content: i just returned from a week stay at azul fives. (my family...me, husband, 4 kids ages 21-28 yrs.) we have been to all inclusives once to twice a year for the last 12 years. i have never written a review but i felt tricked on this property....... the problem i had with this particular hotel was that they didn't have what they claimed. there were lots of goods and bads in my opinion. i'll list them all......i want to be completely fair. good.... workers were friendest ever very clean food was good rooms were gorgeous bar tenders were great drinks were great bad...... zky bar (all the night life) was closed and under construction one resturant was closed because of construction bar was moved into a conference room for shows and music (small dark and loud) jack hammer ran all day long at the pool (could barely hear the music) there was never a beach party(like advertised) there was never live music (like advertised) there were no kayaks, no sailboats, no water sports of any kind (like advertised) the beach was solid rock and coral so you couldn't go out in the water unless you walked way down the beach to other properties the resturants took 1-2 hrs to get your food menu was always the exact same at lunch and same at dinner well there you have it. if you go for the rooms this is for you. if you want any night life even to sit out and have a drink and visit.......book another hotel. the only bar open at night was in the little room where the show was.if the sound of a jack hammer from breakfast til dinner doesn't bother you then you might like it. i had a great time because i was with my family and on vacation. the pool was nice and the bar tenders were a hoot. if i were booking again i would not go back here until all the consturction is finished and then i would think twice about it. good luck with your trip. patti abilene tx

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - It is Very Good but...”
Reviews.Author: lacdf
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from a week at Azul Fives. ( All-Inclusive Package) It is a resort that it is good and compared with what we saw walking at the beach one of the best that were around ( Sandos, Tides, Princess). If you can stay in the Grand Vela Playa del Carmen I think it is worth it ( I think it is more expensive, but from what we saw from the beach and from the infinity pools that one looked much better that this one). On the plus side: Rooms: Great Rooms, we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite it is basically an apartment, one of our friends stayed in a normal bedroom and it is very good as well. Something that might be useful the 1 bedroom suites and the regular rooms are usualy next to each other if you are travelling with relatives or a big family ask them to put them next to each other. Pools: All the pools are beautiful 3 in total ( 2 unwinding pools in the interior of the resort that circle all the building and are usually empty... + 1 infinity pool facing the beach with an amazing view.) Service: The staff is willing to serve and to help you, no attitude no laziness extremely helpful. Kids Club: It is good if your kids are between 4 and 9 ( below 4 you have to be with them over 9 they will get bored ). Activities all day long from 9 - 5 pm including lunch so that is very good. Night Shows: They have night shows every night the kids love it , Michale Jackson Show and the Magic show were great, The Circus and the Fire Show were good, the rest so-so. Neutral: Restaurants: There are 2,5 restaurants and 2 pool grills. Flavours: It is where you have breakfast and one of the options for dinner ( every night they give you a special cuisine: French, Mexican, etc... it is a buffet restaurant) Breakfasts are good and dinner for a Buffet are good as well. Sea Olive: Mediterranean Food, it is regular to good, mild flavor and some time foods comes not properly cooked. Zuki (or something like that): it is the 0.5 restaurant that I mentioned because basically is a rectangular area at the end of the Sea Olive Restaurant. Sushi is OK, the duck and the curry chicken are good. On the Sea Olive and the Zuki service is below par regarding the pace of the food coming out of the kitchen, several times the entrée arrive before the appetizer. Portions are Gourmet-like so you will have to order more than usual. Waiters are friendly, no attitude and doing their best to compensate any negative issue. Pool Bars: The drinks are extremely soft on the alcohol content, but that is easily fixed you just ask the barman for a double, if you want international liquoor you have to ask for it ( Grey Goose and Tonic, Bacardi and Diet, otherwise they will give you off the rail liquor) Negative: Beach: No beach, at least for swimming, there are rocks, corrals, in front of the beach it is extremely difficult to get in, a guest stepped into a sea urchin and had to get medical assistance, trust me if you are going for the beach experience it is not there, you have to walk 5 minuted to the right to sneak into the Sandos Hotel Beach or 5 minutes to the left to get into a beach front that is not too appealing. People Sneaking in: We met 3 couples that they just walked into the resort from the beach, there is not bracelet only your room key that it is asked on a random basis and if you do not speack spanish and you look the part of a tourist you just say that you left it in your purse and problem solve, I think they should improve that. Internet Connection: Spotty but it work at the end $ 15 per day $ 70 per week. Punctual Negative Issues that I hope will get fix when you go: Aquatic sports activities: Zippy, nada, zero: They claimed that they had a conflict with the company that managed this activities so we ended up with no scuba diving, kayak, snorkeling, that would have mitigate the entry to the beach at least. Sky Bar: This was a big issue for us they are doing a major remodeling on this bar that it is on top of the Sea Olive Restaurant and just in from of the infinity pool so it was closed. This was a pain the neck because 1st the noise was far away from the relaxing experience you are looking for. 2nd there is no place to chill or to have a drink at the end of the day/night, the management cleverly kept on mentioning the Sky Bar as open, but what they did was that they relocated to a ballroom that is just that a small ballroom that makes you feel like you are having a drink in a prom night! Sun Umbrellas at the Infinity Pool: This is a quick fix, but they do not want to fix it, they have like 10 sun umbrellas and like 20 sun umbrellas basis. Basically what happens is that early in the morning all the lounges/chairs with shadow or a sun umbrella get taken the rest remain empty the whole day, I told the staff that we needed more sun umbrellas but he told me that when the wind gets strong they fly away so they decided to remove them I think it will be better if they have the closed on site and open them if a hotel guest ask for one. I hope this will help you, call ahead and ask if they have finished the remodel/construction and asked them if they have the water sports shop open, I did call and they never mention any of this. Taxis from the Hotel to Playa del Camen : $16 or 160 pesos Taxis from Playa del Carmen to Hotel: $ 12 or 120 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Bored to tears and food was terrible”
Reviews.Author: merricka
Reviews.Content: I've been to several all inclusive resorts and after the first day I was basically wanting to leave. I was really disappointed, bored and hungry. All the resorts in Mexico are pretty remote from anything fun and exciting and if you want to go anywhere off the resort you need to arrange transportation to get around. The resort had basically NOTHING to do. I booked a 1BR suite on bookit.com because you receive a $500 coupon book of offers. We ended up being upgraded to a penthouse suite because our room smelled a bit funny because there was water leaking throughout our place. We went to the pool. We went to the gym. We went to the spa. We went to eat. We slept. We watched tv. We were beyond bored. We basically didn't have much to do while we were there. The beach area is really small and you can't do anything like water sports. The service was great and the people are nice. The best meal I had the whole trip was when we took a taxi to the shops and ate at a hole in the wall restaurant and I had amazing shrimp ceviche and enchiladas. But the all inclusive food to put it mildly was disgusting. I was so hungry the entire trip! If I ever travel to Mexico again, I will definitely book a resort closer to Cancun and known for a lot of activities and great dining.

Reviews.Title: “Fair to Middling”
Reviews.Author: perudallas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Azul Fives and were happy enough as we (My wife and I and our 5 year old son) did the European Plan and enjoyed full benefits of the resort without paying the extremely high All-Inclusive price. here are Pros and Cons: Pros: Rooms - Great, comfortable, rooms, with big balconies. We were in the smallest, a double, and we still had plenty of room. Azulitos (Kids Club) - Our 5 year old loved it, and asked to go back. Good for them to get out of sun for awhile and give parents some down time. HINT - You can do babysitting (a couple of hours) for $15 Beach - Same as all comments - not for swimming - big downer Distance - Cab fare to Playa del Carmen is $16 and is abt 15 mins away. Cons: Bars - Only 1 beer selection available at all bars - Dos XX - thats it - as anywhere, take care of your server/ bartender, and they will take care of you ~ tips help get better service. ATM - Non on site. Restaurants - Felt very "Non - Gourmet" and I am really happy I did not have all-inclusive and obliged to eat that food. Room Service - Extremely slow....I had read a review, so to test them I ordered ice and matches. It took approximnately 1 hour to get to me (fyi...he forgot the matches).....luckily it was only a test as I already had what I needed. Pool Bars - Most of them closed - had to go to main infinirty pool, abt a 5-10 min walk from anywhere in complex. HINT: NEXT TIME I WILL REANT A CAR, GET EURO PLAN AND EAT OUT....FYI, I WOULD GET A COOLER AND BUY STUFF AT LOCAL WALMART IN PLAYA TO KEEP IN ROOM-IT WILL COME IN HANDY!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury resort with exceptional service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: travelgurlYYC
Reviews.Content: I vacationed with my family (6 adults) at the Azul Fives the last week in June. We booked the 3-bedroom rooftop patio suite, and it was gorgeous. It was so nice to have a living area for us to congregate, relax, and socialize in. Since it was so hot we didn't spend much time on the rooftop patio except our last night. And all of us having our own private bedroom was totally ideal for our family situation. Unfortunately we didn't have the best of weather, but we made the most of it anyway. I won't go on about the suite, the photos on here and the hotel website are true to form. The hotel itself is beautiful and really well maintained. The infinity pool area is specatular, and although I didn't spend any time on the beach, it was of a decent size with tons of loungers available. Where this hotel excels is in the service department. I don't think I've ever had as exceptional service anywhere, and I have travelled globally including many many 5-star hotels throughout the Caribbean. The staff here really take pride in their work and always seem to go the extra mile for you, and it really is genuine. I can't say thanks enough to everyone at this hotel for the fantastic vacation my family & I had, if it hadn't been for them, the experience could have been much different. The restaurants were wonderful too. Besides a little hiccup on our first night, we had so many good meals, I unfortunately wasn't able to get back to try all the different options during our 7-night stay that looked so good. We also had dinner one evening at Senses, which isn't included in the all-inclusive package, but I wanted to treat my family to something special. It was worth the splurge, we all really enjoyed it, including my dad who is more of a 'meat & potatoes' kind of guy. On our last night the hotel had arranged a Mexican BBQ for my family on the rooftop patio of our suite. This was the highlight of the week for me. It was so amazing...they had music, served us apple martinis on arrival, had a whole bar set up and the dining table all set for us, and mmmm did it smell good! Just as were being served the BBQ, it started to downpour. No roof over our heads! We all laughed, grabbed our drinks & plates and trudged downstairs to the dining room in our suite. The guys worked tirelessly to bring the BBQ back down to us, and despite the change of locales, we had a really fun time. The service again was impeccable. And they even had an anniversary cake for my parents and a birthday cake for my uncle. So all in all, despite some weather challenges, we had a really amazing week at the Azul Fives and I would not hesitate to recommend it or to return myself, which I plan on doing!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing adventure”
Reviews.Author: TXleafpeeper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and I guess the best thing I can tell people is that you have to come here and be on Mexican time. Slow down and enjoy what they have to offer not expect to be catered to all the time. Yes Restaurant service is slow as I think 1 kitchen serves 2 restaurants with completely different food. Waiters are very nice and spent perhaps too much time at each table trying to know each guest which makes it a longer process ordering food and drinks but makes it also fun meeting different cultures. My wife and enjoyed our time here even through having a flooded room the second night of our stay with a blown hot water heater putting 2" of water in our room in Villa 4. I now know why some rooms smell musty when you go to resorts in Mexico. They swept the water out the door and installed new water heater and had the room occupied the next day by someone else. They moved to us to a lovely pool view room at 10pm at night after finding an opened room. the resort was only about 40% full but that was about right for drink and food service. A tropical depression was in tthe gulf when we arrived at the resort but except for two (2) quick thunder storms that cleared the pool the days were sunny as my sunburn will prove. Go have fun and relax Azul 5 is alright.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal with self-catering but...”
Reviews.Author: karenk540
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on a very classy one bedroom suite with kitchen, living room and balcony. The suite wad great, no maintenance problems, very clean. We opted to cook all our own food (we like to cook) or get takeout and really enjoyed that - we were glad we didn't rely on the restaurants here. For very little cash you can get lovely fresh fish, great ingredients, and wonderful top-shelf booze and prepare it in your own granite and stainless steel fully equipped kitchen. Staff are eager to help you to your room with groceries and we did not feel judged in any way for cooking our own food. Pools are wonderful and are through the whole resort. We had a car and drove into Playa for supplies, shopping etc. at least once a day. We would not have liked this place so much if we were stuck there without a car. As others have said, the beach is rocky and tiny - it's not even good for snorkelling. We were mistakenly showed to a "one bedroom suite" without a kitchen and told this was our room. We then had to wait two hours in the lobby, without use of any facilities, to get the room we'd reserved. Apparently this was because there was nobody present senior enough to give us the room we'd actually reserved. The non-kitchen suite we were shown by mistake was a bit small and pokey, and we would not recommend those if you're going to spend time in your room. Others have indicated problems with incorrect reservations here and we experienced this too. The rooftop suites looked very good. However, there are not any true ocean-front rooms here. It did not look like any ocean views were worth having either. The staff were overall very friendly and helpful, but as well as the reservations we had long waits and other issues with valet parking (our car was recovered one time by a young staff member who did not appear to know how to drive). Overall, we recommend this place if you are looking for a luxurious base to stay and cook your own food while you explore locations in the Riviera Maya by car and are OK with some SNAFUs.

Reviews.Title: “Money Poorly Spent - Maybe should be named Azul Twos?”
Reviews.Author: Tigger303
Reviews.Content: OVERALL We just returned from our vacation to Azul Fives (July 24-30, 2011.) We have three boys: 5, 7 and 12. For the money we spent on this all-inclusive resort, it was a colossal mistake. From facilities to service to food it was sub-par. There is no way this is a five-star resort. Please read the write-up below before you make your arrangements. ARRIVAL You enter the resort through a public access road, which is lined with some shacks, a local pool area, a mini-mart (Oxxo) and an above-ground water purification site (purifying yet to happen.) It is not a site that puts you in a vacation mood. The hotel entrance resembles a Springhill Suites or Comfort Inn. It is not ugly, but not impressive either. The check-in process was, again, comparable to a business budget hotel. It was satisfactory, but not impressive and certainly did not make you feel like an honored guest. We received a book summarizing the resort (almost all of the data in the book was incorrect...restaurants not open, times were incorrect, age limits for programs were wrong. We received a ride to our room in a golf cart and a "tour" of the property, consisting of pointing in the general direction of buildings. ROOMS We picked the resort for a number of reasons (as filtered through our travel agent.) One of the reasons was that we wanted a suite so that we had a room connected to our childrens' room. As it turns out, there are no true suites or connected rooms. There is a shared vestibule with an outside door and two separate rooms with their own doors. This made us uncomfortable as the kids feel very far away from you. One of us slept in the kids room on most nights. Our first room had a remarkable view of a partially constructed concrete wall and the same public access road described above in the arrival section. The next morning the view was "enhanced" with a dozen construction workers right beside our balcony, building the wall. The second "suite," and you can see the experience is going great so far, was the same set-up, but smaller than the first. It was on the ground floor and our patio looked out on the "beautiful" kitchen next to a pool which we could not see...Fantastic for sitting out on the patio and feeling like you were at home, looking at your neighbor's house...not exactly five-star views. As a note and contrary to what is intimated, there are no beach-front rooms. You will have, at best, a view of the jungle or a pool. BEACH - POOLS One of the other reasons we selected this resort was that they promised a beach. We even took the step of calling and having our agent call to the resort and ask if there was a nice beach and that there were no rocks there. There is a beach, meaning sand and chaise lounges. However, if beach means walking into the water, forget about it. The water is all rock; pitted limestone with ankle-breaking holes and shells. We tried to get to deeper water the first day and almost made it, but not without a little bloodshed. We found a walk out area at different resorts about 3/4 of a mile down the beach and another one about 3/4 of a mile up the beach. Of course, because they weren't part of our beach, we couldn't get chairs or towels, but at least we could swim. We ended up going to a public beach at Playa del Carmen one of the days. We did enjoy the water, but it was crowded and cost about 9 bucks to rent chairs and about 40 dollars for lunch and drinks. By the way, the resort is bordered on both sides by public access walkways so there will be local families and fisherman who will be right beside you as you are on the beach. It made us a bit uncomfortable with our kids the first day or two. We also saw pictures of the pools when we were researching and they looked very nice. They were nice enough, but the main pool was shut down in the evening; closed completely twice and, as is detailed below, did not have drinks available all the time and certainly not after 5:30pm. You also could not swim after 11pm or before 6am. This was not an issue for us, but you should know about it before you go. Bring your own goggles, snorkels, etc. There was nothing there and there was also no buckets or any other items for kids to use for fun. SERVICE AND BARS The service was horrid! The staff did say "Hola" everytime they walked by, but little else. Getting answers to questions like, "Is there an ATM?" or "What fun stuff is there to do?" or "Can I get something to eat?" seemed near impossible. On the three occasions my wife and I wanted a beer at the swim-up pool, they were out of beer. Twice, they were out of ice for daquaries. The swim-up bars closed, theoretically at 6 pm, which is already bad enough, but but they started closing as early as 5. The staff didn't even look at you when you went to the bar for a drink, but instead kept cleaning. When you asked for a drink, they just mumbled, "closing." This happened every day at the main bar. Our youngest two were ignored unless our oldest or my wife and I were with them. Even after monetary tips to the bartenders and servers, drinks were hard to come by. CLEANLINESS The rooms were clean enough when we arrived, but the service to them was spotty. One day the coffee mugs were not replaced and only one room had its bed made. The floors were not cleaned all week and the showers were not cleaned the last three days. The outside was fairly clean and the restaurants and public areas seemed clean enough. The grounds were very well manicured. There was a ton of construction. There was a restaurant shut down; two areas were barricaded by large sections of plywood; walls were being constructed. It was like living inside a renovation for a week...not exactly relaxing. We are in Mexico, so you have to expect some insect life. There were mosquitos, spiders, ants and a very large (2-inch) bug which looked a little like a locust. We were ok with mosquitos. The "locust" was our guest for the week, but he mostly kept to dark areas. The spiders we killed. There was also a bug that was not quite distinguishable after my wife squished it. None of this was overwhelming, but you should be prepared for it. SPA My wife and I did a couples massage. It was one of the highlights of the resort experience. The staff was nice. It was a relaxing area and the cold/hot tubs, sauna and steam rooms were great. RESTAURANTS There are really only two restaurants. One is near the check-in area and is more family-oriented with a buffet-style selection and different types of food each night. The other restaurant pretends to be three with one under construction. However, all of these restaurants share one kitchen. We are not sure if this is what caused slow services or not, but the service was VERY slow. The selection of meals for kids at Tsuki (Asian) was not great and they didn't seem to want to accomodate requests. We ended up taking the kids to the buffet at Flavours for dinners, even if we (mom and dad) ate at one of the other locations. The portions are incredibly small. The duck entree, which tasted great, included three, 2-inch by 1/2 inch strips of duck and a tablespoon of carrots and greens. My 12 year old needed to go to the buffet afterward to get more food. The sushi was good as well. The desserts were portion-size challenged, too. The cheesecake was a one-inch diameter cupcake on a plate. It was less than a bite and that was all you received. We were only on site for lunch twice (see beach and pool section.) Only one restaurant was open for lunch. The kids pizzas and hamburgers were ok and the "barbeque area" which served chicken and sausages was, likewise alright, but was far away from the pool areas and had little selection (not even cheese for the hamburgers!) Service at the lunch areas was also very slow. It took 45 minutes to get a meal of a warmed up pizza for each of my sons and a hamburger. Also, beware of some extra charges for room service ($6 Delivery charge) and for top-level wines. We waited 1 hour and 20 minutes for a room service delivery the one time we used it. ENTERTAINMENT and KIDS CLUB The nighttime entertainment was another bright spot. It was a little hokey (think Dirty Dancing) but good. The fire show was good and the carribean dancing show was also very good. The daytime entertainment, was a little less than we expected, but they tried. Our young kids liked the one day that they were at Kids Club. There were games, a gymboree kind of area and a small pool. The staff seemed nice. There was a bit of a language barrier. It was good for kids under age 8. There was nothing for our 12 year old to do at all (he did not stay there.) According to the booklet, there was supposed to be a teen kids club, but, as it turned out, there was not. It was a tough resort for him as the adults ruled the pool and the young kids were in kids club. The Tweeners and teenagers all looked bored.

Reviews.Title: “saved by a nightmare at dreams tulum”
Reviews.Author: JoanieBaker
Reviews.Content: we booked our trip at dreams tulum which was a nightmare after 3 hrs we ran away as fast as we could azul fives was wonderful the staff was very friendly and could not do enough for you the room were wonderful we had a 2 bedroom suite my only complaint was the beach it was very rocky and made it hard to get into the water but that was the only problem that we can say we will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing week”
Reviews.Author: TammyandMike
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 7/16 in the evening. The Cancun airport is crazy. You are verbally assaulted by time share people. If you aren't warned you would never know. They tell you that you have to stop and answer their questions or fill out forms. At the hotel we were the only people checking in and it went quickly and smoothly. A cart driver took us to our room after giving us a tour of the grounds. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. We had a one bedroom suite. The bedroom is separated by a sliding door that does not lock. The weather was beautiful the entire week. Hot, humid with only one short storm on Friday evening. The temperature wasn't a problem since we stayed at the pool all day. We went into town one afternoon but it was too hot to enjoy it. Go in the evening when it is cooler! The food was very good. Breakfast was buffet style in Flavours. Variety was fine for the week. The eggs are so buttery and delicious. There was an omelette bar each day. The orange juice is so sweet and made great Mimosas. Lunch was either Sea Olive or a grill out in the garden area. The staff grilled hamburgers, steak, chicken and fish. There were side dishes and their FANTASTIC Guacamole!!! Sea Olive had wonderful, freshly prepared cuisine. The food is a mix of all nationalities with highlights of the local Yucatan food. Not what you typically see in the States. No salsa, no tacos! Dinner was Sea Olive, Tsiki or Flavours. Sea Olive is mediteranean, Tsiki is Asian and Flavours has a different theme each night. Food was always good. A couple of the pool bars also served snack food and light meals. The Zky bar is open each night and is all ages until 10:30. They show music videos, there is a movie on the schedule but we never saw one, and they have a nightly performance at 9:30. The Michael Jackson show was Great! The guys who directed the activities were so friendly and energetic. There is an activity schedule posted by the pool and on the TV. There is also a newsletter that is in the lobby of each restaurant listing daily information. Beware - information is not always accurate. The posted theme for Flavours dinner wasn't always what you got when you arrived. We showed up on Mediteranean night and they were serving Oriental food. There was also listings for wine tastings and tequila samples. We never saw either of them and the staff we asked had no idea what we were talking about. The activity shed, where you can get kayaks and snorkeling gear was sometimes closed for the day with no explanation. The hotel is in the process of adding some new restaurants and improving the grounds. A big thank you to Sergio in the smoothie bar. My son visited him multiple times each day. Sergio even took the time to give him smoothie making lessons. Yadira at the Infinity pool gave us such great service. She was always there ready to get us whatever we needed. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Everywhere you went you were greeted by staff members. The only problem came when we made a business call using a local Mexico number. It was a toll free number but the hotel charged us $4 per minute anyway. I am not sure that they understood that they would not be charged for the call. We make these types of business calls all around the world multiple times per year and this is the only time that we have been charged for them. The infinity pool has the most refreshing water. The other pools have very warm water. We felt very much at home here. Since this was our first visit to Mexico we can't really compare it with the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews before you go”
Reviews.Author: NancyMac711
Reviews.Content: We just got back 7/23/2011 from Azul Fives. We took our son, 20 and his girlfriend, 19. They had a blast and loved it because they could drink. They loved the swim up bars in the pools and they met up with some other young adults and had a good time with them. The hotel was nice we had a two bedroom suite, however, it was musty and the air conditioning wasn't really adequate for the suite size. The people that work there are very nice and helpful. We did the all inclusive package. You have to because there is nowhere else close to go and eat. The food was average at best, edible, but not up to the standards for the money they charged. The Sushi restaurant was very good however. This is a family resort so expect couples with young children. The pools were great, but the beach was not great full of rocks and coral. Don't expect your room to be on the water!! We requested a suite on the beach and were surprised that they did not have any rooms on the beach. The hotel is rated four (4) stars) - I would give it a 3 star rating. Playa del Carmen is well okay they had one street to go shopping on and nothing is inexpensive. This was a very expensive vacation. Any of the day trips are outrageous in price. Oh before I sign off all four of us went to the spa. VERY EXPENSIVE, but it was really nice and relaxing. WE all loved it. Good luck. BTW, I live in a very expensive resort community, so I know how expensive things can be. The price to do any type of water sports was extremely high. No, they don't do much bargaining.

Reviews.Title: “So Many Problems in the First 24 Hours, We Switched Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Jarmos
Reviews.Content: While the accomodations at Azul Fives - and the kids club - are outstanding, we had so many problems (which took too much effort on our part to resolve) that we switched resorts after the first night. Azul Fives is billed as being having so many great amenities for young kids - which is one big reason why we booked there. While some of this is true, it took us a hour to get a waiter's attention at dinner, were never asked for a drink order, had to beg for them to bring out bread or something for our 2 and 4 year olds to munch on and then they brought out entrees and appetizers in totally random order. With my 2 year old fed and ready for bed, I took him back to our room (before my entree was brought out), and figured I'd just call room service. Two hours and three phone calls later, my order arrived. Meanwhile, we had called because our air conditioning wasn't really cooling the suite properly. They sent someone out to fix it, and in the middle of the night, one of our rooms completely lost air. Again, it took hours and several phone calls to fix the problem. We were on a 10-day vacation, so after having all of these issues in the first 24 hours, we decided to move to Aventura Cove Palace. While it was nice, and the service was good, it was dated, rooms were small and it was not worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms”
Reviews.Author: iconnorcsr
Reviews.Content: The 2-bedroom villa for my family of 5 exceeded our expectations. We were very impressed with its size and luxury. We loved having 3 TVs, 3 DVD players, and 2 1/2 baths. The fire show, the Michael Jackson show, and the circus show are a must-see! Best shows we've ever been to out of the three Cancun resorts we've stayed at. Oh, there was also a bonfire with marshmellows and a movie on the beach. The cons were the long waits at times in restaurants and the repetitive music and videos. Staff was excellent! We would definitely return. They are adding restaurants that we're looking forward to visiting as well as making the beach more accessible due to the rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: TerpWife
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is attractive enough: very large rooms, beautiful grounds, and a neat, family-friend concept. HOWEVER ... we had many issues with the resort, their services and their personnel. The rooms had bugs, bad lighting, and in at least 2 roms, a disgusting mildewy smell. The tubs were stained, surprisingly for a "new" resort. The resort mgmt (group director and tour coordinator) were clearly motivated only by financials: they steered us toward inappropriate tours, gave vague information, withheld key details, and were inflexible when changes were required. They dealt with problems with evasive rigidity, with NO focus on customer service. Many of promised services were not available as advertised: watersports were only available on one of our 5 days - despite the weather being perfectly fine. One of the major pools was essentially closed, including it's bar. Only one restaurant served breakfast at all. The activities were lame - aerobics, dance lessons, and "shows" had a markedly high-school hour feel. The beach is rocky and largely impassable. The food was acceptable - breakfast and lunch were basic, although the dinners were more upscale and tasty. I love Playa del Carmen and will definitely be back - but never again to the Azul 5s.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: tomtom1111
Reviews.Content: Clean, almost brand new resort with great pools and restaurants. We spent five days with our 8 year old son and loved every minute. The hotel is about 25 minutes south of cancun. Delta travel handled our transport to the hotel, which was fast and efficient. The rooms are very clean and well appointed, our son loved the in-suite jacuzzi and there was a full kitchen that we didn't need (because we selected the all inclusive option). We were in the first set of rooms, near the front of the resort, close to the Flavors restaurant and a 20 yard hop into the pool. Three of the pools run the interior of the resort and act as sort of a lazy river to move between rooms and the pool bars. There is also an infinity pool that overlooks a beautiful white sand beach. This pool is close to three restaurants and has a pool bar as well. The beach itself was clean and the water warm and inviting, but there are a lot of rocks about 10 yards out, which made playing in the surf difficult. If you're a snorkeler, you can swim past the rocks, we saw many doing this, but it wasn't our thing. For those interested in the all inclusive, here's the run down. Pool bars are open from around noon until 5:00ish. After 5, you can get drinks at the main bar (by the infinity pool, open late) and at Flavors restaurant (until 10). Rooms service can bring cans of beer to your room, but don't deliver anything stronger. The restaurants were excellent, service was generally quick and efficient. Flavors had a great breakfast buffet that ran from 6:30am til noon, lunch was available at the Sea Olive (sit down) the Lizard (part of the pool bar) and a bbq setup from noon until 3. All of the food has to be eaten in specified areas, which was a big deal, but made pulling my son away from the pool more difficult. There also weren't any snacky foods (chips, cookies, etc..) available as part of the AI package. Not a huge deal, but sometime you want just a snack, not a full meal... There are three restaurants open at dinner, the Sea Olive has outdoor seating and an assorted menu, Tsuki, has a pacific-asian theme with sushi and other asian-fusion dishes. Flavors offers a similar menu to the Sea Olive, but seems more formal. There is also a fourth restaurant, but it was not part of the AI package, so we didn't experience it. There are no dress requirements at any of the restaurants, tee-shirts and baseball hats mix with island casual. The Sky bar offers drinks and dancing each night and have a family friendly show each night (magic, mexican dancers, circus acts and a Michael Jackson impersonator). Our son is a pool rat and very happy to swim 24/7, there was some water sports available (boogie boards, kayaks) and a game area with an oversized chess/checkers set, a pingpong table and shuffleboard set up. The paddles and pucks are only available when the kids club is open (usually until 5) which was a challenge since the area is not in the shade and an early afternoon game under the mexican sun can sap your energy... We did a package tour to Chechen Itza, which was incredible, but a very long bus ride (2.5 hours both ways). We also decided to walk from our resort to Playa Del Carmen, which took about 2 hours and picked up a cab back to the resort. We didn't take advantage of the in room Internet, it required an ethernet connection. You could also get a password for their wifi, which seemed to be well distributed near the pools, I was able to get a wifi (open) connection at the infinity pool on my iphone. Overall, the service was excellent, the staff was friendly and helpful and the ocean breeze kept us cool and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!"”
Reviews.Author: mria
Reviews.Content: From the time of arrival to our departure, the service was quality. Upon arrival the lobby was clean, well-kept and since it was steamy hot when we arrived, we were greeted with cold, lavender scented towelettes while we checked in. Members are proficient in both english and spanish, therefore communication is fairly easy. The simple architecture and white facade of each building adorned with vivid greenery create a refreshing and relaxing atmosphere. Since the resort is fairly new, the grounds and the rooms are clean and well-kept. There are three major restaurants and four swim-up bars. There are activities planned for daytime and nighttime entertainment. We loved the tequila tasting and beach volleyball. Needless to say, you will not be bored. I cannot rave enough about the friendliness and accommodating nature of every person working in the resort. Be prepared to get a "hola, buenos dias " from even the grounds crew! Even though there were many families there, as a couple, we loved the fact that we could go to different areas of the hotel and not be bombarded by children. By the way, they are very accommodating to people with families. It was nice to see this. Honestly, the only thing that bothered me was that the swim-up bars closed at 6pm! Word to the wise, if you buy an all-inclusive package make sure you pay attention to which services are NOT included (i.e exclusive wines, spa services etc.). Also, bring some cash(dollars or pesos they take both) just in case you want to tip the service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, two items stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: daurand
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Mexico for my 3 teenage sons and myself. We found the property to be beautiful and very clean. It was a great family resort. It was small enough to have a very homey, comfortable feel to it (approximately 300 rooms in 12 villas). The food was good, but they need to add a few more restaurants, which apparently they are going to do within the next few months. Also, while there is a great kids club for kids 12 and under, there wasn't as much for teenagers to do. The resort said they are aware of this and are in the process of adding a teen club. The one big negative to our trip was that we had two incidents of theft from our room. All my cash was stolen from a drawer I had hidden it in. I had approximately $220. Then, two days later, my son's IPOD was stolen. The security people at the hotel were nice to a point, but they really didn't believe my items were stolen. They felt we probably misplace them. That wasn't possible because we never took cash or IPODs out of our room. We felt there were too many people walking in and out of our room. One day, we had a broken toilet, and there were many different people coming in and out of our room. I came back to my room twice that afternoon only to find the door to my room wide open with no one in it. My warning to all travelers is to lock up everything in your room, although it's unfortunately you have to do this in a high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars with a bullet”
Reviews.Author: yankeefan51NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 7 nights stay at Azul Fives, dates of our trip were 7/2-7/9. Vacationed with my wife and my brother and his wife. The following is a breakdown of the different aspects of our trip. Transfers: We used USA Transfer for the roundtrip private tranfers and both ways were quick and efficient. Checkin: We were offered sparkling wine upon arrival and since we were there @11:30am our rooms were not ready yet so we were taken to lunch and upon our return both the 1 bedroom suites were ready, we were driven to our suites in a golfcart and our luggage soon followed. Rooms: The one bedroom suite is very spacious and comfortable,the 1&1/2 bathrooms are great. The lighting in the vanity area definately needs upgrading. Closet and storage area are plentiful. AC was fine but it did make the chandelier clank all the time. Housekeeping did a fine job everyday. Pools: The pools are terrific and do wind around most of the property. We mostly swam at the Lizards pool which had the snack bar directly behind it making for quick nachos, burgers ,etc.The bartenders,Ali, Cheddar(Ivanhoe) and Domingo did a fine job keeping the drinks flowing. The Infinity pool near the beach is very nice also but has more guest and not as peaceful. Beach: The beach area has plenty of loungers and looks good but the coral, rocky entry make for a difficult swim. A 5-10 minute walk south(to the right) will bring you to a nice area for entering the water with no problem but the water is shallow,probably a sandbar. Restaurants/Food:Flavours is the International restauraunt that was open for Breakfast featuring a buffet with an omlette station.All items were served hot and were good. The pastries could be better, the coffee and tea were very good.Dinner items were quite good here. Sea Olive was open for lunch and dinner. Lunch at the Sea Olive was excellent and all items on the menu were great (Highly recommended for lunch). Dinner items were good but service seems a little slow at dinner, we ate there twice for dinner at had the same experience. Tsuki is the Asian restaurant that is open for dinner only and was our favorite, all the items on the menu are very tasty and you can't go wrong sampling them all. Staff: everyone we encountered was openly friendly and polite, we had great service from the following Hostesses Sol, Bernice Waiters Jose, Esteban, Ammondo,Flavio,Manuel,Mayo and their captain Christopher. A special thanks to Yadira Carrion for taking care of my request. Final thought: overall we had a great time at Azul Fives' there are a couple items that will get better as the resort matures, we were told the two additional restaurant will be added in the near future( a Mexican and an Italian) and that will help out with more variety, an expansion is also in the future adding more room and an additional two restaurants bring the total to seven. The property is on it's way to a five star in the not to distant future.

Reviews.Title: “The Good & The Bad”
Reviews.Author: csumn
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Azul Fives (AF) resort in early July. There were a lot of good things about the resort and then some bad things. There are a variety of reviews on here about AF and I hope I can help others in deciding where to stay in the Maya Riviera. First of all, bring insect repellant. Put it on before you arrive at the resort. The mosquitos are everywhere. We sprayed it on in the morning and reapplied it as needed after going in the pool, etc. After being bitten in the night, the spray went one before bedtime as well. The front desk was a bit chaotic when we first arrived, but very soon were made to feel welcome by the staff. All of the golf cart drivers that take you to your room and around AF were fantastic and super nice. We booked a 1-bedroom suite and were put in Villa 1. Unfortunately, this is one of the "condo" rooms which meant most of the kitchen cabinets were locked and the "extra bathroom" in the living room area was a locked storage closet. Not what you want with a family of 4 with 2 little kids always needing to go to the bathroom in the night. Villa 1 is also right next to the entrance of the resort and the buffet restaurant, gym and spa, but the furthest away from the beach, kids club and other restaurants. We asked to be moved because of this and didn't get any resolution until the next day at check-in time. We could have downgraded to a smaller room that night, but chose to wait to get the room we booked and paid for. We were moved to Villa 5 which was great. Right next to the kid's club and a short distance to the beach and the infinity pool which were the places to be. Room issues with the new room was that the ceiling fans operated via remote control. The one in our main bedroom did not work including the light staying on. We had to get someone in to fix this. Everyone on staff was fast at helping whenever needed. The lighting in the bathroom is not good as it has been reported. I always went into the living area and used the huge mirror to do my hair and makeup. So much easier. For those planning on using the sofa bed for the kids in the 1-bedroom suite. It may or may not have any bedding already on it. Check this before you get ready to go to sleep or you'll have to wait for housekeeping to bring you anything. Make sure to ask for sheets, blanket and pillows because there are no extras in the closet. It's a sectional and you take the larger side for the bed. We used the "extra" part to make a 2nd bed for our other child, just needed extra bedding for that as well. Housekeeping was very hit and miss. There was no toilet paper in the "extra" bathroom that we had to request. The kleenex dispenser was empty. They took the "do not disturb" sign for the door after the first night so we were woken up by housekeeping a couple of mornings. Bath mat was taken away after the first day and returned 2 days later. Didn't get any face towels after the 2nd day. Had to request those. Lots of calls to housekeeping and leaving notes in the best Spanish language I could muster. The chandelier does make a clunking noise, but was worse in Villa 1 than 5 for some reason. It appeared that you needed to put your room service plates, etc. outside the main door to your room (there's a foyer first), which led to ants near the room. There were some inside as well (on the 2nd floor). We had a trash bag liner in the kitchen can (located under the sink in the cabinet) and also in the bathrooms for just 1 day. Never to return. Made it difficult to throw out any uneaten food, etc. from room service. As far as the resort itself, you have to go down a bumpy side road to get to it. Some of the other resorts along the highway had gigantic stone entryways right off the highway, so it seemed a bit odd when we took the "scenic route" to AF. The kid's club was fantastic. Our kids loved it (ages 4 and 6), but I'd be hesitant with teenagers, it's not really something for them. Watch out for face painting night. The paint was not easy to get off their faces and ended up all over their clothes and the room. They take the kids to the main pool and the beach as well. Didn't see them go in the kiddie pool at the kids club. Infinity pool was great. Only goes to about 4 feet, so no deep end really. Great for people watching and the beach view. Great service here as well at the pool bar. The beach has nice sand, nearer the water, there's bits of shells that make it a bit crunchy underfoot. There are rocks (coral?) at the front and even with treaded water shoes, I would watch your step if a wave hits you then you could easily slip and fall in the water and possibly hurt yourself. You can walk down the beach if you want to go right in without the rocks. Watch out for ants near the lounge chairs that move to where someone may have spilled a drink. Only saw one night of the shows. A fire show on the beach. It was a bit late for the kids (9:30), but we really enjoyed it. I would suggest you book enough days there to account for weather/rain issues. It rained everyday and we had only 2 days where we had enough sun to go to the pool for more than 20 minutes. There's not much to do there if it rains. I didn't see too many people tipping, but we tipped $5 at each meal, $2-3 for room service and $2-3 for housekeeping each day. Would I go here agin? Probably. When the sun was out, it was great to go to the beach or the pool. I've never been to this area before so I have nothing to compare it to as far as other resorts. The room was great except for all the little nit-picky things. I just wished the rain had stayed away. Please message me if you have any questions. I did so with other reviewers before we went and they were immensely helpful in answering random questions about AF.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and forget your stress”
Reviews.Author: krntxn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently were married at the Azul Fives in early June. We spent 5 nights there. I had an incredible amount of anxiety about this location from all the poor reviews I read and my husband disliking sand, hot weather and Mexico (he compromised on the location to make me happy). From the moment we arrived, we had an incredible vacation. We were immediately upgraded to a 2 bedroom penthouse suite complete with a rooftop deck without making the request. Ernesto drove us around the property to our suite and gave us our incredible introduction to our rooms. Our deck was spacious enough for many guests and included a cold water jacuzzi, barbeque grill and bathroom so people didn't have to walk downstairs. My husband was in complete awe. The rooms are incredibly nice and roomy. It's above what I've seen at other resorts. And the bed was comfortable to sleep in. Room services is just room service. It was just average. I can't complain since I never had an upset stomach my entire stay which is uncommon for me even at home. There are 3 restaurants that rotated lunch and dinner service due to the low occupation on the resort. We loved that it wasn't crowded since we could enjoy the atmosphere and service. When our guests arrived they experienced the same type of experience. Sol, Berniece, Jesus, Armando, Manual and Jorge are among the few that provided excellent service. They went above and beyond what I personally consider good service. And as we learned their names and some of their backgrounds, they also learned ours. When our wedding day approached, they all seemed to know that we were the couple getting married that Saturday and gave their well wishes and sentiments. On our wedding day, Estefania from the resort and Itzy from Lomas Travel eased all my anxiety about having a destination wedding. These girls are professionals and have an eye for detail. I can't say enough good things about how well things went. They arranged so our ceremony could be in the Zky Bar so my husband wouldn't sweat his suit off. My hair is especially curly and typically I straighten it. There was no amount of work I could do alone to make it manageable. Estefania and Itzy made an appointment for my hair to be done. I was extremely pleased with the outcome. It stayed up until I washed it out. We arranged for our dinner after our ceremony and it too was wonderful. The staff took great care of everything and even teased the both of us at certain times since we had already gotten to know them. The next morning our breakfast in bed was late and I had to run to eat make it for my scuba dive trip. I ran over to the restaurant and the head waiter recognized me immediately and asked why wasn't I in my room. I explained I have to eat before I go on my dive but my husband is in the room so it's ok. He went out of his way to have everything on our breakfast in bed menu served to me there in the restaurant while my husband had an identical one served in the room. We chose Caribe Photography for our wedding photographer and coincidentally they are among the list of photographers that Azul allows on site without an extra charge. Marco, our photographer is extremely talented. He took some beautiful pictures that have many of our friends in family stunned at our gorgeous pictures. I will add there was a miscommunication about when our pictures would arrive stateside but everyone at Lomas Travel did their best to take care my questions. We did go on several excursions on our trip that were handled by Lomas Travel. My husband and my brother went to Coba. They were informed it was to be a 4-5 hour trip which ended up being gone 10 1/2 hours instead. They came back hungry, sweaty and irritable. Two vans broke down that were to return them back to the resort. My brother actually got under the hood to reconnect a battery cable to get it started. The very next day we went to discuss the trip with Gerry who is with Lomas Travel. He knew what happened before we even got to tell him. He was so apologetic about their experience. He arranged for my husband and my brother to take another excursion to snorkel and sky ride (similar to para-sailing). Those 2 came back with gigantic smiles and some incredible pictures. I ended up scuba diving with a friend and had an incredible dive and saw a lot of wildlife. The beach is beautiful there. It's only a small strip at the end of the hotel However there is coral right in front of the Azul's beach and inexperienced swimmers should walk down the beach where it's clearer. It did not detract from my experience whatsoever. The nighttime entertainment would have to be the one place it was lacking. We went up to the Zky Bar in the evening expecting music and possible dancing. Instead people were playing bingo and poker. When one of my guests went to inquire about music, they were told that it would start at 1030p. At 1030p they switched from bingo to Mexican bingo which was funny to me. The evening of our wedding, it was an equal let down. I didn't want to go out into Playa but stay at the resort and enjoy the amenities but the entertainment was sorely lacking. I will admit that since the resort was not heavily populated, that could be among the reasons why the entertainment and activities were not stellar. There were very few things I could complain about. The lighting in the bathroom is definitely dim to put on makeup. I had to turn on all the lights (there are a ton of light switches to figure out) so I could have more light to do my hair and makeup. Internet is not a free amenity here. I was incredibly surprised to learn that it was $15/day or $75/week. I feel like I should have opted for their plan after I accessed my email on my phone for a mere 15 min. That 15 min cost me triple their weekly rate. The room service menu could include a few more items. Most of the deserts were strangely shaped like flan but flan was not on the menu. Even the tiramisu was shaped like flan, lacked lady fingers and just tasted like coffee. My wedding cake was absolutely horrible. Not one of my guests ate more than a single bite. The flowers and trim were supposed to be a light pink and instead were a hot pink. (For those that know me well, it was incredibly funny). That was such a waste of money to spend on a cake I hated. For me to mention these few things even seems petty. That's how great everything else was on our stay. I think that our entire experience was wonderful. The best compliment I could give is that my husband wants to return. That's huge for someone that hates sand, heat and thought he hated Mexico. In fact he's mentioned it many many times since we've returned. It is an incredibly beautiful place. I have wonderful pictures of our wedding and great memories of our stay. I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: 1walker1
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week with my husband and 18 year old daughter and we had a great vacation. The property was just beautiful and the grounds were very well maintained. The pictures don't do it justice. If there were ever issues with the staff, management has taken care of them. We had a champagne reception at check in and everyone we encountered was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Nothing was stolen from our rooms and the refrigerator in both rooms was stocked everyday. Based on other reviews I even brought my own instant coffee fearing the coffee bar in the room wouldn't be restocked but it was never an issue. Many staff made a point to remember our names and even what we liked to drink. When it started to rain one afternoon the bartender at the Lizards pool bar ran to put our things under the umbrella so they wouldn't get wet - how thoughtful was that. Shout out to Santiago and Christian - they made my daughter feel special and even helped her with her Spanish. She learned how to Salsa too. Never having been to an all inclusive, we thought the food was very good for the most part but by the end of the week we were ready for something else. Flavours was open for Breakfast where you order from the menu or the buffet and it was good. The Smoothie Bar was tucked in between the spa and the gym. Lunch was Sea Olive or Lizards. We usually ate at the pool bar unless it was raining (which it did for 3 days straight) as Sea Olive seemed a little formal for our swimsuits. Sea Olive has a nice outside dining area but when it rained it would get wet. I loved the ceviche, guacamole and nachos at Lizards but wished the resort offered more Mexican dishes. Sea Olive and Tsuki were open for dinner. Sea Olive was OK but could have used a few more choices on the dinner menu (they should consider opening up their lunch menu for dinner too); the wait staff was very friendly and attentive. We really enjoyed Tsuki. One night at Sea Olive we asked if we could have sushi appetizers from Tsuki and they arrived with no fuss. We found the wine, both red and white, to be very good. We went to the entertainment every night and thought it was just great. We took advantage of the Spa and it ranks right up there as one of the best I've experienced. The prices were comparable to any nice spa in a large resort so people that complained about the prices must not go to many resort spas. They were offering a 2 for 1 treatment special which sealed the deal for me and the personal attention we received was worth the price. I also used the gym most days and it had everything I needed. I had to ask someone to make the room cooler 2 of the days which they did with no issue. We had a 2 BR penthouse and it was perfect since we had our teenage daughter with us so it afforded everyone plenty of privacy. She was thrilled with her room, it was really large and had it's own balcony. Unfortunately we had to be moved in the middle of our stay because her room started leaking from all of the rain. Our 1 BR suite was very spacious and comfortable. We never had any issues with cleanliness that others have complained about and always had fresh towels (some shaped like swans and rabbits too, a very nice touch). The lighting in the bathroom vanity is terrible though- even my husband commented on that. I was able to swing the makeup mirror into the water closet where there was plenty of light to see to put on my makeup! There were some other design issues like the light fixture over the dining room table that rattled non stop from the air vents blowing on it and it was just loud enough to become very annoying after a while. We couldn't figure out how to get the shower to work after we were moved but called maintenance and they were there in just a few minutes to take care of it. About the view, the first half of the week our view was of the woods and a dirt road separated by a fence (villa 7). We were on the 3rd floor so it afforded plenty of privacy and we could see a little of the ocean - it was peaceful as there was no noise coming from the pool area. If I had been on the first floor I would not have wanted to look out at a fence. When we were moved (villa 8), we overlooked the pool with a pretty view of the property but it obviously didn't have the same privacy. That wasn't as much of an issue since the resort was no where near capacity but if there were lots of people at the pool all day long I would not have liked overlooking all of that noise and activity. It just depends on what your family prefers. Not sure I would do the penthouse again for my small family since we really didn't need the space. It was a very cool concept but it was too hot to use during the day since there was no shade and no cover when it rained. The Jacuzzi only had cold water so we never used it either. I can see if you had a large group it would be a nice place to have a cookout catered or to hang out in the evening but we did not get our money's worth from that. There isn't much to do when it rains or places to go other than your room but I think they realize this and are working on some rain activities. I am a beach person more than a pool person so not having access to the ocean was a let down for me - yeah, you only have to walk a few minutes down the beach but if I'm spending that much money I want to be able to get out of my lounge chair and swim in the ocean. My husband and daughter prefer the pool area so they were very happy. The infinity pool at the beach and the beach itself was awesome with lots of lounge chairs, palm trees and nice service. I didn't find it to be tiny and crowded whatsoever. It was really beautiful and the view was just what I had hoped for. Don't be put off by some of the bad reviews. They are very unrealistic and certainly don't outweigh all of the good things Azul Fives has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Coolhandluke13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Azul Fives with family and friends and felt the need to write a short review for those that might be considering a stay. I must say beforehand that I read many reviews before we left in hopes to find any useful information. Well, there was enough negative talk to raise some concerns. However, in light that we all have individual experiences, our stay was without hesitation, fantastic! It would be unfair to this resort to discredit their endeavors by not acknowledging the amount of effort the staff ignites to meet the needs for a mass variety. Thank you staff. We began our stay by a very smooth friendly front desk visit and was escorted via golf cart to our room. Our room was spacious and clean with a modern motif. We had a beautiful jungle like view that was frequently visited by a family of Spider Monkeys. It was hot outside and decided to hang out by the main pool area. The pool was well taken care of and offers a swim up bar. The bartenders were always willing to quench your thirst with your drink of choice and even upon request, concoct something on their own. Oh, I liked the Mango Margarita. The ocean provided a special canvas for that special feel. The beach in front of the resort is rocky but didn't bother us because we enjoyed our ocean walks and found spots to dip in. The food provided by the restaurants was on point. They offer a nice variety and more importantly...they aim to please! So if your order isn't satisfying, say something. The staff works hard to please your needs. Also, room service is available. The kids enjoyed ordering refreshments and were ALWAYS served with a smile. Thank you everyone for a wonderful experience. For those of you reading this review: I strongly recommend a stay here. No worries......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Visit to The Fives”
Reviews.Author: MaxTraveller
Reviews.Content: Visited the Mayan Riviera area to stay at the El Dorado Royale for a week. However, since my fiance and I are scheduled to get married at Azul Fives later this Fall, we decided to schedule a visit. We actually visited the Fives during some inclement weather as a tropical depression was passing through. Overall, our visit was fantastic. Estefania is our wedding coordinator who graciously gave us a property tour. Most of the other guest have covered various topics well on this site. So, I agree with the modern and spacious rooms. Given that we are having over 40 guest coming to the property, we wanted to see the different room types. From the deluxe room with two double beds all the way to the two or three bedroom penthouse condo, the rooms are quite spacious and truly feels like a nice contemporary condo. Other areas are quite impressive including several pools w/swim-up bars, first-class/excellent spa and Fisher Price klids club. I am a gym finatic and was worried that they would not have adequate facilities, that was proven wrong. Their gym is very nice, modern with a selection of freeweight dumbells, cardio and lifting stations. Equally impressive is the sky bar which overlooks the pool and beach area. In speaking with our coordinator, we raised many concerns previously posted on this site regarding theft of personal items and broken in-room safes. She assured us that the hotel went through a thorough revamping of its staff and that the problems immediately ceased. Overall, we left very satisfied and confident that we made the right decision to come to the Fives for our wedding. We have enjoyed the El Dorado Royale resort for a week and know that we will be in for a treat at Azul Fives.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent's Opinion of Resort”
Reviews.Author: TripGuy
Reviews.Content: As I visit anywhere from 8-10 all-inclusive resorts a year on business or pleasure, I feel that I can do a generally good job at comparing one from another. This resort shines in certain areas, and still has work to do in others, but overall is a very high quality resort. The Skinny: The Rooms - Probably the nicest, largest rooms for families in Riviera Maya. We stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse suite with 2.5 bathrooms. Master bedroom was good size, good design, and large comfortable bed. Somewhat short on closet space but due to large size, more than enough space for suitcases to act as additional storage. Children's room was also excellent size with nicely designed bathroom. Family room was amazing with comfortable sofa, powder room, and kitchen. We didn't use this extra space often, but was nice to be able to spread out. Showers were great with no hot water issues even at peak times. Pools - there must be 10 pools on property....some around the rooms and then the larger pool by the beach. All were spotless and modern. Temperature was fine even for the kids, and the rumor is that they will soon all be heated. Service - we found service in all areas to be top notch (restaurants, housekeeping, bartending, beach, spa, etc.). Everyone had a smile and was very friendly. Employees seemed happy to serve and some totally went out of their way, especially with the kids, to ensure that everything was going well. Food - although I enjoyed the food more at El Dorado properties and Azul Beach - they are all the same owner, so although the food surpassed most other family resorts, it didn't meet the really high expectations I had going in. I found the breakfast buffet ok, but lacking variety (and enough fresh vegetables like tomatoes/cucumbers/etc.). Lunch had lots of options both by the pool, the BBQ, or the grills around the pools around the property. No wait for tables as a result. Dinner was somewhat limited and the biggest disappointment....japanese was good but otherwise found the food lacking some variety. They really need 1 or 2 more dinner options to keep things interesting for a week stay. Beach - Yes, the beach here is nice. The ocean isn't (with rocks as others have mentioned). Sand on the beach was clean, with plenty of lounge chairs and great sand. Yes - it is a pain to walk the 4-6 minutes north or south on the beach to swim....but for families where ocean swimming isn't a primary need - the beach and numerous pools more than make up for it. Entertainment - I was pleasantly surprised with the evening entertainment. It's not Iberostar quality but much better than other similar family resorts (Riu, Barcelo, etc.) I did feel that the daytime entertainment was rather lacking for adults, and although the kids club provided some entertainment - I expected more for teens/pre-teens. Perhaps we didn't look for it also. Spa - The spa on property exceeded my expectations. Great waiting area upstairs and relaxing sauna/pool area downstairs. Room Service – Usually one of my biggest pet peeves on property – small menus of pre-prepared food. Not here. Menu was good size with plenty of options for the kids on the meals they didn’t want to go to the restaurant. We even ordered off the menu a couple of times with requests – that the resort had no issue fulfilling Roof deck – Although, I don’t believe most of the people in penthouse rooms even use their deck…..we actually had a private BBQ on the deck one night. It wasn’t very expensive and allowed our group to have an amazing meal to our specifications , excellent food, and top notch service. It would be a great idea for a special birthday, anniversary, or other dinner. Really a great concept that doesn’t exist anywhere else in Riviera Maya. So, all in all, we had a very good stay. With some minor improvements and expansion, this resort could set the standard for family all-inclusives in Riviera Maya. Feel free to private message me if I can answer any specific questions about the property or our stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved this little gem”
Reviews.Author: mistafairy
