Reviews.Content: it's a smaller resort but it makes up for it with excellent food, great service, and amazing rooms. we stayed in on of the suites and it was bar none the nicest room I have ever stayed in, it even had a little fire place. the food was amazing, best guacamole i've ever tasted - and i don't like guacamole :P we had the all inclusive plan, no reservations required at the restaurants and the food was gourmet restaurant calibre. they had those swings at the beach that were very relaxing. the pool is ok, the staff were amazing, super attentive. would make a great spot for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and low key”
Reviews.Author: atlhppwt
Reviews.Content: Compared to other resorts, Azul Fives has a different feel. It is smaller and more intimate, which is terrific if you’re looking for a more relaxed, low key atmosphere, away from the frenetic pace of some resorts. But, when occupancy is low, it almost feels like a ghost town – it was eerie walking to dinner several nights without seeing another person. And swim up bars at a couple of pools were closed because there weren’t enough guests to justify opening them. If you tire of the slow pace, excursions abound and Playa del Carmen is a $15 cab ride away. The grounds are well kept and manicured and the winding river pool is cool and unlike anything I’ve encountered before. There are three restaurants as opposed to the five or six choices at larger resorts. Our penthouse suite was as well appointed as any I’ve stayed in and the Salvatore Ferragamo bath and beauty products are among my favorites from any resort. And in a region of adult only resorts, Azul Fives is family friendly, complete with its own Kid’s Club. Restaurants require no reservations, you simply show up and are seated, a pleasant change from the circus of standing in line at an appointed hour to reserve your restaurant of choice that night. Breakfast is the typical wide-ranging buffet, including an omelet station and bloody mary/mimosa bar. Lunch offerings were a little common, and while adequate, don’t live up to the gourmet-inclusive concept – skimpy ingredients on the pizza and a thin, pre-frozen hamburger patty that got lost on a huge bun. One shock was requesting ketchup and receiving little packets like you get at McDonald’s, definitely not in keeping with the gourmet concept. The restaurants really shine at dinner with superb entrees – Coq Au Vin and Lamb Shank were among my favorites. And if you’re not on the all-inclusive plan, called gourmet-inclusive here, the ala carte menu pricing is very reasonable. Service at the restaurants is not bad but was noticeably slower than what I’ve encountered at other resorts. Except at breakfast, we lingered too long at the hostess stand before someone noticed and came to seat us and it often took too long before anyone approached our table. Chris, the manager at Sea Olive and Tzuki, came to our rescue one night and became our favorite employee. Pluses include a great housekeeping staff, constantly replenishing towels even at turn down. Requests from housekeeping and maintenance were dealt with immediately and satisfactorily. And the evening entertainment (think fire shows and a Caribbean revue) was fun, professional and engaging. Drawbacks include a rocky beach not very suitable for swimming. And we encountered the same issues with hot water from the shower noted in other reviews. We felt foolish after calling maintenance and steaming hot water came pouring out when they turned it on. Something about the design of the handle requires working it just a certain way to get hot water. And the grid over the bathroom sinks causes lighting to be shadowy and uneven, not good for putting on makeup, shaving, or even brushing one’s hair and teeth. The differences between Azul Fives and other resorts is really a matter of degree, a reflection of each resort’s personality. We left happy and satisfied and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: rcpaul
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 5 nights at Azul Fives and we had a great time (couple plus kids age 5 and 8). The service was the best I have had anywhere! I have traveled all over the world and have never had such consistently pleasant interactions with the hotel staff. Five star hotels like the Ritz Carlton have nice service, but it often feels forced and with an expectation of a tip. Without exception, EVERYONE and I mean EVERYONE at Azul Fives was extremely nice and attentive. We could not walk 50 feet without someone saying "Hola." If we looked slightly lost, we were offered help. We were known by name after the first day. We had a 1 bedroom suite, about 1100 square feet and it was beautiful. The first night we had a room looking towards the outside of the resort (some trees and barbed wire included), but we asked for and were moved the next day to a ground floor pool-front suite. The value of having such a huge room was awesome. I can't see going back to a regular hotel room with 2 kids. We could walk onto the patio and jump straight in the pool, but the resort was fairly deserted the first few days and it felt a little lonely. The patio had to be 40 feet long with 2 arm chairs and 2 loungers. We were about 50 feet from a swim-up bar, but it was closed, which was disappointing, presumably because of the low (30%) occupancy. The beach infinity pool and bar were great. My wife commented that the view looked like a Corona commercial. Beach was very nice, but as others have mentioned you need to walk down the beach a little to walk casually into the water due to rocks and coral. The upside is that the kids loved looking at the sea life in the little tide pools between the rocks. We spent all almost our time at the pools anyway so it was not really an issue. The kids loved the kids club, but the first couple of days there were not very many kids. The staff was great and really tried to keep the kids entertained. My 8 year old daughter made a good friend and they were inseparable after the first day. The food was very good, but as others have mentioned the restaurant choices were limited because it is a smaller resort. Fine for 5 days, but if we strayed much longer I think we would have tired of the choices. The service was great. My daughter dropped her fork one time and the waiter SPRINTED over to pick it up and get her a new one. We went to lunch early one day and the restaurant was almost empty. Instead of having one server, with the others just hanging out because their tables were empty, we got two servers at once. All of the wait staff were great. I just saw a review from June 9th giving the resort a 1 star and complaining about the service-- which I think is insane. It is simply not possible that someone was there the same week as we were (or close to it) and had bad service, unless he/she is a complete a##hole--which I think is the more likely explanation. The downside is that the rooms do not have ocean view and restaurant and bar choices are limited. Service and rooms are excellent however, which go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It--Top-Notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: travelpro1098
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband, two grown daughters and their boyfriends for a 3-day getaway, and we were all very impressed! I am in the travel industry, and have travelled all over the world with my family. We have stayed in dozens of five-star (+) all-inclusives (an average of 3-4 per year), and the Azul Fives was definitely one of our favourite resorts. We have mainly stayed at large resorts, and much preferred the quieter vibe of the Azul Fives. The service was absolutely phenomenal---this might be because it was only 25 percent capacity, but regardless, it was great! The staff was extremely friendly and anticipated everything before we had to ask. I am shocked to read about others receiving poor service--have never received such friendly and professional service, anywhere. We stayed in a one and a two-bedroom suite which were lovely. The housekeeping was excellent, as was room service, and maintenance (daughter had problem with sliding door and they responded and repaired immediately). The spa facilities were top notch as well. We stayed for only 3 nights, but might have gotten tired of eating at two restaurants if we were staying for a week. The only two complaints I have are the wine (always horrible at all-inclusive, but I was expecting something decent as it is a "gourment all-inclusive") and we didn't have hot water one night (as we were leaving, I noticed them installing hot water tanks, so I believe they are addressiing this issue). For us, it was also the small things that made our stay so enjoyable: Comfortable pool loungers, no towel cards, no reservations required for restaurants, warm pool, sunscreen provided, and so on. It is difficult to find a resort that can accommodate many people in a suite---I recommend this for large families (a 2-bedroom can accommodate 6 or 8 people). My next vacation will definitely be at a Karisma resort---will try adults only the next time. A special thank you to Pedro, the tennis pro who gave us some good tips, and Gustavo who helped my daughter when she injured herself on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family vacation! Incredible resort!”
Reviews.Author: Carguercio
Reviews.Content: Probably one of our best vacations. We can't say enough about this resort.. We loved everything about it. Lets begin with the service. The people at Azul Fives are so friendly and helpful. Attention to detail is every where. From the ladies at the Kids Club Azulitos Patricia, Ceidy and Nash to our waiters Pascal and Felipe. They remember your name, where you like to sit, what you like to drink... They are the best!!! Our daughter has Celiac disease so she can't eat anything with Gluten.The Exectutive Chef Danton and/or his sous chef Pablo, spoke with us every day 2 or 3 times a day about what she would like to eat. They made everything for her. She was treated like a real princess, from pancakes, to pizza, burgers, brownies and even a HUGE gluten free chocolate chip cookie delivered to the room as a treat. Having 24 hours room service was the best. In the morning we would order fresh juice and fruit for the kids until we were ready to for breakfast. They have a great health bar where we had smoothies everyday made with fresh ingredients. Not having to make reservations at the restaurants was great.. What ever we felt like having that night we had. If we wanted something different they made it for us... The rooms are amazing. Spacious, modern and very accommodating for young families. The Azulitos was truly a blessing.. it rained one afternoon and we took the children to the kids club. They have absolutely everything a child could imagine. A great Gym, Legos, videos games, arts and crafts, all types of toys for all different ages. At one point the kids simply didn't want to leave the kids club. There was also a family of monkey's who lived on the property...the kids and us loved them!! We would definitely go back to Azul Fives!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1 star service for 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: Jribtoyou
Reviews.Content: The customer service is atrocious, all of the complaints we had were literally ignored. Cleanliness is a major issue and the food is nauseating. Pool is nice, there is no pool service though. Rooms are spacious, but unclean and not functional. Service is an absolute joke.

Reviews.Title: “So many sweet things to say, especially the SPA!! TOP quality resort for families”
Reviews.Author: slither76
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, I took my wife and (almost) 2 year old daughter to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary at the 5's. There were many super highlights yet for me, it the top had to most definitely be the spa / massage treatment...beyond incredible! we did a couple's massage together. Steam room, sauna and jacuzzis to wind down before the massage and aromatherapy and peaceful music in the background. The food is awesome and apart from most of the all inclusive places, the food comes freshly served, except in the larger dining, it is display (which they still can serve you if preferred). For those who don't have patience, or big families to feed, and want lots of food choices, this may not be the place for you. I thoroughly enjoyed every meal and even room service was excellent quality. I've been to several resort where something looks good yet may be cold or stale from sitting too long. 5's all is made on demand and 5 star quality. Another highlight for me...my daughter had a blast in the kid's club (of course we had to accompany her being she is still young) as there are so many games and activities, she didn't want to leave!! She (and we) also had a tremendous time in the pools. They are big and are great for those looking to get excercise too with long rivers winding through the condos. We had a unit that faced the pool and enjoyed the large balcony spaces to sit and relax too. There are snack and swim up bars that are with in easy access throughout the resort. Of course there is no perfect resort stay and I have read a few previous posts stating some things we experienced too. For example,, the chandler clanging noises in the dining room because the A/C vent blowing on it is annoying. The staff were great and once we needed sheets for the pull out couch. Housekeeping came in good time and made the bed up, very friendly. A definitely thumbs up from us and we plan to visit again soon. :)

Reviews.Title: “Mother & Daughter Trip”
Reviews.Author: missypjordan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a 5 day vacation here over the Memorial holiday and loved it. Check in was smooth and easy. Lomas travel didn't push anything on us and was helpful with questions on our visit to 5th ave to Playa del Carmen. Bellboys swept us away on a golf cart which was brilliant for dinner arrivals also. We were located in Villa 8 which I loved due to the lizards swim up and grill are located at that end. We were in a basic deluxe room which was perfect for our needs. These do not have a tub so if you have a younger child to bath this would not work. Nice touch with the rain shower head. Goumet inclusive rings true! We loved the food offered and enjoyed every meal. My husband and I stayed at Secrets Maroma in January and the food here at Azul Fives was way better.We ate breakfest every morning at Flavours and loved the french toast and of course the verde juice which is just green oranges blended with pistashios a must try and blows the orange juice away. We at lunch at Sea olive twice and enjoyed the break from the sun as it was in the high 90F during our stay. The rest of or luches was easily located at lizards grill. For dinner our first evening we did the buffet at Flavours and it was fabulous. My favorite was Tsuki and the other night at Sea Olive and one night downtown at Carboncitos for some local mexican fare and it is rated #2 here on trip advisor location is 4 calle and 5th ave. As we know there is coral on the beach front which is disapointing but we just walked north and in front of the princesss it is clear. We were able to find lots of seashells and some sea glass and tons of coral. All the staff was wonderful from the front desk, bellmen, waiters, bartenders, hostesses, and entertaintment team. With a special thanks to Gama in the entertainment team he made a difference in my 17 year old daughters stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: sj7
Reviews.Content: We just got home from Azul Fives and are so glad we decided to go there, we had read some reviews and I guess some people just like to complain about everything! We loved the place, our one bedroom suite was fantastic, we have never been to a 5 star so we cant really say if 5 star for sure but we were treated like kings for the week we were there. The beach is a little rocky but the wind was up quite a bit so never ventured into the ocean, stayed by the pools all day. The resort was not full so some days we had our own section of pool and that made it much more relaxing for us. We loved having room service, so did our son, we did not drink them out of booze this trip, our son ate them out of food, that was the best part I think. I loved their coffee and there is nothing better than ordering coffee for 2 and having it brought to your room so you can sit our on your balcony and have coffee in the robes they provide for your use! The food was good, we ate all the restaurants, the only complaint is that there were 2 italian nights in the buffet and we had hoped for a different buffett each night as there is only so much you can order from at the ala cartes. It was also nice not to have to reserve in advance. There is a couple of things that bothered us while we were there, one was the doors, they slam quite freely, when we realized this we tried to shut our doors quietly but unfortunately not everyone there was that considerate, we would be almost asleep and the neighbours would come in and slam both doors so we got woke up a few times, the other is the security, there are rules to the pools 8:00 pm close, and am quite sure there are rules for quiet time, we had a couple of bad nights, our 3rd night there was a wedding so when the party started and continued on I just took a sleeping pill, I did not complain cause I thought it was a wedding and not a big deal. The next night the same group started up again and they were in the pool about 9:30 PM and hootin and hollering for an hour before I decided to call down as our son was not feeling well and could not get to sleep, I had hoped that security would quiet them down but it took them about 1.5 hours to finally quiet the place, I spoke with other families there and they said the same thing, I had to call down 3 times before it seemed to be taken care of. The 3rd night it started again, always around 9:30 but it seemed security was on it right away cause it quieted down right away. That may seem petty to some but we go to relax and the place was full of families with small children, so it would be common courtesy to realize that you are not the only people there, especially since they could have gone to the beautiful roof top bar by the beach and no one in the resort would have heard them! Other than that, we had a wonderful time, would highly recommend this place, the grounds are beautiful, the pools are great, the staff was fantastic, polite, fun, friendly, the drinks are great, (too great, lost a night after sitting at the pool bar for a couple of hours !) Any questions, feel free to contact me! We did Xcarat, it was cool, ate lunch watching the black jaguar pacing and sitting in the pool of water, that was great! We went to Playa del Carmen, dont like getting accosted all morning so went back to the resort, went again at nigth to see it lite up, beautiful at night and not so bothersome! We also hired a taxi for a day for 100.00 and he took us into Cancun to the shopping malls, markets, beaches, hotels zones, it was worth it, he was very friendly and informative, I have his number if anyone heading that way, we are going to call him next year when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Wedding”
Reviews.Author: AllyAdrianDowning
Reviews.Content: We changed resorts from the Grand Riviera Princess to Azul Fives after the Princess had a gas explosion in Nov 2010. Azul Fives price matched us 100%. We had our wedding at Azul Fives on the beach. We couldn't have asked for a better day! Everything from the flowers to the food was exactly what we had picked and was nothing short of amazing. Estefania and Johanna were our wedding co-ordinators and they did an outstanding job I couldn't have asked for two better people to help us with our wedding. Upon arrival at Azul Fives we were upgraded to a penthouse suite with a roof top terrace. Some family members complained that their rooms weren't set up great for couples. The hotel manager had a meet and greet one night and we all went and voiced our kudos and complaints. There were no towel hooks in the bath room and that was fixed the next day. The manager also noted that queen sized beds should be made available to couples travelling without kids. The kids club was amazing and so were the staff, our son didn't ever want to leave the kids club he was having so much fun! My only complaint would be that we needed to give the photographer more pointers on what we wanted for pictures. We did recieve our wedding albums before we left and they were gorgeous all the pictures turned out beautifully I just wish I would have been more aware of the pictures being taken and gotten more with our family. I would highly recommend to anyone looking to get married in the Mayan Riviera to get married at this resort. We did all of our bookings through www.destinationweddings.com and Lomas Travel they literally took care of every last detail and made this a completely stress free experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this rip off place!”
Reviews.Author: psardana
Reviews.Content: This was touted as a five-star, Gourmet Inclusive resort, with penty of activities, great bars and lots of things to do for our late-teen children. In fact, we got none of these things. The food was, in general, awful right down to their so-called cappuccino/espresso. The entire resort resembled something out of someone's cottage in Muskoka (they even had their grounds crew start mowing the lawns right as we were trying to enjoy some peace and quiet in the sun). The food was barely passable and the cocktails were mixed with sub-par brands and mixers. The rooms were on par with cheap motels with not even a picture on the walls to liven up the place. The fan didn't work properly (sped up and shut off on its own, and the light in the fan came on and off on its own). Three of us even came down with Montezuma's revenge for a day. The restaurants noted that they had guacamole on their menu, but they never seemed to have any (imagine running out of Avocados in Mexico). This place is a joke, and the Karisma group should be ashamed of partnering with these clowns. They couldn't even figure out how to properly operate ther wood burning stove in one of their restaurants, with the result that the entire restaurant was typically filled with smoke (which fit well with the cottage country feel of the place), and meant that we always went to bed feeling and smelling like we'd been roasting weenies around a campfire. This place should be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Islander005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days in May 2011. I was VERY worried about visiting this hotel given the reviews. I spent the first 2 days going through all of the reviews I had read in my head and wondered what hotel people had stayed at. It's no where near as bad as they say so I'm guessing you can't please everyone. The hotel is great. It's not 5 star but it's great. The staff asked us every single day if everything was ok, if the food was ok, if the rooms were ok. They went out of their way to make sure we were happy. We traveled with friends who have two small children under the age of 3 and the hotel staff were wonderful with the kids. The restaurants all had high chairs and booster seats and all the staff were eager to keep the kids happy. They were even able to get baby food via room service and the kids club has babysitters for the night times (for a small fee) The grounds are fantastic and well maintained. The rooms: great, spacious and clean. Beds are comfortable. Only downside was that we booked a 3 bedroom suite thinking the living space was in the middle of the 3 rooms. Because this is actually a condo complex the suite was really 3 separate rooms with 3 separate entrances so it was a little awkard having the living space be in someone's bedroom. Nevertheless it was fine for what we needed and we had more than enough space for 4 adults and 2 kids. The food at the hotel is great. It's not out of this world but there's nothing wrong with it either. The staff are happy to get you whatever you want and went out of the their way to accomodate you if needed. Many times we were able to get 'take out' from some restaurants for the kids rather than just ordering room service which was a nice touch. There are 3 restaurants so if you are there for a long stay be sure to go into Playa for a few meals to get a change of menu. All 3 restaurants had great food and we enjoyed all of our meals. Not many Mexican items which is what I would change but there was enough variety to eat at all 3 for 7 days which was nice. The breakfast buffet is great - it even has sparkling wine and mixers for bloody marys etc. There's a separate smoothie bar attached to the gym which I thought was a great touch and much needed after a few days of over indulgence. The pool area and swim up bars were nice. Downside is that we were there during 'off season' which we weren't aware of so two of the swim up bars were closed. Not the biggest deal really as we were able to hang out by the infinity pool all day. The beach does have rocks close to the shore but if you swim past them it's fine. My tips for improvements for the hotel are thus: 1) Fix the showers. We had cold water ever day in our shower. The hot water seemed to last 20 seconds. It wasn't freezing but it wasnt' warm either. The friends we travelled with didn't have this problem in their room so perhaps it's not widespread BUT I have read other reviews that noted this. 3) Add more mexican food to your menus. We were in Mexico and wouldn't have known it by the menu options. The options you did have were delicious so add more!!! 4) Keep the pool bars open later than 6pm. They should close at sunset. 5) have better wine on the all inclusive package! All in all this is a nice quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday with Tremendous Staff”
Reviews.Author: McAdamsScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Azul Fives Hotel for the first 2 weeks of April, Travelling from Scotland to Mexico is a long flight! but absolutely worth the 11 hours to stay at this hotel, as other reviews have said we were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews before we went, but I think I have came to conclusion that you cannot please everyone, we consider ourselves to be well travelled I can honestly say this is one of the best holidays we have ever had. We are a family of 4, myself, husband, daughter of 15 and son of 8, so as you can imagine having 2 children of different ages you need to choose holidays well and we certainly did choosing the Azul Fives, the hotel is lovely the rooms, gardens the beach, the infinity pool was fabulous, the restaurants, we mainly ate in Sea Olive & Tsuki both lovely, my favourite time of the day was sitting in Sea Olive in the afternoon with a lovely glass of wine and chicken tacos looking out over the infinity pool to the beach it was heavenly! Both our children had a wonderful time my son of 8 would be happy in the pool or going on to the beach and would occassionaly go the kids club, the entertainment team at the pool were great, Alex, Gamela, Gabo (our favourite), playing volleyball, football and generally entertaining us, Christian was our pool butler so polite, friendly and helpfull the evening shows were mainly very good, we loved walking to and from the beach looking out for the monkeys up in the trees,I could go on and on with positive comments, what I have to say in our experience the No: 1 thing that made our holiday so memorable was most definately the Staff, in particular Pamela who was the hostess of Tsuki Restaraunt, Berenice the hostess of Sea Olive, Christoper the manager of Sea Oilve and Senses Restaraunt where we had a beautiful last evening meal I could name many many more, we were always made so welcome and the service whether it be a breakfast, lunch or dinner was fantastic, being there for 2 weeks gave us the time to get to know a lot of the staff and it was a pleasure to be served by them. We were very sad to leave and will most definately return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a five star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: FighterOne_11
Reviews.Content: It’s a beautiful facility with a sinuous pool that goes through the villas and well maintained grounds. The architecture is more of a European flair and we wouldn't have known that we were in Mexico had it not been for the wonderful staff. The manager Enrico was German. Watch out not to fall in the water when you get out of the cart in front of the convention facility. I bet a few folks have taken a spill there. At check-in we were given a glass of sparkling wine a splash of Curacao in the bottom to make it blue...”azul”. The sparkling was good, local, 11.5% alcohol called Dubois. It was also served at the buffet even for breakfast. Our picture was taken to identify us on the room key, a nice touch and a great little souvenir. The map of the resort was unfortunately a poor quality black and white print out, hard to read and not at all detailed. I asked for two so we could each have one but was told they had no more. Rooms Adequate with a rain shower but unfortunately none give out on the ocean which is separated by an ugly chain link fence with green plastic and foliage. We were driven to our room in an electric cart. Unfortunately the balcony was right in front of the playground to Azulitos, the children's play area. This room might have been more suitable for a family with small children. The sound of that basket ball pounding the ground and of the little ones screaming prompted us to request another room. There are double entry ways for added security. The second room was by the pool and more quiet with a nice rain shower but no tub. The safe didn't work but was quickly fixed when we called. There are no ice machines; ice is available through room service only. The bar is stocked with four beers, four soft drinks and four bottles of water, no snacks. The coffee pot has two more water bottles, some coffee and tea bags...these were full of stains so I didn't use them. One day, we were not given any water. I called for some four times and nobody delivered any. The next morning, I called again. The maid told me later that they had none until late that previous afternoon. They just didn’t want to be bothered with delivering us any that evening. That was unacceptable to us. Food Many guests were on the European Plan (EP). We went on the all inclusive plan (AI). The food is very costly on the a la carte menu at Sea Olives, an excellent restaurant. I was a bit confused at first, when the waiter told me they took all major credit cards until we clarified that we were on the AI plan. A hamburger is 135 pesos at lunch. Tzukis is an Asian restaurant and rather mediocre. The green tea was undrinkable, the salmon overcooked, the tempura shrimp oily (old oil) the rice noodles tasteless and the vegetarian dish my friend had also totally tasteless. The sushi was good. We didn’t care for the waiter here and his …friendly banter. There is also an area where they serve barbecue by the tennis court at lunch, on certain days. This is worth it. I enjoyed the chorizo salchichon there as an appetizer. Right across from here there is a table where you can purchase a piece of ceramic and paint it. They make bracelets with your name and your choice of three colors of thread for $8USD. We went to the buffet for breakfast and once for dinner. One morning, there was a long line of folks outside the door waiting to be seated. The breakfast buffet had the usual array of boring dishes with the exception of some rot on the papaya. Empty dishes were not refilled promptly. The dinner buffet was mediocre. Some of the plants are neglected here. Service is more attentive but evidently, waiters provide more attentive service to those who are on the EP than to those who are on the AI due to the tipping practices. The hostess was so excited at breakfast one morning; she didn’t watch where she was going and clobbered a woman and her plate full of fruit. If you want to have lunch but would like to avoid a two hour sit down meal, bring a sandwich from the breakfast buffet. There is no snack bar close to the beach. Sea Olives is it and it takes a while to get served here. We requested a cart to go to the snack bar and bring our food back to the pool with us. That is just not done here, I guess, because the waiter at the snack bar frowned at putting saran wrap on the salad and on the pizza. We were there for the beach and the sun and didn’t want to spend a lot of time in a restaurant at lunch. This was one of two disappointments. The beach is beautiful and the peddlers no longer bother you since the police monitor the beach and impose heavy fines on those who sell without permits. The infinity pool is great and where we spent most of our time since the beach was very windy. There are no restrictions on the amount of towels you can have and they have a small library of books for you to borrow and free sunscreen. The other disappointment was that there are no iced coffee drinks available at the swim up bar at the infinity pool. My friend does not drink alcohol but enjoys hot or cold coffee all day. This was not available. The waiters at Breezes are extremely knowledgeable and very nice though. Another poor reflection on the place is some of the activities. One day, we waited for someone to give word that the water aerobics class was about to start but it never happened. I guess the staff preferred to go play volleyball on the beach. Incidentally, the volleyball game later turned into a soccer game where goals were set up close to those of us who were in lounge chairs; the ball was flying around us, into us and there was no motion from the staff to stop this. The next day, finally we were asked if we’d partake in the water aerobics activity. Every single movement for the arms was completed out of the water. When the time came to work the legs, no movement was done while standing in the water. Instead, the teacher had us move over to the side of the pool, remove our upper body out of the pool and while lying on the stomach with the butt out of the water, and flap our feet. This was a poor excuse to see a row of women’s butts lined up at that pool and that is when my friend and I slipped away from that class. There is a boutique with a few items with the Azul Fives logo. The cost is astronomical, however. A coffee mug is 170 pesos; an ashtray or a spoon holder for the kitchen cost 66 pesos. A Mr. Perez owns this boutique and the staff says that if anything comes up missing, the person on duty in the store has to pay for it. They sell food here since many of the rooms are actually suites with kitchens at this hotel…bring your own mustard, their Dijon is 100 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you're in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: AandG11
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Azul Fives in the month of February. The rooms were decorated beautifully and the grounds were well manicured. We loved the pool that meanders all the way through the complex. Although the hotel was fairly crowded, there still was a feeling of serenity and intimacy which sometimes can be lost at larger complexes.The staff couldn't have been more accommodating and the food was of a high calibre. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great. I think cockroach and spider do not match a 4.5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pardal_Brasil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two days. Booked at Hotwire and got a very good deal. Despite the delay at check in, the first impression of the hotel was amazing. The front desk could not find my reservation. Partly it was my fault. I booked only one day in advance and didn't print the confirmation page. The attendant was very helpful, but took too long to solve the problem. After overcoming the initial difficulty with the check in, the first impression with the room was great. Extremely spacious and very comfortable. The bed in particular is very good. The beach in front of the hotel is not so nice, but in a few minutes walk you get one a lot better. Just had a single meal at the hotel. Still, I approve the service. Quality and a reasonable value. The first day was great and the hotel seemed to be perfect. On the second day, however, I began to see the flaws. Something happened that today I find quite funny but messed up my hole day. I was stuck in the bathroom for 40 minutes. The old lock broke and crashed. It took a while for my girlfriend to call the customer service and even more for them to come get me out of the bathroom. In the end we still had to wait 30 minutes while they changed the lock on the door. The worst however was yet to come. Despite bedroom suite seem very clean. We were not alone in the room. I think cockroach and spider do not match a 4.5-star hotel. I could not believe it. So I had to take some pictures. I know I had very bad luck. It should not happen often, but that is the story.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Trip To Remember”
Reviews.Author: mkebeachgal
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort April 26 thru May 3, 2011. Let me say this our family has traveled extensively throughout the world and we loved this resort and had a phenomenal time. I am a very picky traveler and love to be taken care of and pampered and I felt I was well taken care of here. We had a 3 bedroom penthouse suite and it was phenomenal. There were 7 of us traveling from the age of 16 all the way up to 76. The suite was spacious and very clean. The staff was very attentive and friendly. They really tried to make us feel at home and did a good job of it. All were very helpful and went out of their way to make our vacation 1 of the best ever. We had a BBQ on our rooftop one evening and it was the experience of a lifetime. They tried to accommodate us with everything we asked for. Beautiful pools, grounds, and beach. I like to take long walks on the beach and you can do that here. The week flew by and all of us were sad when we had to leave. I can truly say this was a trip that we have great memories from. One of our best family trips ever if not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Solid Family Resort...but Don't Expect Five Star!”
Reviews.Author: PassionForTravel42
Reviews.Content: We were very concerned about this resort due to the mixed reviews. In fact, we came very close to cancelling as some of the reviews were so bad. We are glad we did not cancel and had a great stay at Azul Fives. I think one of the biggest problems this resort has is over-marketing themselves. Their website really promotes exceptional service and five star food. They try to promote themselves as a very high end resort and they fall short of this. It is a very good, solid family-oriented resort....but not a super premium five star resort. And...you are not paying super premium, five-star rates, so one should probably not have that expecation! We have previously stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba down the road. By the end of the stay, my husband said he preferred the Fairmont as it was more professionally managed and service was more consistent. However, I probably preferred Azul Fives as for about the same approximate cost (estimating value of food), we had a suite at Azul Fives for about what we would pay for a single, garden view room at the Fairmont. Personally, I valued the space, but I agree with my husband that the Fairmont is much more professionally manged. Here's a summary of our experience: ROOM: We had a one-bedroom suite. The room was great for a family of four. The sofa sleeping accomodations were very good...they pulled out into two single beds which worked well for our kids. The room was also very large and nicely decorated. We were definitely comfortable in our room. We found it unnecesary to have a full kitchen & dining room as we were on the all-inclusive package. However, it did add space to the room. Most of the rooms have nice views of the pool. However, some of them look on to a dirt road. You do not want those rooms!!! We had one fo the very few rooms that had a partial ocean view. Our room looked at the tennis court and beach club. We would recommend that view. Overall, the rooms are one of the biggest selling points of the resort. POOL: The pools were very pretty. We preferred the infinity pool next to the beach as we liked looking out to the ocean. This pool was quite beautiful. We also enjoyed the other pools that meandered through the property. My kids liked swimming from pool bar to pool bar for smoothies. There were a lot of reviews about cold water in the pools. This was definitely not the case during our stay. I will NOT go in cold water and I found myself enjoying the pool temperature. We are early birds so we did not have a problem getting a chair directly on the pool edge which we wanted to keep an eye on our kids. However, these chairs usually filled up by about 10:00. Even when these poolside chairs filled, there were always other chairs in the second row or on the beach or at other pools that were available. So, there was no huge hassle over beach chairs. BEACH: As mentioned in many other reviews, the beach directly in front of the resort is not swimmable due to rocks. You could walk about 5 minutes down the beach to a beautiful sandy area to swim. This was a bit of a bummer as you would have to carry any sort of equipment down with you and then sit on the sand. It was fine for short swims, but it certainly would have been nicer to have a swimmable beach by your beach chairs and bar service! If you want to spend lots of time swimming in the ocean, do not stay here! FOOD: I would give the food 3 stars. We had some very good meals and some average ones. The breakfast buffet was fine, but nothing special. We went to the buffet only one night for dinner and found it to be disappointing. Our favorite restaurant was Tsuki. We loved several of the dishes there and our kids enjoyed the beef skewers and the chicken with noodles (our kids are age 7 and 9). We liked Sea Olive for lunch but did not like it for dinner. As such, we ate at Tsuki quite often at dinner which got a little old after a week. We were also very disappointed that there was no good Mexican food on the menu! One of the reasons we go to Mexico is to enjoy the food so this was very disappointing. I would revamp Sea Olive to make it a nice Mexican and seafood resaurant. We were also disappointed that you could not order food around the infinity pool. It would have been great to eat by the pool or order a snack or ice cream there. You had to walk to Lizards in the other pool area to do this. The only other all-inclusive we have stayed at is Club Med. Contrasting Azul Fives to Club Med, the quality of the food was better at Club Med. However Azul Fives had more flexibility around when you could eat and the decor and atmosphere of the restaurants was nicer. SERVICE: Service is just okay. It seemed staff was working really hard, but they don't seem to have staffing managed quite right and perhaps staff has not been trained as professionally as some of the large chains. However, they really did seem to be doing their best. At the pool, there was only one waitor working the pool area for drinks. We were there during Spring Break and it was crowded. He did his best to get around, but it could be slow. Tipping certainly helped! At the restaurants, we tended to get there on the early end. We found that we were always seated quickly and orders were taken quickly, however sometimes it seemed the kitchen got backlogged and it would take a long time for food to come out. We had 3 or 4 meals where the wait stretched to frustratingly slow. However, it was fine for most of our meals. Our minibar was never automatically restocked. I had to call every time I wanted it to be restocked. It would usually be done the same day. We never ordered room service. The menu is limited and we heard many complaints from other guests about slow service. GROUNDS AND FACILITIES: The resort is relatively small which we liked. The grounds were well kept and pretty. The beach club complex with the Sky Bar and two restaurants was very nice. It has a Miami vibe which is kind of fun. The lobby is a disappointment. It comes off more as a sales center for time shares vs. a lobby. (With that said, while we received a couple of "invites" for marketing pitches, we ignored them and never felt hounded). Having to pay for wifi is a rip-off! KIDS CLUB: There was a problem with English with the Kids Club staff. A couple of the staff members spoke English, but many of them seemed to have limited English. My kids participated in about one activity a day. They also had a couple of evening events that seemed like good ideas, but did not seem to get executed completely. For example they had a very cute beach movie night with smores. However, they set the movie on some odd option with commentary so the kids found it not worth watching. The staff seemed to try hard. I would say improving the English language skills and perhaps having activities for older kids would be great. My kids are only 7 and 9 and they found most of the activities to be too young for them. A separate note on pottery painting on the property. The guy that runs this concession does an amazing job with the pottery. I would totally recommend doing this as it makes great souvenirs for the kids. However, he tells you the paint is washable and it is NOT!!! Do not wear any clothes that you care about! GUESTS: Overall, this resort seemed to be full of families. There seemed to be quite a few groups of families travelling together, for example siblings getting together with their families for vacation. There were also a lot of wedding parties. I thought it had a nice vibe of families trying to spend time together. It was not a party resort (Sky bar tended to be empty) and it was not a resort where someone was hounding you to do an actvity every minute. It was a nice, family-oriented atmosphere. TRAVEL EXCURSIONS: We took trips to both Xel-Ha and Xplor. Both were fantastic and I highly recommend. We booked both through Lomas Travel in the lobby. I would NOT recommend using Lomas for these trips. Xplor is only 30 minutes away. We were the first stop that the bus stopped at. Eight guests from our hotel boarded our bus. Instead of taking this almost full bus to the park, they proceeded to stop at 3 more stops where they picked up parties of only 1 or 2 people. It ended up taking 1 1/2 hours on the bus to get to the park! We missed time at the park and our kids were totally frustrated. It is as easy and probably cheaper to just book a taxi to and from these resorts. Rates at both ends seem to be fixed and both parks had nicely organized taxi booking services where you could get in a certified taxi with a predetermined fixed rate. In the end, we had a really nice vacation and enjoyed the resort. If we were to return to the area, I would consider staying at Azul Fives again, but only after exploring other options. The primary thing I would look for in a different resort would be a better beach. I also would like better food quality and service. However, the value for what you get at Azul Fives is solid so it would remain a strong contender as a place we would consider returning to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Vacation Experience - Great Resort for Families”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrip555
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from a vacation at Azul Fives and it was incredible. We had a 2-bedroom suite and it was truly over the top --- full kitchen, dining area, master bedroom suite, living room area, and a full seperate room for our 3 kids (which they LOVED). This suite was absolutely huge and was more than enough room for our family. I had read some of the reviews prior to our trip and saw some comments on the slow restaurant service. We went over spring break and aside from a couple meals during peak times, we didn't experience slow service. In fact, the service was fabulous. The waiters were huge hits with our kids -- they made the kids special desserts that weren't even on the menu, and a few times even carried the kid's plates from the buffet to our table...they felt like royalty). The food was very good. My wife and I had wonderful meals at Sea Olive and the Asian restaurant (our kids were happy to hear they had macaroni and cheese, chicken nuggets, etc.). The buffet was a great option for breakfast and they changed the themes up each night. The chicken wrap was a favorite for lunch at the Sea Olive. At night, we attended two family-friendly evening shows - a magic show and a fire show. Both were hits. The Azulito kids club had some special events on Easter Sunday which our youngest participated in and had fun (face painting, playing with a bunny, etc.). The pools were uncrowded. The first couple of mornings we put towels out on chairs by the pool to "save" them for when we were ready to hit the pool....until we realized we didn't even need to do this. Our kids still miss being able to swim up to the pool bar and order a special frozen drink. The staff was friendly and very helpful (even upon arrival when they provide a ride to your room in a golf cart --- also a big hit with the kids). I highly recommend this resort to any family (especially families with 3+ kids given the unique accommodation options and would go back in a heart-beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: trader714
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Azul Fives for 5 nights for Easter with our 21 year old daughter and 12 year old son. First let me say i was very worried about this resort with all of the mixed reviews. i am very picky when it comes to resorts. We visit Sandals resorts quite frequently and wanted something along those lines of an all inclusive resort. Azul Fives delivers that type of resort. We have a wonderful time her and would defiantly go back !!! here is a lil information on the positives of this resort. I will say if you are looking for a party type resort this is not it, its a very chic classy family orientated relaxing resort ROOMS: we had a one bedroom suite, it was very spacious and very clean and modern. My children slept on the sofa bed and part of the sofa is like a single bed, they were comfortable. There is a separate 1/2 bath , toilet and sink for them to use which was convenient. FOOD: we did the Gourmet all inclusive, i feel it was well worth it, better than most all inclusive food. Flavors had an excellent breakfast selections, our favorite restaurant was Tsuki , its the sushi/Japanese restaurant, Excellent service and food!!!! Joel was always took care of our every need at dinner there. We also spent extra on the private dining at Senses, food and service was incredible here but its an extra charge but well worth it. Sea Olive was nice , my son didn't like anything on the menu here but the were very accommodating in making him whatever he wanted. This goes for all of the restaurants, Flavors have the most variety of food for kids, but the other restaurants will accommodate their needs even if its not on the menu. our favorite place for lunch was Lizards restaurant and pool bar. Great lunch food. DRINKS/BARs: the drinks were good, they will make you whatever you want at the swim up bars, i had a drink i like that made with fresh banana, they didn't have any but i did, so i brought them the banana gave them the recipe and i had my drink! I didn't find they were watered down either. BEACH: great sandy beach, water was beautiful, can't swim right in front of the resort, just walk down the beach a lil ways and you can enter with no rocks. this didn't bother us at all. It was very windy the entire time we were there so all water sports were canceled. BEACH STAFF: I have to say these guys at the beach made sure my son had something to do all the time, they went out of their way to make sure everyone was having a good time, they organized volleyball, soccer, all sort of thing to do on the beach. GAMA made my sons trip, he went out of his way to make sure he was having fun all the time. My son didn't want to leave and was sad the day we left. The beach butlers were very accommodating as well, Christian made sure we had everything we needed and even made spa reservations for me on day. The salsa lessons were alot of fun too RESORT GROUNDS/POOLS: Beautiful, the resort is laid out perfect. Winding pools through the middle of the resorts. Infinity pool view is amazing. NEGATIVES: this is a new resort and i feel they do have a few things to work out, and it would not take much to improve. Service desk after hours, they are slow at taking care of your needs, we need sheets for the pull out sofa, Suggestion, they should give you sheets when they take you to your room if they see you are going to be needing them, took over an hour to bring us sheets. There is a language issue, with housekeeping staff, and after hours front desk staff. The bathroom lighting was dark, they can improve this with higher wattage bulbs or lighted makeup mirrors. WiFi, i was able to get wifi on my iphone after i paid for the week, but only one person at a time could be on it. I think if you pay for it, you should be able to get it on all phones in your family. I was lucky that i had access to the wifi because i was close to Lizards thats where the router was located. Beach wifi was excellent, but i think they were upgrading this while we were there. Overall we loved this resort and can't understand why some of the negative reviews are so bad. I met our standards and i have to say i feel i have very high standards to meet when staying at a resort. I would say this is a 4.5 star resort. and would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world "FANTASTIC"”
Reviews.Author: Evaandjames
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/05/11-15/05/11 Writing this while still on holiday as I know when I get home real life will kick in and my time will be gone and this Is too special not to comment on!! Anyway I like to consider myself an honest person and have traveled all over the world, Azul fives is by far the best place I have ever stayed and is perfect in every way I truly cannot fault it, staff- fantastic, room-amazing, food - Devine , pools - spotless. Listen I could go on and on raving about this hotel, but let's sum it up if there is such a thing as perfection I've found it here and will I be back "yes yes yes" :) truly sensational !! DONT MISS THIS HOTEL. Eva and James UK

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, we defintely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: analuit
Reviews.Content: Positives: Our room was very big, very comfortable and always very clean thanks to the excellent maid service. The pool(s) were very big and very well maintained, constantly being cleaned throughout our one week stay. The staff were exceptionally friendly and very polite, always helping when asked (eg. when requesting a cork screw, someone came to our room quickly to help). We only tried one of the hotel's restaurants but the food was very nice. Negatives: There were a few negatives but these were relatively minor. Generally the drinks were a little pricey but not over the top. The private beach was nice but rocky meaning you couldn't really swim. The rooms didn't have a wifi available (although there was a wifi showing, we believe this is for timeshare owners only), and the wired connection was not free (not even in the lobby area) and useless for our iPhones anyway. Another point to consider is that when paying for things such as drinks and food, prices were in Pesos and USD but when we settled our bill at the end of the week we had to pay in USD (we only had Pesos and the hotel's exchange rate wasn't very good which meant we paid slightly more than we should have done). We didn't think this was very fair, especially when you consider we were in Mexico!! The hotel room price is quite expensive but we managed to get a good deal for a one bedroom suite. Overall though this hotel was very nice and we would love to return one day...

Reviews.Title: “VERY RELAXING”
Reviews.Author: alimac1213
Reviews.Content: My husband and 16 year old son stayed for a week starting April 19th. We were in a 1 bedroom suite. It was comfortable and roomy. The shower and jacuzzi were spectacular along with the bath amenities! The only complaint was the sink area with mirror was too dark. I had to use the smaller bathroom to put on my make up. Our room was located in front of the tennis court. We liked sitting out there with a cocktail and watching the tennis.Pedro the tennis pro is great! My son enjoyed having lessons with him and he filled in to make a foursome when we wanted to play doubles. We loved the food. The sushi was great. The salads and fish dishes were wonderful too. We enjoyed the salsa's, Guacamole and anything mexican. The breakfast at Flavors was excellent especially the coffee and cappuccino's! We loved the omelet's, mexican side dishes like refried beans, sauteed mushrooms, spinach, fresh fruit, pastries and make your own Bloody Mary's! We enjoyed the pool by the beach and spent the afternoons at the lazy pool swimming to the bars for an array of delicious drinks. The beach was nice and never too crowded. My son enjoyed the volleyball and soccer. The ocean was too rough to swim in so we walked down the beach to see the other resorts. We are more pool people so we were happy to swim in the different pools. The staff at the beach and pool were very helpful with bringing drinks and answering questions. The staff at the restaurants and bars were great too. We brought a lot of one dollar bills and kept running out. So bring more then you think because the workers deserve tips! At night we went to bed early. However the fire break dancing show on the beach was very good and the mexican magician show was funny and different! The town of Playa del carmin was close to the resort. We had fun shopping and had a wonderful lunch at La Parrilla. I would like to go back or try another Karisma resort .

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: NBNat
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Azul Fives in April, as part of a large group of friends/family attending a wedding there. There's always plus and minuses at any resort, so I think the simplest way to review this one is to list the pros & cons: Pros: - Very modern and beautiful rooms - close proximity to Playa del Carmen (10 minute cab ride) - you don't have to make reservations to any of the A La Carte restaurants - Food was good (I would not consider it "gourmet" but it was on par with other resorts I've been to) Cons: - The resort is very SMALL... I wasn't expecting how small it really was.. so as long as you're not expecting nice walk paths and lots of lush greenery/gardens, then this might be to your liking. - There is no lobby to speak of, so no communal space where a group can gather to relax and unwind... there is the Sky Bar but there was almost never anyone there and only open at night. - The buffet is tiny also - not a lot of food choices... - Service across the resort was very inconsistent: sometimes there would be a waiter around the pool/beach area to take drink orders, then other days you wouldn't see him at all... some people had their mini-fridges filled everyday, some didn't have it filled once the entire week, even after leaving a big tip! - The beach: like all previous reviews, it is true, you can't swim in front of this resort.. you need to walk 2 resorts down in order to go in the ocean... not a huge deal, but a little disappointing. Overall, this place was originally built to be a condo-village before being bought by Karisma and turned into a resort... It really wasn't built to be a resort and it shows.. they certainly have a lot of kinks to work out and are far from being a 5* "gourmet" resort, in my opinion. Since we were a big group, we made our own fun and still had a great week, being in the sun and doing some excursions outside the resort. But I would never return to this place and don't think a week's stay here is worth the top dollar that we paid. My two cents!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort!!”
Reviews.Author: iamxing1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Azul Fives in April. We were a family of 6 including two kids(3 and 6). We absolutely loved every aspect of the resort. The room, one word: Perfect! The two bedroom suite we lived in is as big as my entire house back home. It's very well decorated, modern and elegant. It really felt like home. I've never been so relaxed in a hotel room. The food is good. My two kids are EXTREMELY picky eaters, they never loved any restaurant, but they loved the food here. That meant a lot to me. I never had to worry about feeding the kids during our vacation, they always finish their plate quickly. Their coffee is worth mentioning. It's the BEST coffee I ever tasted. The side effect is: I can never drink coffee again. The coffee back home tastes horrible in comparison. The beach and the swimming pools are beautiful. The ocean is not swimmable because of the reef, but I didn't mind because the infinite pool is so great I never wanted to come out of it. And the best thing is, the beach is never crowded. You'd never be stressed over grabbing a good beach chair. Everybody is warm and friendly. The hot water in my room was not very hot when I arrived. I called the front desk, someone came and replaced the hot water tank right away. I was impressed. I never had any other problem since. The nightly show was so so though. Wasn't crazy about it. The only thing I concerned was the security at the kids club. I once picked up my kids from the kids club, nobody asked my to sign out or anything, no question asked. The staff were not watching the kids, they always chat together. I was wondering what if somebody else took the kids. Also, during the egg hunt, all the kids were outside, running wild. The staff never counted the kids. What if one kid is lost? Other than that, everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “This resort is Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler0707
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing!! The hotel rooms are brand new, modern, and sheik. The hotel staff is friendly and there to help you with whatever it is you need. The hotel is in a great location and only a short cab ride to Nightlife and great shopping in Playa Del Carmen. The pools at this hotel are gorgeous. I never left the infinity pool that overlooks the ocean!! The beach is a bit rocky right out in front of the hotel steps but if you walk down about a minute, you are able to get in and swim. I didn't have too much interest in that because I never wanted to leave the pool!!! If you work out the hotel gym is very clean and everything is brand new - They even offer complimentary yoga and various aerobic classes throughout your stay!! If you can, don't pass up going to this spa. I have been to spas all over the world and this has been one of my best experiences. The ambiance, spa staff, and massage were terrific!! Overall this hotel is great and I would reccomend it to all of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: elt05d
Reviews.Content: I decided to plan a trip with some friends to Azul Fives and could not be happier with my decision! The minute we arrived to the hotel, we were amazed. We were welcomed with cold, fresh towels. The check-in process was quick, easy, and the front desk agent did an excellent job of explaining the location of my room. The golf carts on property are great and took us to our rooms and wherever we needed on the property! My room was beautifully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. On our last day of our trip, we decided to treat ourselves to a massage at the spa. It was the best massage I ever had! My massage therapist, Fanny, was amazing! The spa was one of the largest spas I had ever been to and the service I received was amazing. The food at the hotel was delicious! I ordered room service one morning and they told me it would take 20-30 minutes...they were at my door within 5-10 minutes! I would definitely suggest to dine at the Sea Olive Terrace for lunch at the resort. The food is great! With all the wonderful service I received, delicious meals, and beautiful room, I will definitely be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “The beach is not swimmable”
Reviews.Author: Linda1leh
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, very large one bedroom suite, very quiet resort and family oriented. It was not the huge resorts where everyone puts a towel down by 6:00 am on a chair, never to be seen again until 11:00 am, the resort never felt crowded. The issue is the entire beachfront is coral, so small children could never go in the water. My husband and I went in with full water shoes and you better be good at seeing the bottom between the waves and making your way back without falling. If you walk down 2 hotel lengths you will be able to enter the water but no chairs or service so you get wet and walk back to your hotel! The pools are beautiful, if you are an ocean swimmer this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent way to torture yourself while calling it "vacation"”
Reviews.Author: Ahma0023
Reviews.Content: Horrid service, disgusting food, pretty rooms until you look closer and see the astronomical level of filth and sickening smell, cold pools, no beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler028
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to the Fives for us it was even better then last time. The staff is very freindly especially the Activity staff. We took the Free Tennis lessons every morning and Pedro is a great teacher. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are fabulous. The best part is they have multiple pools to chose from...so you can decide if you want to sit in a quiet area.......or go to a pool with lots of action.....Loved it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will go again”
Reviews.Author: LeahOttawa
Reviews.Content: Kind friendly, helpful staff, spacious quality accommodation, spotless, great lagoon pools next to rooms. Food is excellent, that offered meals for different food requirements. . Went with elderly mother and sister, good choice having golf carts, helpful staff, pool that did not slope off. Enjoyed the excellent activities and entertainment. One bedroom can sleep three in their own beds - king bed, sofa bed and lounger next to sofa bed. Beds comfortable and clean for a quiet goods nights sleep. As others have reported, can't swim at the beach, need to walk 5 minutes up the beach to a non rocky location. The resort is planning to add a dock which hopefully allows easy access to swim beyond the onshore rocky beach. Hopefully there will also be catamarans available to sail. None available now. There is kayaking and snorkeling - fish in sandy location - not worth bring a mask and snorkel - the resort has equipment to use. Appreciated the book loan and complimentary sunscreen that was available at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not for anyone who enjoys the good things in life.”
Reviews.Author: Segaleet
Reviews.Content: Planned this for our friends and I am truely embarrassed. After speaking to management multiple times before our arrival to ensure everything goes smoothly, it was quite a disappointment when we arrived. Money was not an issue...so we did not mind spending a bit more for this place but we found it to be more like your average mexico trip. Defintiely not a place for people from the bigger cities that know good service and food. There many better places you can find for your money in Mexico (especially Playa del Carmen). Management didnt even bother accomodating us until we mentioned calling amex to dispute the charge. It was only then that they even spoke to us after 4 torturous days and attempts to speak to management. Management even agreed that all the issues we were having were unacceptable. By thispoint we only had a night left and could not be bothered with them.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Beautiful, Five Star”
Reviews.Author: AmandaNic0le
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Azul Fives with a couple of girl friends for a weekend getaway and it definitely exceeded my expectations. When we arrived we were greeted with champagne and cold towels which was refreshing after traveling. Following the friendly greeting was a quick and easy check in process. Everyone at the hotel was VERY welcoming and really aiming to please you during your stay. Once I got to my room, it was beautiful. Everything was clean, well decorated and up to date. I stayed in a room with 2 double beds and there was plenty of space. I've traveled a lot and I can honestly say that this is the best all inclusive hotel i've ever seen. Usually all inclusive hotels get a bad reputation for not being very up to date or nice, but this hotel experience totally changed my mind. Walking around the hotel grounds were beautiful because they are nicely spaced out with tons of trees and greenery around. In the morning, people were relaxing on the balcony, sipping coffee and everything was quiet and peaceful which is the point of vacationing!! Of course my friends and I had to do a little spa day and it was a wonderful experience for all of us. I've had several massages and this wasn't your typical massage. They have you change into robes, offer you time to meditate in a calming room with warm neck beads and once you are relaxed for about 15 minutes, you are taken into the massage room which is a large, zen-like room with a shower if you choose to shower before or after the massage. After the massage, you are given hot tea, time to relax in the meditation room and brought to the sauna, steam room and hot and cold baths. The spa itself is very big and very well decorated. Our experience at the Vassa Spa was sensational!! As for the food, we ate at Flavours for lunch and dinner and the food is delicious. The breakfast display included everything from belgium waffles, bagels, mimosas, bacon and omlettes made to order. My favorite restaurant for lunch was Sea Olive, mostly because its a beautiful place to sit outside and enjoy the fresh air in the shade. The food was absolutely fantastic...my friends and i ended up ordering tons of things for everyone to share so we could really taste everything!! The pasta, steak, salad were all incredible...the flavors really made your mouth water! The beach was pretty, but im not crazy about swimming in the ocean so i didnt go in the water, but the beach beds were a great place to take a nap in the sun. I really came back and had great things to say abou this property. It wasnt over crowded and i didnt feel like i was amongst tons of people...it was mellow and relaxing which is the atmosphere i like when im on vacation! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my friends, family or coworkers....

Reviews.Title: “It was great except for the front desk clerk Chris for giving us grief upon leaving.”
Reviews.Author: Brookekidd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful spacious rooms, we had the one bedroom suite. Beautiful property, most of the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Great kids club for our 16 month old. Had some problems the first day, slow checking in process, slow serice at lunch, horrible room service, food was gross. We reported our problems to sol and she said she would tell manager, including removing the $30 room charge on our bill because we had bad service at sea olive restaurant. The rest of the trip was great until we had to check out and the $30 had not been removed from our bill. Chris who was checking us out forced us to pay the balance so we could leave. I asked to speak with a manager or sol but Chris claimed they were both in meetings. We couldnt wait because we had a flight to catch. It ruined my whole experience, it was like chrisvjust wanted our credit card and for us to leave. Also practice your Spanish because there were lots of language barrier.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: luvingthesouth
Reviews.Content: Truly didn't know if it would be as good as some said. Lets start with the bads (its easier on this one, there are only a couple) The buffet, completely overshadowed by how great the a la cartes are - not good at all. The Beach of course is amazing, but if you are looking for somewhere where you can just run out and swim, this isn't it. Its corral and rock, but there are some great spots if you are willing to walk a little bit down the beach. Thats it thats all for the cons - Lets start at the beginning, the concierge, check in, welcome etc amazing from the first walk through the door. I can't even begin to describe how well were treated. Nora looked after us in a huge way. She put us in by far the best spot in the resort, and we could not have asked for anything more. Checked in, went and had a beer and an awesome lunch, they came and picked us up and brought us to our room, perfect. Pool bar - lizard was a ton of fun if you are looking for a late day fiesta thats the spot to do it, if you are looking for sun. The main pool is great but the pool bar is shady later in the day. Lizard food was exceptional, the chicken panini fantastic and all of the guys there are so great, I can't say enough. The service is way over the top. Breakfast, order a la carte or grab a fresh smoothie from the juice bar next to the gym, they make them fresh and they are a must (especially after a long night/day/night ...whatever you get the drift) Tequila tasting was fun they do it a couple of times a week The sushi restaurant was suprisingly good, we go out for sush a lot, and they do a really great job. The Sea Olive...hmmmmmm... (I'm missing the Bocancini and Pruchutto, grilled shrimp ok pretty much everything) already going through withdrawl. Oh by the way that was lunch, I would be remiss in not mentioning the Lamb, Tenderloin or the Chik Chik (dont no how to say it, but its the spicy fish) for dinner. Or pretty much order whatever you like, they will get it done. again the service, outstanding all of the guys there especially Santiago, and Hugo - look after you like gold. The wine - good, passable - I drink red and the Tempranillo was a pretty good table wine. Room service awesome just tell them what you want, they will get it done. Whoever trained/trains the staff should be commended, ever single employee knew exactly what was going on in the entire resort at any given time. Pretty amazing, I'm going to fire off an email to them (yes they were that good) what more can I say, you get the idea. wifi is free gym is good, it gets it done playa del carm is a must - hit the tequila factory if you are looking to purchase some awesome tequila, I ended up with Casa De Oro and a Manana for 100- everything in. its a steal, that Casa is a 400 dollar bottle on its own if you could ever find it, its like cognac had it a while ago and was never able to get it again, but there you go. one thing, if you are looking to hang, drink and get down until all hours. unfortunately this is not the place. Go to the El Dorado or one of the other Karisma and definitely go for the adult only thing. This one worked for us, because we wanted to completely decompress and have some quiet time. 98% of the people here are with weddings and/or children (nothing wrong with that) and I hung with some pretty cool people when there kids were looked after etc. But you get the idea - all and all I would return in a heartbeat if I were ever looking for this type of holiday again.

Reviews.Title: “DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME”
Reviews.Author: STEVEN_BALA
Reviews.Content: These issues have all been discussed with and acknowledged by hotel management. -No hot water in suite, due to the fact that a tank has to be replaced which obviously cannot be done during our stay. They offered to chage the hot water tank in the room on our last day... after repair men had made 5-6 attempts of fixing it. -bathroom in master locked, multiple requests made to open it, situation resolved after 3 DAYS! -no premium liquor anywhere on premises, although this was advertised on website. We had to pay an employee to purchase liquor for us. Incidentally, we asked for a certain brand of alcohol that we know well, they brought us something totally different under the pretense that it was the requested liquor. -no mini bar/alcohol in room as advertised -prior to our arrival, we were reassured that the bedrooms in the 2 bedroom penthouse suite would be comparable to each other. As a matter of fact, we called several times just to make sure. When we arrived, we saw that was not true. We were told that the 2 beds in the 2nd bedroom would be able to be put together as one (as if it was one bed with no space between it). In reality, they just pushed the 2 beds together, with separate linens with a big space between it. It took 3 nights before the bed was put together in an acceptable way. I did not come on vacation with my spouse to sleep on opposites sides of a bed. -we placed a do not disturb sign outside our room, however, that did not stop employees from entering our room. Which I am sure you can agree that this is an extreme violation privacy. -the hotel's beach was not accessible, the ocean is very rocky and we had to walk up to other hotels to access their beaches. -one of the closets in the suite was locked and they said that they couldn't open it at all. -very difficult to receive bottles of water. Each time we had to ask several times before we got anything. -very slow and unresponsive service in general. It seems the only way to receive decent service is to tip the employees. As a result, we have spent a few hundred dollars just to receive service that should be expected and standard anyway -we requested to speak with a manager one evening and waiting 2 hours, they never showed up -the food is advertised on website to be gourmet. The food was prepared cold, at times uncooked and really just didn't taste good. This seemed to be the consensus among other guests at the hotel as well. As a result, to have good food, we had to have our dinners in town and spend even more money. -housekeeping was cleaning one room in the suite, while the other room door was left wide open for anyone to come into -this hotel has been open for only several months, but it doesn't look like it. The kitchen appliances were filthy, stained and didn't look like they have ever been cleaned. What is the point of providing a kitchen when it is too dirty to use? -it is unfortunate that we had to spend much of our time on vacation unhappy, dissatisfied and constantly on the phone trying to find a resolution.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments; highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: femcgarry
Reviews.Content: I had made reservations at Azul Fives in January (based on several recommendations) and when I read recent reviews (in March) on Tripadvisor (several very bad reviews) I was quite concerned that Azul would be a disappointment. Overall, I think the strong negative reviews are ill-founded. Our experience was that our stay was terrific. There are some items that were minor issues, but overall, AZUL fives is a resort I definitely would recommend to others. Some specific points: 1. Accommodations. (Excellent) The rooms (suites) were large, clean, well-furnished and very well maintained (e.g. sheets were changed every day even though we really didn’t feel that was necessary). The refrigerator was stocked with soda, beer and water- and they always very responsive anytime we asked for extras. 2. Food/ restaurants. (Very Good) There are 4 restaurants on site and we ate at 3 of them. The buffet had average selections and the food was what one typically expects at an open buffet.
