Buffet is very kid friendly and service was excellent. The other 2 restaurants had specialty foods (Asian and Mediterranean) and that food was excellent. The foods were well prepared, tasty and well presented. You are able to order anything on the menu and even ask for multiple items on the menu. There is an added wine list where you can order specialty wines at additional cost. Wines on the list are quite average and a bit pricey for this type of environment. Breakfast buffet was excellent (for a buffet) and had most anything one would want for breakfast. My primary suggestion for this to be a 5 star resort would be to significantly upgrade the buffet to stock with prime selections (specialty fish, meats, hors d’oeuvres, etc.). The buffet is OK but not a 5 star buffet. , 3. Service: (Excellent) both of our groups felt the overall service3 was excellent. We did not encounter any of the issues reported on some of the earlier reviews from March, 2011. Meal servers were always prompt, courteous, and responsive to all requests. Bar tenders were always very accommodating and friendly and there absolutely no issues with slowness or unfriendly staff. The overall service was excellent. 4. Bars: (Excellent) there are multiple swim-up bars and there was never a wait for any drinks. Most bars were stocked with excellent brands and bartenders were happy to serve requested specialty brands (Chevis (scotch), Beefeater or Tanqueray (Gins), Jack Daniels (bourbon), Baileys Irish Cream, Kettle One or Stolie (Vodkas), Specialty Tequila etc.). They sky bar is a wonderful relaxing spot, but was rarely busy- so we often had the entire place to ourselves. This is probably due to the fact that most guests had children and the late night bar was not the place for them. 5. Entertainment; (Fair) There was entertainments each evening (mostly in the sky bar) and these shows were fun (mostly for both adults and young adults). It would have been fun to have some more ‘Mexican’ type of entertainment such as a Mariachi group or Mexican dancers. Sporting and adult activities were also quite good (such as water aerobics, tennis, and the spa). 6. Beaches; (Very good) Here some of the complaints may be well founded in that the beach area which is part of the resort is quite rocky and full of coral. The sandy beaches were excellent and were very well furnished with beach chairs and towels. For those who wanted to swim and enjoy the surf, you had to walk about 5 minutes up the beach (or down) to areas that were rock free. We did not see this as a big issue, but some guests may not like this. 7. Equipment/ facilities: (Excellent). In some other resorts, there is always contention for beach chairs, lounges, towels, etc.; but at Azul Fives, there are tons of equipment (chairs, etc.) and plenty of towels are always available at every pool. None of us ever had to search for adequate numbers of beach chairs or pool-side chairs. 8. Kids activities; (very good) Staff was very attentive to the kids and there were activities that interested most of the youngsters (such as small crafts, and games). This is a very family friendly resort and there is added attention given to the young guests- they feel part of the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return in a Heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: jettsfamily
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Azul Fives for so many reasons: Resort--We LOVED how spread out and quiet the place is. If we wanted action and activities to do, we went to the beach/infinity pool and restaurant area. If we wanted to be left alone and have quiet time, we stayed by the pool which was always near our room because of the lazy river. Some may lament that there are no beachfront views (unless you have a penthouse deck facing the ocean) but we liked that fact that we could be away from the action when we wanted to be. The grounds are so beautiful, I didn't miss the ocean view. Our favorite spot was in the pool near the Rainbow swim up bar. It was always quiet and relaxing. Santiago was amazingly friendly, helpful and we enjoyed his company. We were there from March 22-29, which was a very busy time because of Spring Break. The hotel was at 100% capacity but you would never have known it. I chose Azul Fives because I wanted a five-star resort for my husband and I with things for our kids to do. I couldn't have chosen better. The hotel is often quiet and relaxing because the guests are often families with young children. We never were kept awake by noisy guests and loud parties. Rooms--As many other reviews have stated, the rooms are spacious, clean and beautiful. I loved the fancy lighting in the living room, but like other guests, I hope they can solve the issue of lighting in the bathroom. I had no idea how tanned I was until we hit the airport! :) Some reviews have stated that the beds are overly firm (which I was worried about because I love a soft bed) but I found they were just fine. We didn't make use of the kitchenette since the restaurants were so good. Our housekeeping service was kind and accommodating, and went so far as to make animal shapes out of towels. Our kids loved it! Food--The food was excellent in every restaurant and we were always amazed at the quality of the food that came out of the Lizard's Lounge. My boys are in "Angus Burger" withdrawal! We loved the gourmet dishes and the waiters and hostess ladies were always really friendly and personable. Ivan, Pamela, Erika, Irma and the two waiters at the Lizard's Lounge were amazing! We found that the Sea Olive and Tsuki restaurants were busiest around 7:30, so if you want to ensure you get a table at Tsuki or a table outside at Sea Olive, try to go around 6:30 or 9 pm. Just a note that sunscreen and aloe lotion were expensive in the resort store but it can be bought in Playa del Carmen for half the price. We were pleased at the selection at the store since it meant we didn't have to leave the resort for things if we didn't want to. I think any gliches this resort may have had in the beginning from just opening in Nov. have well been ironed out. I wouldn't mind to see next time if they could let people know more about the things they offer (like I didn't know about the smoothie bar near the spa), especially the events for kids. The Spa is really superb. I thought $70 for a 25 min. massage was expensive but it was well worth it. I went an hour early and went through the "Water Journey" and then was given tea in a quiet room after. The whole thing took almost 2 hours. My only regret is not going back for a 50 min. massage. I want to book another week at Azul next year based on that fact alone. Trips: We went on the Mayan Aventure which was snorkling at three sites: a cenote, an underground cave and the ocean. It was nice--I liked it because I'm a bit afraid of water and I mostly felt safe. My husband felt it was a little bland. Head's up on the photos they take of you and sell to you--$15 for the first photo, $25 for the second, $30 for the third or $40 to buy the whole CD. Overall, Azul Fives is an excellent resort. I was worried about choosing one for my family, since we sought a quiet family vacation, but the resort was more than I had hoped for. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone and I hope to go back next year. Thank you Azul Fives for an Amazing Vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: rubylola
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my family of four in January. It was off season and the resort was not crowded at all which was great. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was amazing. Huge. Tons of room. When we got to the room there was only one television in the living room and none in the bedroom. We asked the porter if we could possibly have the tv moved into the bedroom. He responded, "we can do better, we will get you another tv, no problem". That was the type of service the entire stay. Kids club always had activities going on. Our kids, ages 7 and 9 popped in and out. It was nice to have as an option. The ocean/beach area is absolutely gorgeous but a bit of a walk from the rooms. My one big complaint is that there is no food service at the pool or the beach. They do not allow food in these areas. That was quite annoying as we had to get up and go eat in one of the restaurants or at the bbq-which interrupted the day. Food was good, not great. Not much to do at night. Overall if you are looking for an amazing,beautiful family vacation you cannot go wring at Azul Fives.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate luxurious getaway!”
Reviews.Author: rizzlet87
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend at the Azul Fives and cannot wait to go back. I had been told it was an hour from the Cancun airport, so it was a nice surprise when it took only about 40 minutes. The proximity to the airport and to Playa Del Carmen could not be better. From the minute I stepped onto the resort to the minute I left, I was in paradise. The hotel staff greeted us with cold towels and sat down with us for the check in process. Our rooms were just a couple minutes walk from the lobby, but we were driven over in golf carts. The room blew me away. I just stayed in Deluxe Room but the size was larger than expected, the bed was very comfortable, and the rainforest showerhead was to die for. I had a friend staying in a 1 bedroom suite, though, and that is the perfect atmosphere. The hotel staff was very accommodating at the pool as well, with fresh towels available and any sort of magazine or book I might want. The infinity pool area was my favorite relaxation spot, but the pools in the gardens by the suites over a bit more privacy. I figured I would be ordering room service for breakfast most mornings, but after eating the waffles and eggs at Flavours one day I was there every morning the rest of my trip. Sea Olive is another great place to eat for lunch or dinner. It offers tons of options and everything is delicious. I would certainly recommend Azul Fives to anyone who is looking into a tropical destination. It was the exact vacation that I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: StanMississauga
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 wonderful weeks in March at Azul Fives and came back very happy. The Azul Fives is a brand new resort and it was growing on us every day. The longer we stayed the more we liked it. One FORTE is the amount of personal service and attention we got from almost entire staff. It was exceptional. Enrico the general manager, Alberto Food and Beverage manager, Federico the Chef, Vanessa manager at main lobby and all the wonderful people from Exotic Travellers: Murray, Marleen, Emiliano and Elizabeth as well as many others, contributed to our happiest vacation ever. We have never before experienced the quality and amount of personal attention like at Azul Fives and we have very significant travel portfolio in our background, so we can clearly compare and conclude that. Amazing!! The resort buildings and rooms are absolutely first class providing the comfort that would be difficult to match by any other resorts. The resort layout provides opportunity to isolate yourself with alone or small groups or be at the heart of it at the main infinity pool. Jorge would take care of your refined needs from the pool bar. It was the first in many years family resort for us and we actually enjoyed being part of that experience. The little ones playing and horsing around provided so much fun and joy to watch. It seems that resort is very well equipped to look after all ages. The beach is beautiful as the whole stretch of PLAYA DEL CARMEN is. There are challenges on that beach all along and you can easily swim in some places and you can't in others. That 's the beauty of Mayan Riviera and the rocky inserts on the beach makes it really majestic. Some of the rocks are so beautiful that we ended up sitting on the shore watching small fish, crabs and other small creatures playing in the tune of the waves splashing into the rocky mini caves and pools. It was a pure paradise like observation and very tranquil. Really there is more to the beach than sand and swim as long as you are interested in finding it. The food was good and got even better by days. Something about it was interesting that we did not have tendencies to overeat like in other resorts, so we were always feeling right. Perhaps the presentation, gourmet selection and the a la carte service contributed to the just right amount consumed. The variety and number of places serving food was more than sufficient. The barbeque stand with Latin music playing was our favourite lunch place. Shows were very good and just right in length and presentation time. The Mayan show was the highlight as were the many Latin theme shows. Not much more to wish for except maybe for more Latin rhythms at the main pool. Go there, be positive and enjoy the resort. Every resort has challenges but they are usually solved quickly and they certainly contribute to your travel experience. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Pman0212
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at Azul Fives. Very family oriented. Friendly staff. Clean and healthy environment. Food was good and diverse. No qualms about recommending and would plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Azul Fives: A Good Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Northstar007
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Azul Fives with my family (four kids ages 5-13). It was our first trip to Mexico and we had a very good experience with both the Azul Fives, and with the activities available in the Rivera Maya. Prior to the trip, I spent a lot of time on Trip Advisor and appreciated the reviews which were posted, so I want to add my perspective and hope it helps others plan their trips to the area. The Hotel The Azul Fives is one of the newest properties in the area, and the facilities were excellent. We stayed in a two room suite with a roof deck. The pictures on the web site do a good job of describing the accommodations - they are clean, modern, and very attractive. In addition, the restaurant locations were very well designed and beautifully appointed - the facilities are a great strength of the hotel. The hotel is comprised of a number of identical three story buildings, with a long winding pool weaving between the buildings. As a result,guests have access to a pool right by their room, in addition to the larger pool located near the beach. This is very helpful for families with younger children who want to stay closer to their rooms and are looking for less activity than takes place at the beach. Some reviewers have commented on the pool temperature, but we found the pools to be just fine and spent many hours in the water. There are three "swim up bars" spread out across the winding pool near the buildings, and many guests seem to enjoy the access to the friendly staff ready to serve a cold beverage. The buildings are set back from the beach, so there are no real ocean views from the rooms. The walk to the beach from the rooms varies by location, but is no more than 5 minutes from any of the buildings. At the beach, there is a larger "infinity edge" pool that looks out on the ocean and also includes a swim up bar. This area is more active and high energy, and hotel staff organizes activities like beach volleyball, soccer, and dancing. This was all done in a fun and lighthearted manner and did not take away from guests who just wanted to enjoy the sun. The Staff One of the highlights of the trip was the very pleasant and professional staff at the hotel. We were very impressed by the desire of the staff to help us enjoy our stay. This was our first trip to Mexico, and we came away thoroughly impressed with the friendliness of the many people we met both inside and outside the hotel - it is a real benefit to travel in this region. I can honestly say that our interactions with everyone we met at the Azul Fives was a pleasure and enhanced our trip. The Restaurants We particpated in the Gourmet All Inclusive program and thought the food was good, not great and there was some uneven service levels. There are three main restaurants, complemented by smaller "cafe" styles options near the guest rooms. Flavours is the main breakfast area, and the breakfast options were terrriifc - custom omelettes, fresh waffles, pancakes, fruit juices, and some mexican specialties all in a beautiful setting that felt like a high-end restaurant.. Our family was excited for breakfast every morning. Sea Olives is more of a Meditarranean style restaurant, and we only ate their one time. We found the food to be average and service was a little slow. We did enjoy Tsuki's, which offers Japanese/Asian food and was quite good. The restaurant is small so it fills up on busier nights. It is worth noting that every restaurant offers a kids menu, and the staff does their best to accommodate requests to help younger guests enjoy their meals. We always felt welcome as a family in all of the venues. Special note regarding the smoothie bar - connected to the gym/spa is a place that makes fresh fruit smoothies which are fantastic. You can get drinks made with mixes at the bars, but this venue offers the real deal and they are terrific. Kids Club/Azulitos The property has a very nice kids club staffed by some terrific ladies who are friendly and energetic. Most families with young kids seemed to have their kids there for some portion of the day. Activities include Lego, video games (always an attraction), water games at one of the pools, and some crafts. The ladies in the center were always positive and happy to welcome another visitor, and our kids looked forward to spending some time there each day. Spa/Gym Very nice facility with a couple of treadmills, ellipticals, weights and stretching. Clean, modern, nice. Spa was expensive, but services were very good and they have options focused on kids. Beachfront As other reviews have cited, you cannot swim directly in front of the hotel because there are rocks/coral in the water. However, a walk of a few minutes up the beach gets you to a sandy bottom where you can play in the waves. The water is warm, clean, and beautiful. We spent some time in the water every day. Lots of beach chairs and cabanas for those who want to hang out closer to the water. Attractions: Playa Del Carmen - bustling town 15 minutes away worth a trip for shopping and dining Tulum - must see Mayan ruins on the coast XCaret - an "eco park" that is somewhat like "animal kingdom" and has a great show in the evening that is worth seeing Akumal - terrific snorkeling in a protected bay Dolphinaris - swim with dolphins - beautiful new facility and a great experience Best of luck in planning your trip

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Short Vacation!!! I could have not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: thigysflyn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Azul Fives was short. Only three days. But for three days I had not a care in the world. Reception; we were greeted by a very pleasant front lobby staff. She processed our arrival quickly, answered our questions and sent us on our way with Champaign on a golf cart to our room that included a tour of the facility. A very nice touch, it took the "were the hell is the food" out of our vocabularies. The one issue with reception was our room was supposed to have been a two room suite, ( I was traveling with my sixteen year old daughter who needs hours of mirror time) the room we got was a one room with two double beds. I ask about this when we received our keys. I was told that is what the travel agency booked for us, and after comparing documents she was correct. So, the resort did exactly was what asked of them. Why do I tell you this? They said if the resort would not have been full, Azul would have placed us in the room we thought we had. ( A review of the travel company will be coming shortly.) Our First Meal. After dropping our bags off at the room, we took a short walk to the Palmas pool bar. We were met by Jose, who is your server at that bar. We became close to Jose throughout our stay. He made our trip fun from the word go. Every time he saw us he would shake my hand and ask how we were doing. Now if you go here give Jose a shout out. The Room; The room was clean and comfortable. Tile floors throughout. A large sliding glass door to the patio which was large too. The entry to the rooms are through a locked door into a small vestibule then you use your card again to enter your room. Ours was 811-2. I felt safe for me and my daughter at all times. The Food; The restaurants were all very good. The menu at the dining locations other than the buffet were the same everyday we were there. The Buffet changed every night. An example is, one night might be american night, the next seafood night so on and so forth.. But, it was all very well prepared, fresh, hot, tasty. I spoke with Frenado the executive chef on afternoon as he was overseeing the evening meals. He explained the detail he expects from his staff, in the restaurants as well as the pool cafe's. His expectations are very high, and the quality of the food shows. The Beach; I had read a few reviews of the beach. It was a little rocky along the edges of the property. But for the most part it was nice a soft sand.

Reviews.Title: “The Azul Fives is a resort of excellence. Our wedding was magical.”
Reviews.Author: loberts
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I were recently married at the Azul Fives by Karisma, accompanied by 40 of our close friends and family members. It was an absolute dream vacation. We arrived around 2 pm and the friendly, attentive staff looked after our luggage while we were transported in golf carts to our private group check-in. It was quite a remarkable experience. We were provided warm towels to clean our hands, followed by a glass of champagne. The hotel staff gave us a group briefing about upcoming meetings and pertinent information to get us settled in. We were also offered complimentary massages at the check-in. This private group check-in was quick, easy and a wonderful way to begin our experience at the Azul Fives. The food at the Azul Fives was one of the first things we discovered and it was delicious. The Tsuki restaurant, Japanese cuisine, was a hit among our group. We also really enjoyed the variety at the Sea Olive restaurant. Every day, the chefs prepared a delicious lunchtime barbeque buffet with burgers, hot dogs, Spanish rice, tortillas and guacamole, and salads. We found the size of the resort perfect for vacationing with a large group. Everyone had privacy, yet the small size allowed for us to easily meet up during the day or in the evening. The grounds and facilities were immaculate. I was amazed by the friendliness of all hotel staff; they were always smiling and greeting you. The wedding services at the Azul Fives were exceptional. We met with the wedding coordinators on Monday prior to our wedding on Thursday. Estefania and Brenda, the Azul Fives wedding coordinators, and Elena, of Lomas Travel, offered professional and friendly services. Estefania and Elena offered their expertise to customize and perfect the details of our wedding. Every detail was done to perfection. Our wedding package included a group dinner. However, since we were purchasing the private barbeque buffet dinner on the beach for our group, we were able to use the group dinner the night before our wedding. The staff and wedding coordinators really personalized this dinner for us. We were thrilled with the set-up in Flavours restaurant. We had our own private room; each table setting had our group dinner menu printed specially with the bride and groom’s names and the date. It was a nice touch and definitely a keepsake. The dinner and service were outstanding. I had a relaxing and memorable wedding day. Estefania and Brenda were available to assist me throughout the day. The ceremony on the beach was beautiful, just like a dream wedding. I cannot say enough about the beautiful beach reception set-up that was prepared by Elena, Estefania, Brenda and the hotel staff. Our guests raved about the barbeque buffet dinner. Again, the service was exceptional. We ended the day dancing on the beach under a full moon. It was the most perfect wedding day. We also had a group brunch included in our wedding package, which was held at Flavours the day after our wedding. The chef had prepared a few special items in the buffet for the occasion. Again, it was delicious. The Azul Fives was outstanding in all areas, food, facilities, accommodations, entertainment and service. We would love to return, perhaps for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: admcd1
Reviews.Content: We were at the Fives from March 16-21 with our 15, 13 and 10 year old kids. It is a very pretty, immaculate resort with a nice infinity pool near the beach. It has a nice tennis court and offer golf cart rides to different parts of the resort (its not too big so we walked and never rode except when we arrived with our luggage. We were not sure what to think initially as the admitting procedure was choppy and we did not get the family suite that we were told we would have; instead we had two separate hotel-style rooms next to eachother. We also were tired from getting up at 3 am to get there so NOT getting what we expected seemed worse than it probably was. Our rooms were nice and clean but there is a damp smell that doesn't go away. We vacationed at the Azul Sensatori las spring and really liked it because we were all inclusive and did not have to worry about tipping. This is NOT the way it is at the FIVES. The first day we were there, we ate at the Sea Olive. The waiter stopped us to ask for a tip after we finished our lunch. My husband said "we are on the all-inclusive plan and thought tipping was already included." The waiter said that it was still somewhat expected that we tip. Of course we did tip but checked up front to make sure we didn't misunderstand. The lady at the fron desk told us that we did not have to tip unless we received outstanding service and WANTED to tip. HMMMM....needless to say, the employees work so hard and we appreciated it but we ended up spending several hundred dollars more on tips than what we had planned. They also offer the a-la-carte plan (European) so you have to be sure to be ready to prove you are on the all-iclusive by bringing your ID card along. We didn't like this part because at other all inclusive resorts, we didn't have to bring our wallets, etc. along. Here we did have to bring ID and money and it was a pain at times! The food was very good; we loved the pool side restaurant "the LIZARD". My 67 year old parents came with us, also and enjoyed the food, walking on the beach and the pool areas. We did not get into the entertainment too much but it seemed good. Most of the time we walked on the beach, etc. The beach outside the hotel was very rocky but walk north a ways to the PRINCESS for inexpensive beach massages, good waves, a cool sand bar that you can go out quite a ways on, jet ski rentals, etc. We loved that area and snorkeled around a bit and saw a few fish. Our oldest daughter loved the volleyball on the beach and met some teen friends there. The gourmet food was good but in all honesty, we loved the hamburgers, guacamole, and smoothies as well as anything. The line at the pool bar was often long but drinks were yummy. :0) Overall it was a great trip. We would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Peacefully Perfect Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Amy3333
Reviews.Content: After ten years of spending Spring Break in the Playa del Carmen area with our three children (now ages 16, 13, 8) - and most of them at the same all-inclusive resort in Playacar, it was very exciting to try the new Azul Fives resort. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite and that was the perfect accommodation for my family - two teenage daughters in one room and my 8 year old son, along with my husband and me, in the giant suite overlooking the winding pools. There are no ocean view rooms but as it turned out, that wasn't a drawback because the grounds were beautiful. There was a lovely deck where we would sip wine and play games in the evenings before dinner. The house wine was decent, too (it came from a bottle!), especially compared to what we have experienced in the past. After fighting a growing trend of obnoxious high school seniors and college students the past few years, it was such a relief to find a relaxing resort where there was plenty of action for the entire family but it never felt crowded or rowdy. All of the service people were very friendly and helpful - and surprisingly quick to respond to our requests. I was very relieved to feel safe there with my family, too. The restaurants were very nice and had some great offerings, including a children's menu. The Asian restaurant Tsuki was our favorite. The breakfast buffet was great and even offered a bloody mary bar and mimosas.One additional restaurant would have been nice for variety. The two food-rlated recommendations I would make would be to have coffee accessible in the early mornings without going into the Flavours dining room. We ended up ordering room service every morning which was okay but some days we would have preferred to get it ourselves if it was easily available. The other would be to have ice cream available to the kids in the afternoon without having to sit down to order in one of the formal dining areas. We didn't get to much of the evening entertainment but my teenage daughters went to most of the shows - they were typical of what you's expect - a little cheesy but still kind of fun. They took place in the Zky club which had nice ambiance.There was a great kids club, Azulitos, where my son would go each day to play Wii or Xbox to get out of the son for a little bit. When he wasn't there, he'd play volleyball or soccer on the beach with the other children. You could also check out boogie boards or snorkeling gear. The pool staff was great. We always bring a bunch of $1 bills for tips because they work hard to keep your glasses full. The beach right in front is beautiful but a little rocky. But you can walk down the beach a few minutes where it is clear and sandy. We walked for miles each day up and down the shore. Azul Fives is perfect proximity to Playa del Carmen. We took a $12 cab ride (about 10 minutes) into town twice for souvenir shopping and dinner. There was a nice workout room for those that want to exercise. There is also a tennis court. As with any resort, particularly in Mexico, some things are a little quirky. They operate a little differently there. For example, we extended our trip an extra day and it took no less than 10 phone calls and a dozen people to figure out how to settle our billing and room keys. Our departure shuttle arrived an our early after clearly establishing our pick up time with the concierge. Little things, not deal breakers. Overall, it was a delightful experience and we will definitely plan to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good but it wasn't great!”
Reviews.Author: BeachDestinations
Reviews.Content: We returned from a one week vacation (March 12 - March19) with our two young kids (5yr old and an 8yr old). The experience was good but not great. We were at the Azul Beach hotel two years ago and decided to try this new Karisma hotel. Here is what we found. The Good --> The rooms were very spacious (we had a 1 bedroom suite). The food was excellent, however, the wait in some of the restaurants was too long. The Not So Good --> The pools were cold, however, they did warm up slightly during the day. You can't swim in the ocean directly in front of the resort because it is too rocky, we had to walk about two minutes down the beach to a spot that was swimmable. We found we did not use any of the spa services as they were totally over priced. Overall, the experience was good but definately NOT a five star!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Not Bad - Staff made the trip”
Reviews.Author: yardc
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Most staff very Friendly (Thank you Edwardo, Mayo, Ali, Edwin, Guillermo ... you are great!!!) - 1 Bed Suite was very spacious - Food was very good - The Price. - Good shows for the kids. - Beach beverage service was better/faster than most resorts - Great Spa The Bad: - One MUST get a pool view room. Resort is VERY narrow with chain link fence on both sides. Rooms facing outside look at/over fence and dirt road on other side with local traffic. Theres a reason they don't provide a resort map on the website! - 5-15 min wait to get table at breakfast every day (even though many tables were always open and available). - Sky bar was under staffed. Always a long wait to get cocktail. - Rocks on beach ... must walk away from resort to go in ocean. - Fitness center very small - always packed. - Maid service often left coffee pot dirty and garbage un-emptied. Did not show at all one day.

Reviews.Title: “Difficulty with key card and lack understanding English with food.”
Reviews.Author: McGill1945
Reviews.Content: We had a very difficult time with being locked out of room twice...also my husband who has food allergies did have a difficult time trying to explain what he could eat not eat plus called the hotel to tell them the same....

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: flyaway31
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 days vacation with extended family (with 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 20 months). We all LOVED it....so much so that my 4 years old started crying at the thought of leaving. Loved the staff, they do go out og thier way to make your stay comfortable, if possible. I was a little apprehensive after reading the negative reviews, and I must admit that when we entered the lobby at 4 a.m. we were a little underwhelmed....there is no wow factor that I usually associate with 5 star properties. Secondly, on check-in they make you pose for a group photo and give you an ID card....I just wanted to go to sleep and requested that this procedure wait. We had booked 3 deluxe rooms, but upgraded to the one bedroom suite the following morning (highly recommended if you can afford it). Speak to Vanessa at the front desk and she will help. Also got late checkout for the 1Bdrm suite for free, plus free wi-fi internet for a week. The open concept washroom was very inconvenient with 4 children hanging around. Need to build for some better privacy, and we adults never used the tub. But was fabulous to bathe 4 excited children at the same time. Word of advice - there is no ATM on site and neither do they let you draw against your credit card, so carry some extra cash. The nearest ATM is an OXXO which a "slow 15 min" walk from the hotel. The food is very good, but there are exceptions. Flavours and Tsuki were good at all times. Whereas, Sea Olives dinner menu was dismal, ended up ordering room service. But the waitstaff was attentive and prompt. Except for one occassions where the chef was having a "tantrum" and did not make gaucamole...all our requests were met. The pool is cool...and our children could not enjoy the water for long. The sea is much warmer and a short walk north will get you to an area of no rocks or coral. It rained twice during our trip and there is nothing to do in any indoor lounge area, but caught up on my sleep. The staff at the Kids club is very friendly but speak very limited English. But they were attentive and kind to the children and the language did not pose a barrier to the enthusiatic children. They have a nice daily schedule. Howver, the kids gym is not free and is an additional charge of $5/hr. Overall, a good trip and am looking forward to staying at other Karisma properties. PS: My sister in law and I ended up getting a massage for $50 on the beach in front of the Princess hotel. The spa rates were too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and definitely not even close to 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Flynst0ne
Reviews.Content: Before our trip I went on trip advisor just like you are probably doing and found it very hard to believe that some of the negative reviews were true. The people who wrote them I thought were just very picky travelers and so I went there with my husband and 2 year old son with an open mind. Unfortunately more than all of those reviews happened to us as well. I cant believe I am writing this and need to just list for you all of the negative things that happened to us during our stay. If I had to explain it all in detail it would be a novel. Please feel free to email me if you have any further questions. I highly recommend NOT staying at this hotel. 1. We were greeted at the front desk by a man that had no idea how to communicate in English to direct us to where we could go to grab lunch while we waited for our room to be ready. He obviously was not well trained. 2. We ate at multiple restaurants that sometimes took 2 hours with a small child just to be served lunch. Also at quite a few meals one of our dishes would come out and the rest of the tables food came a long time after. 3. Experienced a blackout in our room and nobody could explain to us what happened. 4. Maid service was inconsistent. When we called for things like water and extra towels we sometimes had to call 5times to get it! 5. We paid for the all-inclusive meal plan and the room service menu had a VERY limited menu 6. Maids would just walk into our room to deliver shampoo and things we never called for at 10pm at night(we have a 2 year old in the room with us). It was completely inappropriate! At that time of night they should never enter someones room. 7. We were upset the first two days with a lot of this stuff and went to the front desk to speak to the hotel Manager and instead they told us to fill out a comment card and that the manager was in a meeting and would contact us as soon as he was out. We waited and waited and NEVER heard from him! We went back to the front desk the day before we left and they told us to fill out another comment card And we Sid we already had and we asked what ever happened with the manager contacting us.....and the man told us he could try and have him contact us before we leave but he was in Miami so he couldn't promise anything. That to me was outrageously POOR customer service. 8. Forty dollars was stolen from my husband. 9. Pools were cold 10. No direct access into the ocean....you need to walk down another beach to get in. 11. We had a couples massage at the spa that was supposed to be a daily special/promotion and the hotel charged us the day the service occured and then added on more charges at the end of the trip to account for the exchange rate. We should have been charged the rate on the day the service occurred. We spoke to a woman or manager of the front desk "Vanessa" and she lied to us about the extra charge and when we looked at all the math she had pulled a fast one on us and actually charged us more than we were promised. Good luck to the management at this hotel because I am a frequent traveler and will not be recommending this hotel to anyone. This is the worst customer service I have ever received on a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great.”
Reviews.Author: TOCAN8
Reviews.Content: We have visited Mexico for the last 10 years. We love the people, the food and the beaches. We have visited numerous resorts throughout the 10 years and found that some were better than others. This year, after researching 5 star resorts I picked Azul Fives hoping that it lived up the the five star status. In terms of location I would have preferred it to be closer to Playa Del Carmen core however the Taxi ride over is less than 30 minutes. The cost should be $12 USD one way. The hotel is fairly new therefore you might have difficulty returning back from Playa del Carmen. Two taxi drivers couldn't find the hotel on their booklet that determines rates. Make sure to know the address or let them know which other resort it's close to. ROOM: We arrived at the resort early morning and requested an upgrade. All other resorts we've been able to get free upgrades or paid a nominal amount if the resort wasn't completely full. We had to pay about $500 USD to upgrade to the 1 bedroom. The bedroom is spacious, modern and clean however it has one large king bed and a uncomfortable pull out couch for the kids. In terms of privacy, it has a somewhat transparent shoji screen type doors. Therefore if you want private adult time the one bedroom will not give you this. The lighting is definately low especially near the vanity area. They have a retractable makeup mirror but you can hardly see anything due to the poor lighting. There is NO ocean view. The hotel is well set back. The main pool and two restaurants face the ocean. I don't think this is mentioned on their website or I missed it. I was a little perplexed as to the 5 star rating and not having an ocean view. I was told this resort was originally intended to be condos but there wasn't enough sales therefore converted to a condo/resort. There is nowhere to hang clothes to dry. We just put our wet swimming suits on the balcony chairs to dry. Our clothes always felt damp in our room for some reason. The air conditioning was on but it still felt clammy inside. The chandelier about the dining table makes this weird rustling noise all night long from the airconditioning unit and often times my husband and I have woken up thinking someone had broken into our room. Lastly, the cleaning is not has meticulous as other resorts we've visited. The beds were made the the bathroom cleaned but there the coffee and dining table was rarily touched. One night we arrived in our room at 6:00pm to find it hadn't been cleaned at all. They started cleaning it at 7pm after we complained. BEACH: Small sandy area before you enter the water. It is very rocky. We didn't really mind. We stayed in the pool area most of the time. I agree with other reviewers, the service and energy level near the main pool was lacking. Most resorts around the main pool there is ample entertainment and constant service staff to bring drinks and food. The sea olive restaurant will not let you take food out to the pool area and there is no other outdoor food options around the main pool. There is a bar for drinks though. We never had any problems with getting chaise lounge however we went when the resorts was relatively quiet. FOOD/RESTAURANTS: Food was decent. Sea Olive during lunch is a tad slow, they ran out of certain items on the menu often. The TSUKI restaurant was good. The service at the restaurants were good and they accomodated special orders. We did get tired of the resort food and went to Playa Del Carmen a few days to get authentic mexican food. I would have preferred wrist bands to identify that we had the all inclusive. I found carrying a card all the time for food and drinks was cumbersome, especially when you are at the swim up bar and are asked for your card. SPA: The spa was excellent. The prices are quite high however they do have specials. I took advantage of the special twice. They had a $117 USD for 50 minute massage and 30 minute facial. Included is access to the spa facility which had a great wet and dry sauna. They also have a hot jacuzzi and cold jacuzzi. The attendant stays with you and offers you towels, drinks and snacks. The massage was excellent. Overall, the experience was fantastic. I would highly recommend this. TENNIS: We took advantage of the tennis lesson offered at 8am every morning except Sunday. Pedro was excellent. This really made our vacation. Pedro was very accomodating and let our son play with us most days when it wasn't busy. Often there was only 3 of us in the group. You can get private lessons for $45/.hr. ENTERTAINMENT: We caught a few shows however as others have mentioned on tripadvisor the shows start at 9:30pm. If you have small children it's hard to get to. I think they should have it at 8:30pm since most families eat early. KIDS CLUB: For young children under 8 they are good but for older children 9-12 not suitable. There are alot of rooms locked during the day and evening which limits the activities. OVERALL: I thought the resort was good but not great. We think they need to work out the kinks in terms of consistency and service. Internet access was not free. They charge you $70 USD for the week or $14USD daily rate. The business centre has internet access on a minute or hourly basis. There is no general indoor lounging area. This would be nice when it rains. Your only option is to wait out the storm in your room. The last comment I will leave is for people who are on the all inclusive plan. Please leave a tip for good service. We generally leave a few bucks for breakfast , lunch, room service and housekeeping and $5 to $10 for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: menzelm78
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Azul Fives.....I think the best thing about this resort is the employees that work here. Particularly the entertainment staff - they were wonderful! We had a unit with the rooftop deck which we loved. The beach is nice and long for those morning walks. If you walk down a little ways there are great places to swim. We would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on European Plan”
Reviews.Author: CamdenH
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2-year-old, and I had a great time at Azul Fives. We were there during the last week of February when the weather was nearly perfect every day. Even though the hotel was supposedly sold out, it never felt crowded, probably due to the fact that this is a hotel+condo resort. ROOM: The 1-bedroom suite was clean, nicely furnished, and comfortable. We like hard beds so that wasn't a problem for us compared to other reviewers. We appreciated being off the ground (1st floor) so that our curious daughter wasn't able to go wandering off to the pool. We also liked having balconies overlooking the pool. FOOD: When we go to Mexico, we go to eat Mexican food. We went to Sea Olive for dinner on our first night since it was already dark and we were surprised to find that there were no Mexican options. No ceviche, no tacos. Flavours Restaurant had an international theme night and I think the theme was "American." !! I would have been very unhappy to pay for the "Gourmet Inclusive" package and be stuck eating what we would eat at home. We rented a car so we ventured out to Playa del Carmen every day and ate very well (La Pesca, La Cueva del Chango, Asaderia de Pollo, La Bamba de Jarocha, Origenes to mention a few) . We walked over to Coco's Cabanas down the beach a couple of times which was fun too. ACTIVITIES: We had a couple of tennis lessons with Pedro and that was fantastic! He's a super guy who gave us solid tips and drills to improve the game. We had a decent yoga class and a terrible salsa lesson. The salsa instructors didn't really want to be there and just went through the motions. Since we were the only ones there, they gave us about 15 minutes of lessons. Why bother even putting this on the social calendar? In fact, if there is a wedding on, they cancel the lesson. So after showing up two days in a row to find that the class was cancelled, we were more than disappointed on our third attempt to get 15 minutes of heartless, halfass salsa lesson. SERVICE: The room service people were very nice. They gave us 4 bottles of water every day (although we bought our own water/juice/soft drinks/cerveza to supplement what they gave us.) I left my wedding ring in the room a couple of times with no problems (I didn't take the diamond ring with me on the trip) . In fact, one day we returned to the room while they were cleaning and one of the cleaners told us that our safe was left open. Everything was in place. RESORT: We enjoyed the pools. The shallow areas were great for my daughter. Because we read how cold the pools were, we took a little shorty wetsuit for my daughter so she was very comfortable. I didn't find the pool to be that cold myself. We didn't get a chance to swim in the ocean. We're scuba divers so we took a little snorkel mask for our daughter along with all our gear but I guess 2 years of age is a bit too young...! and we thought the waves would have been a little too much for her to handle. We also really wanted to see the monkeys that other reviewers talked about but we never got to see them. But our daughter came home talking about the iguanas sunning themselves. KID'S CLUB was nice but they told us that we have to pay $30/day usage fee since we're not doing the all-inclusive. On top of that, there's the $15/hour for a babysitter at the club. When I called the hotel before the trip, they told me it was $10/hour at the kid's club ($15/hr in the room) and they mentioned nothing of the $30/day. $60 for two hours of adult time is quite different from the $20 that we expected to pay...but when we paid for the two hours, they only charged $30 for the babysitting, my guess is due to inefficiency rather than wanting to comp us for it. OVERALL: I 'd go back in a heartbeat, especially now that we know where to go for good food and how to structure our days better for everyone's enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: dramz3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 6 night vacation at Azul Fives. We traveled with our 2 year old and two other couples with toddlers. We have traveled to many all inclusives in the past (Sandels, couples, el cid) and this was by far the best family friendly all inclusive we have ever been to....this was the first Karisma resort we have stayed at. There are some negative reviews on Trip advisor and I have to say, I was a bit nervous the week before we left, but our experience left us wanting to return ASAP. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which was amazing! I would definitely suggest the upgrade. The room is huge and beautifully appointed with modern furniture. I wasn't bothered at all by the lighting as some other reviewers mentioned. The separate shower and tub were very nice. We had a large deck, but no view to brag about. We spent minimal time in our room, so the lack of a nice view wasn't a bother. Housekeeping did a wonderful job everyday! We used the safe for our valuables, which we always do when traveling, and we had no problems at all. I always felt perfectly safe at the resort. We didn't venture out of the resort, but the other couples we traveled with did go into Playa del Carmen and loved it. The property is beautiful, just stunning! There is a bit of walking required, but it was nice to get the excersize. The beach is one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen....there is coral out in front of the resort, but all you have to do is walk 5 min down the beach to enter the water. Really no big deal! The pools are a bit on the cool side, but really just felt refreshing- definitely didn't keep any of us out of the pool because it was too cold, however, it would be nice if they were a little warmer. The swinging beach beds are awesome! You do have to reserve them, so think ahead when you arrive. The service is amazing! We met so many nice people that work at this resort and really take pride in making your experience special: From the waiters to the smoothie maker to the beach butlers. Of course there are always exceptions, but by and large we encountered excellent service. Two occasions we waited an excessive amount of time to receive our food at Sea Olive....so we opted to do the buffet for dinner to avoid long wait times with the kids...the fajita station was delicous! The food overall was excellent! We liked Tsuki the best and probably Sea Olive the least. Flavors is great for b-fast and Lizards was handy for snacks. The drinks are so good! If you think the drinks are weak, just ask for a double and that should take care of you just perfect. We also ordered a fair amount of room service and it was tasty and speedy...often arrived much sooner than quoted. The room service waiters were so nice and often times room service would call after it was delivered to make sure everything was right. The most impressive aspect of this resort is the family friendly amenities. The staff and resort as a whole goes out of thier way to ensure that families enjoy thier vacation. The kids club is so cute and even has toddler size toilets! Tons of fun toys and activities to keep the kids happy. Probably the only disappointment during the whole trip was the lack of access to the "My Gym" facilities. They have this beautiful room with tons of tumbling equipment, but it is locked all day except for one hour in the morning for specific age group classes...we only had access to it once during our stay. It is such a wonderful space, that it is a shame that they don't allow more access to it. The yoga class was amazing! The teacher was really well trained. ..so fun! I also did the tennis classes every morning- Pedro was great! Night time entertainment was a little on the cheesy side, but the kids liked it. The only downside is that the night shows don't start till 9:30pm, which was too late for our little ones most nights. The gym facilities are perfectly appointed. None of us did any spa treatments, although I really wished I would have! I felt the prices too high, otherwise I would have been ther in a second. We did bring one dollar bills to tip, but we never felt obligated to do so. Although when we did encounter excellent service (which was often), we rewarded for it and the staff was very appreciative. All in all, a wonderful trip- go with an open and positive mindset and you will be pleased. We sure were!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your valuables are always in the safe!”
Reviews.Author: cabbyschnabby
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort since we were traveling with our two young adult children and a three bedroom suite was ideal. On the positive side the suite was spacious and comfortable. We liked the idea of having a kitchen but it wasn't very well appointed, lacking essentials such as a corkscrew. When we requested one from room service they said they didn't think they had any and it never showed up. I had to borrow one from the bar staff. The mini bar wasn't stocked unless several complaints were made, by our last day we were running out of water. Even if the mini bar was stocked it only had poor quality beer. The hotel grounds are lovely and we liked the layout of the pools. There was never any difficulty finding chaises by the pool or beach. Our terrace faced directly on a pool so it was equivalent to a swim-up room. Now for the downside. We were told that the resort was at 98% occupancy, and I believe this was a first for this new resort and it showed. Service in the restaurants was often slow. Special requests were usually not met. Breakfast at Flavours ( a buffet) is good but dinner isn't very good. The food at Sea olive and Tsuki is much better but inconsistent and overcooked. Lizards is a good choice for lunch. Only one bar remains open after six pm and it gets very crowded making getting a drink difficult. Now for the worst part, we had a theft from the room. We left the resort for the day and on our return we found that my son's I pod touch and expensive ear buds had been stolen. I know he should have put it in the safe but he hadn't left it out in the open meaning someone rifled through his backpack .Security investigated and they determined that the only people who had keyed in and out of the room were housekeeping and mini bar staff but nothing was resolved during our stay. My son has a form of autism and this upset him greatly making the last two days of our stay very miserable.Thank god for... Ivanhoe, a bartender at one of the pool bars who had befriended him, otherwise we would not have been able to get him to leave his room. Several weddings took place during our stay and there were some loud celebrations into the wee hours of the morning. We travel fairly frequently and are pretty easy going but this resort did not live up to the standards we have grown to expect.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest experience!”
Reviews.Author: Caughtthebug6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Azul Fives mid February and were very impressed by our whole vacation. We stayed there with our 4 children and really couldn't have asked for a friendlier place to be. Our room was a 1500 square foot suite, perfect for a family of our size. We had 1 king size bed in our side of the suite with a roof top hot tub, bed, couch and lots of sitting room. The other side of our suite held 2 queen size beds for our children to sleep on as well as their own washroom. The beach was really nice but you definitely notice the coral as you start navigating the ocean. However, that is easily remidied by walking down the beach for 5 minutes where you find a smooth enterance. The pools weren't crowded, enough chairs for everyone. The water temp was perfect after laying in the sun. The swim up bars were well located and always ready with a drink for you. The restaurants (have 4 but we went to 3) had a great selection of good food and using the all inclusive option, we ate until our hearts content. The coffee from Columbia was literally second to none! Better than Starbucks or Tim Hortons, Van Houtes or any other that I've tried. The service... wow! We loved our waiters and hostesses, they were so friendly and eager to help my children learn spanish when asked. They truly went above and beyond. We are already looking forward to our next trip to Azul Fives!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place--we can't say enough good things about it.”
Reviews.Author: MRW1227
Reviews.Content: We were at the resort for a week with a 2-year old. My wife & I were both in need of serious relaxation after a rough several weeks at work, and Azul-Fives was just the ticket. Here are a few details: * The comprehensive package made it easy financially, and very convenient--we put our wallets away the 1st day and didn't need them again until it was time to go home, and all the restaurants were very good. * I've never seen a resort with both staff &facilities so welcoming of small kids. There were lots of other families with little ones, and between their company and the excellent child center (especially the staff), both Mom & Dad and son were happy all week. (The toddler-sized robes were also a nice touch--made for a cute picture of our son.) Overall, I haven't had such a hard time packing up to head home at the end of a vacation in quite a qule, and I heartily recommend Azul-Fives to anybody looking to get away from the real world for a while. Enjoy! (PS One small criticism--but really just that--for the times of year before it's really hot outside, pool heating would be a nice addition.)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury All the Way”
Reviews.Author: eclipze006
Reviews.Content: Wow, its amazing to see how polarized the reviews are on this hotel! Let me start by saying that I am one of those people who are extremely picky about hotels. Whereas it takes most people a couple of days to decide on a resort, I will take weeks and read every review out there. I travel down south (Mexico, Cuba or Dominican Republic) once a year and have been to perhaps 10 different resorts. I search for resorts that are luxurious but at a good value (I refuse to pay more than 1600-1700$CAD for a week). I will say that I did have some reservations about the hotel after reading some of the reviews, but all of my worries flew away the moment I arrived at the resort. First of all, the place is absolutely GORGEOUS. The decor is outstanding, and we were treated so well when we first arrived to the hotel. Eduardo, our bellman was so sweet and helpful making sure we felt comfortable when we arrived in the room. If you can afford it, I really recommend taking the one bedroom suite; when I travel, I usually go for the most economical room, but I paid about 13$ extra per person, per day and i found it to be really worthwhile. The bed was really comfortable, and the room was always really clean. The only thing that is a bit confusing all the light switches! There are so many them, and even on the last day, we still didnt fully comprehend which ones opened which! The first time we arrived at the pool and beach area, our mouths dropped. The place is stunningly beautiful and I absolutely loved the infinity pool. Chris (Rock) and his brother Alfonso are the pool butlers and they are absolutely amazing. They really go out of their way to make you comfortable, putting your towels down for you, and asking if you need anything. At the pool, they have towels, sunscreen, magazines, cool face towels, all you might need. Also, I wasnt aware of this before leaving but they have approximately 8 day beds on the beach. You have to reserve them ahead of time, so speak with the butlers a day or two ahead. The man who delivers the drinks at the pool was also incredible, passing by often (unfortunately his name escapes me at the moment). One thing I will mention is that I would characterize Azul Fives as almost like an upscale family resort. My friend and I are in our mid-20s and prefer quieter resorts for rest + relaxation. There were not many people our own age, besides a few couples. This did not bother us. Most people at the resort are either traveling with their spouse, or with their spouse and young children. I did not see many kids over the age of 4 (this is a good sign considering we went during the school year). There were alot of babies around one or two years old. Would I have known this before coming, I still would have gone to the resort however, for others it might be something to consider. I really dont know how anyone can fault the service at this hotel. Its obvious that the management puts a very high emphasis on providing top-notch service and the employees do. Everywhere. The nicest thing on top of it, is that during a conversation with one of the waiters, they told us that are also treated really well which makes it easy for them to do a good job. This was really nice to hear. At all the restaurants, the service was wonderful. I cannot remember everyones name, but Gregorio and Joel were two that really stood out. At the Tsukis, all the waiters were really nice. Although the waiters always passed by and were really attentive, one issue we had was how slowly the food was served at the two pool side restaurants. Dont get me wrong, I dont want them compromising the quality for lighting fast service, but it often took 20-30 minutes to receive our meals, even simple things. Also, one night we went to Tsukis (where the food is amazing) but the restaurant was full and we were told to return. We did return an hour later and had to wait so long, that we decided to leave. However, Joel and a couple of other servers were kind enough to run after us and bring us to the Mediterranean restaurant right next door, and tried really hard to please us and make up for it. In terms of activities and excursions, all we did was travel to the town, and play tennis. I have an important note to write about traveling to Playa - REMEMBER that it should cost 12$ US to get there, not a penny more. Our driver tried to convince us that it was 15$ and we ended up paying it. Dont make our mistake. Tennis: Pedro who worked at the tennis court may have been the highlight of our trip. He is so kind, and such a good teacher. A private lesson is alittle steep (45$) but at 8am every morning there are free group classes. When I went one morning, there was only one other person, so its more like a semi-private class. Be sure to bring tennis shoes, its slippery. But honestly, this guy deserves a raise. The entertainment staff is also amazing - so thank you Alex, Gam, Hilarios and others were making our week special! Another thing is: the sun is extremely strong, so wear lots of sunscreen and apply often. My friend got an extremely bad sunburn. But, another testament to the service - one of the managers found out, went to the store to buy her cream and tried to locate us at the resort to give it to us. Thank you Mr. Nunez!! Now the spa: we both went for a 1 hour massage. It was a really great experience, but extremeeeellly expensive. They had a promotion so we got 80 minutes for around 130$ (CAN). My massage wasnt the best, but my friend really liked hers. However, they make the whole experience wonderful so we were actually there for like 3 hours. You have access to the spa area (with waterfall pools - but the hot one was actually cold) and saunas. They bring you to a room before and after your massage were they put heating pads on your back while you drink tea in a tranquil environment. Its terms of the WHOLE experience, it was the nicest spa ive ever been to. Ok - last thing: the front desk service was generally good, but I hate to say this it could have been a bit better. I dont want to get anyone fired, but here were some of the things that happened at the front desk: - I had a question about TV channels, and whether they had ABC, and the guy told me to "go to the pool area and ask the guy with shorts on." Normally, I would think they would find out for the guest. - The day before we were leaving, we went to the front desk and asked what time our bus would be coming to pick us up the next morning. Our flight was at about 11am so we figured someone would come at around 8am or so. The person said that they didnt know and that we should contact our travel company. I mentioned that normally there are binders with the information left in the lobby and the person said there wasnt. We got really nervous and figured we should be at the lobby at 7am to make sure we wouldnt miss our bus. We were talking with other guests and found out that there ARE binders at the front desk with the information in it. Thank goodness we found this out, because the bus passed really early. I also asked this person to schedule a wake up call for the next morning at 6am, but it never happened. We were lucky that we had a back up alarm. Overall, I would really recommend this hotel! Please feel free to contact me with any questions! And a big THANK YOU to everyone at the hotel for an amazing trip!!! Side note of things that I recommend could be changed to improve the service: -i really appreciate that this hotel has tried to be at least slightly "environmentally friendly." it mentions in the room that if we want our towels changed, to put them on the floor. However, as much as I tried to save our towels for a couple of days by placing them back on the rack, they were always changed. Most people probably appreciate this, but its really not necessary. Also, I have never been to a resort that recycles but I really encourage the management to start putting designated areas in the room for water bottles. I would always leave my recyclables in a corner but I am sure they got tossed in the can. The waste that goes on in these places is really unbelievable and the Azul Fives could really be setting a precedent. -i know most people dont travel to watch tv, but most of the american channels were missing (ABC, FOX, NBC). the reception wasnt great either. -Bathroom lighting could be improved slightly (using higher wattage lightbulbs), like other reviews remarked it was alittle challenging to apply makeup -time of delivering food in the restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bits5
Reviews.Content: Wonderful family vacation. Not sure this would be my pick without kids, but this is a perfect spot for families looking for a sophisticated resort that caters both to kids and adults alike. Never crowded or over-run with hoards of the party-crowd. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: JenFlodin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 night stay with our 4 and 5 year old kids as well as Grandpa. We rented a one bedroom suite and then a double room for my dad, which was essentially attached. After quite some time in negotiating with the front desk why I didn't like the first room (keys didn't work 3 different times in same day, water heater and building elevator were broken), they finally agreed to move us. BTW - no one at the resort with the exception of the managers can make a decision...everything had to wait until I could talk to a manager, so if they are busy or not there, you sit and wait. The room they moved us to was on the ground floor, with a "view". I would recommend anyone with young kids to request a ground floor. The "view" was rather odd - essentially when you stepped out to the patio, you were directly staring across the walkway into the kitchen of a pool bar, Lizzards (grill, computers, stacks of plates, food, etc.) as opposed to one of the resort pools, but it was better than the first room they gave us, so I shut up. Other pool kitchens were enclosed, so I am not sure why this one wasn't. The main things I would have liked to know about this place before I booked that I didn't know at that time are as follows; Rooms. The one bdrm suite isn't as ideal as I thought it would be with small kids. We wanted a suite as opposed to a regular hotel room, which is why we came to this property in the first place. The intention was that the adults would be able to stay up later than the kids (8:00), but the suite only has one bed in the bedroom - no other options (like 2 queen or double beds), only one king size bed. The other "bed" is a sleeper sofa - which is obviously where folks would put the kids, but it is smack in the middle of the living room. So essentially, the whole point of getting a suite was lost. The room is big, very modernly decorated, the furniture isn't very comfortable - stiff "pleather" like material on the couch as well as benches and chairs at dining table. The lighting in the bathroom is terrible. We had other issues (no cable connecting the tv to the cable, no batteries in the ceiling fan remote, circuit breaker to hot water tank hadn't been turned on, called concierge multiple times about seeing if there was anything that the toddlers could stand on to reach the sink to wash hands, brush teeth, etc, but never received a returned call, etc.), but I really don't think anyone had ever stayed in these rooms before - so after a few days I just chalked it up to new property "stuff"). Several other people we met had 2 or 3 bdrm suites and were happy with the accommodations, but if you get a roof top deck with a hot tub, just know there is no way to actually be able to fill it with hot water. Beach - the other reviews talk about "rocks" or "stones". All I can say is that the beach has significant boulders and coral in the ocean making it un-swimable directly in front of the resort. You can't really even go in up to your waste without navigating the coral. Most people walked down to the Princess or the Sandals resorts to swim in front of their properties (about a 10 minute walk either direction). Kind of a bummer when you have little kids. Kids club - they ladies there are great although their are only a few that can speak more than a few sentences of English. A few items to note...the My Gym equipment can only be used at certain class times each day (one hour each day usually in the am), and there is a fee for My Gym. No where did I ever read this, even in the room brochure it doesn't say this - but the fee is $10/hour/kid. There is also a 24 or 48 hour notice and addtl. fee if you want them to watch an infant. I am not sure of the exact details on this, but another mom was telling me this was news to her that she had to give notice AND pay a fee as well. They do a really nice job of trying to do different activities and definitely a plus when it rains. Pools. They are not heated. When I read this fact in other reviews I didn't think it was that big of a deal, but believe me, it is COLD! Most people at the resort won't even go in above their waist b/c it is freezing. We had a few days of rain and cooler temps, which really effected the water. If it is sunny every day, it helps, but a definite shock. There are "lagoon" pools throughout the property which are nice (also not heated). If you have little ones that need to nap, ask for a ground floor room along one of the pools, then you can sit in the sun or swim while they are sleeping. The music at the pool bars is just awful. We asked to change it or at least turn it off, but yet again, they had to ask a manager, this is a very unusual request, this is the CD that we play at all our properties, etc. It sounds like a dying whale - the wait staff are ready to blow their heads off - they really need to do something about it. Restaurants. While we got bored with the food (only 3 main restaurants on the property), part of that was b/c we were there for 10 days. The other item to note is that the kitchens are sooooo slow. My kids didn't want to go back to the Olives restaurant b/c every time it was at least a 2 hour event - regardless of lunch or dinner. The "manager" of the Japanese restaurant Pablo was really rude and unhelpful - I won't go into details, but he really has an attitude and isn't very helpful - he was more concerned abut how he wanted to run the restaurant as opposed to making sure the guests were happy - an unusual attitude at this property. Most of the wait staff very much wanted to make your dining experience wonderful, but they are at the mercy of the kitchen - some meals the food would be uncooked in the middle, other nights the "molten" chocolate dessert was cold as ice, salads would be delivered 60 minutes after ordering, etc. I think they just need to work through some of the new resort issues and this will improve in time. Also, while there is room service, the menu has all of 5 or 6 items on it - we got it one night and it was terrible, so not really a decent option if you just want to relax. Bars. There are plenty of pool bars to enjoy during the day (all close by 6) - but the one thing we really missed was there is no lobby bar or anything like that to congregate at. There is a "nightclub" that opens at 6, but it never had anyone in it before dinner and if you went there after dinner, there were green strobe lights playing, and again, nothing really happening until their nightly shows - which started at 9:30 or 10....so we were disappointed there was no family activities for the early evening or anything before 9:30 at all. This was a really big void for us and many of the other guests there as well. There were some very special people that went out of their way to make our stay a pleasure - they were Elenka at the pool...my son adores her....Alex at the pool...Alfonso the pool butler and Marcheleno at the Lizzards bar...they all gave excellent service and should be rewarded for it. Sol and Alena (sp?) at the restaurants did their best too to make us happy. All in all, it was a nice resort, pretty, modern property (not typical Mexican feeling property), but probably best served to those looking for a quiet vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Really Struggling”
Reviews.Author: Sonny_Mos
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at Azul Fives based on the 1bdrm set up due to our 2 young kids, 2yrs & 3yrs. I planned on writing a detailed review of the resort with lots of information such as menus, internet rates, photos, resort maps, wine and drinks, and kids club. This seemed to be missing from the reviews and photos. When we checked in, we were told they were overbooked and could only accommodate us in a standard room for 4 nights, then 3 in the room we booked. They offered some additional compensation but it was resort credits (all inclusive package + resort credits = who cares) . As it turns out, another couple from Canada were also downgraded on the same day. A few days later I overheard another family checking in and given the same story, overbooked. The 1+ bedroom configuration is why people book and they are clearly overbooking the resort. Because of this approach, I can not recommend staying here and will not be going back either. For us, this downgrade really added needless frustration and cramped space to a much needed vacation. Stay away unless you are happy with a down grade. On a final note, there's is so much potential for this place. I would say in our experience, almost all past reviews are fairly accurate. Clean/dirty room (i mean dirty!), english/no-english, nice/rude, slow/quick service. We encountered so much variability. We quickly figured out our routine to ensure we had a good time but we couldn't crack the crappy room situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for families looking for a Higher End resort AND Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: kdueck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb. 9-16th 2011 and love it! I think the two things that stand out the most are 1) excellent customer service and 2) a beautiful resort yet very family friendly. There are 3 restaurants, one is buffet, one mediterranean and one sushi/asian. Plus two or there small outside restaurants. The restaurants had great food and felt like dining in a fine dining establishment AS well as being very kid friendly - they are attentive to parents and children, have food for all, have boosters and highchairs and kid toys at all the restaurants. The service in the restaurants was fantastic. Fernando at breakfast was a very kind and helpful man! This allowed my husband and I to enjoy the food and ambiance a bit more as dining with two children can be a bit hectic. The rooms are nice, very stylish and clean. It would be better if they were designed a bit more kid/family friendly, i.e. better places for kids to sleep. We were in a one bedroom, my husband and I slept in the "bedroom" and our kids in the living room just behind a sliding door from us. So when one person woke we all did. Otherwise this room was definitely big enough for us and we enjoyed it. The pools are nice, some with gradual entry so great for kids to sit and play in shallow water. They are not heated but we didn't' think they were too cold. The beach is nice, it is rocky/coral right infront of the resort so if you want to swim and play in the ocean you have to walk about 5 min. to a sandy spot. No big deal for us. The kids club is really nice - clean with nice toys, it rained one full day we were there so this was a great resource. We also popped in various times throughout our stay, you can play inside or at a small park outside or a small kids pool. All the resources for families was great for us (strollers, highchairs, crib). My husband and I did a couples massage at the spa - it was fantastic as well. A beautiful spa and again great service. Although they do not tell you until after that they add a 10% service charge to the services at the spa. Drinks are bountiful so you can always have a pina colada in hand but it is not a huge party resort. All in all we had a great time and hope to go back! Being a new resort I just hope the beauty of the resort and the great customer service doesn't change as time goes on.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recomment this place to my worst enemy.”
Reviews.Author: JBLocke
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all of the positive reviews. Before leaving on this trip, and after reading all of the glowing reviews, I was pretty confident that I was going to a top-notch resort. Boy was I mislead! This resort is completely awful on more levels than I can mention: a) the food is awful, b) the beach is awful, c) the hotel lay-out is awful, d) the service is awful, and e) the pool is awful. The awful service is what killed it for me. When I go to an all-inclusive resort I expect excellent food and drinks.
