The food, in particular, was horrible, and anytime we'd go to one of the restaurants something that should take 10 minutes would take an hour - it would be at least a 3 hour ordeal for any meal. For such a "highly rated", "exclusive", resort this is unacceptable. And I must note, this wasn't just an issue for my boyfriend in me... I was there for a wedding, and EVERYONE experienced crappy service, food, and drinks. In April I stayed at a MUCH cheaper all-inclusive resort in Mexico... it blew this resort away. The only good thing going for Azul Fives are the rooms, which are very nice, however, I'm only sleeping there... so who cares?! In general, Azul Fives has a nice website with nice photos... but trust me, in reality, this place is not that sweet. My advice is to stay at an all-inclusive that doesn't have condo owners and requires everyone to have the all-inclusive package. A resort that is set up for all-inclusive hotel guests is better set-up to meet your vacation needs.

Reviews.Title: “Average for adults. Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: apsgitt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went to Azul 5. The food is average. The drinks were not the best. The rooms are damp and we had to change ours because of a strong mildew smell. In the basic room there are no kings size beds. The hot water was inconsistent. I will say that this is a GREAT place to bring children of all ages- including toddlers. They have a kids play center and everything you need in restaurants and the room. MAYBE i would return in the future with our children.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: ignavus9
Reviews.Content: We just returned form a very relaxing stay at the Azul Fives. The resort didn't disappoint - very large and well appointed rooms. We were surprised to find an entire apartment to ourselves complete with kitchen, dining room and living room. The entire resort is extremely clean and well maintained. Being a smaller boutique resort, you don't find the crazed mobs of people with their itineraries that are often found at family resorts, so it was generally quiet and relaxing for a couple traveling without kids. The food was good, not mind blowing by any means. I'm not a food snob but I think the food is overpriced and not on par with many U.S. chains, let alone gourmet resorts. Weather in February was a gamble and we ended up with 2 days of rain and clouds. I would plan for late Feb or March next time. Luckily there are still some things to do in Playa and Cancun on a rainy day. Unfortunately this resort didn't have much to do when the weather was poor so most guests stayed inside their rooms. Finally, we enjoyed the beach due to the many tide pools and beautiful view. We did have to take a short walk on the beach to another resort to swim in the ocean due to all the rocks and broken shells right along Azul's beach. You can walk openly between resort beaches as there are no barricades, so we just walked 4 or 5 resorts down to find a nice open area. Service was excellent in most cases, although slow in some cases, which didn't bother us since we had nowhere to be and wanted to unwind. Although I live in the States, I am originally from South Africa and not fluent in Spanish, and this did present a bit of a challenge as the staff mostly speak very broken English. This shouldn't be a deterrent for anyone, just something to keep in mind when prepping to go. I've been to other resorts in Playa and did not encounter this large of a language barrier. Overall I'd recommend this resort to other couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: FERRARI64
Reviews.Content: I have worked in the travel industry for 30 years and have stayed in many great hotels in many great countries, so when we decided to escape winter and head to Playa del Carmen ,we found Azul Fives. Looked nice in pics and good location about a five min drive to town. When we arrived i was pleased at the welcome, glass of champagne and beyond the most gracious welcome i have ever recieved in any hotel. We had a small miscommunication about our room category, but that was Instantly resolved with not even a minute of stress. The one-bedroom condo was FANTASTIC so beautiful, spotless (im a neat freak) and comfortable beyond expectations! The service by all staff is flawless, friendly, helpful. Now i would like to dispell some myths i have read about the hotel, first and most important, the restaruants in the hotel are your BEST best in playa! We had dinner twice and lunch twice in playa del carmen, downtown found the food sub par at best and ridiculously over priced!!! Not to mention the waiters in town have a very nasty habit of adding thier own gratuity usually 20 to 40 dollars extra for the service for one watered down margarita and cold seafood. The Azul Fives restaruants are very beautifully appointed, very comfortable and the food and drinks are half the price of town restaurants!!! The six meals we ate thier were simply , fresh delicious food! The beach in front of the hotel is typical of most beaches in the area,,,swimming directly in front is tricky ( short coral abundant there) but a very short walk will take you directly to ocean access. The swimming pools at the hotel are from a dream, endless, warm, swim up bars abundant and very unpopulated in front of the rooms, which was perfect for nite time quite swims. The main pool by the beach is a little more popular with great music, bar very handy and staff that will address every whim. Now if you think this hotel might be too far to playa del carmen to suit your needs ( we did rent a car) we found the hotel so perfectly catered our needs that we only went to town a couple of nites...you can take a quick taxi for cheap and not worry about driving. The value for the money at this resort is guanteed, simply they are rated five star, in my travel journal they rate 7. It is a must stay if playa del carmen in your plans!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, FANTASTIC, GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: colleencampbell
Reviews.Content: We travelled for our Son's wedding Jan 31-Feb 7/11. The wedding planner was absolutely perfect!!! She certainly made our Son's and Daughter-in-laws wedding day well above day perfect. The restaurants were fabulous service everywhere from the front desk to restaurants, pool bars, & bars, room service & maid service. The food was inpeccable!!!! The pools were beautiful and bartenders great. The rooms were breathtaking. Our friends & family that joined us for the celebration all had great comments and would go back in a flash. Betty one of the condo owners was so sweet and nice to our family-she loved us and she is a great person-so if you go and she is there look her up.

Reviews.Title: “I wished for a positive review, but reality prevailed”
Reviews.Author: latinrusso
Reviews.Content: This is 6th night... it's 2pm and our room is just started getting cleaned... it has dirty dishes, etc., etc., etc. Here is what I wrote on the very first day (please see below), didn't post it hoping for things to get better, but unfortunately they didn't. One more comment: food is really NOT good, not bad but not good at all... To the point of us, being on the all inclusive plan... we still opted to go to the Playa Del Carmen for two nights out of 7 just to get some variety. We leave this place tremendously unsatisfied. More sights to post :). Sadly this is our first night… 6 more to go. Arrived here with a two year old, being given a crib that’s big enough for a 10 month old max, after having to ask about 6 times, no kidding… and being told “we are checking” no bigger crib provided. Child couldn’t sleep all night, had to put her in bed with us. I am writing this on the next day at 2pm, and after having spoken with a concierge, now I am being told that they are waiting someone to check out. This is after again being told that “they are checking” but pressing with the issue. With or without our daughter in bed we couldn’t sleep either, as the smoke alarm right above our bed, was emitting strobes similar to the disco light. Let the “concierge” Geovanni know about it in the morning, still nothing done. This hotel is proving to be a huge disappointment, will post more as days progress, but so far my only recommendation is to stay away. Just to underscore – we really wanted to like this place, and have stayed up and down the Riviera Maya – Ceiba Del Mar, Paraiso de La Bonita, Banyan Tree, Maroma Resort (no kids but still nice), and Gran Velas. None of these are infrastructure issues – just poor service – at the place where it should be top notch, the reception/concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: vaucluse
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting this area for 15 years and have stayed at many many resorts.The Azul Fives is something special with a few exceptions. We had a week by ourselves and then our daughter, husband and two children 11months and 4years joined us. FAMILIES Great for families -when they checked in there was a stroller outside their door a bottle warmer on the counter, the crib already set up, and one can order cartons of milk to be placed in the fridge. The children loved the pools which were quite shallow. ACCOMMODATION Large clean new 1 bedroom suite with 2 balconies and two bathrooms on 2nd floor. RESTAURANTS We are not foodies but the food was pretty good especially breakfast at Flavours. The Spanish wine both merlot and chardonnay were excellant as was the cuppucinos and Kahlua after dinner. Enjoyed eating outside at Sea Olives in the evenings and Tsuki - great tempura. They charge $95 per person at Senses for a six course dinner - never saw anyone in there. STAFFare so wonderful especially PASQUAL AND MAYO IN SEA OLIVES, EVELYN at the Front Desk, both EDUARDOS at the entrance, VIRGINIA our maid and the smiling hostesses in the restaurants. They really want you to have a great holiday and cant do enough for you. With the exception of .........(wont say his name) the front desk supervisor who did not want to give us late checkout (only 2hours) I said we will be vacating the room at 2.30pm and that is it what we did. Also the towel boys on the beach who said we could use the flat swinging beds but if they had been reserved we would have to move. I never read or heard about reserving these. BEACH So we had to walk 7 minutes up the beach to swim - the exercise was good as was the sun and warm sand. We are beach people and swim about every hour - so did a lot of walking. Gazed out at the beautiful blue green water in front of the hotel just beyond the rocks. It is illegal to remove the rocks (reef). However GOOD NEWS There are plans to build a wharf over the rocks with concrete steps down to the water - wonderful hope they receive 100% approval. All in all a beautiful resort. It takes a good manager to make a good resort - he is so unobtrusive - saw him checking the food in the buffet one morning. SPA Our daughter had a deep tissue massage and a free facial. She said it was very good and the Spa was beautiful. Thankyou all for a wonderful wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding & Honeymoon here - Pefect, relaxing, beautiful, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jamieirving
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at Azul Fives in February 2011. We were a group of approx. 30 people. Its extremely fair to say that everyone in our group, including us, absolutely ADORED this resort. Pools & Pool Bars - There were 3 pools here; two that were winding throughout the villas and one that was an infinity pool facing the carribean sea. They were always clean and rarely busy! We've seen alot of people complain that they were cold, and yes, they were cool but it was nice and refreshing when you are sitting in such heat. Pool bars were awesome too. The bartenders were so fun and had so many fun suggestions for drinks, shots, etc. Restaurants - There were 4 restaraunts: - Tsuki - amazing sushi - Sea Olive - loved it here, wide variety of food on menu - Flavours - buffet & menu available, breakfast was only available here (very yummy) - Senses - this restaurant isnt included in all inclusive packages. Here you have your meal in a cabana surrounded by water and candelit. This was our FAVOURITE meal on the whole trip, the food was unreal. Rooms - we were in the one bedroom suite with a king size bed, livingroom, kitchen, dinig area etc. The room was awesome. We only used the kitchen (fridge) to put our wedding cake in but it was nice to have the kitchen island to sit at and eat, etc. The deluxe suites are alot great smaller but really nice too. Room Service - The room service menu was great, and once you know what food you can order at some of the restaurants around the pool, you can order that via room service too. The food was fast and fresh. They always called a few hours later too asking how to food and service was which was really nice too! Wedding - Our wedding couldnt have been more perfect. We chose to get married at the Zky bar terrace (up on the 2nd floor, over looking the sea). We found this option to be alot more private and quiet. We loved our wedding coordinator (Estefania) as she was so very helpful throughout the entire process. We 100% recommend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation, whether it be with a group or just with your partner. The following staff members at this resort made our wedding & honeymoon the best experience of our lives: - Alex (golf cart driver) - Sol (hostess at Flavours) - Ivanhoe (Bartender) - Brenda (she was our attendant for the wedding day) - Estefania (wedding coordinator) - Alex (Animation team) - Hilario (Animation team) - Gama (Animation team) - Paulo (Sous Chef) - Maya (Server) - Pamela (Hostess at Tsuki) Please feel free to msg us with more questions regarding the resort & our entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT, FANTASTIC FOOD AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: SSpivey-80
Reviews.Content: We were at the Azul Fives the last week of January with a large group for a wedding. The resort was only about 20 minutes from the airport, which was nice after a long day of travelling. When we arrived at the resort they had us checked in quickly and offered us refreshing champaign and wet towels. Our luggage was brought to our rooms immediately and we were shown where everything was located on the grounds and how to use everything in our room (,air, TV, phone , safe). Check in couldn't have been any better. We had a great central location in Villa #14. We were on the ground floor which was nice cause our patio was only steps from the pool. The only complaint about our room is that the beds were too HARD!!! There was a bit of a walk from the villas to the beach, but it was kind of a nice stroll, after a great meal! It just sucked when you needed something from your room, but no big deal! ...I just sent my husband! LOL! The grounds and pools were kept very clean. There were a few areas between buildings and such that got a bit wet and muddy from water run offs, but it was really not a big deal! The pools were on the cool side, but again not a big deal, when it's hot outside it is a welcomed refresher. All of the restaurants were great, the food was AMAZING! Everything that we ate was excellent, and there was a nice variety. The hotel also offered 24 hour room service, which was great for late night snacks or for having breakfast on our poolside patio. The Sea Olive was our favourite place to eat...The Risotto, Greek Salad and Pork Tenterloin were always big hits! My Husband hasn't stopped talking about the Tomato Rissoto! The house wine, both red and white were great! Not to mention all the great cocktails and shooters (mmmm....lemon drops!) we had all week! Although the beach was not the best I've seen, the staff at the beach hut were fantastic and there was always lots to do! My husband actually got PADI certified through the hotel it cost $400 and included 4 dives. They were very accomodating to do the training when HE was able, which was nice because we did have lots of other things planned. He is very happy that he did it there! Although some people in our group complained that they had money stolen from their safe.....we had NO PROBLEM...we left valuables around our room and on our patio and never had anything go missing. As for CASH we NEVER keep much cash on us on vacation...we bring a couple hundred $$ for tips and small souveneers ect. and use our credit card for everything else! There are bank machines in town that give american cash, the service charge is about $7.00.CND Playa Del Carmen was great to see....but pretty expensive, as far as drinks and food goes! It was only a $13 cab ride, and took about 10 minutes. We did go to Coco Bongos one night...Wow! What a great show! Highly reccomend it to any adults, except the show doesn't start till 11p.m. and goes till 3:30 a.m. ...We lasted till about 1:30, but it really was entertaining! We went on several group excursions planned through the resort. I feel that they were a bit over priced, but were easy to book and never had any problems! We had left our 3 year old at home for this trip, but he would have LOVED the kids club!! There seemed to be lots of families at the resort, but never saw too many people take advantage of this club....not sure why, it was clean, staff were friendly, and it had EVERYTHING that kids LOVE! Most of the group that we were with were couples or families, however there were a couple young single guys with us, and I think that they were hoping for a little more "action" around the resort...it is not a great place for singles or people that are looking for a PARTY!~ Having said that, they simply took a $13 cab ride into town for a little extra excitement. The nightly entertainment was not the best I've seen, but entertaining none the less! We watched the show every night, but it didn't start till 9:30 or so, which I was surprised with all the families that they didn't do an earlier "Family Friendly" show, like many of the resorts I've been to. Also the shows were is the Sky bar, which doesn't have the best layout for live shows, but they did pretty good considering! The resort never seemed busy...There were always chairs available by the pools and beach, never a reservation needed for meals and rarely a lineup at the bar! It was a nice and relaxing atmosphere! All In all a GREAT RESORT! I don't like to go to the same place twice, but this is definately one I would consider! I would be happy to answer any questions that anyone might have! Happy Hoildays!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kclady66
Reviews.Content: Just returned home last night and wish I was back. We booked a Funforless Azul on Funjet, so we did not know where we would be staying until five days before we left. We have been to the Azul Beach and also ElDorado Seaside so we were not worried. We had a Deluxe room. It was spacious on the first floor and right across from the pool that went through the property. We were in between Lizards and Paloma bars where we could also get a quick snack. The front desk gave us a connector cord for internet in the room and there was wifi service at all the bars. There was no charge for this which was great. The service at this resort was outstanding. Everyone greeted you whenever they saw you. The front desk was great, (Abraham at the desk and Edouardo) the staff in the restaurants were attentive and very friendly (Bernice and Oseph in Sea Olives). We had a slight problem with the toilet in our room not shutting off and maintenance was there within five minutes of our reporting it. Maid service was wonderful. We left change on the dresser one day and it was all there when we returned and we felt comfortable with putting our belongings in the safe. The resort was always clean including the beach. Beach butlers were attentive and continually were straitening up the beds and asking what they could do for you. We only had one time when we could not find a beach bed, but we did find lounges under the shade so it was not a problem. The way this resort was set up you had to walk a ways for the Ala Carte restaurants, but that was probably a good thing as I usually ate to much because the food was great. The food was so good. We particularily liked Sea Olives. Loved the fact that we did not need reservations and could eat in the Ala Carte as many times as we wanted to. So sad to leave, can't wait to go back. For two people the taxi was $10.00 US to get to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star resort - made my daughter cry upon leaving”
Reviews.Author: NDArkie
Reviews.Content: We had a three-night/four day stay at Azul Fives for my wife's 50 birthday with my 16 year old son and 8 year old daughter. We all loved the resort. My wife doesn't like huge resorts and we wanted to be pampered. We found that in Azul Fives. The resort is secluded but close to town and about a 30 minute ride from the Cancun airport. When we saw some of the mega-resorts on our ride from the airport, I was excited to see Azul Fives is much smaller and more initimate and peaceful. We just wanted to relax, swim, lay in the sun, and make my wife happy. We accomplished all that. We were greated with champagne and smiling faces at check-in and immediately love the clean, modern, contemporary design. I'm an architect, and I loved the quality of the design and construction. Check-in was fast and easy and Abraham was very helpful throughout our stay. My daughter was excited to get a cold chocolate milk. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite in Villa 9 with a king size bed in the bedroom with a pull-out sofa in the living room. The suite included a nice kitchen, dining area, living area, whirlpool tub, glass-enclosed rain shower, private toilet room, and double sink. The furniture, appliances, and furnishings were clean and worked fine. The suite has a powder room off the entry/kitchen and that's a nice feature with a group of four. We were on the ground floor and had windows on two sides and a patio with lounge chairs. The room was quiet and we slept very well each night. There is one flat-screen TV in the living area with a collection of Spanish and English channels. There is also a DVD player. We brought DVD's but never played them because we were constantly out of our room swimming, sunning, eating, and drinking. We were not online much during our stay because we were trying to relax, but the pool bars had wifi and we could connect to it with our iPhones and laptops when we wanted. The maid did an excellent job (Guadalupe) and our room was clean and fully stocked each day. One of two "winding river" pools and pool bar/grille (the Lizard) was about 25 feet from our patio. There are two winding river pools that weave through the resort with three swim-up bars, and two grilles that open from 10-6. The rivers are 4 feet deep and have shallow sunbathing and swimming areas with lounge chairs in the water and sunbathing areas around the edges. My son and daughter loved swimming the length of each pool and getting drinks from the friendly staff. Domingo and Marcelano at the Palmas Bar were extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone is very friendly at the resort and call you by name if you take the time to say hello. They're not pushy, but are there to help with anything you want. We would typically spend the mornings at the winding river pools and then move to the Infiniti Pool and Beach mid-day and in the afternoons. The pools are not heated, but that didn't seem to be a problem with 80F weather. The Gulf of Mexico was warm. The Infiniti Pool has plenty of seating, is located next to the Sea Olive & Tsuki restaurants. There is a large swim up bar that serves the pool and beach area. You can get your own drinks at the bar or a waiter will get them for you at the beach or pool. The selection of drinks were excellent for both adults and children. The beach has nice sand and has a wonderful small coral reef along the shore. I saw a review where someone described this as rocks, but coral in Riviera Maya is excellent and a lot of fun. There is a beach activities hut where they're loan you kayaks, snorkeling gear, etc. There are activities scheduled about every hour for kids and adults. We went on a snorkeling tour the first day (right in front of the hotel) and then went snorkeling each day once or twice. Just off shore you'll find clown fish (Nemo), sea urchins, etc. We loved it so much my son and I took a one-day scuba lesson and dive to a reef off of Playa del Carmen arranged by the hotel staff. I would highly recommend that. Gama works the beach hut and is very nice and helpful. Victor was our dive instructor and was excellent for newbies. Alfonzo is the beach concierge and is very nice and helpful. On the beach are lots of lounge chairs and about a dozen "beds" with pillows that swing gently on four ropes. We used one most days. There was never an issue with reserving or find a chair and no reservations are required at any restaurants. It's just not too crowded of a place. We saw crowded when we went to town. Wow! It made us really happen to be at Azul Fives. We ate in each restaurant and at each winding river pool bar/grilles. Flavours is the largest and is located near the lobby, hotel store, and spa. They served a different menu each night and had an excellent breakfast each day. You can order for the menu or go to an excellent buffet. My wife and I enjoyed the food and drinks and our children were happy with the food (which is saying something). They also setup tables and grille food on the lawn between the beach and the hotel each day. On our first day, they setup a Tequila tasting table. We also had room service a couple days for breakfast and the food was delicious and arrived quickly. I used the free exercise gym each day and thought it was fine. It was never crowded. The equipment was all new and mostly LifeFitness. My wife and daughter spent an afternoon at the spa getting massages and manicures/pedicures and loved it. My wife thought it compared well with any spa in the US. Very clean, nice staff, and a beautiful design. We went to downtown Playa del Carmen (5th Avenue) one night. It cost $15US each way and took about 15 minutes. The town is full of tourists and has a collection of Mexican gift stores and chain stores. There are plenty of restaurants, but not that many Mexican food restaurants (at least not on 5th Ave - odd). We ultimately found a nice place to eat Mexican food outside and bought some gifts. There is a nice kids club/separate building (Azulitos). We went there one night to get my daughter's face painted and it looked very clean and nice. The children were watched over and cared by three young nannies that my son thought must be the nicest young women on the planet. The were very friendly and the children seemed totally at ease and enjoyed being there. They have small pool, playground, gym, and other play rooms filled with toys. Kids were watching movies together, playing Wii, playing XBox or just playing with toys. A young couple we met said their two young children didn't want to leave Azulitos each day. Nearby, there is a tennis court (ran out of time to play), ping-pong, shuffle board, and a large chess board. We played ping-pong and chess on a warm evening. It was interesting to note the mix of people at the resort - couples (we saw one beach wedding), families with all ages of children (like us), young couples with babies, extended families, pairs of couples, etc. They only thing we didn't see were large or rowdy groups. I figure they must go for the larger AI resorts with more of a party/spring break atmosphere. We had a drink on the second floor outside patio at the Zky Bar, but we didn't see any of the nightly shows. The family we dove with went each night and said it was great. We were out of energy from our days in the water and sun so we opted for our beds instead. The bar looked nice and it was a great place to grab a drink under the stars. There is a small stage for shows and a large dance floor. You can drink at the bar, at small tables, or on small sofas and chairs in informal seating groups. In the end, I would highly recommend this resort. I was hoping it was as good as the good reviews noted and it was. I'm not sure where the negative reviews stayed. It didn't seem like this resort. My children loved it so much that when the van arrived to take us to the airport, my daughter started crying. That's a pretty good endorsement by her and we all agree with her. Five stars! We look forward to staying here again or trying another Karisma resort.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: leonaruto
Reviews.Content: I love the service there and the the food was excelent, my favorite restaurant was the Tsuki. My kids loved the kids club it was great, they had good activitys for them and they also have a babysitting service, that realy came in handy . The best thing is that its only 10 min away from playa del carmen and down town. I am definetely coming back to azul fives on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable - Beautiful Resort, Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: JulesfromGlenEllyn
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 friends were there last week for a girls' trip. We found the resort almost too good to leave, so we didn't! The staff is very friendly and anticipates your every need. Every restaurant was outstanding in its own way. The infinity edge pool looks out past the sugar sand beach to the Caribbean Sea - tranquil heaven! The rooms are large and beds very comfortable. Extremely clean grounds and facilities. We would recommend this as a great place for a girls' trip, couples' retreat or a family vacation. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and relaxing week !”
Reviews.Author: Abeja_2011
Reviews.Content: Great : room,beach beds, room service, food, pools, drinks, staff, 10 minutes from playa del Carmen This resort is stunning and the room was huge (we were three girls sharing a suite) No need to reserve spots at restaurants and no limits of visits. The tennis court was always free so we were able to play without reservations. I mostly recommend this resort for families as the kids will find everything to keep them happy while parents relax. As for single people like us, we were only 10 minutes from Playa del Carmen so great nightlife ! I will definitely go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but it's NOT where Expedia Advertises it. Too far to walk to town.”
Reviews.Author: FunnyJuggler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property for anyone who wants a vacation where you can lay on the beach in a lounger and sip drinks in style while looking at the ocean. You'll love it! Be warned though that the hotel in not "in' Playa Del Carmen, as advertised, but a 10 - 15 minute drive from town. Longer if you hit rush hour. I had counted on walking to the many restaurants available on 5th ave in Playa. Due to the location, this isn't possible. If you don't have a rental car, count on a 15 - 20 dollar taxi ride, each way, to get to town. I only tried two of the 5 or 6 restaurants, but the meals were so over priced that I couldn't enjoy them. Paying about $60 bucks for a buffet that would be a great meal if it was $20, makes it hard to walk away satisfied. Fortunately, the waiter was kind, and only charged us for 3, meals instead of the 5 of us, or it would have been much worse. This wouldn't be an issue I had opted for the all inclusive plan. While the property is ocean front, the rooms are not. There is a nice view of the pools, but the ocean is 500 meters through the jungle away from the closest room. The beach is not the soft sand that Playa Del Carmen is known for. You must be in town for this. At The Azul Fives, it's coarser, with lots of rocks and shell fragments. It is still better than Mexican west coast sand though. The water is too rocky to be considered safe for swimming right in front of the hotel. You'll have to walk 5-10 minutes up the beach if you want to swim. The programming staff did a great job of keeping people involved, with beach volleyball, soccer, and night shows. They were the high lite of the resort. The housekeeping staff did a pretty good, but not great job. Asking for anything above and beyond the usual was a challenge. Asked for extra towels, got extra blankets instead. After two weeks the TV still hadn't been fixed. We had a two bedroom with full kitchen, advertised to sleep 6. Great for 4, but the other two had to sleep on a terrible pull out couch. We asked for a cot instead, but that was something the hotel wasn't able to accommodate. the room was "surface Clean', but after a few weeks there you really noticed the areas that were missed. If this resort could be picked up, and moved to a location right in Playa del Carmen, I would be happy to return, but for me, the distance from town is too great to make for a good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding at an Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: G22
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 40 people for my wedding in Jan.2011 Everyone had a fantastic time and we were all very impressived with the service, food,wine selection,suites, staff and wedding coordinator...They made our wedding day perfect by taking care of ALL the details specifically the way we wanted!They were very professional and we were all treated like kings and queens. They were very accomadating and it was never a problem for us to have supper all together, got lots of drinks served to us on the beach and the pool, everyone had a wonderful time! Snorkling is great but you can't swim directly in front of the resort, yes the pools were chilly but they had had a very cold front come in the week before we were there, the hotel seemed empty so we never had a problem to find a place on the beach, no line ups anywhere,beautiful and clean pools,the disco is great if you are a big group because there is nobady there! Ican go on and on about how fantastic this place is and would without a doubt go back! I don't understand the negative reviews...those people should probably stay home!

Reviews.Title: “If it were as good as it looks...”
Reviews.Author: JJJ18
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very nice (it's new, so it should look nice)... but it was substantively lacking. Biggest drawbacks: - I can sleep just about anywhere, but the beds (and couch) were SO UNCONFORTABLE. There was no give in the mattress at all - crazy! It was like sleeping on the floor. We were at AF for a week, and neither or us slept well that entire time. Disappointing since the reason for the vacation was to catch up on much needed rest. The couch - which looked fancy - was equally as uncomfortable. It felt like it was ejecting me when I sat down. - No hot tub. I guess there's oneside at the VERY overpriced spa (an hour massage was over $200) if you are doing a spa day, but not for soaking at the end of the day. The pool water is also unheated. So, we were there when it was about 80 all week, and didn't get in the water until the last hour of the trip when I made myself get into the pool. Soooo disappointing. (BTW, it wasn't just us, nobody - not even the little kiddos staying at the hotel - went in the pools.) The pools looked amazing, but were just too cold to use. The ocean was warmer. - The food was just okay. Nothing we ate there was good at the hotel, either - nothing bad, but wouldn't recommend the all inclusive. The drinks are also really weak (and I'm a light weight). We ended up eating over half of our meals in town, and I was still really tired of the food at Azul Fives. (Side note: we ate at Seasons in PDC and it was fantastic!) - Far from town. It is a $10-11 cab ride each way to town. This adds over a week. There isn't really another way to get around because the hotel sits over a mile off of the main road. If you are ambitious and feel like trekking in the heat, then you can walk the mile to the main road and catch the collectivo to either PDC or Cancun. - There's nothing to do after 5:00. Everything is dead. We got bored and tried the entertainment in the main bar. Some acts were good others were just weird. They tried, though. - And, you can hear through the walls, so if you are a light sleeper, you may not want to be near anyone. The good stuff: - Everything looked very nice. Everything was clean. It seemed very safe. The staff tried hard to please, even if they weren't the most adept at doing the job. - The rooms were really big. Although somewhat unusable because the furniture was so uncomfortable. - Rates were really reasonable. - The beach is right next to the pool, so you can choose to sit in the sand or by pool. Plus, there's shade on beach for when you need a break from the sun. (Note on the beach: It's pretty nice for walking around, but you have to walk a little ways to get to small swimming areas). - We don't have kids, but the kids center (which had staff to watch the kids), looked really fun - had its own pool and looked like gymnastics place. Overall, we didn't have a bad stay here, but would not recommend it or go back beause: 1) the beds, 2) the food, and 3) the distance to town and lack of things to do at the hotel after the pool-time ends.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: swardrop
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the great reviews on the hotel I am very confused. I was there as part of a family reunion of 19 people and none of us were happy with the hotel. The best part was that it was quiet and you could always get seating at the pools or the beach. However, the food was not good, particularly at the buffet and it was very inconsistent. An example would be the chocolate lava cake at the Sea Olive restaurant. One day it came at room temperature, the next day it came with no chocolate in the center and the next day it came literally still frozen so hard that you could knock it against the table. And it was the same thing with everything we ordered. It began to be our little game each night to see what new way the meal would be different. Iceberg lettuce instead of romaine in a ceasar salad, tenderloin steak when striploin was ordered, fajita's with spicy sauce, fajita's with no spicy sauce. Seriously, every time we went the meals were presented differently, and I'm even talking about the same dish, the same night for two different people at the same table. For a resort that bills itself as a "Gourmet Inclusive" the food was not good. Also because we had 8 rooms booked we knew how the service was different between the rooms. Some would get their mini fridges refilled, while others had to call three and four times to get it done. Some got turn down service with chocolates and fruit baskets and towel animals and others got nothing. I know what you are thinking, they probably didn't tip. Wrong, in a one week stay we tipped over $300 for just my husband daugher and I, and I know the others were tipping well also. As for the rooms, they looked good on the surface as they were large and do look like the photos on the website, however they weren't very clean. I wrote the date in the dust on the shelves above the bed. The room smelled like sewage, (six of the seven rooms had that problem). We never had towels or soap in the half bath off of the kitchen until the last day, we didn't get a bath mat until the last day, and everthing needed a really good wipe down. Three of the rooms had flooding from the toilet tank (no sewage, just water), but if we hadn't been in our room when it happened and quickly turned off the water, it would have flooded. Speaking of flooding, the last two days that we were there, water was flowing under the doors into the outdoor hallway area and down to the ground from the third floor of villas 10 and 11. One of the things that really bothered us was that we were told that this hotel was great for family reunions and would cater to large groups. Not true, they wouldn't even give us one night where they would put tables together so that we could have a family dinner. And they could have, because they did it for a wedding while we were there. Their website says that they do bonfires at the beach, which they did not. They were supposed to have butler service at the beach, but they don't. And whatever activities they have are not posted anywhere, so you really don't know what is available. There is no ATM on site and they couldn't make change at the front desk. In fact one day we asked for change so that we could continue to tip the staff and we were told that the staff was paid a wage and it wasn't necessary to tip them. The beach was nice if you just wanted to lay in the sun or play volley ball, but if you wanted to go in the water then you needed to walk down to another resort and use their beach, as the area in front of Azul Fives had too much coral. The one shining spot for us was the swim up bar on the pool side of villa 11. The food there was good and the service could not have been better. The only down side is that it closed by 6. Basically, because it was billed as a five star "Gourmet Inclusive" we had certain expectations. If we had paid less and been told to expect a three star, with so so food and service, we would have been happy. I had a nice vacation because I was there with great people and the weather was wonderful, which made up for the shortcomings of the resort, but I am still confused as to how other people are writing such different reviews based on their experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: americlad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take my two daughters who are 21 and 23 along with two of their friends to a Playa Destination. We could not have picked a finer place to stay at! When we arrived, we received a very warm welcome and were taken care of immediately. The resort was a smaller, boutique style resort which we enjoyed because we were trying to get away from the busy resorts where it is often difficult to relax. It was amazing, according to the check in folks, they were booked 96% and we were amazed because the resort did not seem crowded in the least. The restaurants were fabulous, our favorite because Tsuki which was an asian restaurant to include a nice selection of fresh sushi. The entertainment in the night club was very enjoyable as well and well done. The grounds were impeccable and landscaped beautifully and the staff was nothing but accomodating to every need we may have had. We highly recommend this for anyone looking for what i might consider the best spot in that area and we have stayed at several of them in the playa del carmen area. Oh! lastly, the spa had one of the best massage sessions that i have ever had in my life! An experience that you have to participate in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Great time and Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: arcticgone
Reviews.Content: Azul Fives was fantastic! Sevice was great, food amazing and the just perfect. We attended a Wedding and everything looked incredible! Anybody going, needs to talk to Halirio on the beach. He is awesome and hooks you up with Volleyball, Bocci ball, and other activities......

Reviews.Title: “Arrived stressed....left so very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: weddingholiday
Reviews.Content: Wow, open for just a month and just fantastic! We spent Christmas and new Years at azul fives with my parents in their 60s, teenage kids and young children. Everyone of us loved it for many different reasons. The food would be my first comment. It was absolutely fantastic! From breakfast to dinner the food was gourmet all the way. The "buffet" area which is really way more gourmet and fresh to be called a buffet was fantastic. they kind of display small quantities of food for you to select and then they top it up fresh all the time so no stale yesterdays sausages here. They even had a pizza oven, cooked fresh meats and fish at all meals and for those needing a hangover cure there was even Absolute Vodka at breakfast for your Bloody Mary. Lunch was either at one of the pool side restaurants which stretches all the way through this stunning resort, at the garden barbecue where they cooked fresh paella daily which was amazing, or at my favorite restaurant Sea Olive. The menu is great but if you don't find something you like then you only have to ask. At this resort you can choose all inclusive or not- EP which means that those on EP are paying for their food and so it is so important that the quality is absolutely top notch or people would not eat there...and I am really fussy! If I had to make one comment I would like to see just one more restaurant I think. There are two more restaurants, also amazing, Tsuki which is Asian and Senses which is a fine dining experience. All great, nothing negative to say at all! The kids....well as my son Oscar has his own website where he reviews kids resorts I think we should know when a kids club is really great or not. A kids club can look great but if the staff is not interactive with the kids then they don't want to go. Plus as a parent I don't want them to sit and play video games all day too. This one, in Oscars opinion is the best! It is great for all ages although I feel it would be even better if there was a teens zone. go to Oscars site around the world with Oscar and you will see his latest video and reviews of the kids clubs. The rooms and suites are superb. We had a one bedroom suite which had a full kitchen, dining area and pull out sofabed. More than enough space for our family. Then my parents had a deluxe room with their own balcony and bathroom right beside us. Service is exemplary. If I had staff working for me for just one month and are that good I would be delighted. I loved the infinity pool right on the beach and when I ran out of sunscreen they had it there for me to save me going to the store. I could go on and on but honestly this place is fabulous. A newborn with attitude! I will 100% be back and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Living up to Karisma standards”
Reviews.Author: mellychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled to many of the Karisma resorts (Sensatori, Seaside Suites, El Doraldo Castitas, Azul Beach and Maroma) alone and with our children. We feel Azul Fives continues the impecable standards set at these other resorts. I agree with all the positive reviews written before ours. Because it was brand new, we were curious and a little nervous to visit as there were few reviews. We had no need to worry. Great service, spotless grounds and rooms, and intimate/safe surroundings. The food is definately family friendly, maybe not as "gourmet" at the other restaurants we have experienced at their other resorts. We like a small, intimate, quiet resort but also need privacy from our children at night (hence the one/two bedroom suites) good food, good nightly entertainment and we like being close to Playa. ($12 cab ride) The Fives provided us with all of this. The only thing that was very different was seeing people entertaining in their suites, cooking dinner and bringing their lunch/coolers to the beach. This is because there is an option for all inclusive or european plan. We opted for AI but agreed that with a bigger family, when incorporating extended family gathering for vacation, or families with allergies the EP would be perfect!! We would bring our children back to this resort before any of their other "family" resorts and are planning a family reunion with extended family as well. Thanks to Azul Fives and the Karisma company. Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way!!”
Reviews.Author: cdnsenorita
Reviews.Content: Where does one begin when describing a resort as amazing as the Fives?! We were recent visitors to the resort, spending 2 weeks over Christmas in complete and total relaxation and comfort. From the moment we were greeted at the doors (cold champagne, scented towels, amazing customer service), we felt pampered and catered to. The entire staff, including security personnel and the "towel butler", bent over backwards to ensure we were well taken care of. This is a staff who totally believes in customer service and to say were were impressed is an understatement! The resort itself is beautiful! The grounds are well-maintained and very serene. The pools are spectacular and plentiful - there is no need to get up at 6am to secure a lounger poolside- there are plenty to go around. The restaurants are stunning, serving exquisite food - likely the best all-inclusive around. The spa is the best I have been to, bar none. The gym, although on the small side, is well-equipped with top of the line equipment, and it is spotlessly clean. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Daily maid-service ensured that towels were refreshed and beds were changed. Small plumbing issues were immediately addressed and rectified by a highly professional maintenance team. Anything we needed was a phone call away and the response was immediate. I would highly recommend the Azul Fives for anyone looking for a destination in the Riviera Maya. We plan to return for 2 weeks at spring break and really look forward to reconnecting with staff and friends! I would like to acknowledge the following staff members at the Fives who went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our stay was a memorable one: Lester, Hilario, Juan, Christian, Jacob,and Annie - thanks to all of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, great service and perfect for families with young kids”
Reviews.Author: Travelfarnwide8
Reviews.Content: Being a mom and traveling to Cancun with a 2 year old, I had my doubts and uncertainties. But the moment we stepped into Azul Fives my worries disappeared. The front desk staff greeted us with warm hand towels,champagne, bottled water and a new toy for my little girl and quickly took our luggage off our hands and into our room. The restaurants had good quality food and was able to cater to young kids taste. The selection was amazing too, very fresh, good variety and tasty.... living in Vancouver we have so much to choose from so we could compare. Even the sushi / pacific cuisine and combination with the food were fantastic. They do spend time working on their culinary skills, as the second night the head chef came welcomed us and asked us for feedback with the goal of improving their food. That was splendid. Every were we went as a family, the staff were very courteous and helpful, they would set up high chairs or provide toys or lend a helping hand to parents. The Kids Club was a a favorite, great toys, good activities and friendly staff who had patience with kids. The beach was a bit small in comparison to other resorts, but it was relaxing, clean and not pretensious, our family of three had a relaxing time be it just lying on the cabana, playing in the sand or in the water. We would go back to Azul Five with out a doubt and recommend it highly to family with young kids. The staff there (from the hostess, to the maitre de, to the room service --and the pool staff -- all were excelenta)

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: misssval
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the resort. It is small and everything is easy to get too. The have a fantastic facility for children and the hotel looks great. We were used to huge resort so it took some time to get use to the small scale. The is only three restaurants but you don't have to make reservation anywhere. The have nice high chair and toys for kids to play. The staff was quite accommodating with all my request; my daughter is very picky eater! The beach chair and the pool are nice. Can't go swimming right in front of the resort but it is just a 2 min walk to fins a rock free entry point. The bedroom are sell as double queen but they more look like double bed. Also the bed were quite hard. Over all we love it. The people, food were great and so were the drinks!

Reviews.Title: “You will not top this true story...”
Reviews.Author: PuraVida222051
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. It is brand new and the photos are accurate. All of the people that we encountered were nice and though little English is spoken they do try. HOWEVER, we had a 2 bedroom 1,500 sq. foot suite. At 12:30 at night the locked door is opened and the porter proceeds to bring a woman and a young child into our room. (this is a true story) I jump out of bed and confront them and all of a sudden – no English. They make a motion that they are going into the adjoining room where my 3 kids are sleeping and I tell them “no” and point to get out -- which they do. I then call the front desk the manager is “unavailable” but will call me back right away. I wait 3 minutes and call again. This time he gets on and is aware of what just happened. He does not apologize just tells me that the system showed my room as available and that’s why no knock on the door, no “hello?” just right in – at 12:30 at night. I was irate I admit that. He tells me the Manager will contact me in the morning. 3 days pass the manager never contacted me. I check out – pay my bill in full and the lady says that I can send the manager a letter. Well, Trip Advisor has been a useful resource to me and so this is my letter. Caveat Emptor for the Trip Advisor readers. As for the Hotel Manager – you kind of suck.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: KeepMeTravelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place over the Thanksgiving break and absolutely loved it. We have zero tolerance for kitschy decor and the place delivered with understated but luxurious indoor and outdoor spaces. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and the kids (5 and 1) had ample room to run around. They loved the in room jacuzzi which did have warm water. The pools were right next to the rooms so changes and bathroom breaks were incredibly convenient. Building 5 is well situated - close to the kids club and beach. We were first in a building closer to the entrance and after the first day decided we'd like to be closer to the beach on the second floor and the staff very willingly relocated us. Azulitos, the free kids club was heaven sent. Our older one would look forward to it every morning. They had free tennis lessons, salsa classes, gym time, swim time and lots of other activities. The staff were very kind and the club was open from 9am to 9pm. The best part is that you could pay the staff extra to baby sit kids in your room (my 1 year old could not be left in Azulitos) if you want a quiet dinner in a restaurant with the spouse. If you decided you had enough of the restaurant scene you could order in and have a nice meal in your own dining room. The beach was a short walk away and was very nice. Long morning walks were our favorite activity. The second was lounging on the swing beds that swayed gently in the ocean breeze. The wait staff at the beach kept everyone well stocked with free cocktails and busy with activities like beach volleyball, bocce ball, etc. While at the staff, it was very clear that they all had a lot of pride in working for the place. They were all very warm and attentive. My one spa visit was phenomenal. I would highly recommend getting a massage here. The buffet breakfast and dinner were good. I would rate lunches as very average. They were bland - perhaps to cater to the mix of international crowd. I expected more local flavors. We had some really good mexican food in Playa Del Carmen and can't say why the same experience could not be replicated in the resort. There was entertainment every night in the Skybar. We saw a Michael Jackson tribute show with some awesome dancers. Other entertainment was sitting in the pool and watching weddings on the beach - so much fun! Azul Fives really delivered for us and gave us a week of relaxation and rejuvenation. We have great memories from this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Beach no good!”
Reviews.Author: googletraveler
Reviews.Content: the azul's try to play as they are 5-star resorts...and they are not!! the hotel truly opened in november and i was expecting great things as the consigner giovanni assured me that the beach was excellent and the pools where magnificent... the beach is the worst I have ever been too. there is no access into the ocean as it is all coral!!!!! we had to walk 400 -500 yards in the sand to get to an area we could get into the water...but the pool side workers would say, "dont bother with the ocean stay in the pool" and the pool was nice but in december the water in the pool was 50 degrees f. it was so cold that when you got out your lips where blue!! they have 2 jacuzzi's in the main pool but have no heat!! there is no heat in any of the pools. accomodations: the rooms where big, and i got the penthouse with roof jacuzzi...again no heat in the jacuzzi, and it runs like a bath tub!! the rooms are not kid friendly with pointed ends, and the master bedroom has a step up to the bathroom. the service is mexico, always amazing as the workers work hard to accommodate and keep there jobs... if you want 5 star, great beach, and warm pools and hot tubes in the winter..stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for the same quality as El Dorado Maroma, you won't find it here.”
Reviews.Author: parrothead40509
Reviews.Content: My family of four with two daughters age 7 and 8 came in on Dec 22nd and we're leaving tomorrow morning (29th). The property (the rooms and pools) are very nice in appearance. We asked for a room with a good view, but apparently the only view is of the pools that meander through the middle of the villas. We were in the villa closest to the beach and our room overlooks what would be the ocean at any other "beachfront" property we've stayed at, but there are trees blocking the view of the ocean. I would estimate the beach is about a thousand feet from our villa, so there is basically no appreciable view of the ocean. Oh, and if you're looking for a nice beach, keep looking. The beach itself is rocky with crushed shells making up a good percentage of it. It isn't comfortable to walk on. It isn't like the beach at Playa del Carmen at all. The width of the property's beachfront area is pretty narrow; I'd estimate it to be about 250 feet. We kept running out of hot water on our first two days and contacted the concierge and maintenance was dispatched. The next morning they replaced the hot water heater to our room. After that, we smelled a kerosene odor every time we turned on the water. There was also a putrid odor emanating from the drains in the sinks, tub and shower. We finally plugged up all the drains and put a wet washcloth over the drain in the shower. That helped a little, but not completely. Again, the room is very nice to look at, but there was a light fixture over the dining table that was made up of dangly plastic pieces surrounding the lightbulb. Every time the A/C unit came on the fixture clanked together. Whoever decided that was a good idea should be forced to sleep in the room with it making noise all night. It appears the property must have sat for quite some time before the opening this past fall because the paint on the rails on the balcony is flecking off in multiple locations. The place was pretty dead, but the service was pretty lame. For the amount of people staying at the property we were expecting more. My wife and I stayed at El Dorado Maroma this past July to celebrate her 40th birthday and were so looking forward to this trip, but it has been quite disappointing. My recommendation to the owners is to bring the Maroma staff down here to train this group. Also, after having experienced the Gourmet Inclusive experience at Maroma, we were looking forward to a repeat of the culinary delights we had there. That would not be the case here. If they could duplicate the food offerings found at Maroma it would have made the experience a little better, but we found our best meals were in Playa del Carmen on Fifth Avenue. We'll go back to El Dorado Maroma, we won't be back to Azul Fives. Feliz Ano Neuvo!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing week away from it all”
Reviews.Author: dselmal
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent a week a the azul fives and had a great week. The resort is on the small side as far as the all inclusive for that area go- which was exactly what we were looking for. Even though there are about 200 rooms/units, and it was considered pretty full during our stay, we never had a problem getting a beach or pool chair, nor did we have wait for a table in one of the restaurants. In fact, at the start of our vacation 2 of the 3 swim up bars weren't even open. (the one near the infinity pool was always open, but the 2 located near the snack bars were not until closer to the weekend) The rooms were cleaned well each day and then towels refreshed/tidied up in the evening during turn down service. (one day our room was skipped for turn down, however). The kids club which says it is for up to 12 years old is really geared more towards the 9 and under set. . Also, the fridge in your room is replenished daily with some bottles of water, a few cans of beer and sprite and coke. We were told that we would also be given juice and some light snacks (pretzels, etc), but only received this once even though we did make several calls. Hot water also runs out fast so if you have more than 2 people staying in a room take fast showers or do it in shifts. Was not enough to fully fill the jacuzzi tub either. We enjoyed the restaurants and made our rounds. Room service was also fun for a late night snack of cheese or fruit and we called up for breakfast a few days as well (the buffet was loosing its luster for us after a few days so we thought we would take a break and then return). The staff were all very friendly and professional. They had activities going on at certain hours as well as a yoga or stretching class in the morining pool side. Sea kayaks as well as snorkel gear were always availalbe and we never had to wait for these. The pools, however, were very, very cold. It was a nice week with perfect weather.....hard to believe as I look out the window at all the snow coming down!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding - Amazing resort!!! -”
Reviews.Author: charleneanderson24
Reviews.Content: We were not originally scheduled to stay at Azul Fives, but due to an explosion at the Princess resort; we were relocated to Azul Fives by Karisma. . . BEST THING THAT EVER HAPPENED TO US. I want to thank all the staff and management at Azul Fives – you made our week and most important our Wedding the most memorable time of our life. We appreciate everything you have done for us during that week. We appreciate you being able to take us in such a short notice. We would like to congratulate you on a week of hard work – I have never seen people work so hard while being friendly and smiling all the time. Faith Wishnie (Karisme Hotels) you are absolutely amazing, thank you for pulling this off – so organized – you got this done!!!! I will keep you in my books for a long time. Estefania, Claudia & Arturo – (wedding coordinators) Valeria (Lomas Travel) Miguel & Alberto (food and beverages) - Estás personas maravillosas, No puedo gracias lo suficientemente. ;0) GRACIAS! Upon arrival, we were treated like royalty. They welcomed us with champagne and personalized check in. We had the option to choose between 3 aromatherapy scents and 3 room scents during our stay. Ok boys! I know you don’t care about this but this is good for the ladies!!!! Wedding Experience – BETTER THAN PERFECT! Flawless…. We arrived Thursday afternoon and Friday we met with Estefania, Claudia and Arturo to go through our wedding plans. They are the most fantastic people ever. We were greeted with champagne and or d’oeuvre. Yummy! We also sat down with Miguel (head chef) What a GEM! He took such good care of us, and he would do absolutely anything for us. We pick the deluxe grill menu. OH my gosh! It was so good - they grilled the meat fresh on the BBQ the night of the wedding! The food was sooooo good! We also met with Alberto (beverages director).What a sweet man. He made us special purple drink for our cocktail hour to match our wedding colors. He then met with us on our second last day and spent some time with us chatting about all kind of things. Truly wonderful man! Estefania, Claudia, Arturo (wedding coordinator) & Valeria (off-site wedding contact). I don’t have enough words to explain how great you guys were. From the moment we were switch resort to the day we left your resort – we were treated with so much respect and anything we needed you were there with a smile on. I remember one night having diner with my husband at the Tsuki restaurant and Arturo came to see us to chat and congratulate us – it made us smile, to be greeted like this. DJ – soooooooo cool !!!! The music was perfect, the lights were perfect and the balloons, the glow sticks and the bubble machine WOW. Thank you. SPA: The NEW spa is gorgeous, 2 stories with many different treatment rooms. The hair stylists are good and creative. I DEFINETLY RECOMMEND THE BEACH CEREMONY, COCKTAIL AT THE SKY BAR, BEACH DINER AND RECEPTION AND HIGHLY RECOMMEND HAVING THE DJ ON THE BEACH. WE HAD SO MUCH FUN! Service at this resort is top notch. The people were so friendly and helpful and would do anything to help you. We had four younger children in our group and the staff was so accommodating and friendly to them all the time. Pool – infinity pool was amazing, looking out to the ocean. You can’t ask for better than that! Pool staff were always there bringing you towels, setting up your chairs. They come around with cold scented towels, evian spritzer and gourmet “treats” like fruit/frozen fruit on a stick at the pool. Thank you Christian! We always had a good pick of chairs – although the resort was busy it never felt like we didn’t have room to sit. The bar staff coming up to serve you your drink on the beach or at the pool It was PERFECT! These boys work hard! The Rooms – it doesn’t matter your room type they are all gorgeous. They are all nicely located. Almost every room has a pool side and swim-up bar. Food/Drink Service: • Food was amazing – Luis our favourite server, WE LOVE HIM! • Breakfast at Flavours was amazing, the “food display” (they don’t use the word buffet) but it was awesome and they would make you anything you want • Ate lunch at Sea Olives (Mediterranean) for lunch and diner several times, sooooooooo GOOD Asian restaurant called Tsuki was amazing and would make whatever you wanted especially in terms of sushi. • Also have 2 “gourmet corners” (snack bars) the Lizards and the Palmas at 2 of the pool bars...had amazing guacamole, thin crust pizza & panini! The staff there is so fun!!!! And they work really hard - Entertainment (daytime/night time) Lester and Halario – were the funniest, most entertaining guys there! Excellente! Water aerobics, salsa, volleyball, Human darts, croquet etc. We ask for music they play music. Great guys! Zky Bar after diner is amazing, great ambiance, large plush outdoor “beds”. Great drinks & music and shows AZULITOS: There is a full kids club on site, with a kiddie pool and kiddie beach beds. They also offer the Fisher Price Toy Lending Program plus the My Gym trampolines and climbing equipment. They will also offer in room movies and popcorn service!! I wish I could go back to this resort right – it was clean, beautiful, fun, the weather was great. 5 star hotel!!!! Thank you from the bottom of our heart ;) Charlene and Max Belanger

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: Toptikka
Reviews.Content: Must take the 1 bedroom suite at the minimum. The Deluxe rooms are too small and only come with 2 double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding at the Azul Fives”
Reviews.Author: EscapeFr0mWinter
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I were scheduled to stay at the Grand Riviera Princess for our wedding and two weeks before we were set to leave, that awful explosion occurred. One week later the hotel was closed for the investigation. We didn't know if we would even have a wedding - but Air Canada Vacations came through for us and put us at the Azul Fives. I hadn't even heard of this hotel, but we were so thankful to be able to still go with our group for our wedding - we were a group of 27. I had only 5 days before we were set to leave and I have to say the wedding coordinators were so accessible and SO helpful that we were able to easily plan our dream wedding in record time. Erika, Faith, Valeria, Estefania and Arturo - we had a whole team working for us and I can't say enough good things about them. The resort itself is stunning - much smaller than the Riviera Princess and we loved the intimate nature of it. The pools - both the infinity pool and the winding river pool throughout the complex were stunning. The beach was gorgeous - the sand was pristine. I heard that a few feet into the water is a bit rocky, but if you wear water shoes you should be fine. I was all over the pools anyway! The staff were so helpful and so kind - I couldn't have found a grumpy person if I tried! The restaurants were good - Tsuki Restaurant was a favourite in our group. We were in a one-bedroom suite - which was huge and gorgeous. The only thing I didn't love was the lighting - which really isn't a big deal at all! Our wedding day was wonderful. Everything we could have hoped for. My husband was given a "grooms room" to get ready in - I had an attendant who helped me get anything and everything I needed. It was so beautiful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - for a couple, a family, a wedding - you name it. My new husband and I would go back there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ekgri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel regularly and have sworn off all inclusives resorts. Azul Fives has changed that for me. This all-inclusive is far from typical. From the moment you arrive, you are treated like royalty. We were greeted with a champagne toast and taken on an escorted tour of the property. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our luggage was waiting in our very well appointed, modern room with a pool-side terrace and jacuzzi. Beds were awesome. The mini-bar was filled with snacks, water, beer and soda (refilled daily). There is a lazy river that flows thru the center of the property and connects swimming pools, 3 swim up bars and the villas. The food was wonderful. They have a very upscale buffet and also 2 a-la-carte restaurants that do not require reservations. In addition, 24 hr room service is available and included. The bars are stocked with nothing but top shelf liquor and many beer choices. The spa has an unusual service called "Water Journey" that is free with any one hour massage. The beach had a few rocks in front but it was not a problem for swimming and snorkeling (reef right offshore). 5 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great new place in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: RickStone70
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. We had a great time. Everything is brand new and first class all the way. We spent most of our time at the Beach Club but there is also a large meandering pool that winds itself all around the complex. Suites come with all the amenities and would be great for large families or large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBoyLondon
Reviews.Content: A truly fabulous hotel - beautiful setting, everything brand new and very modern and superb friendly service. On this last point there were so many people to help and they were very keen to do so. The infinity pool with swim up bar was a highlight. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience to date”
Reviews.Author: Nico_de_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. First, the Expedia map shows the hotel as being right downtown. No one knew where it was and when we finally managed to get an address, we realized we had to take a taxi to get there. A fifteen minute ride. The place was well out of town. The ride was fifty pesos. But when you want to get back to town, you have to go through the hotel and the charge is 120 pesos. Strange, isn't it. For me, it's not the amount, Seventy pesos is not much. it's the fact that they aren't being honest. OK. The rooms. First room. I sit on the bed. The bed breaks. Back to the reception. We ask for a new room. They don't have one just right now. Maybe in two hours or so. It's lunch time, so why don't you go for lunch and come back after. We go to the See Olive, their beach side restaurant. Bad food. Then back to the reception. They give us a new room. We get there and it's half clean. We stay there and take a nap. Two people come into the room saying they were just given this room. I try to take a shower, I can't work their strange shower and I end up taking a cool shower. When we try to get some sleep at night, the ceiling fan light starts to do funny things. It turns on and off by itself. We call reception and they send someone. The man has to open the ceiling fan and to work on it for some time while we wait sitting on the beds. Finally, 45 minutes after our initial bed time, we get to turn the lights off for a second time. Bad hotel, location, service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in everyway !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler028
Reviews.Content: The most incredible Hotel Resort we have every stayed at , the Food, Service, Grounds the Suites were FANTASTIC. The pools and beach front were incredible. The Spa was out of this World. They had several types of Restaurants even the food in the buffet restaurant was fabulous...it was small Freshly Cooked trays of food and lots of it was cooked fresh in front of you...very Gorment like. From the minute arrive to the minute you go home feels like total BLISS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible food, drinks, and service!”
Reviews.Author: familyman91
Reviews.Content: We were not originall planning on staying at Azul Fives, but due to an exposion at another resort, we were forced to move to Azul Fives . . . good for us. Upon arrival, we were treated like royalty. Service at this resort is top notch. The people were so friendly and helpful and would do anything to help you. We had five younger chilrden in our group and the staff was so accommodating and friendly to them all the time. The pools were our favorite part. Almost every room has pool side. Two of the poosl wind through much of the resort, so beautiful. The food was excellent and plentiful. This is a very quiet and relaxing resort. I would definately recommend this to anyone wanting to have a time of their life.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hutsone
Reviews.Content: The Azul Fives was an absolutely gorgeous hotel. The rooms were huge; a deluxe room had two bathrooms, king/double bed, couch, full kitchen, dinning table, two balconies, and good size bathroom. You could not ask for better workers, they were very kind and always willing to help even when you did not ask. The food is delicious, they have several types of restraunts to pick from. The beach was nice, there were rocks along the shore but after you past the rocks, it was good water to swim in. This hotel satisfies the needs of families with daycare and couples with romantic settings. I would recommend this hotel, we had a blast and would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Chic, Stunning All Inclusive with perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: spirit0ftravel
Reviews.Content: Location: • in the Mayan Riviera, about 30 minutes from the airport • 10 minutes by cab to Playa Del Carmen (between $10-$12 cab ride) • Right next door to the Tides Riviera Maya First Impressions: • Very modern lobby • They were anticipating our arrival and welcomed us with champagne and personalized check in • Was asked to choose between 3 aromatherapy scents and 3 room scents for our stay • Was taken on a tour by golf cart of the resort (golf cart not needed as its not huge, but was nice sometimes) Service: • Beyond wonderful! • Every staff greeted you as you walked by • Couldn’t do enough for us • Chef came out to talk about the menu, asked if we wanted anything special • Pool staff were fabulous, wouldn’t even let you put down your towel and set up your chair by yourself-they did it for you The Room: Room Type • One bedroom suite • Huge room! • Full kitchen with stainless steel appliances, dishes, etc • Large square dining room table • Living room with large L-shaped leather pull out couch • Guest bathroom which was excellent! • Big bedroom with open concept washroom • Modern and beautifully appointed • Balcony or terrace...our terrace had 2 wicker chairs with cushions and 2 upright chairs with a table • Penthouse suite is amazing, has a huge deck with a large Jacuzzi, big dining table, BBQ, lounge chairs, outdoor bed, etc! Food/Drink Service: • Food was amazing • 4 restaurants: Flavours (all day), Mediterranean, Japanese and Senses (pay additional for Senses) • Breakfast at Flavours was amazing, ate off the menu and also had a “food display” (they don’t use the word buffet) but it was awesome and they would make you anything you want • Ate lunch at Sea Olives (Mediterranean) everyday because the resort is new Flavours was not open for lunch yet. It was amazing and served bread (whole wheat or white) which lunch and dinner • Asian restaurant called Tsuki was amazing and would make whatever you wanted especially in terms of sushi • Also have 2 “gourmet corners” (snack bars) at 2 of the pool bars...had amazing thin crust pizza! Also served things like nachos, burgers, salad, etc Take Note: • This is not a “party resort” • It was very empty when I was there because it just opened, but it’s not going to be a loud and rowdy resort-it is very upscale and refined chic • The kids club is amazing. It has an outdoor jungle gym, small kids pool and lounge chairs, arts and crafts room, nap room, fisher price room, my gym (amazing!) video game room with WII, Play Station 3 and X Box, etc! • The beach right in front has a lot of coral-you can go walk in snorkelling. This is great for clients who want that...if you walk a few minutes either way you can swim without a problem • I would suggest water shoes as I cut my foot swimming out in the middle ocean (a few hotels down, and was quite deep!) • About a 40 minute walk along the beach right into Playa Del Carmen Things I liked: • The infinity pool overlooking the ocean was the best part and focal point of the resort-it is picture perfect!! • The resort is built a little back from the beach but all the rooms even at the front of the resort have access to a pool almost right outside their door. There are no swim up suites but there are pools snaking throughout the resort • Comfy modern wicker chairs with cushions by the pool and double bed cabanas by the pool and beach • They come around with cold scented towels, evian spritzer and gourmet “treats” like fruit/frozen fruit on a stick at the pool • Safe is electronic-no need to carry around a key • Ferrero roche chocolates at turndown! • Zky Bar is amazing, great ambiance, large plush outdoor “beds” • Music playing at the pool • Beach volleyball!! Things I didn’t like: • No peepholes on the doors • All the rooms are set up in suite like situations...either a 2 bedroom or 3 bedroom so you have one door to get into the suite and then 2 or 3 doors once you are in. If you have a deluxe room, or one bedroom suite you will just have access to one of the rooms. If you have a 2 or 3 bedroom suite, you will have access to all the doors. Because of the main door being locked as well, it’s difficult to hear someone knocking for room service or the maid, etc This resort sets the standard very high...it combines everything you find at high end resorts/hotels with an all inclusive concept.
